loans.name: Romeo

texts.en:
Romeo lives in Barangay Arellano of Tuguegarao City.  He is married to Dace Jane and they have two children.  They want to give their children a better future by providing them with college educations. 

Romeo owns and manages a computer shop in the city.  With his desire to develop his business, he also offers snacks and electronic cellphone loaders inside his shop.  He requests a loan of PHP30, 000 that he will use as additional business capital. He also plans to use the loan to purchase at least five more computers.

loans.use: additional capital

loans.name: Eusebio Maximo

texts.es:
El socio Eusebio, es natural de Apurimac, pero residente ya desde hace 20 años en  la provincia de Urubamba, ubicada en pleno corazón del valle sagrado de los inkas. 

Nuestro socio es casado, tiene 60 años y tiene 1 hijo, el socio hace muchos trabajos diferentes, llamado mil oficios, nuestro socio requiere el préstamo para poder seguir apoyando a su hijo en la compra de un moto taxi así el hace su propio negocio e invertir en otros pequeños proyectos también. 

Nuestro socio agradece el préstamo y el apoyo otorgado, se compromete a cumplir con el pago en el plazo establecido como lo ha hecho durante 3 años que lleva trabajando con este banco comunal y con el apoyo de sus compañeros de banco, debido a que este socio es cumplidor y paga sin demoras.
texts.en:
Eusebio is a native of Apurimac, but has lived for the past 20 years in the province of Urubamba, which is located in the heart of the Sacred Valley of the Incas. He is 60 years old, married, and has 1 child. Eusebio has held many different jobs (often expressed as “a thousand trades”).

Eusebio is requesting a loan to purchase a motorcycle taxi for his son, who currently does not have his own business. He plans to invest in other small projects as well.

He appreciates the support that this loan will provide and promises to complete his payments as agreed. Eusebio has been working with his Communal Bank for the past 3 years. He has received the support of the other members because he is compliant and makes his payments without any delays.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase a motorcycle taxi for his son & invest in his other businesses

loans.name: Ngin

texts.en: Ngin T. is an older woman, 60-year-old, and currently lives in Pursat Province. Here she and her husband earn a living by cultivating crops. They own a plot of farmland where they plants rice and they will harvest and collect their productivity when they are mature. This couple was married with 10 children; seven of whom are married and have ready started new homes, while others are single who go to school. Ngin T. will be used her first loan to achieve her goal of having other farmland. She will use this loan to buy a nearby neighbor's farmland on which she will plant crop or rent it out to other farmer for fees.

loans.use: To buy a nearby neighbor's farmland on which she will plant crop or rent it out to other farmer for fees.

loans.name: Imelda

texts.en: Imelda D. is the mother of seven children. She is able to sustain her family through rice farming. Aside from farming, she also has a sideline cutting hair. She is 50 years old, living in Surallah, South Cotabato. The income she receives sends her children to school. Imelda would like to take out a loan to help support her business. She has joined Community Economic Ventures, Inc. and is requesting a loan of 10,000 pesos.

loans.use: Business financing

loans.name: Ibragim

texts.en:
Ibragim is married with three children. He lives in Shahrituz, Tajikistan and runs a store selling carpets of different kinds and tastes. His business is very prospective and flourishing. Ibragim has an individual approach to each of his customers which has helped him win many loyal clients. He has been in this trade for 5 years. Currently he needs a loan of $3000 USD to expand the range of his selling business. Ibragim is happy to have access to lending services as additional financial assistance gives him options in his dealings with different suppliers of specific merchandise. Ibragim’s business is developed and settled. 


More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Increasing of the range of goods for selling

loans.name: Alejandra

texts.en: Alejandra M. is from the village of Talic. She is 36 years old, is married, and has two school-aged children. Alejandra owns and operates a "carinderia" (eatery) business, serving a variety of different meals to customers in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month. In 2008, Alejandra joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan from PMPC. Alejandra is requesting a new loan of 14,900 PHP which will be used to purchase food and drinks for her carinderia. This loan will be her 3rd from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support immediate members of her family. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase food and drinks for her restaurant

loans.name: Help Yourself Group

texts.en:
Ballah K. is a leader of a five-member loan group called "Help Yourself." He is 40 years old and married. He has 5 children, ages 8-20 years old, whose educational levels range from  kindergarten to 8th grade. Ballah dropped out of school in 6th grade due to poverty. He and his family live and work on the Kebbah Road in Barnersville, north of Monrovia, the capital of Liberia.

Ballah has a general store.He buys consumer goods, such as body cream, bath soaps,batteries, and food, in wholesale quantities and sells then retail from a table to the residents of Kebbah, Barnersville, Monrovia, Liberia. He has been running this business for 10 years and hopes to improve it in the future by importing consumer goods into Liberia .

To encourage customer to continue to patronize his business, Ballah talks to customers in politely and never gets angry when customers misbehave. He started his business with LD$150.00 from his savings and money from selling charcoal.  He needs this loan to purchase more consumer goods to improve his  business. Ballah dreams of providing a better education for his children and building a house for them in the future.

loans.use: To purchase more goods for his general store

loans.name: Delia

texts.es:
Delia, de 19 años, es una joven muy sencilla y alegre, vive en la casa de sus padres y lo que más desea es tener una mejor calidad de vida.

Aunque todavía es muy joven sabe que tiene que ayudar a sus padres con los gastos del hogar, es por eso que con todos los ahorros que tenía, y con ayuda de sus padres, pudo comprar un auto, que ha puesto a trabajar en la empresa de taxis “Guerreros”, donde ella es la encargada de la central. Ella recibe las llamadas de los usuarios y apoya a los chóferes de los taxis a ubicar las calles que les solicitan sus pasajeros.
Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es escuchar las cosas que dicen los conductores, ya que eso la distrae mucho, lleva 2 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es tener que permanecer todo el día atendiendo en la central. 
Para más adelante, espera poder comprar otro taxi para que sea incluido en la empresa de taxis y obtenga más ganancias.

Este es el primer préstamo de Delia con MFP, sabe que tiene que pagar todas sus cuotas a tiempo y está dispuesta a hacerlo. En su banco comunal es una socia muy responsable, siempre está al tanto de los acuerdos a los que llegan en las reuniones. Con los ochocientos soles solicitados hará arreglar su taxi, pues está empezando a fallar.
texts.en:
Delia, 19, is a very happy and unassuming young woman. She lives in her parent’s house. What she wishes for most of all is to have a better quality of life. Even though she is still young, she knows that she needs to help her parents with the household expenses. That is why bought a car with all of her savings and help from her father. She has put it to work in the Guerreros taxi company, where she is in charge of the center. She takes the calls from the users and supports the drivers by locating the streets that the passengers ask for. What she likes most about her work is listening to the things the drivers say. It is very entertaining. She has been doing this for two years. The most difficult thing is having to stay all day taking care of the center. Later she hopes to be able to buy another taxi to be included in the taxi business in order to get more earnings. This is Delia’s first loan with MFP. She knows that she has to make all of her payments on time, and she is prepared to do so. In her communal bank she is a very responsible member. She is always up to date on all of the agreements reached in the meetings. She will use the 800 PEN that she is asking for to fix her taxi as it is starting to have problems.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Repair her car

loans.name: Ana Marling

texts.es: La señora Ana Marling  tiene 33 años de edad, es madre soltera y tiene 3 hijos, que están estudiando. Ella se dedica al destace de cerdo a pesar de no recibir una educación superior, ha luchado por salir adelante y por lograr que sus hijos tengan la oportunidad de estudiar. Por lo que hasta los momentos ha mantenido su negocio pues le ha sido de muy buena para generar ingresos en su familia. Ella dio inicio a este negocio hace  12 años, debido a que quería brindar un mayor sustento a su familia. Su crédito será invertido en la compra de mayor cantidad de cerdos ya que actualmente tiene buenos pedidos. El sueño es comprar su propia casa ya que recientemente en donde vive esta alquilando.
texts.en:
Ana Marling, 33, is a single mother of three school-age children. She butchers pigs even though she wasn't trained in this. She has struggled to get ahead and to see that her children have the opportunity to go to school and this motivates her to continue with her work which has been profitable for her family. She began this work 12 years ago because she wanted to be a better provider for her family. The funds will be used to buy a larger amount of pigs because she currently has good orders to fill. Her dream is to have her own house since she's currently a renter.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital.

loans.name: Dominga Del Socorro

texts.es:
La señora Dominga M. se ha caracterizado por ser una mujer muy trabajadora y por velar por el bienestar de su familia ya que es madre de dos hijos ambos en edades escolares. 
Ella atraviesa la necesidad de mejorar las condiciones de su vivienda principalmente cambiando su techo porque ha estado en malas condiciones y este es el motivo por el cuál ella ha acudido a Ceprodel para solicitar el crédito ya que es para llevar a cabo la  reconstrucción de su vivienda en especial el cambio de techo. Espera muy confiadamente que su crédito será otorgado y así mejorará las condiciones de vida de sus hijos en el municipio de San Rafael del Sur.
texts.en:
Mrs. Dominga M. is characterized by being a very hard working woman and for watching over the wellbeing of her family since she is the mother of two children, both of which are of school age.

She needs to better the condition of her home, mainly changing her roof because it is in a bad state; this is the reason why she went to Ceprodel (Kiva’s field partner) to seek a loan since it is to reconstruct her home and above all her roof. She hopes that her loan will be granted so that she can improve her children’s way of life in the municipality of San Rafael del Sur.

Translated from Spanish by Mayra Duque, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy construction materials.

loans.name: Antonia

texts.es: Antonia de 49 años de edad es soltera, tiene 2 hijas mayores las cuales viven con ella, la mayor, Carla,  de 32 años que trabaja y le apoya con los gastos de la casa y la menor Helen de 20 años  estudiando 4to año de Ingenieria en Sistemas en la Universidad UPONIC de Juigalpa;  doña Antonia trabaja como conserje, alquila un pequeño cuarto para vivir con sus hijas, pues gracias a un proyecto con del INVUR y la Alcaldia, logro construir su vivienda, la cual consta de un solo cuarto y una pequeña sala; espera seguir siendo  beneficiada con el fondo kiva para terminar de construir un anexo que le servirá para la cocina y un cuarto, pues con el crédito anterior logro comprar ventanas de metal y vidrio y anexar las verjas. El mayor sueño que tiene es poder culminar su casita para habitarla con sus hijas.
texts.en:
Antonia is 49 years old, single, and has 2 grown children who live with her. The older, Carla, is 32 years old; she works and helps out with the household expenses. The younger, Helen, is 20 years old and in her 4th year of Systems Engineering studies at the UPONIC University in Juigalpa. Antonia works as a janitor, and she rents a small room to live in with her daughters. Thanks to a project with INVUR and the city, she has managed to build her own home, which consists of only one room and a small living room. She hopes to continue to benefit from Kiva to finish construction on an addition that will serve as a kitchen and an additional room. With the previous loan she was able to buy metal and glass windows, and add gates. Her main dream is to be able to finish her little house and live in it with her daughters.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to build a kitchen and a room

loans.name: Ya

texts.en: Mrs.Ya C. contributes to her family finances by raises pigs. Her partner and her husband owns an old grinding machine and provides a rice-milling service. Ya C. will use this loan to buy mature rice to mill and sell at a profit. She has four teenage children who no longer attend school and are part time laborers.

loans.use: To buy mature rice to grind and sell

loans.name: Elgon Development Group, Mukono

texts.en: J. Sulaiman is in the small photo at the bottom left and also appears in the big photo.  He is the leader of his lending group in Mukono. He is 35 years-old and married with six children aged three to thirteen years.  He has a boda boda (bicycle transport for people) business.  He also is a market vendor and has been selling produce in Namanve for three years.  Although his businesses are affected by seasonal changes, he is able to make 140,000/= profit a week from both and this allows him to take good care of his family and children’s education. Sulaiman needs a loan to be able to buy more produce for resale and to finish paying the school fees for his children.

loans.use: To buy produce for resale and pay children's school fees.

loans.name: Toyin

texts.en:
Toyin, a hardworking and honest woman, lives in Ogbomoso, Oyo State, Nigeria, where she sells foodstuffs at retail prices. She loves this business, which she has been engaged in for many years, because of the one-on-one interaction that she has with her customers, and uses her experience to both retain her clientele and attract more customers.

Toyin, a 35-year-old married mother of three children, is now requesting a loan of NGN 50,000 to purchase more foodstuffs to sell, hoping to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs to sell

loans.name: Rose

texts.en: Rose is 42 years old. She buys fish in bulk from fishermen and resells them to consumers.  Before she became a member of Faulu Kenya, she had a lot of challenges. She needed money to provide her family with their basic needs as well as to start a business.  She has been in this business for four years. She wishes to expand her business and improve her living standards in the future. She has requested for a loan of Kes 10,000 from Faulu Kenya to add more fish, energy saving cookers, spoons and a fish rack.

loans.use: To buy fish, energy saving cookers, spoons and a fish rack

loans.name: Saratu

texts.en:
Saratu,43 years old, is a mother of two children. She sells food items and other soup items. Before now she hawked cooked food from place to place but could sell only what she could carry. After joining LAPO, she has been able to own a shop.
Saratu opens her shop everyday of the week, 8am to 6pm except on Sundays. Her biggest priority is feeding her children and making sure their school fees are paid.

Saratu is asking for a loan of NGN 50,000 to purchase food, in bulk, at a reduced rate. She says this will enable her to meet the demands of customers. She says thank you to Kiva lenders and LAPO microfinance.

loans.use: To purchase more food items to sell.

loans.name: Theoung

texts.en: Theoung B., 38, is married and resides with her husband and three children in Sa ang District, Cambodia, an area known for sugarcane plantations. She sells Cambodian traditional cakes for an income of about USD 5 per day. Her husband is a motor-taxi driver, earning an income of USD 5 per day to help cover the family expenses. B. is requesting a loan of USD 1100 to purchase groceries to sell at home. In the future, she would like to use any additional profit to send the children to a good school. This is her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loans.use: To buy more groceries to stock the store.

loans.name: Independent Trust Bank Group

texts.en:
Paul A. calls himself a responsible and serious trader who sells 'kente' cloth at Ampedwee near Mampong. He is a father of 3 and has been in the 'kente' business for 5 years. He has a dream of owning a whole shop at Kumasi market which will serve Kumasi and Accra, the capital of Ghana. He also hopes to pay for his children's education to a level that will allow them to be gainfully employed.

According to Paul 'Independent Group' was formed to access a loan from a financial institution so as to expand their businesses. Other members are into the sale of smoked fish, food, and provisions. Paul was elected leader as a result of his sense of responsibility. The entire group wish to expand their business with this loan.

loans.use: Purchase 'kente' cloth

loans.name: God's Grace Group

texts.en:
Mohammed A., who is holding the sign, is the leader of a group of five borrowers called God's Grace. He is 25 years old, single and was only able to attend school through ninth grade due to financial difficulties.

For six years, he has been selling goods such as milk, sardines, batteries and soap at the Redlight Market in Paynesville, outside of Monrovia, Liberia. He started his business with funds his uncle gave him for school, but he had to do business for some years then go back to school.

He plans to use his 18,000 Liberian Dollars portion of this 48,000 Liberian Dollars group loan to buy more milk, soap, sardines and batteries. He describes himself as determined, honest and hard-working.

He hopes to improve his business and to go back to school, improving the standard of living of his family.

loans.use: To buy more milk, soap, sardines and batteries

loans.name: Ouch

texts.en: Ouch O., 47, is married and resides with her husband in Takeo Province, Cambodia, an area known for Pre-Angkorean Temples. She and her husband buy fish to resell for an income of approximately $3 each per day.  O. is requesting a loan of $1,000 to purchase more fish to resell. In the future, she would like to use any additional profit to repair her house.  This is her second loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loans.use: buy more fish to resell

loans.name: Aminata

texts.fr: Madame Aminata S. habite à Kip coco,  une zone située  non loin de la localité de Baye Laye  Guediawaye. Elle évolue  pendant  longtemps dans le commerce bien qu’elle soit aussi couturière  de profession. Elle s’active surtout dans la vente de pain et  de patte d’arachide. Elle a choisi cette activité  par passion et surtout pour gagner sa vie afin de pouvoir soutenir financièrement  sa famille. Elle sollicite un crédit  de 400 000 destine a bien renforcer son stock de pate d’arachide qui sera bien vendu durant l’hivernage. L’accroissement de ses gains lui facilitera la gestion de ses besoins personnels ainsi que ceux de ses enfants et petits fils. Elle souhaite aussi renforcer son épargne.
texts.en:
Mrs. Aminata S. lives in Kip Coco, an area located not far from the town of Baye Laye Guediawaye. She has been involved in trade for a long time, although she is also a trained seamstress. She is especially active in the sale of bread and peanut butter. She chose this activity out of passion and above all to earn a living in order to support her family financially. She is requesting a loan of 400,000 in order to build up her peanut butter supplies that she will sell easily during the winter season. The increase in profits will help her manage her personal needs as well as her children's and grand-children's needs. She also wishes to increase her savings.

Translated from French by Marie-Elodie Bazy, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase working capital

loans.name: Rokia's Group

texts.fr:
Benkadi 3 est un regroupement de 10 femmes mariées ayant une moyenne d’âge de 45 ans, 3 enfants et qui vivent majoritairement  dans des familles polygames à Kegne, un des villages de la sous-préfecture de Fana, région de Koulikoro, 2ème région administrative du Mali.
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso dans le but de pouvoir mieux organiser leurs activités en début d’hivernage. Les spéculations cultivées sont entre autres l’arachide,   le petit mil, le maïs. Elles sont à leur cinquième prêt de campagne et tous les prêts précédents ont été bien remboursés.
Avec ce nouveau prêt, ROKIA D. compte acheter les intrants avant la hausse des prix, les petits équipements et payer les frais de labour pour entretenir environs 1 hectare d’arachide et de maïs.
Les productions sont vendues au niveau de la ville de Fana et à Dioïla après les récoltes à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. Elles comptent réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 35000FCFA environs  en fin de campagne.
texts.en:
Benkadi 3 is a group of 10 married women with an average age of 45 years and three children, who mostly live in polygamous families in Kegne, one of the villages in the sub-prefecture of Fana, Koulikoro, second administrative region of Mali. They collaborate with the institution Soro Yiriwaso in order to be able to better organize their activities in early winter. Among other products, they cultivate peanuts, millet, maize. They are requesting their fifth loan and all previous loans have been fully repaid. With this new loan, Rokia D. intends to buy seeds and other planting material before the prices increase, as well as some small equipment and pay the cost of labor to maintain about one hectare of peanuts and maize. After the harvest, they sell their products in the town of Fana and Dioïla, to men and women. They hope to make an average profit of 35000FCFA by the end of the season.

Translated from French by Monica Urban, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Seeds, fertilizer, herbicide, weeding, small equipment and labor costs.

loans.name: Pergelie

texts.en:
Pergelie L. is from the village of Poblacion, Mahinog, Camiguin Province. She is 32 years old. Pergelie is married and has 7 school-aged children. To make a living, Pergelie owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector running a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling both food & daily use products in the local community. Pergelie has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Pergelie joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Pergelie is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the 1st loan taken out by Pergelie from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand the borrower's business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Abaya

texts.en: Madame Abaya G. sells mobile phone use credits for some of the major cell-phone companies here in Togo. She has been in this business since 2004. As an experienced entrepreneur, this is Madame Gnadouwa's second loan from WAGES. She is requesting 300,000 CFA to help her purchase more phone cards. Her profits will help her care for her two children, along with the income of her husband who is an agricultural engineer.

loans.use: To purchase phone credit recharge cards

loans.name: Elizerbeth

texts.en: Elizerbeth K. is currently in the business of selling bags of beans, maize flour and rice at the market and is requesting a loan to stock bags of baking flour, more rice and beans.  Elizerbeth is 53 years old and is married to a peasant. She has eight children and her children go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build a house for her children.

loans.use: Stock bags of baking flour, more rice and beans

loans.name: Johanna Leonor

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Familiar se reúne cada 15 días en una localidad llamada Colorado a pocos minutos de Montecristi, en este sitio la mayoría de los habitantes tiene diferentes negocios como la fabricación de botones de tagua, artesanía y comercio en general.

La señora Johana tiene 26 años y está casada hace 9 años, de esta relación procreo tres hijos los cuales estudian en escuela. Su esposo se dedica a labores del campo, trabaja cuando hay trabajo, en ocasiones pasa mucho tiempo sin trabajo.

Ella tiene un torno (máquina para cortar tagua) con la que se elaboran los botones pero en forma cruda, producto al que entregan en Manta a comerciantes. Trabaja de lunes a viernes mucha veces sola y a veces con la ayuda de su marido cuando está desempleado, trabaja unas seis horas por día. La materia prima la va a comprar al campo por que dice que sale más barata ya que se la compran a los productores y esto le deja mejores ganancias.
 
Este crédito lo va a utilizar en comprar materia prima ya que quiere aumentar su producción para aprovechar que el precio de su producto esta a buen precio en el mercado. Es su segundo ciclo  en el Banco y le gusta porque no piden tantos papeles para dar el crédito.
 
Sus sueños son darles una buena educación a sus pequeños hijos.
texts.en:
The Family Communal Bank meets every two weeks in Colorado, a few minutes from Montecristi. Most of the residents here run various businesses such as the manufacture of ivory palm buttons, other crafts, and general trading. Johanna is 26 years old and has been married for 9 years. She and her husband have three children who are all in school. Her husband works in the fields, working when there is work; sometimes he goes a long time without work. Johanna has a lathe (a machine for cutting ivory palm) for roughly manufacturing buttons, a product that is delivered to merchants in Manta. She works about six hours a day, Monday to Friday, often by herself and sometimes with help from her husband when he is unemployed. She is going to buy the raw materials in the country, because she says it is cheaper to buy it from the growers, and this will provide greater earnings. Johanna will use this loan to buy raw materials. She wants to increase her production to take advantage of the good market prices for her product. This is her second cycle in the Bank, and she likes it because they do not request so many papers for giving out loans. Her dream is to provide a good education for her young children.

Translated from Spanish by Rachel McRoberts, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing ivory palm.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This Kiva borrower is a 38-year-old married man and the father of three school-aged children. He has owned a van delivery business for the past 20 years. He works hard to be able to raise his three children and pay for their schooling. He is the main income provider for his family. 

Today, he is requesting to borrow US$ 2000 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to perform maintenance for his van including vehicle engine overhaul and body painting. This will be his second loan and he is thankful for the results. He is certain that with the new loan he will be able to perform the needed maintenance and expand his business.

loans.use: perform maintenance for his van

loans.name: Juan Carlos

texts.es:
Juan Carlos M. B. tiene 32 anos. Vive en unión libre en el cantón de Ventanas en la  Provincia de Los Ríos. Tiene 4 hijos. 

Juan es un socio de la ventanilla rural Nueva Esperanza, que está ubicada a 25 kilometres del Cantón de Ventanas. Es una comunidad que se dedica a labores de ciclo corto (siembra de maíz, arroz, soya, frejol, y cacao. Son 14 socios en total.
A Juan se dedica a la siembra de maíz y fréjol desde 20 anos. Las compras y ventas de sus productos realizan en el Cantón de Ventanas. Solicita el crédito para arrendar tierras para sembrar maíz. Con el apoyo del crédito podría aumentar sus cultivos y arrendar más tierra. Su sueno es comprar un carro. Se desafía por encontrar tierra para arrendar y poder sembrar sus cultivos.
 
Le gusta jugar el indor fútbol y volley.
texts.en:
Juan Carlos M. B. is 32 years old. He has a common law marriage and lives in the village of Ventanas in the Los Rios Province. He has 4 children. 

Juan is a member of the Nueva Esperanza Rural Bank, which is located 25 kilometers from Ventanas. It is a farming community based on growing corn, rice, soy beans, beans, and cacao. There is a total of 14 bank members.

He will use the loan money to rent land to plant corn. With the loan he will be able to increase the quantity of crops he grows and be able to rent more land. His dream is buy a car. The biggest challenges he faces are finding land to rent and planting his crops. 

He like to play indoor soccer and volleyball.

loans.use: Rent more land and plant more crops

loans.name: Isaac Wolio

texts.en:
Isaac K. is 37 years old, married to Linet and they have three children; Brian 10 years, Gregory 6 years and Lucy Adema 8 years old.  

Isaac has a motorcycle business that he has been running for the past 12 years and he is in dire need of another motorbike. This will allow him to employ someone to help him in the business. The area has transportation problems and he wants to seize the opportunity and make his business grow. This is Isaac's third loan from KADET Ltd and he has a good credit history with us.

His desire is to be able to buy a Nissan 12-seater minibus to add to his transport business.

loans.use: Buy another motorbike to add to his business

loans.name: Efua

texts.en:
Efua E. is divorced and has seven dependents. Efua smokes and fries fish for sale at Elmina. She uses her income to see to the welfare of the family. Efua will use the loan to purchase more fresh fish to smoke and fry for sale. With the new profits from her expanded business, Efua plans to buy a plot of land.

At the time of the visit, Efua had  a few fried fish to display.

loans.use: purchase more fresh fish to smoke and fry for sale

loans.name: Edgar

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “LLANKACHINAPAC”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

El socio es el Sr. Edgar; el tiene 38 años de edad y es conviviente y tiene 2 hijos; el socio alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de crianza de cuyes, que luego son distribuidos a sus clientes que se encuentran en el mercado local de Urubamba, a la vez el socio se dedica a la agricultura al cultivo de papa, maíz entre otros.  

El socio solicita el préstamo  para la compra de insumos para su negocio como alimentos balanceados para las diferentes clases de animales que cria.

El socio agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the communal bank "LLANKACHINAPAC". The bank is located in the district of Cusco, which belongs to the province of Cusco and the department of Cusco.

The member is Sr. Edgar.  He is 38 years old, married, and has two children.  The member alternates his daily activities with the business of raising guinea pigs, which then are distributed to customers located in the local market of Urubamba, while the member spends time in farming to grow potatoes, corn, among other crops.

The member requesting the loan for the purchase of materials for his business as feed for different classes of animals he breeds.

The member thanks those who form part of this dream by means of this method, and he commits to comply with the payment of his dues on time.

loans.use: El socio solicita el préstamo  para la compra de insumos para su negocio como alimentos balanceados para las diferentes clases de animales que cria.

loans.name: Ivan

texts.es: El Sr. Iván tiene  domicilio  propio que consta de 2 cuartos y cocina, en la cual vive con sus dos hijos y su esposa la Sra. María Isabel. El se dedica al servicio de transporte urbano cuenta con un vehículo propio el cual fue adquirido con su esfuerzo propio, su esposa la Sra. María Isabel apoya también con otro ingreso de confección de prendas de vestir, el mismo que es en su domicilio así de esa forma ayuda con los gastos del hogar, el fin del préstamo solicitado será invertido en la compra de llantas y otros res puestos para su vehículo, esta agradecido con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
Iván lives in his own home which has 2 rooms and a kitchen.  He lives with his two children and his wife María Isabel.  Iván provides an urban transport service with his own vehicle which he acquired through his own hard work.  His wife, María Isabel, also helps support the family with the profits she makes from her dressmaking business which is located in their home.  In this way she helps with household expenses.

Iván is requesting this loan to invest in buying tires and other spare parts for his vehicle.  He is grateful to the institution for the support he receives.

loans.use: To buy tires for his vehicle

loans.name: Mediatrice

texts.en:
Mediatrice is 41 years old and married. She has 4 children between 9 and 17 years old and she cares for 3 orphans who are between 18 and 24 years old. Mediatrice is in retail sales at Nyabugogo Market in Kigali. She has been in this business for about 10 years. Her business is open from 6:00 a.m. to 9:00 p.m. most days and she currently employs one other person to help her run the store.

Mediatrice has requested a Kiva loan that will allow her to increase her sales by purchasing more products for her store. With the additional business, which hopefully will attract many customers, Mediatrice will keep expanding her business with a vision of being financially stable.

loans.use: To purchase more products to sell

loans.name: Alijon

texts.en:
Alijon is a businessman from the small town of Penjikent, Northern Tajikistan.  He offers transportation services in his home town and its vicinity.  His usual route is Penjikent-Dushanbe and Penjikent-Khujand.  Alijon's business is the main source of income for his family.  He started this business 3 years ago. 

Alijon is requesting a loan of 3,000 USD to buy a new car.  He believes this will help him attract more clients.  We believe Alijon's focused approach to business and his diligent hard work will help him repay this loan on time and expand his business as a result. 

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule.  It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi.  The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia.  While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need.  To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing a new car for taxi service.

loans.name: Serwaa

texts.en:
Serwaa A. prepares a local corn made food called banku at Breman, near Elmina. Serwaa has attained a junior high level of education. She is divorced and has 5 children. She is responsible for school fees and other expenses for the children.

Her loan will be used to buy more maize to prepare more banku for sale. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to reinvest back into the food selling business.

loans.use: Her loan will be used to buy more maize to prepare more banku to sell.

loans.name: Marco Antonio

texts.es:
Marco tiene 26 años de edad, es soltero y reside junto a su padre en el caserío Pedregal Bajo del distrito de Tambogrande un distrito agrícola que se encuentra ubicado en la Región de Piura, a más de cuatro horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Marco se dedica  a la crianza y venta de ovejas y cerdos, los cría encorrales situados cerca a su domicilio. El los alimenta de granos y pastos naturales, cuando ya han alcanzado un buen nivel de desarrollo los ofrece en venta a los negociantes que frecuentemente visitan la zona en donde reside. Adicionalmente trabaja vendiendo productos de omnilife en su domicilio a los vecinos o visitantes de la zona.

El desea adquirir alimento balanceado para ampliar su negocio, u productos omnilife para poder percibir mayores ingresos. Por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles que le ayuden a lograr su objetivo.

Marco es una persona bastante empeñosa y trabajadora, su mayor anhelo es seguir creciendo como empresario para poder mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Marco is 26 years old, single, and lives with his father in the village of Pedregal Bajo in the District of Tambogrande. This farming district is situated in Piura region and more than four hours away from the city of Chiclayo.

Marco raises and sells sheep and pigs. He keeps the animals in pens located near his home and feeds them grains and natural grasses. When the animals have reached the proper level of development, he offers them for sale to traders who frequently visit the area where he lives. In addition, he sells Omnilife products out of his home to neighbors and visitors to the area.

Marco wants to acquire balanced feed so that he can expand his business, as well as Omnilife products to help generate better earnings. For this reason, he is requesting a loan from Edpyme Alternativa in the amount of 1000 PEN to help him accomplish his goal.

Marco is a determined and hardworking individual. His greatest wish is to continue working as an entrepreneur so that he can improve his family’s quality of life.

loans.use: Purchase balanced feed for his animals

loans.name: Kea

texts.en:
Mrs. Kea P. was born in 1959.  She is a villager who lives in Chong Preaek  in Kandal province. She and her husband, Mr. Kean Srean, are farmers who own a plot of land which they use to grow rice and peanuts to earn a living. 

To support this farming, Mrs. Kea P. would like to ask for a loan to buy fertilizer, gasoline, and pesticide for growing rice and peanuts. She wants to use the rest of the loan to pay for her child's treatment.

This couple has three children: One is a seamstress in a garment factory, one is a laborer, and the youngest attends a local school.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer, gasoline and pesticide for growing rice and peanuts.

loans.name: Julia

texts.es: Julia, de 55 años, es una mujer muy sencilla, que a lo largo de su vida siempre ha trabajado muy duro por sobresalir, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposo Antonio de 61 años, quien es el compañero de toda su vida y lo que más desean es tener una vejez tranquila. Las chacras que con tanto esfuerzo ha cultivado Julia, siempre le han brindado los ingresos necesarios para mantener a su familia, ella cultiva zanahoria, papa, gladiolo, y con la ayuda de su esposo lleva a vender hasta el mercado mayorista de la ciudad de Tarma, ya que es ahí donde mejores precios le dan por sus productos. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es sembrar sus tierras y lo hace con mucha paciencia, lleva 31 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es cuidar sus cultivos de la plaga de insectos que pueden aquejarlos. En adelante, espera poder ampliar sus tierras, para poder sembrar más. Este es el décimo crédito con MFP, ha sido muy puntual en sus anteriores créditos y desea serlo también ahora, en su banco comunal es una socia muy comprometida con el desarrollo de su grupo. Con los dos mil nuevos soles solicitados, comprará más semillas de arveja, además comprará sacos de abono e insecticidas.
texts.en: Julia is 55-years-old and a very simple person who has worked very hard her whole life to get ahead.  She lives in her own house along with her husband Antonio who is 61-years-old and who has been her partner her whole life and what they wish for most is a calm old age.  The farm that she has cultivated with so much effort has always provided the income needed to maintain her family.  She grows carrots, potatoes, gladiolus (a flower), and with her husband’s help takes these to the wholesale market in the city of Tarma as there they give the best prices for her products.  What she likes best about her work is planting her land and she does it with a lot of patience.  She has 31 years working at this and considers the most difficult part to be taking care of her plantings when they have the insect pests that can attack them.  Looking forward, she hopes to be able to expand her land in order to grow more.  This is her 10th loan with MFP.  She has been very punctual in her previous loans and hopes to continue being punctual with this one.  In her communal bank she is a member who is very involved in the growth of the group.  With the 2000 nuevos soles she is requesting she will buy more pea seeds and will also purchase sacks of fertilizer and pesticides.

loans.use: Purchase pea seeds, fertilizer, and pesticides

loans.name: Djekafo Group

texts.fr:
Les femmes du groupe Djekafo, toutes mariées, ont en moyenne 40 ans, 4 enfants et vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies dans le village de Wakoro, préfecture de Dioïla, Région de Koulikoro (deuxième région  administrative de la république du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et d’amitié. Elles font la restauration, le commerce de la volaille, du bétail, des poissons et des tubercules.                                                                                                                          
Les femmes du groupe Djekafo sont à leur deuxième prêt solidaire. 
MARIAM C. compte acheter du riz et condiments pour la restauration effectuée au marché lors des jours de foire à Wakoro, au comptant et à crédit, à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes.
Elle envisage réaliser un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 10 000F CFA qui sera utilisé pour payer les échéances du prêt, payer les contributions des cérémonies sociales et le reste sera  réinvesti dans son activité de restauration.
texts.en:
The women of the group Djekafo are all married and average 40 years of age and four children living in traditional extended families in the village of Wakoro, prefecture of Dioïla, Region of Koulikoro (2nd administrative region of the Republic of Mali). The women know one another through ties of kinship, community, and friendship. They do commerce in poultry, livestock, fish, and tubers, and they work in food service. The group members are now on their second solidarity loan.

Ms. Mariam C. intends to use her loan to buy some rice and condiments for a restaurant at the marketplace on market days in Wakoro. She accepts cash or credit from a customer base composed of women and men.

Mariam envisions making an average monthly profit of 10,000 francs CFA that will be used to make the loan payments and to help pay for societal ceremonies. The rest of the profits will be reinvested in her restaurant business.

loans.use: to buy restaurant provisions

loans.name: Kick Poor Group

texts.en:
Meet with members of the “Kick Poor United” group from Kabala, a town in northern Sierra Leone. They are local entrepreneurs who have come to SMT, a partner of Kiva, to apply for a loan of SLL 500,000 for each. With the help of this loan they will be able to expand their businesses, make more sales and consequently to improve on their living conditions. 

Mariatu K. is the leader of this group. The 32-year-old is married to a tailor and they have 3 children. Mariatu has been a businesswoman for 10 years now. She sells gari (fast food made out of cassava roots), palm-oil (the most popular cooking oil) and soap. With her share of this loan, she will buy gari, palm-oil and soaps in bulk to add to her business.

loans.use: To buy gari, palm-oil and soaps in bulk to add to her business.

loans.name: Meas

texts.en:
Meas R., 50, is married and lives with her eight children in Takeo province. She is a farmer who works for less than US $1 each day, while her husband works in construction making US $5 each day. This family is also supported by three of the children who are garment factory workers.

Weather conditions have been difficult for farming in Cambodia this past year and inflation has caused food prices to skyrocket. These factors have played into a difficult economic year for many Cambodians, Meas R. included. In light of these economic difficulties, she is asking for a loan of US $1,000 to purchase fertilizer and a motorbike for her children to commute to school.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and a motorbike for her children to commute to school.

loans.name: Nancy

texts.es:
La señora Nancy es una mujer muy trabajadora desde hace 5 años adquirió su vivienda de interés social como es sabido este tipo de casas son muy pequeñas y no tienen la suficiente protección en la parte de enfrente, por lo que Nancy desea construir en la parte frontal una barda para ofrecer a sus 2 hijos mayor seguridad al momento de que salen jugar al patio. Para poder levantar la barda en su vivienda necesita comprar material de construcción y pagar mano de obra.
Nancy y su esposo trabajan en maquiladora y algunas ocasiones se quedan tiempo extra para ganar más dinero para el sostén familiar.
texts.en: Nancy is a hardworking woman who acquired her home from social housing 5 years ago. It is known that these types of houses are very small and they don't have sufficient protection in the front. So Nancy wants to build a wall in the front part of the property to offer her 2 children greater security when they go out to the patio to play. To be able to build the wall she needs to purchase construction material and to hire someone. Nancy and her husband work at a production plant and sometimes they have some time to earn extra money for their family's support.

loans.use: to build a wall in the front of her house.

loans.name: Damaris

texts.es: Damaris tiene una familia conformada por su cónyuge y sus dos hijos en las edades de 8 y 18 años, con ellos vive en la ciudad de Barranquilla y tiene sus planes de mejoramiento y bienestar para esta familia plasmados en un negocio,  a través del cual prepara alimentos como deditos fritos  y comidas corrientes, uno de ellos ubicado en un espacio de su casa y el otro  en la esquina de su cuadra y lo practica durante todas las tardes. Ella se ganó una rifa y con esto compró las primeras herramientas básicas y gradualmente ha incrementado o que hoy conforma su infraestructura; su especialidad es  la preparación de almuerzos y deditos con harina de trigo y de queso que también vende. Su meta más adelante es tener un local en su propia vivienda y generar empleos para apoyar los ingresos de familias que lo necesiten,  porque su mayor desafió es el reducido espacio en el cual trabaja. Con su credikiva, que es su primer financiamiento a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo,  comprará insumos para la preparación de sus comidas como arroz, aceite, sal, harinas, en mayor volumen con tal de ganarse los descuentos que genera la compra cuando la realiza en importantes cantidades y también arreglará las herramientas de trabajo para poder incorporar mejores condiciones en su diario trabajo.
texts.en: Damaris has a family which is composed of her common-law husband and her two children, aged 8 and 18. She lives with them in the city of Barranquilla. Her plans are to improve the wellfare of her family are rooted on her business.  She prepares finger foods and fast foods. One of her stands is located in her house and the other is located at the corner of her block. She operates them even afternoon. She won a raffle and with it she purchased the first basic tools and she gradually increased it to what it is today. Her specialty is lunch and finger foods prepared with wheat flour and cheese, products which she also sells separately. Her goal for the future is to have a store installed in her home to generate jobs and to supplement the family's income for what they need. Her greatest challenge is the reduced space where she works. With her Kiva loan, the first loan she accesses through Fundacion Mario Santo Domingo (Kiva Field Partner), she will purchase ingredients to prepare foods, including rice, cooking oil, salt, and flour in larger quantities. She will earn special discounts when she buys in larger quantities. She will also repair her working tools to experience better conditions during her daily work.

loans.use: to puchase ingredients to prepare foods, including rice, cooking oil, salt and flour.

loans.name: Vilu Maribeth

texts.es: Vilu Maribeth tiene 33 años, esta mujer ha sido una gran madre para sus hijos ya que siempre ha brindado lo necesario además todos los días les enseña valores importantes para que sean personas de bien. Ella se dedica a la venta de mercadería en general, desde hace mas de 10 años que tiene este negocio, sus inicios fueron cuando tenía la edad de 18 años, a pesar de ser tan joven tenía la experiencia necesaria para ofrecerles a sus clientes lo que ellos le solicitan. El crédito es para la compra de ropa, calzado, cosméticos, sabanas y tratamientos.
texts.en: Vilu Maribeth is 33 years of age. This woman has been a great mother to her children since she has always provided them with what they need, and in addition, every day she teaches them important values so that they may grow up to be decent people. She earns a living selling general merchandise. She began this business more than ten years ago when she was 18 years old, yet in spite of being so young, she had the necessary experience to offer her customers what they wanted. The loan is to purchase clothing, footwear, cosmetics, sheets and window treatments.

loans.use: to purchase clothing, footwear, cosmetics, sheets and window treatments.

loans.name: Armen

texts.ru:
Армен родился в 1967 г. в городе Капане, после окончания школы поступил в проф.тех. училище. Живет вместе с родителями пенсионерами, жена не работает, старший сын живет в Росси, а младший учится  на втором курсе Капанского Архитектурного коледжа. 
С 1991 г. Армен торгует фруктами и овощами на Капанском городком рынке. Сельскохозяйственную продукцию он закупает из близлежащих областей и деревень, а также из Еревана. Прибыль от торгивли Армен использует на содержание своей семьи, а также плати за обучение своего младшего сына.  
Кредит на сумму 500,000 драм необходим Армену для преобретения партии овощей и фруктов (в частности, черешни, вишни, помидоров, огурцов, перца, баклажанов и т.д.) для своего бизнеса. 
Данный кредит является для Армена 9-ым по счету, и он никогда не задерживал свои выплаты.
texts.en:
Armen was born in 1967 in the city of Kapan. After finishing school he started vocational school.  He lives with his retired parents.  His wife does not work.  His elder son lives in Rossi, and the younger one studies in his second year at Kapan Architectural College.

Since 1991, Armen has traded in fruit and vegetables at Kapan city market.  He buys agricultural products from nearby areas and villages, and also from Yerevan.  Armen uses his income from trade to support the family and also to pay for his younger son’s education.

Armen needs a loan of 500,000 drams to buy vegetables and fruit (in particular cherries, sour cherries, tomatoes, cucumbers, peppers, eggplants, etc.) for his business.

This is Armen’s ninth loan, and he has never been late with is payments.

loans.use: To buy a large lot of fruits and vegetables to resell

loans.name: Lenin Antonio

texts.es: El Sr. Lenin Antonio  él es trabajador activo de la Alcaldía Municipal San Rafael del Sur desempeñándose como Inspector Ambiental  tiene  dos años  de trabajar para esta institución es casado actualmente, tiene dos hijo en edad escolar. Ha obtenido  siete créditos con CEPRODEL y cada uno los ha realizado para la compra de materiales de construcción para ampliar y mejorar su casa de habitación y este lo está solicitando para invertir en el negocio de Reciclaje para tener ese otro ingreso de dinero, los cuales los créditos con ceprodel le ha beneficiado en gran manera ya que de esta manera el ha  mejorado su condición de vida de él y su familia.
texts.en:
Lenin Antonio works for city hall in San Rafael del Sur as an Environmental Inspector. He’s been working for this institution for two years.  He’s married and has two school age children.

He’s gotten seven CEPRODEL loans that he used to buy building materials and supplies to enlarge and improve his home.  He’s asking for this loan to invest in a recycling business in order to have an additional source of income.  Ceprodel loans have been very beneficial for him in that he’s improved his and his family’s quality of life.

loans.use: to invest in a recycling business.

loans.name: Uth

texts.en: Mrs. Uth is a 53-year-old farmer who lives in the Chey Chor district of Kompong Cham Province. Mrs. Uth and her husband work together in the farming business. They has been spending most of their lifetime in the crop-planting business and earning an income of about $3 each day to use for their financial expenses. They have three children. Two of the children are single and one is married. Two of them are employed in different jobs to make money. Mrs. Uth will use the loan to buy some piglets to feed. With this loan, she can make more income. Mrs. Uth and her husband are pictured in the photograph.

loans.use: to buy piglets to feed.

loans.name: Margarita

texts.es: La Sra. Carmen es una persona muy respetuosa y trabajadora   la cual  atiende  personalmente  su negocio  de  venta  de  ropa   el  cual le permite   obtener  ingresos  para  salir a delante  día  con día  y  poder   brindarle a  su  familia  una  excelente  calidad  de   vida, en este   momento  ella  requiere  realizar  la  compra  de mercancía  para   surtir  el negocio  y  poder  contar  con inventario disponible   ya  que   así  podrá  ofrecer  a sus  clientes   el excelente   servicio  que  la caracteriza,  agradece  de  antemano el apoyo  brindado  para la  realización de su proyecto.
texts.en: Mrs. Carmen is a very respectful, hard-working woman who has her own clothing business.  This allows her to earn a living on a daily basis and get ahead so she can provide her family with an excellent quality of life.  At the moment, she needs to buy merchandise for her business so she can increase her inventory and offer her customers the excellent service to which they are accustomed.  She is grateful for the support received for her project.

loans.use: To buy clothing to sell.

loans.name: Margoth Ines

texts.es:
Margoth Ines tiene 23 años, Es casada vive con el esposo y con un hijo de 3 años, en el Cantón Ventanas Provincia de los Ríos. 

Los miembros de la V.R.C. SAN JOSE, se encuentra ubicada recinto EL ROSARIO, perteneciente al Cantón Ventanas, esta ventanilla se dedica a labores agrícolas de ciclo corto siembra de maíz, arroz y frejol.

Margoth se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz, arroz y frejol . Compra sus productos en Comercial Guzman en Ventanas y los vende en el mercado mayorista de Ventanas.

Solicita el crédito para sembrar maíz, arroz y frejol, para la compra de abonos y semillas para la producción.   Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrenta desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades de los cultivos. Su sueño es culminar el ciclo de cultivo y que salga bien los productos.

Le gusta pasar con la familia y ser una persona trabajadora.
texts.en:
Margoth Ines is 23 years old, married, and lives with her husband and three-year-old son in the canton of Ventanas in Los Ríos Province.

The members of the San Jose Communal Bank meet in the neighborhood of El Rosario, which is part of the canton of Ventanas. This Communal Bank consists of short-cycle farmers who grow corn, rice, and beans.

Margoth is a farmer who grows corn, rice, and beans. She buys her supplies at the Guzman Commercial Center in Ventanas and sells her products at the wholesale market in Ventanas.

She is requesting a loan for planting corn, rice, and beans. Margoth plans to buy composts and seeds. With the financial assistance, she will be able to acquire needed supplies. The challenges she faces include pests and diseases that could impact her crops. Her dream is finish the crop season with a good harvest.

Margoth enjoys spending time with her family and being a hardworking individual.

loans.use: to buy compost and seeds.

loans.name: Hosea

texts.en: Hosea is 22 years old and single.  He runs a taxi business to earn a living.  He has been in the business for three years.  He also earns extra income from his car wash.  Since he joined Faulu Kenya, Hosea has learned how to keep business records and to  manage his business well.  He hopes to grow his business in the future for more income generation.  Hosea has requested for a loan of 20,000 Kenya shillings to buy tires for his car.

loans.use: To buy tires

loans.name: Reina Isabel

texts.es:
Reina, vive con su familia conformada por su esposo y tres hijos D. 16, 8 y 2 años D. edad, ella se dedica a la venta D. fruta y verduras, negocio que tiene en el mercado municipal, trabaja todos los días D. lunes a domingo.
Ella por el momento necesita comprar tomates, güisquil, repollo, papas, esta compra la realizara a través D. un préstamo, el cual permitirá tener a disposición D. los clientes verduras frescas.
Sus aspiraciones son: el fortalecimiento del negocio, y el apoyo a sus hijos en los estudios mejorando la calidad D. vida D. ellos.
texts.en:
Reina lives with her family, maD. up of her husband and three children ages 16, 8 and 2. She sells fruits and vegetables in the town market. She works every day, Monday to Sunday. 

At this time, she needs to buy tomatoes, chayote [a squash], cabbage and potatoes. She will use the loan to make this purchase, which will allow her to have fresh vegetables at her customer's disposal. 

Her dreams are strengthening her business, supporting her children in their studies and improving their quality of life.

loans.use: to buy tomatoes, chayote, cabbage and potatoes for her business.

loans.name: Omar  Javier

texts.es: El Sr.   Omar  es cliente antiguo de la institución, se encuentra en el tercer ciclo de su crédito,  se dedica a la elaboración de riquísimas comidas que vende en su restautante,  su esposa es la señora Elena que también le ayuda en el  negocio de venta de comida  tiene dos hijos que están en edad escolar  y en su tiempo libre  sus  hijos colaboran en  los que haceres del negocio, El crédito  lo invertirá en  el  equipamiento de su negocio compara  muebles y sillas. El negocio queda ubicado en una de las avenidas más concurridas de la zona del tejar  El Sr Omar  se siente  feliz y agradecido con la institución por el apoyo brindado. En la foto el Sr. Omar se encuentra acompañado de su esposa.
texts.en:
Sr. Omar is a longtime client of Emprender who is in his third loan cycle. He prepares delicious meals that he sells in his restaurant. His wife Sra. Elena helps him in his business of selling food. They have two children who are of school age and spend their free time helping them with the tasks involved in running their business.

This loan will be invested in equipment for his business, such as furniture and chairs. Omar’s business is located along one of the busiest avenues in the District of El Tejar. He is pleased and grateful to Emprender for the support that has been provided. In the photograph, Sr. Omar is accompanied by his wife.

loans.use: to purchase furniture for his restaurant.

loans.name: Ana

texts.en:
Ana is from the village Bredza, East Georgia. She is 52 years old.  Ana lives with her family: husband Revaz and 35 years old son Grigol. 

All family members are involved in the agricultural business. In particular, they have two milk cows and sell cheese, in Khashuri (nearby town).  The family grows wheat, haricot and maize on two hectares of land that they own.  Ana has a greenhouse, where she grows tulips. Tulips are sold in Khashuri as well.  Their average monthly income is 600 Laris. 

Ana requests a loan to repair her greenhouse.  It is old and can’t maintain needed temperatures.  She will also buy tulip seeds.   Ana will sell the flowers in spring.   Ana plans to reinvest her profits and rent more land to grow more vegetables.

loans.use: to purchase materials for greenhouse renovation and tulip seeds.

loans.name: Sophart

texts.en: Sophart is 53 years old and a farmer.  He sells animals and earns $10 per day. His wife is a farmer, and sells fish earning $10 per day. They have three children; one is studying, and the other two are working earning $10 per day each. Every month, he has to spend $61 on food, $5 on electricity, $15 on school fees, $10 on transportation, and $5 on other expenses. He would like to request a loan of $1200 to buy cow for farming and to sell. He doesn't want to change his career of selling cows because he can make good income from this career.

loans.use: To buy cow for farming and to sell

loans.name: Emperatriz Magali

texts.es:
Emperatriz es una madre de familia de 41 años de edad, vive en su casa con su hijo, cuenta con los servicios de agua y luz, ubicada en la zona urbana del distrito de Tambogrande que pertenece al departamento de Piura.  Esta zona es de actividad agrícola, ganadera y artesana.

Emperatriz desde hace algunos años brinda el servicio de cosmetóloga (corte de cabello, pintado de cabello, maquillaje, etc) cuenta con su clientela por el buen servicio que da, con los ingresos que obtenga podrá solventar sus gastos de su hijo.

Ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 1200 nuevos soles para comprar algunos materiales y herramientas necesarias para seguir brindando un buen servicio a sus clientes, al incrementarse su clientela podrá cubrir su crédito y mejorar económicamente.  Emperatriz es una mujer trabajadora y empeñosa que lo único que desea es que su negocio crezca para seguir apoyando a su hijo y poderle brindar algunos gustos.
texts.en:
Emperatriz is a 41 year-old housewife, who lives in her house with her son. The house has water and electricity service, and is located in the urban area of Tambogrande district, which is part of Piura department. This is an area where people make their living from farming, livestock-raising, and crafts.

Emperatriz has been operating a beauty salon for a few years (hair cuts, hair coloring, makeup etc.). She has her own clientele, because of the good service she gives. With the income she earns, she is able to support her son.  

She has applied to Edpyme Alternativa for a loan of 1,500 nuevos soles, in order to buy a few materials and tools that she needs to continue providing good service to her customers.  By increasing her clientele she will be able to pay off her loan and improve her finances. Emperatriz is a hard-working and persevering woman.  Her only wish is to see her business grow, so that she can continue supporting her son, and provide him with a few pleasures.

loans.use: To buy a few materials and tools that she needs to continue providing good service to her customers.

loans.name: Aden

texts.en:
Aden is 35 years old, married, and has four children. She lives in the Philippines. Aden has a retail shop that sells fish such as sardines and mackerel. She has had this business for five years. 

Aden is requesting a loan for 5,000 PHP, which she will use to buy fish to sell. Aden is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Aden hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase fish to sell.

loans.name: Sinoyia

texts.en:
Sinoyia, is 34 years old, married, and has three children. He has been a farmer for the past six years.  

He has been a good client with KADET LTD. and paid his previous loan well. He is asking for a new loan to buy farm inputs including wheat seeds and fertilizers.

With the profits generated he plans to pay school fees for his children. He dreams of becoming a prominent farmer and works very hard to attain more despite limited resources.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs including wheat seeds and fertilizers.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more food, such as bananas, pineapples, potatoes, etc. for resale.

loans.name: Jonife

texts.en:
Jonife works hard to support her family. Jonife is single and has a ballot vending business in the Philippines.

Jonife has requested a PHP 29,500 loan through NWTF to purchase additional eggs for her business.

Jonife has been in this business for five years now.

In the future, Jonife would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional eggs for her business.

loans.name: Martha

texts.en: Martha is 39 years old and lives in Kakata town. She is married and has five children between 7 and 20. They are in school and live at home. For the past five years she has been selling palm oil in the local market. One of her main challenges is that the price of palm oil is very high. She is requesting a loan to purchase more palm oil for her business. She hopes to build her house and attend college in the future.

loans.use: to purchase  more  palm oil  for her business

loans.name: Hasan

texts.ru: Хасан житель города Истаравшан. Ему 41 год. Он женат. У него трое детей. Хасан более шести лет занимается торговлей. На сегодняшний день он занимается торговлей детской одежды. Кредит берет для покупки детской осеней обуви и костюмчиков.
texts.en:
Hasan is a resident of the city Istaravshan. He is 41 years old and married. He has three children.

Hasan has been engaged in trade for more than 6 years. Currently he sells children's clothes. He takes a loan for the purchase of children's autumn shoes and children's costumes.

loans.use: to buy children's autumn shoes and children's costumes

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To increase on Stock

loans.name: Doh

texts.en:
Mrs. Doh Y. is a 55 year-old mother of two (02) children. Even though she is exhausted by working in the field, she also remains very active as an entrepreneur. Today, she wants to exclusively work to purchase gari, store it and resell it along with other various products such as charcoal and other domestic products.

This is why she is asking for a credit of $400. We should make note that she has always reimbursed her financings and has enormous experience in the management of her business.

Translated from French by Ivana Kostic, Kiva Volunteer.

Epuisée par le travail de la terre, Madame Y. Doh âgée de 55 ans et mère de deux (02) enfants, reste très active et entreprenante. Aujourd’hui, elle veut se limiter à l’achat de gari, en faire stockage pour le revendre en y associant les produits divers tels que la vente du charbon de bois et d’autres produits à usage domestique. C’est pourquoi elle sollicite un crédit de $400 . Signalons qu’elle a toujours fait preuve d’une bonne impression lors des financements antérieurs reçu et a une expérience énorme dans la gestion de son activité.

loans.use: Purchase and resale of gari (a traditional food)

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more used handbag stocks needed to expand her business

loans.name: Mercedes

texts.es:
We have been in the grocery business for over 10 years. My husband and I work and this is our family income, since it is just the two of us. Thankfully, our children are adults. We don't want to be a burden to them, and that's why we are requesting a loan of $1200 to provide more merchandise and have more sales and more income.

Translated from Spanish by a Kiva volunteer.

Tenemos ya mas de 10 años en el negocio de los abarrotes en el trabajamos mi esposo y yo este es nuestro ingreso familiar ya que estamos solo los dos. Gracias a dios nuestro hijo ya son personas adultas. Y no queremos ser una lata para ellos, por eso estamos solicitando un préstamo de $1,200.00 dlls. Para surtir más mercancía y así tener más ventas y más ingresos.

loans.use: Stock goods

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.es:
Cecilia is 54 years old. She started selling tacos 10 years ago. She has a taquería at home and she opens every day. She wants to remodel the place with the loan. Cecilia is a part of the group called “Primavera 5” together with Mrs Rosa Pérez Guzmán who sells food at her house. She will refit the place to provide a better service to her clients and be able to obtain bigger profits that will provide them a better life.

Translated from Spanish by Ana Gabriela Clark, Kiva Volunteer.

Cecilia tiene 54 años, hace 10 años que ella inicio vendiendo tacos, su taquería lo tiene instalado en su casa y abre todos los días. Con su préstamo remodelara el local. Forma parte del grupo llamado Primavera 5 junto con doña Rosa Pérez Guzmán que vende comida en su casa. Con el préstamo acondicionara el local para proporcionar a sus clientes una mejor atención obteniendo ganancias que les proporcionen una mejor vida.

loans.use: Remodel taqueria

loans.name: Ababil

texts.en: Ababil is an Internally Displaced Person from Fizuli region located in southeast part of Azerbaijan. She and her family were relocated to Lokbatan settlement of Baku city as a result of Armenian-Azerbaijan military conflict over Garabakh. She rents a booth in the local market and trades canned vegetables, dry fruits and spices. She has been in this business for more than 10 years. She wants to increase the volume of sales, invest more in her business and increase her income. She has had two previous loans from Normicro Baku branch. Now she applies again for $1200 to invest in business.

loans.use: To increase working capital and increase amount for sale

loans.name: Sok

texts.en: Mrs. Sok S., 47, is a widow and lives with her four children in a part of Phnom Penh, Cambodia. To supplement her family income, she works selling chicken at an open-air market, earning up to $10 each day in revenue. One of her children works selling clothes, another is a student and the rest are unemployed. Mrs. Sok S. hopes to use this loan to purchase a motorcycle for one of her children to operate a motor-taxi business. She believes this motorcyle will enable her and her family to have another source of income.

loans.use: To purchase a motorcycle for one of her children to operate a motor-taxi business.

loans.name: Codifun

texts.es:
Codifun learned the work of autobody repair on taxis while working in a factory, but he always dreamed of having his own factory. Thanks to his perseverance, dedication and effort, he has managed to open his own shop, a place in which provides work for four other young people. Now, he is married to Judith and has an infant, so he lives independently in his father's home. The work he produces with great professionalism gives him a lot of joy, because not only does he manufactures the body of mototaxis, but he also performs repair work, an activity for which he has a broad customer base (these customers constantly recommend his work/services to other potential clients). Codifun's desire is to buy additional raw materials (Fierros) so that he can continue to work and provide his family with better living conditions. This young entrepreneur needs your support to continue to prosper in life.

Translated from Spanish by Mayra Gould, Kiva volunteer.

Codifun, aprendió la labor de construcción de carrocerías para mototaxis trabajando en una fábrica que construía estos objetos, pero siempre soñó con contar con su propia fábrica; gracias a su perseverancia, dedicación y esfuerzo ha logrado abrir su propio taller, lugar en el que también brinda trabajo a otros cuatro jóvenes.Ahora ya casado con Judith y con un pequeño niño en brazos vive en forma independiente en el domicilio de su padre. Este trabajo que desempeña con sumo profesionalismo le otorga mucha dicha, porque no sólo fabrica carrocerías de mototaxis, también realiza trabajos de reparación, actividad por la cual posee una amplia cartera de clientes que constantemente recomienda su trabajo a otros potenciales clientes.El deseo de Codifun, es comprar materia prima (Fierros) para seguir desenvolviéndose en su trabajo diario y así ofrecer a su familia una vida con mejores condiciones.“ Este joven empresario requiere de tu apoyo para seguir prosperando en la vida”

loans.use: To purchase good wholesale materials so he can continue to work. (Compra de mayor cantidad de materia prima para continuar con su labor.)

loans.name: Aygun

texts.en: Ms. Aygun has very little income. She is 22 and lives with her parents in the village of Saatli in the central part of Azerbaijan Republic. Aygun started her business five years ago with one cow, and now she has a herd of five cows. Aygun has applied to the Saatli branch of Normicro for a loan of $500 to build an open shed for the cattle.

loans.use: To build open shed for herd of cows

loans.name: Melania Del Carmen

texts.es:
Mrs. Melania is a single mother who lives in Villa Reconciliación. She has three adult children who work freelancing and help their mother economically when they can. Seven years ago, she found herself unemployed, and she decided to start up a business in her home. It's a small cafe, where she offers homemade food, sodas, juices, and other products. This business has enabled her to live in a dignified way. In the future, she hopes to make her business progress, improving her facilities so that she can provide better service and personalized attention to the customers that visit her. Her business' immediate priority is the electrical system, which requires that she change all the internal cabling that is currently a very real risk to human and material damages.

Translated from Spanish by Shannon Skoglund, Kiva volunteer.

Doña Melania es madre soltera, vive en Villa Reconciliación, tiene 3 hijos, los cuales son mayores de edad, trabajan de manera informal y cuando pueden le ayudan económicamente a su madre. Hace 7 años, al encontrase sin empleo la señora decide emprender un negocio en su vivienda, el cual es un cafetín, en donde ofrece comida casera, bebidas carbonatadas, jugos, entre otros productos. El negocio le ha permitido llevar un nivel de vida digno. En un futuro la señora tiene la esperanza en que su negocio progrese, mejorando las instalaciones en el cual pueda brindar un mejor servicio y atención personalizada a los clientes que le visitan. La prioridad que presenta en estos momentos el negocio, es el sistema eléctrico, por lo cual la señora necesita cambiar todo el cableado interno ya que el actual representa un verdadero riesgo que podía ocasionar perdidas materiales y humanas.
