loans.use: Purchase wire, PVC pipes, switches, sockets, and a cash register

loans.name: Rosalba

texts.es:
Since she was young, Rosalba has successfully sold cosmetic products for several different brands. On marrying, she devoted herself to this activity due to the need to help her husband with household expenses and to pay for the education of their two children. Additionally, since her youngest daughter was born she hasn't wanted to find work which would absorb a lot of her time, so she dedicated herself to increasing sales.

Now she needs a loan of US $750 which she will repay in four months in order to pay for a batch of merchandise which they have already provided. Let us help Rosalba by contributing economically to her case.

Translated from the Spanish by Katy Long, Kiva Volunteer

Rosalba se dedica a vender productos cosméticos desde joven viene haciéndolo exitosamente para diferentes líneas. Al casarse se dedico arduamente a esta actividad por la necesidad de apoyar en el gasto de la casa a su esposo y para solventar la educación de sus 2 hijos, además de que al nacer su ultima hija ya no quiso seguir trabajando en algo que le absorbiera mucho tiempo por lo cual se dedico de lleno a las ventas.

Ahora necesita un crédito por US $750 que pagara en 4 meses para pagar un lote de mercancía que ya le surtieron. Ayudemos a Rosalba contribuyendo económicamente a su caso.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise

loans.name: Chhin

texts.en: Chhin S. is 42 years of age. Since 1999, she has worked hard farming vegetables in her home province of Kampong Cham. Her farm only earns her US$3 per day of profit. En Neum, her husband, is the primary breadwinner, earning US$6 per day selling rubber to local factories. They support their only child, who is a student, as well as themselves through these lines of work. With access to enough money, Chhin S. wants to buy a large stock of rubber for her husband to sell in bulk to nearby factories. This will give their family a much needed financial boost.

loans.use: To buy rubber.

loans.name: Nacer Group

texts.es:
The Community Bank Nacer is a bank which has recently been established with 16 founding members. All of them are from different suburbs of the town of Ayacucho.

The members are engaged in different businesses, such as the sale of cereal grains, young animals, groceries, meat, cosmetics, clothes: they also offer services such as Comestic treatments and preparing natural juices.

The members need varying amounts of money to be loaned: some loans are for 300, 600, and 900 sols, making a total of 7800 sols in loans from the Community Bank.

The loans will be invested in the purchase of rice, sugar, flour, eggs, various fruits, wheat, barley, clothes and cosmetics.

The members dream of expanding their businesses, having stable employment, their own houses and seeing their children become professionals.

Translated from the Spanish by Katy Long, Kiva Volunteer

El Banco Comunal Nacer es un Banco que recién inicia con 16 socias. Todas ellas son D. distintos barrios D. la ciudad D. Ayacucho.

Las socias realizan diferentes negocios como venta D. cereales, animales menores, abarrotes, carne, cosméticos, ropa, también brindan servicios D. cosmetología y preparación D. jugos naturales.

Las socias necesitan diferentes montos D. préstamos, algunos montos son D. 300 soles, 600 soles, 900 soles, haciendo un total D. 7,800 soles D. préstamos en el Banco Comunal.

Los préstamos lo invertirán en la compra D. arroz, azúcar, harina, huevo, frutas variadas, trigo, cebada, ropa y cosméticos.

Los sueños D. las socias ampliar sus negocios, tener un local estable, casa propia y sus hijos sean profesionales.

loans.use: The loans will be invested in the purchase of rice, sugar, flour, eggs, various fruits, wheat, barley, clothes and cosmetics.

loans.name: Madické

texts.fr:
This young salesman specializes in selling clothing. He has a stand at the Saint Maures de Fossés central market in Ziguinchor. He would like to increase his supply of merchandise and increase his income before the summer vacation starts, as his customers are mostly women.

Translated from French by Kristina Jackson, Kiva Volunteer.

Ce jeune commerçant est spécialiste de la vente des vêtements. Il tient son commerce au marché central Saint Maures des Fossés de Ziguinchor. Il veut renforcer son stock de marchandises et augmenter ses revenus avec les grandes vacances qui s'annoncent, car sa clientéle est constitué pour l'essentiel par la gente féminine.

loans.use: Sales

loans.name: Alejandro Ignacio

texts.es:
Alejandro has a great quality, that of being enterprising and very hard working. He has been selling potatoes for 3 years, has plots of land which he is preparing for plating potato, then after a few months harvest and selling the potatoes, as a traveling vendor. His wish is to have his own stall in the market and he is working intensely toward this goal. At the moment he needs to plant his potatoes on his land, and due to the rise in prices of natural fertilizers, he is asking for a loan in order to be able to buy fertilizers. Alejandro waits for your help in order to be successful.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

Alejandro tiene una gran cualidad, ser emprendedor y muy trabajador, se dedica al comercio de la papa, lleva 3 años de esta labor, tiene extensiones de terreno, los que prepara para la siembra de papa, luego de varios meses la cosecha y la vende, por el momento de manera ambulante, su deseo es tener un puesto propio en el mercado, para lo cual está trabajando intensamente.Su necesidad en este momento es sembrar la papa en su terreno, debido a la alza de precios de los abonos, solicita un préstamo para poder adquirir estos. Alejandro espera su apoyo para seguir adelante.

loans.use: Purchase organic fertilizer for his potato fields

loans.name: Mohtaram

texts.en: 8 years ago, Mohtaram started this business. He is an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-occupied territory of the Lachin region in Azerbaijan and has settled in Khirdalan town. This man is married and has 3 children. Now he needs a loan of US$ 625 to buy the meat necessary to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy meat for re-sale

loans.name: 6 De Enero Group

texts.es:
Este comité de Mujeres Emprendedoras fué el primero que se benefició con este programa de apoyo, se formó a de la promoción realizada por la Asesora y el gerente de la Oficina.
El comité esta constituido por 16 señoras quienes viven en el mismo barrio. Las señoras tienen diferentes actividades y que a partir de la conformación del comité se ayudan en la compra de sus productos unas de otras.
Ellas solicitan el crédito para la compra de las materias primas en cantidad para conseguir mejores precios.Ellas ya están en el 2º ciclo y tienen un ahorro de mas de 700.000 Gs.(176U$), es un comité muy sólido, y apuntan a crecer en confianza, y desarrollo personal.
texts.en:
The Committee "Mujered Emprendedoras" was the first that benefited from this support program, and was started under a promotion by the Advisor and manager of the Office. The committee consists of 16 women who live in the same neighborhood. The women have different activities and from the start of this committee they have bought each other's products. They are seeking a loan to buy raw materials in bulk in order to get better prices. They are now on their second cycle and have a savings of more than 700.000 Gs (US$176). It is a solid committee and they note that they want to grow in confidence and personal development.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy clothing, fabric, perfume, cosmetic, jewelry, beverages, basic needs items like sugar, flour, noodles, tea, eggs, meat and other items.

loans.name: Rosa Argentina

texts.es: La señora Rosa Argentina habita en el barrio Waspan Sur, barrio ubicado en la capital de Managua, tiene 50 años de edad, se encuentra soltera, tiene una hija de 35 años quien le apoya en la venta de comida. Actualmente la señora Rosa Argentina tiene un pequeño negocio donde vende comida casera, lo inicio con un préstamo que ella realizo en una y con el apoyo de su hija, esforzándose ambas en el negocio, ya  que comenzaron con pocos clientes, por tanto la señora rosa argentina solicita C$ 10,000 aun  plazo de 12 meses para capital de trabajo comprar mas materia prima y poder ofertas mas variedad de comidas y por tanto incrementar sus ingresos de ventas;  y lograr en un futuro desea hacer mas grande su negocio  y lograr estabilidad económica.
texts.en:
Rosa Argentina lives in the South Waspan neighborhood of the capital city, Managua. She is 50 years old, single, and has a 35 year old daughter who support her in her business selling food. Today Rosa Argentina has a small business where she sells homemade food. She began this business with a small loan she made with the help of her daughter, both of them growing stronger through the business, as they began with few customers. Now Rosa Argentina is asking for a loan of C$10,000, which will be repaid in 12 months, to buy more raw ingredients and be able to offer a greater variety of food and thereby increase her income from sales. In the future she wishes to make her business bigger and achieve economic stability.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy raw ingredients to invest in her business selling homemade food

loans.name: Hassan

texts.en:
Hassan is a 43-year-old man who lives in Nabatieh, in southern Lebanon, with his wife and their two children. Issam has been a car painter for 30 years. He has requested a loan of $1200 from Al Majmoua to buy new tools for his work. 

Hassan is known for his fast and precise work, and also the good quality of execution. His customers are his friends, his family, his neighbors and others. 

When he first started his business, he had some difficulty establishing a good reputation for his work, but now that he is well known in his area, he doesn’t worry about his reputation. Hassan decided to start his business because he always wanted to work on his own, to have a private business and not depend on anyone. He did his best to make it work. Therefore, his future plans are to expand his business as a blacksmith and a painter. Painting for him is very important; it helps him to express himself and feel better.

loans.use: Hassan wants the loan to purchase new tools for his business

loans.name: Thi Hoa's Group

texts.vi:
Trần Thị Hoa sinh năn 1962 (mã số 010117050051) tham gia vay vốn mức vay: 4.578.000 vnđ để đầu tư kinh doanh vận chuyển sắt vụn. Cô đang ở cùng chồng và con gái. chồng cô làm nghề lái xe có thu nhập ổn định khoảng 5.000.000 vnđ/ tháng. Con gái cô đang theo học phổ thong. Cô là người nhiệt tình và có ý thức hoàn trả vốn tốt. Cô làm nhóm trưởng nhóm vay vốn gồm có:
 Nguyễn Thị Mỹ sinh năm 1953(mã số 010117050053) tham gia vay vốn mức vay: 4.142.000 vnđ để đầu tư chăn nuôi lợn.
 Nguyễn Thị Phượng sinh năm 1975 (mã số 010117050054 ) tham gia vay vốn mức vay: 4.142.000 vnđ để chăn nuôi lợn.
 Nguyễn Thị Dịch sinh năm 1953 (mã số 010117050052 ) tham gia vay vốn mức vay: 4.142.000 vnđ để đi chợ rau.
 Trần Thị Liên sinh năm 1982 (mã số 010117050056 ) tham gia vay vốn mức vay: 4.142.000 vnđ để đầu tư ao cá.
 Trần Thị Nhài sinh năm 1965 (mã số 010117050055 ) tham gia vay vốn mức vay: 4.142.000 vnđ để đầu tư chăn nuôi gà.
texts.en:
Mrs. T. Thi Hoa was born in 1962. She would like to borrow 4,578,000 VND to invest in scrap metal transporting business. She lives with her husband and daughter. Her husband is a driver with an income of 5,000,000 VND per month. Her daughter is in grade school. Mrs. T. is an enthusiastic person and a conscientious borrower who wants to repay her loan on time. She is the team leader of her group, which includes the following people: _N. Thi My, born in 1953 who wishes to borrow 4,142,000 VND for raising pigs _N. Thi Phuong, born in 1975 who wishes to borrow 4,142,000 VND for raising pigs. _N. Thi Dich, born in 1953 who wishes to borrow 4,142,000 VND for produce selling business. _T. Thi Lien, born in 1982 who wishes to borrow 4,142,000 VND to invest in raising fish. _T. Thi Nhai, born in 1965 who wishes to borrow 4,142,000 VND to invest in raising chickens.

Translated from Vietnamese by Thiennga Ngo, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: chăn nuôi

loans.name: Michael Jose

texts.es: Michael es soltero, de 23 años de edad, tiene 1 hija de año y medio, su compalera no trabaja, el trabaja en El Ayote como profesor de primaria, viaja cada 15 dias a Juigalpa a ver  a su familia, esta solicitando su primer credito para utilizarlo en la compra de tablas para cambiar la de su cuerto que esta construido mitad concreto y mitad tablas (minifalda conocido popularmente), ademas comprará cemento para embaldozar el mismo, esto  lo hace con el objetivo de brindarle mayor seguridad a su familia durante los dias que el esta fuera; ha sido recomendado por otros clientes  y clientas ya que ellos consideran que AFODENIC es la solucion a los problemas de vivienda, con una mejor politica para sus clientes.   El se ha comprometido a pagar en tiempo y forma para de esa manera ganarse un buen record crediticio y llegar a ser un fiel cliente de la institucion que ha alcanzado un gran prestigio entre sus clientes.
texts.en:
Michael is single, 23 years old and has a daughter aged 1 and a half. His partner is not working; he works in El Ayote as an elementary school teacher. Every 15 days he travels to Juigalpa to see his family. He is asking for this, his first loan, in order to buy floorboards to change those in his room which is built partly of concrete and partly of floorboards (commonly referred to as "minifalda"). He will also buy adhesive to tile the room, which he is doing in order to give his family a more secure home when he is away. He was recommended by other clients, who believe that AFODENIC can help solve their housing problems because of its client policies. He is committed to paying on time and recognizes that this is a good way to earn a good credit record and become a loyal client of the institution which has gained such a good reputation with its clients.

Translated from Spanish by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy building materials.

loans.name: Boubacar

texts.fr: Boubacar est un jeune commerçant dans le populaire quartier de Lyndiane. Grâce à son commerce il entretient sa famille de 3 enfants. Il sollicite ce crédit pour renforcer ses activités et gagner davantage de profits.
texts.en:
Boubacar is a young merchant in the working class neighborhood of Lyndiane. Thanks to his business, he supports his family of 3 children. He is requesting this loan to bolster his little business and earn more profit from it.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: bolstering his little business

loans.name: Mex

texts.en: Mex Y., 58, lives with his wife in Takeo province, Cambodia. He is a taxi driver who typically makes US$ 7 every day. His wife grows and sells vegetables at the market to earn approximately US$ 10 per day. This couple has five children and all of them are students. Mr. Mex Y. would like to take out a loan to purchase a water pump to irrigate his wife’s farm.

loans.use: To purchase a water pump

loans.name: Pham Thi

texts.vi: Phạm Thị Dích sinh năm 1959, (Mã số: 010103090005). Chị chủ yếu làm nông nghiệp, chồng chị lái xe chở thuê hàng vật liệu xây dựng. Thu nhập của gia đình chị là: 2.000.000 VND/tháng. Chị tham gia vay mức vốn là 3.270.000 VND.
texts.en:
Phạm Thị Dích was born in 1959. Her main occupation is farming, and her husband drives a truck transporting building materials. The total income of her family is 2,000,000 VND (122 USD) per month. She requests a loan of 3,270,000 VND (200 USD).

Translated from Vietnamese by Robert Sides, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Farming

loans.name: Fabiola Kruscaya

texts.en:
Fabiola is the president of the “Juntos de la Mano” (“Holding hands”) Village Bank. She is 29 years old and is the single mother of a two-year-old daughter.

Fabiola sells dry goods like grains, flour, and dried beans and corn from a small grocery store she runs in Anta, a town about 40 minutes outside of the city of Cusco. She recently opened the store in a rented location; before then, she worked from a smaller stand. Fabiola works seven days a week at her store from 6 a.m. to 8 p.m. She usually works alone, though sometimes her goddaughter helps her, as does the father of her daughter.

Fabiola is requesting a loan of 1500 soles to stock her new store. She still has to take inventory, so she isn’t sure exactly what products she will need to buy yet. She has pledged to repay her Kiva loan on time and in full.

Fabiola’s goal for the future is to open her own large supermarket.

loans.use: To stock her recently opened small grocery store

loans.name: Paulina

texts.en: Paulina A. K. sells clothing and fabric in Abura. Paulina has received an education through Junior High School.  She is married and has 4 dependents. Her husband is a trader. Paulina has been selling clothing and fabric for 12 years now. She is responsible for paying housekeeping expenses and support when there is any other need. Her loan will be used as additional capital to enable her to increase the sale of clothing and fabric for resale. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to reinvest for the expansion of  her trade in clothing and fabrics.

loans.use: Her loan will be used as additional capital to enable her to increase the sale of clothing and fabric for resale.

loans.name: Dao Thi

texts.en:
Thái Đào Thị (428040894) is a 49 year-old female living in the town of Kim Động.  She is married and has 3 adult-aged children.  To making a living, Thái owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising livestock.  While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from raising cattle for sale.  Thái has been engaged in this business for over 15 years and earns approximately 2000000 VND a month from these activities.


In 2006, Thái joined TYM Fund to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  Thái has successfully repaid a previous loan from TYM Fund.  This previous loan was used to purchase breeding livestock.  Thái is now requesting a new loan of 9000000 VND which will be used to purchase livestock feed & other supplies.  The loan will be the 7th loan taken out by the borrower from TYM Fund.  Thái plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase livestock feed & other supplies

loans.name: Nzovwe 2 Group

texts.en:
For many years, Frola has been a food seller in the Nzovwe neighborhood of Mbeya. She belongs to Nzovwe 2 group loan (Group code 2018). She currently earns very little monthly profit. Every day she works at her business for 12 hours.

She is requesting her third loan from BRAC Tanzania so that she can buy more food items to add her current stock for the improvement of her business. She is hoping that through this loan, her profit will increase and she will be able to grow her business.

Frola is 34 years old, married, and has five children: ages 15, 14, 12, 10, and 8. She will be sharing this loan with her fellow group member, Sophia, who has her own small business, selling food in Mbeya.

loans.use: To buy more food items to add her current stock

loans.name: Rose

texts.en: Rose T. sells sarongs. She is married with a child and she is 40 years old. She is requesting the loan amount of N 100,000 to purchase more sarongs to sell. Rose says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more sarongs to sell

loans.name: Ana Jane

texts.en:
Ana Jane M. is from the village of Danao. She is 24 years old. Ana Jane is married. To make a living, Ana Jane owns & operates a fishing business in which she harvests & sells ocean-caught fish in the local community. Ana Jane has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 4,500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Ana Jane joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and to engage in business activities. Ana Jane has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase fishing equipment, including hooks & nets. Ana Jane is requesting a new loan of 7000 PHP to be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be the 2nd loan taken out by Ana Jane from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business.

loans.name: Majengo Group

texts.en:
Avelina is one of 2 members of the Majengo borrower group in Kiboriloni, Kilimanjaro. She is  32, is married, and has 2 children, 11 and 6 years old. 
  
Avelina started her own cafe business 3 years ago. She works  11 hours a day and earns a monthly profit of approximately 120,000 Tanzania Schillings.

This is Avelina’s first loan from BRAC Tanzania. She has requested 200,000 Tsh in order to to buy more commodities for her business. With the additional profit she gains from the use of this loan, Avelina hopes to get more food, pay school fees, do repairs and expand her business. 

Fatina, the other member of the Majengo borrower group, has requested 200,000 Tsh in order to support her clothing business.

loans.use: To buy more commodities

loans.name: Salome A.

texts.en:
Mambo (greetings) from Tanzania! This is 29-year-old Salome M. from Mbozi. She is married with two children, ages 4 and 6. Salome has been running a retail shop business since 2007. She owns a small "duka" or neighborhood shop in the city, where she sells common household and grocery items.

She works at the business for nine to 12 hours per day, six days per week. Salome currently earns about $250 a month from her business. She is requesting a loan in order to purchase shop items in bulk for her business. In the future, she plans to improve the quality and range of products in her "duka." Salome thanks you for your support!

ABOUT SELFINA:

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through micro-leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback micro-finance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of micro-leasing is that it allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To purchase shop items in bulk for her business

loans.name: Roberto Jose

texts.es: El señor Roberto José B. López, tiene la edad de 39 años, habita en el Municipio de Ticuantepe, el es un hombre esforzado, el trabaja en una financieras en créditos para poder sastifacer sus necesidades de su familia, su esposa también trabaja para apoyarle con los gastos del hogar , ellos tiene a su cargo dos hijos , un varón de doce años , actualmente estudiante de secundaria y una niña de nueve la cual estudia su primaria , don Roberto desde hace dos años tiene el negocio de agencia de gas, a veces no llena en cada ronda por falta de dinero por que las ventas están bajas y otras veces  no abastece a todos sus clientes  por falta de productos, lo cual da las gracias Afodenic por el préstamo el cual comprara cilindros de 25 libras para tener en su inventario y poder vender a cada familia Nicaragüense.
texts.en:
Mr. Roberto Jose B. L. is 39 years old and lives in the municipality of Ticuantepe. He is a strong man who works in a financier in credits to satisfy the needs of his family. His wife also works to help him with the household expenses. They are taking care of two children, a boy who is 12 and currently a High School student; and a girl who is 9 and is in primary school. For 2 years Roberto has had a branch of a gas business and sometimes cannot fully stock it because sales are low and other times he cannot fill all customer orders for lack of supply. He gives thanks to Afodenic for a loan that he used to buy 25 pound cylinders to have in his inventory and so be able to sell to any Nicaraguan family.

Translated from Spanish by Machelle Wilson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy 25 pound gas cyclinders for public sale

loans.name: Mohamad

texts.en: Mohamad is a 24-year-old single man who lives with his parents. He has been working as a baker since 2005 and has eight years of experience in this field. Today, Mohamad is requesting a loan of $800 USD to renovate the tools in his bakery.

loans.use: To renovate the tools in his bakery

loans.name: Raymark

texts.en: Raymark Z. is from the village of Jasaan, Misamis Oriental. He is 38 years old, is married, and has two infant children. Raymark owns and operates a business raising crops, primarily planting and harvesting bananas for sale. He is just starting this business. In 2009, Raymark joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and his ability to engage in business activities. He is requesting a loan of 7,000 PHP which will be used to pay for services to increase crop yield. This loan will be his first from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand his business. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To pay for services to increase crop yield

loans.name: Gulnora

texts.ru: Гульнора Аминова проживает в Яванском районе. Возраст 28 лет. Замужем, имеет 5 детей. Муж занимается бизнесом. Сама Гульнора более 5 лет занимается земледелием. Она в основном выращивает фрукты, а потом продает их на рынке. Кредит просит для покупки удобрений и семян, чтобы посеить новый урожай.
texts.en:
Gulnora A. lives in the Yavan region. She is 28 years old. She is married and has five children. Her husband does business. Gulnora has been in agriculture for more than five years. She mostly grows fruits and then sells them on the market. She is asking for a loan to buy fertilizer and seeds so she can sow new harvest.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and seeds for harvest

loans.name: Mirna Elizabeth

texts.es: Mirna Elizabeth R. C. originaria del departamento de Santa Ana vive con esposo y sus cuatro hijos todos menores de edad. Mirna tiene 37 años de edad,  ha montado un pequeño negocio de venta de cosméticos, ropa y zapatos en su hogar, el cual lleva seis años al servicio de sus clientes, Mirna y su esposo son equipo, juntos se ayudan con los gastos del hogar y otros que representan  los estudios de sus hijos. Mirna solicita de un crédito para surtir su negocio, con variedad de productos de los que comercializa, ella ya obtenido  otros créditos los cuales se encuentran saldados y con una experiencia de puntualidad en sus cuotas.
texts.en:
Mirna Elizabeth R. C. is originally from the department of Santa Ana. She is 37 years old and lives with her husband and 4 dependent children. Six years ago, Mirna started a small business selling cosmetics, clothing, and shoes out of her home. She and her husband work as a team. They help each other with the household expenses and are involved in their children’s education.

Mirna is requesting a loan to restock her business with a variety of products that she can sell. She has had received previous loans that were repaid on time.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise to restock her business

loans.name: Taban

texts.en:
Taban S. sells charcoal from her home. She is requesting a loan to stock more bags of charcoal to sell. Taban is 26 years old and is married. Her husband is a primary school teacher. She has three children who go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to open up a shop.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education , and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To buy more charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Ketty Gouvani

texts.es:
Ketty Gouvani M. S., comenzo hace 12 años vendiendo ceramicas, sus ventas disminuyeron en un 90%, lo cual la obligo a cambiar de actividad, como la venta de frutas, pues su familia tiene en el campo cultivos de naranja, mandarina, banano y platano. Por ejemeplo ella invierte US$ 100 en frutas y obtiene como ganancia US$ 80. Su esposo es chofer y le ayuda con las ventas en el sector donde vive. Ketty tiene dos hijos de 18 y 13 años respectivamente.
 
Con el prestamo planea comprar semillas para cultivar arroz, maiz y compar naranaja, mandarina, banano y platanos. Cuando tiene tiempo libre se dedica a realizar ciertas ceremicas.
texts.en:
Ketty Gouvani M. Sánchez began selling ceramics 12 years ago. Her sales went down by 90%, which caused her to have to change her business to fruit sales. In the countryside her family has oranges, tangerines, bananas, and plantains. For example, she pays $100 for fruit and then makes a profit of $80. Her husband is a driver and he helps her with sales in the neighborhood where they live. With the loan she plans to buy seeds to plant rice and corn and to buy oranges, tangerines, bananas, and plantains. When she has free time she makes a few types of ceramics.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer

video.title: Kiva Entrepreneur Ketty Gouvani from  Ecuador

loans.use: To buy seeds, insecticides, and fruits

loans.name: Socios Unidos Group

texts.es: El grupo “Socios Unidos” esta representado por la señora Guadalupe y conformada por 12 miembros muy responsables y con grandes expectativas D. seguir creciendo para poder darles a sus familias una mejor calidad D. vida. Cada una D. las socias tiene sus actividades comerciales como se la venta D. D. comida, carne, cosméticos, joyas, pan D. batalla y otros se dedican a la jardinería. Dentro del ámbito D. venta D. productos existe una elevada competencia ya que existe una gran gama D. productos, es por resta razón que las socias deben esforzarse más en sus ventas diarias ya que D. ello depenD. el sustento D. sus familias. El crédito será destinado a la adquisición D. mercadería, insumos y herramientas que coadyuven a la realización D. un mejor trabajo capaz D. competir en el mercado. Los miembros D. este grupo se encuentran cursando su cuarto ciclo juntos demostrando responsabilidad y puntualidad en sus pagos ya que D. ellos depenD. el sustento D. sus familias las cuales ya se han visto mejoradas en el transcurrir D. los ciclos que llevan juntos los socios.
texts.en:
The group “Socios Unidos” [United Partners] is represented by Ms. Guadalupe and formed from the twelve very responsible members with grand expectations of continued growth in order to give their families a better quality of life. Each of the partners has their commercial activities with the sale of food, meat , cosmetics, jewels, “battle bread” [crispy mini-loafs] and others are dedicated to the gardening. Within this product sales environment, there is a high level of experience and a wiD. variety of products, for this reason the partners push themselves more in their daily sales as their families’ sustenance depends on it. The loan is marked for the purchase of merchandise, primary materials and tools that help them to do the best job possible in order to be competitive on the market. The members of this group find themselves passing a quarter century together and have demonstrated responsibility and punctuality in their payments, as they depend on these to sustain their families, who have seen improvements in the passing of time that they have been together as partners.

Translated from Spanish by Andrea Kellogg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operations capital

loans.name: Mariscal Caceres Group

texts.es:
MARISCAL CACERES

Mariscal Cáceres es un grupo conformado por 13 socios  las cuales son personas  sobresalientes en el campo de los negocios, pero eso se debe al esfuerzo y dedicación que ponen los socios para ayudar a sus familias.
Yolanda es una socia antigua, ella se dedica al rubro de la textilería hace 10 años, negocio con el cual pudo aportar con la mejora estructural en casa además de los estudios de su hijo.
La Sra. América  tiene una bodega hace 6 años donde vende diferentes productos, con las ganancias ayuda a su familia; el préstamo otorgado lo invertirá en la compra de panetones, cervezas y demás comestibles solicitados por estas fiestas de fin de año.
Hace varios años vende diferentes tipos de frutas en un mercado muy concurrido, y tiene 3 hijos por los que Herlinda  sigue esforzándose para darles lo mejor que puede, aunque nunca es suficiente.
Eulogia es casada y tiene 2 hijos en edad escolar, tiene una jugueria hace 6 años, sus ingresos solo le permiten aportar en casa para los gastos básicos. 
Los socios están agradecidos con los prestamos,  será destinado para la compra de insumos para los diferentes negocios que tienen cada una y así poder brindarles a sus familias solo lo indispensable para vivir, por el momento no hay para más.
texts.en:
The Mariscal Cáceres group has thirteen members who are outstanding business people. This is due to the effort and the dedication they put in so they can help their families. Yolanda is a long-time member who has been in the textile business for ten years. This work has enabled her to make structural improvements to her house and also to educate her son. Sra. América has run a grocery store for six years where she sells different products. With the money she earns she helps her family. The loan will be used to buy panetones (traditional cake), beer, and other food often eaten during the New Year festivities. Herlinda has been selling various kinds of fruit for several years in a popular market. She has three children for whom she goes to great efforts in order to provide them with the best that she can--although it is never enough. Eulogia is married and has two school-aged children. She has been selling juice for six years, and the income has allowed her to buy her the basics for the household. The members are grateful for the loans which will be used to buy supplies for their various businesses so that they can provide their families with the basic necessities. For the moment there is no money for anything more.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy products

loans.name: Maria Cruz

texts.es:
El banco comunal Nueva Juventud está formado por un grupo de mujeres luchadoras  que  buscan con su esfuerzo salir adelante junto a sus familias, se han convertido en grandes amigas viven todas en la urbe cuencana, esta ciudad se caracteriza por su gente amable, sus paisajes, su centro histórico, en general es una ciudad encantadora que atrae al turista nacional y extranjero.

María Arévalo tiene una linda amistad con todas las socias del  banco comunal, ella tiene  42 años  vive en unión libre con su pareja  y sus cuatro hijos de  17, 10, 8 y 3 años de edad en la comunidad Conferencias en la parroquia de Quingeo,  su hijo mayor trabaja  en cualquier actividad que  se le presente para sus gastos personales  y sus  clases de música, sus hijos menores  estudian en la escuela de Santa Ana y para llegar a allá tienen que caminar 30 minutos todos los días,  su esposo no tienen trabajo fijo y labora en lo que le ofrezcan que puede ser en la agricultura o  la construcción,  su casita es propia aunque de adobe y pequeña pero acogedora.

Ella se dedica a la cría  de vacas, cerdos,  cuyes y pollos y recuerda que el primer credito recibido lo invirtió en la compra de pollos para su criadero, con el dinero que reciba esta ocasión va a  comprar pollitos, alimento y vitaminas para su crianza para incrementar su corral de aves.

Su sueño es que sus hijos sigan adelante en sus estudios para que lleguen a tener un mejor futuro.
texts.en:
The Communal Bank “Nueva Juventud” (New Youth) was formed by a group of determined women who look for ways for their families to get ahead. They have become good friends since they all live in the city of Cuenca. This city is known for its friendly people, its landscapes, and its historical center. In general, it is a charming city that attracts both domestic and foreign tourists.

María Arévalo has a wonderful friendship with the other members of the Communal Bank. She is 42 years old, in a common law marriage, and has four children (ages 17, 10, 8, and 3). They live in the community of Conferencias in the Quingeo Parish. Her oldest child works in order to pay for personal expenses and music classes. The younger children attend Santa Ana School and have to walk to classes 30 minutes every day. Her husband does not have a steady job and works in agriculture or construction whenever such opportunities are made available. María and her family own their own adobe house, which is small yet comfortable.

She raises cows, pigs, guinea pigs, and chickens. María recalls that the first loan she received was used to buy chickens. With this new loan that she will receive, María will buy chicks, feed, and vitamins so that she can increase the number of birds in her coop. Her dream is for her children to succeed in their studies so that they can have a better future.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase chicks, feed, and vitamins

loans.name: Anthony

texts.en: Anthony is a 30-year-old married man with two children. He has been running his boda boda (motorcycle taxi) business for the past year, and he also sells knife sharpeners to earn additional income. With the 15,000 KES loan, he wants to purchase another motorbike to have a well-established transport business. He hopes to have a stable source of income and a happy family someday. Anthony describes himself as hardworking and determined.

loans.use: To purchase another motorbike.

loans.name: Lilian

texts.en: Lilian is married with one 3-year-old daughter. As a busy entrepreneur, she has been running a sari-sari (general) store for almost five years. Her husband is a motorboat driver in the neighborhood. To build her business, Lilian would like to receive a loan to increase the inventory of goods sold in her sari-sari store. She is planning to purchase additional products such as rice and gasoline. She believes that offering a wider assortment of goods to customers will increase traffic to her store and maintain customer loyalty in the community. A dedicated member of Ahon sa Hirap, Inc. (ASHI), a Kiva micro-finance partner in the Philippines, since 2008, Lillian has been a model member demonstrating regular attendance to weekly meetings and steady repayments on previous loans. Lilian’s long terms goals are to provide a better future for her family, sustain the profitability of her store, and start a savings account for her children. Through hard work and determination, she is focused on improving her quality of life through her entrepreneurial initiatives and support from ASHI and Kiva lenders. About ASHI Ahon sa Hirap Inc. (ASHI) has the distinction of being the oldest existing replication of Grameen Bank Approach (GBA) to credit delivery to the bottom poor in the Philippines. With its outstanding achievements over the years, it has become one of the role models in credit delivery to the poor in the country.

loans.use: To purchase additional products such as rice and gasoline

loans.name: To God Be The Glory Group

texts.en:
Mamie V. is the leader of the group of five borrowers called To God Be the Glory. Forty-years-old, married, and the mother of four children who range in age from 12 to 26, Mamie was only able to attend school through elementary school. For two years she has been cooking and selling food at the Red Light Market, the largest market in Liberia. She says she sells good food which keeps her customers returning.

Mamie plans to use her 10,000 Liberian dollar portion of this 46,000 Liberian dollar group loan to buy more food to cook and sell. Her goal is to open a restaurant and improve the living conditions of her family.

In the photo that accompanies this profile, Mamie is the one holding the sign. Miatta M. is inset at lower left. About LEAP

The Local Enterprise Assistance Program (LEAP) is Liberia's largest and oldest continuously operating microfinance institution, with 13 branches across the country. Founded in 1994, the non-profit organization has survived periods of civil war and severe socio-economic hardship. LEAP seeks to help rebuild post-conflict Liberia through its group and individual loans to micro- and small-scale entrepreneurs, and puts emphasis on lending to women.

loans.use: To purchase additional food to cook and sell.

loans.name: Manuel Alberto

texts.es:
El señor Manuel Alberto B. S., tiene 54 años de edad vive en Villa Libertad tiene 1 hijo el cual ya no depende de él economicamnete, su esposa es manicurista y comparten los gastos del hogar, trabaja como chofer.

Ellos son una familia que vive en una casa muy himilde, construida hace 40 años en donde se notan los deterioros que el tiempo ha dejado, es por esta razon que solicita un prestamo para la compra de materiales de construccion, y cambiar en primera instancia el techo de su vivienda debido ha que las temporadas de lluvias se aproximan y esta inversion los apoyaria de gran manera  ha habitar en un espacio mas seguro y comodo para toda la familia.
texts.en:
Manuel Alberto B. S., 54, lives in Villa Libertad with his manicurist wife. They have a son, who no longer depends on him economically; his wife and he share household expenses; he works as a driver. They are a family living in a very humble home, built 40 years ago, which is showing the signs of deterioration that the passage of time has caused. For this reason, he is asking for funding to buy building materials to, primarily, replace the roof because the rainy season is approaching and this investment will make it possible for them to live in safer surroundings that are more comfortable for the whole family.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy building materials and supplies to replace the roof.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en: Esther A. is a hair stylist who makes lovely western and Nigerian hairstyles for her customers. She loves this business because of the opportunity to interact with her customers. She has been in this business for 15 years. She is married with four children and she is 42 years old. Her children are excelling in school and this gives her joy as a mother. She lives in Oyo state, Nigeria. Esther is requesting a loan of 100,000 NGN to purchase more hair extensions and cream to sell.

loans.use: To purchase more hair extensions and cream to sell

loans.name: Gulchehra

texts.en:
K. Gulchehra has an established business selling children's clothing in her store. She started her business about 10 years ago. She has an entrepreneurial mind and she has worked hard to develop her business. Buying clothing inventory from neighboring country China, where she can get better prices, is the way in which she is able to gain a competitive business advantage. Gulchehra is married, and she has two children. She is requesting a loan of $2600 USD in order to purchase more clothing. With additional clothing, she will be able to increase her sales and will continue to provide a better life for herself and her family. 

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase children's clothing to increase the variety of goods for sale.

loans.name: Gresilda

texts.en: Gresilda I. is from the village of Olingan, Dipolog City. She is 49 years old and is single. Gresilda owns and operates a manicure and pedicure business, providing beauty services to local community members. She is just starting this business. In 2010, Gresilda joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase materials needed to expand services provided. This loan will be her first from PMPC. Gresilda plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase materials needed to expand her manicure and pedicure business

loans.name: Maria Ines

texts.es: Maria Ines tiene 56 años, su actividad económica es la crianza y engorde de pollos para engorde. Hace más de 10 años que inicio esta actividad, pues no tenía suficiente ingresos para mantener a sus 6 hijos pues ella tenía que buscar la forma de mantenerlos, actualmente ellos trabajan de manera independiente, Maria inicio con pocos pollos a medida a transcurrido el tiempo es que ha logrado aumentar su producción. El financiamiento que solicita es para capital de trabajo y poder realizar la compra de alimento para los pollos y acondicionar el local para que puedan tener más espacio.
texts.en:
Maria Ines is 56 years old and earns her living by raising chickens for fattening. She has been in this business for more than ten years. Since her income was not enough to support her six chidren, Maria had to find ways to make money. Her children now work independently. She started with a few chickens, but as time passed she was able to increase her production.

The loan she requested will be used as operating capital to buy feed for her chickens and renovate her chicken coop so that the birds will have more space.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase poultry feed & renovate a chicken coop

loans.name: Salif

texts.fr:
Monsieur Salif Traoré est un homme marié de 37 ans et père de 2 enfants. Il vit avec sa femme et ses enfants chez son père à Bougouni dans le quartier Médine.
N’ayant pas fréquenté le système scolaire, dès son jeune âge il commença les activités génératrices de revenus.
 Après plusieurs activités mais sans réussite, il décide d’apprendre les activités d’achat et de vente des appareils électroniques, auprès d’un ami. Avec plus de 5 ans d’expérience, Monsieur Salif Traoré maitrise son activité d’achat et la vente des appareils électroniques.
Dans le cadre du renforcement de ses activités, il décida de rejoindre le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso. Il est à son deuxième prêt et le précédent a été correctement remboursé.
Ce prêt sera utilisé pour acheter une quantité importante d’appareils électroniques et accessoires.                                                                                                                                                                               Il s’approvisionne à Bougouni et Bamako (capitale de république du Mali).
La vente se fait au marché de Bougouni et une partie dans les  marchés hebdomadaires des  villages environnants.
Monsieur Salif Traoré compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 75 000FCFA.
Avec ces bénéfices il envisage construire une maison pour son avenir et ceux de ses enfants.
texts.en:
Mr Salif Traoré is 37 years old and married with 2 children. He lives with his wife and children at his father's house in Bougouni, in the Médine district. Having never attended school, he started income generating activities at a young age. After several unsuccessful attempts, he decided to learn from a friend about the business of buying and selling electronic devices. With more than 5 years experience, Mr Salif Traoré is mastering the business of buying and selling electronic appliances. As a means of further developing his business, he has decided to join Soro Yiriwaso's credit program. This is his second loan and the first was diligently repaid. This loan will be used to buy a significant quantity of electronic appliances and accessories. He gets his supplies at Bougouni and Bamako (capital of the Republic of Mali). He sells his goods at the market in Bougouni and also at the daily markets in surrounding villages. Mr Salif Traoré expects to generate a monthly profit of 75 000FCFA. With this profit he hopes to build a house for his future, and for that of his children.

Translated from French by Kate Bennett, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase electronic appliances

loans.name: Vanimonimo

texts.en:
"Vanimonimo K. is 31 and married with 2 children aged 5 and 10.  She is starting a business venture selling pancakes (fried flour pancakes flavored with lemon or coconut jam). Vanimonimo needs a loan of WST$1000 to buy raw ingredients for her cooked foods. She plans to use the earnings from her business (estimated to be 450 talas or US $188 per week) to improve and expand the business.

In 2010, Vanimonimo joined SPBD. This is her second loan with SPBD. SPBD's loans are Vanimonimo's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks.

About  SPBD 
In 2000, Greg Casagrande founded SPBD and since then, it has expanded from the main island of Upolu in Samoa to Savaii, as well as Tonga.  SPBD's philosophy of lending is based upon the Grameen Bank lending method. Please join SPBD's lending team on KIVA to receive on-the-spot updates on SPBD.  http://www.kiva.org/community/viewTeam?team_id=8375"

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients for cooked foods

loans.name: Zarif

texts.ru: Давронов Зариф проживает в районе Шахритус. Возраст, 38 лет. Женат, имеет 5 детей. Образование средне - специальное, бухгалтер. Проработал 10 лет по профессии. Сейчас он занимается растениеводством. Арендует земельный участок, где выращивает овощи. Имеет богатый опыт в этой области.  Кредит берет для закупа минеральных удобрений, чтобы получить хороший урожай для продажи.
texts.en:
Zarif D. lives in Shahrituz. He is 38 years old, married, and has five children. He has a vocational degree in bookkeeping. He worked in his profession for ten years. Now, he farms. He rents the plot where he grows vegetables. He has vast experience in this. He is taking out a loan to buy mineral fertilizers in order to get a good harvest to sell.

Translated from Russian by Melissa Kniazeva, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: buying mineral fertilizers

loans.name: Marie

texts.fr:
Marie M.  est une femme de 50 ans, née à Butare, province du Sud du Rwanda. Elle est mariée et a quatre enfants, le moins âgée a  15 ans et le plus âgée  a 25 ans, tous ses 4 enfants sont allé à l’école.Marie et sa famille  habitent à Nyamata.

Son activité est le commerce des maniocs et farine de manioc dans laquelle on prépare le FUFU( pate de manioc) dans le petit marché de NYAMATA. Elle a une expérience de 7 ans dans ce domaine.
Le crédit contracté avec ACB est  le premier et va lui aider d’améliorer son business de commerce des maniocs et sa farine et à payer le minerval des ses enfants et le bien être de sa famille. Ses épargnes lui permet d’acheter deux vaches pour avoir du lait pour les enfants :
Dans l’avenir, elle compte devenir un gros commerçant des maniocs et sa farine, pourra contracter un nouveau prêt d’un gros montant pour augmenter son chiffre d’affaires, ainsi elle pourra acheter un champ pour augmenter l’étendu cultivé les maniocs et pourra fournir d’autres marchés comme Ruhuha.
texts.en:
Marie M., age 40, was born in Butare, a province in southern Rwanda. She's married and the mother of four children, aged three to ten. Out of them, three attended school. Emmanuel's family lives in Nyamata. Her business consists in selling cassava and tapioca, used to prepare FUFU (a staple food of Central Africa) at Nyamata's small market. She has seven years of experience in this field. The loan from ACB is her first, and will help her to improve her business selling manioc and manioc flour and pay tuition for her children. It also improved the well-being of her family. Her savings enable her to buy two cows to get milk for her children. In the future, she intends to become a large clothing reseller, and get a new sizable loan to increase her revenue. She will thus be able to buy a field to increase her cassava plantation, and supply other markets, such as the one in Ruhuha.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a lot to grow cassava

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en: Josephine is 35 years old and has five children. She is married and her husband helps her with her business. Josephine sells timber and has done this business for three years. She needs a loan to buy more timber in order to enlarge her business. She also hopes to sell local brew with the profits. She strives to have a big workshop in the future.

loans.use: To buy more timber.

loans.name: Robelina

texts.en:
Robelina S. is from the village of Cabisera II. She is 39 years old. Robelina is married and has four school-aged children. To make a living, Robelina owns & operates a general store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling a variety of different products in the local community. Robelina has been engaged in her business for over 13 years and earns approximately 3000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Robelina joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Robelina is requesting a loan of 7000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the 1st loan taken out by Robelina from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Mariana De Jesús

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Familiar se reúne cada 15 días en una localidad llamada Colorado a pocos minutos de Montecristi, en este sitio la mayoría de los habitantes tiene diferentes negocios como la fabricación de botones de tagua, artesanía y comercio en general.

Aquí encontramos a la señora Mariana tiene 59 años es viuda y tiene 5 hijos, los primeros 4 son casados y el ultimo que es  soltero vive con ella, nos cuenta con lagrimas en los ojos que su esposo falleció hace cuatro años pero  ella  todavía no lo ha podido superar.

Después que su esposo murió puso una pequeña fábrica de botones, ella tiene un torno (máquina para cortar tagua) con la que se elaboran los botones, producto al que entrega en Manta a comerciantes al por mayor, estos envíen al extranjero para que sean terminados. Trabaja de lunes a viernes  y los sábados selecciona los botones para llevarlos a vender, compra en Manta la tagua semirajada que es la que ella utiliza ya que es más rápida de trabajar.
 
Este crédito lo va a utilizar en la compra de materia prima ya que quiere aumentar su producción para aprovechar que el precio de su producto esta en estos momentos a buen precio en el mercado.
 
Esta en el Banco Comunal hace dos años, le trajo una amiga y le ha gustado porque siempre estos créditos le ayudan  mucho.
 
Su meta es seguir adelante en su negocio hasta que Dios lo quiera.
texts.en:
The Familiar Communal Bank meets every fortnight in a town called Colorado, a few minutes from Montecristi. Most of the inhabitants of this area run different businesses, such as the manufacture of buttons from the tagua nut (“vegetable ivory”), other crafts and general trading. Here lives Mariana, who is 59 years old and a widow with five children. The four eldest are married and the youngest is single and lives with her. With tears in her eyes, she tells us that her husband died four years ago but she is still grieving. After her husband died, she set up a small button factory. She has a lathe (a machine for cutting the tagua) which she uses to make the buttons. She then delivers the product to wholesalers in Manta, who send them abroad to be finished. She works from Monday to Friday and on Saturdays she selects the buttons she will take to be sold. She buys semi-processed tagua in Manta, using this kind because it is faster to work with. She will use this loan to buy raw materials because she would like to increase her production and benefit from her product currently being sold at a decent price in the market. She has belonged to the Communal Bank for two years – a friend introduced her and she is delighted with it, as these loans are always a great help to her. Her goal is to develop her business while it is God's will.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Stansfield, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy tagua.

loans.name: Kyandago Development B, Kihihi Group

texts.en:
N. Loy of Kyandago Development group is a 37-year-old determined, hardworking and happily married mother of 5 children. Like any other responsible parent, she studied how best she could satisfy her family requirements. She started a poultry farming business, where she looks after chickens for egg production and broilers for consumption. She manages this alongside her other farm sales.

In her home area of Kyandago, Kihihi, she has a variety of chickens, which makes her business more attractive. With this project, she has been able to capture a good share of the market from shopkeepers and hotel owners who purchase her eggs. She earns 90,000 UGX weekly and is well able to look after her family. Her main intention for taking up this loan is to help in the purchase of chicken feeds and feeding troughs and to stock more chicken. This will improve her market supply and her sales revenue.

loans.use: to restock chicken and to buy chicken feed and feeding troughs

loans.name: Magdaline

texts.en: For five years, Magdaline, a 34-year-old mother of three, has been operating a retail shop with one employee.  She also runs a metal fabrication business to supplement her family's income.  Since she joined Faulu Kenya, Magdaline has learned how to run her business in a better way.  Hence, she has stabilized her business and can now afford access loans from Faulu Kenya.  Now requesting a loan of 55,000 Kes to buy steel rod for welding and sugar and rice for her shop, Magdaline hopes to open a supermarket in the future.

loans.use: To buy steel rod for welding and sugar and rice for her shop

loans.name: Bernardo Tacalina

texts.pt:
Bernardo Tacalina V. nasceu na Província de Zambezia, centro de Moçambique casado e pai de 4 filhos de idades entre 09 a 19 anos de idade, todos vão a Escola. Fez somente 4ª classe e não continuou porque foi incorporado no serviço militar obrigatório. Vive na casa própria e sustenta seu irmão que vive com ele.

Saiu da Zambezia para Maputo cumprindo o serviço militar, é pensionista do Ministério da Defesa e recebe uma pensão mensal de 7.328.00mt que aplica nas despesas de casa e ainda consegue poupar algum na sua conta bancaria.

Ja teve empréstimos em outros bancos (BIM), conheceu a Hluvuku através de sua sobrinha que também é cliente desta instituição. Este é o seu primeiro empréstimo no valor de 10.300.00mt com o qual pretende comprar material de construção (cimento, tinta, areia, ferro e outros) para dar continuidade com a construção da sua casa.

Compromete se a pagar devidamente o empréstimo para poder aceder a outros. No futuro pretende solicitar mais empréstimo para concluir a sua residência e iniciar uma actividade comercial.
texts.en:
Bernardo Tacalina V. was born in the province of Zambezia, in central Mozambique.  He is married and has 4 children, ages 9 to 19.  All attend school. He only completed school through the 4th grade and did not continue because he was conscripted for mandatory military service.  He lives in his own home and also supports his brother, who lives with him.   

He left Zambezia for Maputo to complete his military service. He is a pensioner of the Ministry of Defense and receives a monthly pension of 7.328.00mt which he uses for household expenses and also saves a bit in his bank account. 

He has previously had loans with other banks (BIM).  He learned about Hluvuku through his niece who is also a client of this institution.  This is his first loan, in the amount of 10.300.00mt, which he plans to use to purchase construction materials (cement, paint, sand, iron, etc.) to continue building his house. 

He promises to pay the loan on time in order to have access to others.  In the future he plans to request additional loans to complete his home and begin a business.

loans.use: Purchase construction materials (cement, paint, sand, iron, etc. )

loans.name: Prospere

texts.fr:
Vendeuse des beignets, elle est très motivée dans ce domaine. Elle a épargnée pendanttout le cycle de remboursements et sa participation était régulière.

Si ses revenues ont augmentés, c’est grâce au  prêt passé qui a améliore entre autre sa manière de gérer son commerce et elle a appris : l’étude de faisabilité, le journal de caisse , la gestion de stock.
La solidarité  mutuelle du groupe a été pour elle une grande école d’apprentissage.
Elle vendait  par jour  25000f jour  maintenant contre 8000 frs  avant.
Le prochain prêt sera pour elle, serait  une occasion de faire plus de bénéfices et elle va augmenter son stock en achetant : 1 sacs de farine de blé, 1 sacde riz, 1 sac de sucre, 1 bidon d’huile, 1 sacde lait en poudre, 4 sacs de charbon, 1 carton de levure boulangère, les arômes, en plus elle a amenage un lieu pour que ses clients puissent prendre le riz au lait, les beignets et les galettes sur place, c'est pour cela qu'elle a achete des tables en plastiques et des chaises pour commencer son petit restaurant.
Divorcé, elle peut maintenant s’occuper valablement de ses enfants, payer leur scolarite et epargner pour leur futur.
texts.en:
This woman sells beignets (fritters), and is highly motivated in her activities. She accumulated savings throughout the entire loan repayment cycle, and her involvement remained consistent.

Her revenue increased thanks to the latest loan, which helped to improve her business management methods by learning about feasibility studies, the petty cash book, and inventory management. The mutual solidarity of the group was a great learning resource for her. Her sales went from 8,000 francs to 25,000 francs per day.

She hopes to bolster her profits with the next loan, which she will use it to increase her stocks by buying one bag of wheat flour, one bag of rice, one bag of sugar, one can of oil, one bag of powdered milk, four bags of coal, one container of baking yeast, and some flavorings. 

Having purchased plastic tables and chairs to start a small restaurant, she was able to set up a place where her customers can enjoy their rice pudding, fritters and pancakes on the spot. 

Being divorced, she is now able to care properly for her children, pay their tuition, and save for the future.

loans.use: To buy flour, rice, sugar, milk, oil, butter and margarine

loans.name: Juan Carlos

texts.es:
Juan Carlos C. C. tiene 29 años. Vive en Unión Libre con la compañera y los hijos, vive  en el cantón de Ventanas en la Provincia de Los Ríos. Tiene 2 hijos. 

Los miembros de la V.R.C. El LA UNION se encuentra ubicada en el recinto Aguas Frías, perteneciente al cantón Ventanas, esta ventanilla se dedica a labores agrícolas de ciclo corto siembra de maíz, arroz y fréjol, esta actividad llevan mucho tiempo haciéndolo.

Juan se dedica a la agricultura especialmente a la siembra de maíz, arroz y fréjol desde hace 3 años. Compra sus productos en Ventanas y los vende en la feria de Ventanas y en el mismo recinto.

Solicita el crédito para la comprar de insumos agrícolas y fertilizantes para los cultivos. Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentan desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades y la variedad del clima. Su sueño es comprar carro.
Le gusta descansar.
texts.en:
Juan Carlos C. C. is 29 years old. He lives with his partner and their children, in the Ventanas region, Province of Los Ríos. They have 2 children.

The members of the La Union rural communal bank are all based in the Aguas Frías area of Ventanas. The group is dedicated to agricultural work, in a planting cycle of maize, rice and beans. This activity takes a lot of time.

Edisson has been dedicated to agriculture - especially the cultivation of maize, rice and beans - for 3years. He buys his supplies in Ventanas and sells his produce at the market in the same area. He is seeking a loan to buy agricultural supplies and fertilizers for his crops. The loan should help him financially, to stock up on these necessities. He faces difficulties such as crop diseases and the variability of the climate. His dream is to buy a car. He likes to relax.

loans.use: Agricultural supplies and fertilizers

loans.name: George

texts.en:
George is a married man with four children, all of whom attend school. He owns a house that has piped water but not electricity. His greatest monthly expense is school fees for the family.

For the past twelve years, he has operated a goat trading business.  He buys and sell goats retail from home. His potential customers are neighbors and butcher operators.  George faces a major challenge of delayed payments by creditors who purchase on credit. He hopes to become a wholesale supplier in the future.

With the KShs 20,000, he wants to purchase goats for resale. He decided to join Yehu to access loans to improve his business.

loans.use: To purchase goats for resale

loans.name: Bethania

texts.en:
Bethania is a 37-year-old mother of 3 who lives with her family in San Jose, in the central valley of Costa Rica. She has been sewing clothing to generate income for the past 12 years. She started with a sewing machine which she borrowed from a friend, and over time, little by little, she was able to buy her own machine. The loan consultant that has been working with Bethania describes her as a hardworking entrepreneur with a fighting spirit.

Bethania carries out her work using one sewing machine and a sewing table which she has obtained through the accumulation of prior savings. She has a small workshop located on the patio of her home. Bethania hopes to use this loan to invest in materials necessary for sewing such as needles, thread and fabrics. At the moment, she is backed up in her list of orders because she doesn´t have the working capital to invest in materials. This loan will help Bethania meet the demands of her clients who are waiting for items such as children's clothing and women's blouses. In the mornings, Bethania carries out domestic tasks such as cooking, cleaning and sending the children to school. The afternoons are dedicated to sewing, making sales and purchasing merchandise.

loans.use: to purchase sewing needles, fabric and thread

loans.name: Goma

texts.en:
Gadzo is a married woman with three children, all of whom attend school. She lives at a rental house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food, rent, and clothing and electricity bills. 

She has operated a food stall business for the past five years, selling from home to her neighbors’ and passersby. Gadzo faces a major challenge of competition from other food stall operators in the area. She hopes to establish a fish selling business in the future.

With the Kshs 60,000 she wants to purchase sacks of Irish potatoes, bananas and a freezer to store fish to sell. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to improve her business and her living standards.

loans.use: To purchase sacks of Irish potatoes, bananas and a freezer to store fish to sell.

loans.name: Rebeca

texts.es: Rebeca tiene 38 años, vive con su esposo y sus hijos en casa de sus suegros. Ella se considera una mujer muy trabajadora y multifacética, ya que desde hace 4 años se dedica al negocio de toda índole y de acuerdo a la temporada. Ahora se dedica  vender gelatina de manera ambulante, mientras que su esposo posee un negocio de distribución de papas peladas y picadas a los restaurantes. Sin embargo desde tener más ingresos, es así que hace 6 meses ha instalado una granja de cuyes, en donde los cría y vende cuando logran tener el peso exacto. Los comerciantes de carne de su localidad son sus principales compradores. Considera que este negocio es muy rentable, y gracias a ello esta obteniendo la estabilidad económica que su familia necesita, además que le permite disponer de su propio tiempo. Por tal razón desea seguir trabajando con ese mismo empeño para  crecer económicamente. Es su cuarto crédito con MFP, esta muy contenta de  saber que tiene un apoyo financiero ya que siempre ha demostrado  ser responsable en sus pagos, además  le agrada ser parte de su banco comunal porque  todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y muy solidarias, agradece  a aquellas personas que serán gestoras del préstamo que solicita y le será  muy útil en el progreso de su negocio. Con el crédito que solicita, lo invertirá para comprar materiales de construcción para mejorar la infraestructura de su granja.
texts.en: Rebeca is 38 years old and lives with her husband and children in her in-laws’ house.  She considers herself to be a very hardworking and multifaceted person, as she has been working in all types of businesses for the past four years depending on the season.  She now works selling gelatin by foot, while her husband has a business distributing peeled and diced potatoes to restaurants.  However, in order to have more income, she set up a guinea pig farm six months ago, where she raises them and sells them when they reach the right weight.  The meat merchants in the area are her main buyers.  She considers this business to be very profitable and thanks to it, she is getting the financial stability that her family needs.  In addition, it allows her to set her own hours.  This is why she wants to continue working with this business to grow financially.  This is her fourth loan with MFP and she is very happy to know that she has financial support, as she has always proven to be responsible with her payments.  She is also pleased to be part of the communal bank because all of the members are responsible and supportive people.  She is grateful for all those who will fund the loan she is requesting because it will be very useful for her business’ progress.  With the loan requested, she will invest in the purchase of construction materials to improve the infrastructure of her farm.

loans.use: To purchase construction materials to improve the infrastructure of her farm.

loans.name: Nicasia

texts.es:
Nicasia es socia del Banco Comunal “Inka Wasi” ubicado en el distrito de Puno, provincia de Puno y departamento de Puno, tiene 55 años de edad, de estado civil casada y tiene 04 hijos (2 independiente).  La señora estudio educación secundaria. 
Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace cuatro años, su primer préstamo fue de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, dinero que invirtió en su negocio de venta de prendas de vestir como buzos, chompas y otros.
Con éste crédito de S/. 400.00 nuevos soles, comprará dos docenas de ropa de lencería, medias y ropas para niños.  Trabaja sola, su esposo es docente.
Su sueño es tener una tienda grande de prendas de vestir de todo tipo.	
Lo que le gusta de su Banco Comunal son las reuniones y la facilidad de los préstamos.
texts.en:
Nicasia is a member of the Communal Bank “Inka Wasi” which is located in the District, Province, and Department of Puno. She is 55 years old, married, and has four children (two of whom are independent). Nicasia studied for her high school education.

She has worked with Manuela Ramos for four years. Her first loan was in the amount of 300 PEN. The money was invested in her business of selling clothes such as sweatshirts, sweaters, and other items.

With this loan of 400 PEN, Nicasia will buy two dozen lingerie garments, stockings, and children’s clothing. She works alone and her husband is employed as a teacher. Her dream is to have a large store where she offers all types of clothing. What she enjoys most about her Communal Bank are the meetings and the convenience of the loans.

loans.use: Purchase two dozen lingerie garments, stockings, and children’s clothing

loans.name: Miraflor

texts.en:
Miraflor L. is from the village of Lower Tambo, Macasandig, Cagayan de Oro City. She is 37 years old. Miraflor is married and has seven school-aged children. To make a living, Miraflor owns & operates a service-based business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from providing "motorela" or "habal-habal" (motorcycle taxi) services with her husband as the driver to local community members. Miraflor has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2011, Miraflor joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Miraflor is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase tools needed for the maintenance of the service. This will be the 1st loan taken out by Miraflor from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase tools needed for the maintenance of the service

location.town: Macasandig, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To use as capital

loans.name: Kototala Group

texts.fr:
Les femmes du groupe Kototala, toutes mariées, ont en moyenne 43 ans, 3 enfants et vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies dans le village de Wakoro, préfecture de Dioïla ; Région de Koulikoro (deuxième région  administrative de la république du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et d’amitié. Elles font le commerce de poissons, de l’arachide, de gâteaux, du bois de chauffe et des parfums. Les femmes du groupe Kototala sont à leur troisième prêt solidaire, après avoir correctement remboursés les deux précédents.                                                                                                                                                                                                    
SATOU B. compte acheter des poissons avec les grossistes de Nangola. Elle effectue ses ventes à la maison et au marché de Wakoro au comptant et à crédit, à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. Elle envisage réaliser un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 10 000F CFA qui sera utilisé pour payer les échéances du prêt, payer les contributions des cérémonies sociales et le reste sera  réinvesti dans son activité de commerce de poissons.
texts.en:
