The members of the Kototala group, all married women, are on the average 43 years old with 3 children, and all live in traditional extended families in the village of Wakoro, Dioila Prefecture, Koulikoro Region (the second administrative region of Mali). They know each other as relatives, neighbors and friends. They retail fish, peanuts, cakes, heating wood and perfumes. The Kototala group members are on their third solidarity loan, having duly prepaid their two prior loans.

Satou B. plans to purchase fish from wholesalers in Nangola. She sells out of her home and at the Wakoro market, for cash and on credit, to a customer base composed of both women and men. She plans to achieve an average monthly income of 10,000 West African Francs, which will be used to pay off the loan and cover her cost of participating in major social events, with the rest reinvested in her fish-selling business.

loans.use: to buy fish

loans.name: Pamela

texts.es:
La señora Pamela es comerciante ella tiene un puesto de venta en la zona 16 de Julio de la ciudad de El Alto, vende los días jueves y domingos; el crédito lo requiere para la  compra  de peluches y juguetes, así podrá tener mayor variedad de modelos y tamaños de los mismos para ofrecer a sus clientes. Con los ingresos que obtiene logra cubrir las necesidades de su familia. Vive en casa de sus suegros en la ciudad de El Alto y no tiene hijos.
Esta es la primera vez que Pamela solicita un crédito de IMPRO, pero el análisis socio-económico la califica como sujeto de crédito.
texts.en: Pamela is a trader. She has a stall in the zone of 16th of July in the city of El Alto. She sells on Thursdays and Sundays. She requires the loan to buy stuffed animals and toys so she may be able to have a greater variety of models and sizes to offer to her customers. With the income she obtains, she will be able to cover her family's necessities. She lives in a house with her in-laws in the city of El Alto and does not have children. This is the first time that Pamela is requesting a loan from IMPRO but the socio-economic analysis qualifies her to be a loan recipient.

loans.use: To purchase stuffed animals and toys to offer a greater variety to her customers.

loans.name: Martha Victoria

texts.es:
La Señora. Martha M. es socia del banco comunal Mujeres de la Bahía, vive en la ciudad de Azogues, esta ciudad es reconocida por su belleza colonial, cuenta con hermosas iglesias, su gente se dedica al comercio, mantienen su cultura y tradiciones.
 
Doña Martha tiene 47 años, es casada y tiene 4 hijos de 21, 18, 16 y 10 años de edad, sus tres primeros hijos estudian en el colegio y su ultimo hijo en una escuela de la ciudad. Su esposo es de profesión policía, la casa en la que habitan es propia.
 
La Señora. Martha se dedica a la venta de frutas y verduras en un mercado de la ciudad, esta actividad  la realiza hace 32 años ya que empezó desde que tenía apenas 15 años, labora de domingo a domingo desde las 9 de la mañana hasta las 6 de la tarde.
 
Se encuentra en el octavo crédito que realiza en el banco comunal y  lo va a invertir en la compra de frutas y hortalizas.
 
Su meta es crecer más en el negocio.
texts.en:
Martha M., age 47, is married and has four children aged 21, 18, 16, and 10.  Her husband is a policeman; they have a house of their own. Martha is a member of the communal bank Mujeres de la Bahía; she lives in the city of Azogues which is known for its colonial-era charm and its beautiful churches. Its people maintain their culture and traditions. 
 
Martha makes her living selling fruit and vegetables in the city market. She has been employed in this line of work for 32 years; she started it when she had just turned 15. Her work schedule is from Sunday to Sunday, from 9am to 6pm. Martha is now in her eighth loan cycle and plans to use the funds to purchase fruit and vegetables. Her goal is to grow her business.

loans.use: to purchase fruit and vegetables

loans.name: Triwana Sari Group

texts.en:
Ni K. J. A., 28 years old, together with all the members of this group agreed to continue borrowing from MUK. Because she already has one piglet from the profits earned from previous sales, Ni K. J. A. is using an acquisition loan to buy three more piglets. Any remainder will be used to buy pig feed needed for the 6 months' raising period.

Ni K. J. A. and her family have high hopes for the business of raising pigs that has been started up to develop profitably. She also has dreams for her children to continue their schooling at a higher level, so that their lives will be better than their parents' lives.

loans.use: To buy three more piglets and pig feed.

loans.name: Rosa Amelia

texts.es:
Rosa Amelia es una madre D. familia D. 60 años  D. edad, es viuda, vive sola ya que sus hijos son independientes en su casa propia y sólo cuenta con el servicio luz, su vivienda está ubicada en el distrito Pítipo.  Este distrito se caracteriza porque los pobladores desarrollan la actividad agricola y ganadera.

Rosa Amelia se dedica  a la agricultura desD. hace algún tiempo, tiene sus propias tierras D. cultivo donD.  siembra arroz y una vez que lo cosecha lo venD. a los molinos para el pilado y la venta del mismo.  Producto que se consume mucho en los alimentos diarios D. todos los pobladores, con los ingresos que obtendrá en la venta D. su arroz podrá mejorar su calidad D. vida.

Ha solicitado a Edpyme Alternativa un préstamo D. 3000 nuevos soles para la compra D. fertilizantes para abonar sus tierras D. cultivo y asegurarse D. tener una muy buena producción D. arroz para poder pedir un poco más D. precio del que existe en el mercado y poder pagar el préstamo brindado como incrementar sus ingresos y solventar su gastos personales.  Rosa Amelia es una mujer trabajadora que apesar D. su edad siempre está pensando en mejorar cada día.
texts.en:
Rosa Amelia is a 60-year-old mother. She is widowed and lives alone since her children are independent. Rosa Amelia has her own home in the District of Pítipo and receives electricity. The people who live in this district are known for having businesses related to agriculture and livestock breeding.

Rosa Amelia has worked as a farmer for some time. She has her own land where she grows rice. When it is time to harvest, she sells the rice to the grain mills for processing and resale. This product is widely consumed by everyone in the area as part of the daily diet. With the earnings she generates from the sale of her rice, Rosa Amelia is able to improve her quality of life.

She is requesting a loan from Edpyme Alternativa in the amount of 3000 PEN so that she can buy fertilizers to apply to her farmland. This will ensure good rice production, which will help her command a higher price at the market. As a result of increasing her income, Rosa Amelia will be able to repay her loan and cover her personal expenses.

She is a hardworking woman. Despite her advanced age, Rosa Amelia always thinks about improving each day.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers for her rice fields.

loans.name: Manuel Augusto

texts.es:
Manuel de 40 años de edad, vive con su esposa e hijo en su casa propia, la cual cuenta con servicio sólo de luz, ubicada en el distrito de túcume que pertenece del  departamento de  Lambayeque.  Esta zona la actividad que desarrollan sus pobladores es la agricultura, ganadería y artesanía.

Manuel se dedica ha manejar su mototaxi (transporte utilizado por las personas en rutas pequeñas), la cual trabaja mañana y tarde en la zona donde vive y a sus diferentes caseríos, a pesar de la competencia que existe el aprovecha en transportar una buena cantidad de personas.  También se dedica a la crianza de aves de corral que una vez que llegan a su desarrollo ideal los vende en los diferentes mercados de la zona,altener más ingresos podrá cubrir sus necesidades diarias de su familia.

Ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 1500 nuevos soles para brindar mantenimiento a su mototaxi, comprar más animales y su respectivo alimento para que estén bien alimentados y poder ofrecerlos a un buen precio a sus clientes y con las ganancias que obtenga podrá cubrir su crédito y darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.  Manuel es muy conocido por ser una persona de  confianza, respetuoso y responsable con sus clientes que utilizan sus transporte, con el objetivo de seguir mejorando en la vida y brindarle una mejor oportunidad académica a su hijo.
texts.en:
Manuel is 40 years old and lives with his wife and son in their own home, which only has light service.  It is located in the Túcume district in the Lambayeque department.  This area the people work in farming, livestock, and handicrafts.

Manuel works driving his mototaxi (a mode of transport used by people on short trips).  He works in the morning and afternoon in the area where he lives and its various villages.  Despite the competition that exists, he transports a good number of people.  He also works raising poultry, and once it reaches its ideal size, he sells them at different markets in his area.  Having more income will allow him to meet his family's needs.

He has asked for a loan of 1500 nuevos soles from Edpyme Alternativa to do maintenance on his mototaxi, purchase more animals, and feed for the animals so that they will be well feed, and he can offer them at a good price to his customers. With the income he earns, he will cover his loan and give his family a better quality of life.  Manuel is well known for being a trustworthy, respectful, and responsible person with the customers who use his vehicle.  His goal is to continue improving in life and to give his son a better educational opportunity.

loans.use: to do maintenance on his mototaxi, purchase more animals and animal feed.

loans.name: Lonilyn

texts.en:
Lonilyn is 33 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married, with 2 children. 

Lonilyn has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks & breads. She has had this business for 5 years. She requested a loan of PHP 10,000 to buy snacks, eggs, noodles & beverages.  Lonilyn has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Lonilyn hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy snacks, eggs, noodles & beverages

loans.name: Sayda Melania

texts.es: La señora Sayda Melania tiene 33 años, tiene un hijo menor de edad, su actividad es una pulpería ubicada en su casa de habitación. Inicio este negocio hace más de 7 años que tiene este negocio, por lo que siempre busca la forma de mejorar sus ingresos, no ha sido fácil mantener este negocio pues ella ha logrado con mucho sacrificio ha salido adelante. Este financiamiento es para la compra de golosinas, refrescos, pan, galletas, crema, leche entre otros.
texts.en: Sayda Melania is 33 years old and has one dependent child.  Her business is a grocery store which is located in her home.  She started her business more than seven years ago and is always looking for ways to improve her income.  It hasn't been easy keeping her business running but, with a lot of sacrifice, she has managed to get ahead.  This loan will be used to buy candies, soft drinks, bread, cookies, cream, milk, etc.

loans.use: to buy candies, soft drinks, bread, cookies, cream, milk, etc.

loans.name: Le

texts.en:
Le, a 54-year-old mother of two, lives with her family in Ho Chi Minh City. She and her husband earn a living selling hand-made bamboo products such as baskets, furnishings and ornaments, a business they began four years ago.

Le requires a loan to purchase larger quanities of bamboo supplies and related equipment and accessories to produce and sell a larger quantity of bamboo products. She hopes that her business runs smoothly and enables her to improve her family's income and living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase bamboo, accessories and equipment to make and sell hand-made furniture and ornaments.

loans.name: Benjie

texts.en:
Benjie is 33 years old and married with five children. All of her children are in school. For the past three years, Benjie has run a vehicle repair business in the Philippines. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.

Benjie is requesting a 15,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase tools and equipment for her mechanics. In the future, she would like to save enough money to send her children to college and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase tools and equipment for her mechanics

loans.name: Godwin

texts.en:
Godwin is 50 years old and lives in the town of Wakiso, in the Kampala east region of Uganda. He is married and has three children, all of whom are currently in school. For over ten years, Godwin has run a small retail shop where he sells cosmetics. He is a member of BRAC’s small enterprise (SEP) program, which has helped his prospects for the future by improving his business.

Godwin is requesting a 2,000,000 UGX loan from BRAC Uganda to expand his business and purchase cosmetic items such as body lotions to sell.  With the help of his loan, he hopes to generate greater profits and pay school fees for his children. In the future, Godwin hopes to continue to expand his business.

loans.use: to purchase cosmetic items such as body lotion to sell

loans.name: Pyahu Group

texts.es:
15 mujeres de la ciudad de Caaguazú se unieron con el ideal de conseguir más ingresos, y de esa forma poder enfrentar los gastos que diariamente aparecen en la casa. Ellas se definen como mujeres trabajadoras, luchadoras, emprendedoras y por sobre todo responsables. Desean crecer no solo en el ámbito económico sino también a nivel personal. Actualmente se encuentran en el segundo ciclo del programa de mujeres emprendedoras de la Fundación Paraguaya.
La señora Roselia es costurera, se dedica a este trabajo hace un buen tiempo, por lo mismo pudo formarse una buena cantidad de clientes. Comenta que personas del barrio y de zonas aledañas se acercan a ella para darle trabajo. Uno de sus proyectos es tener un taller grande donde pueda recibir grandes pedidos y de esa forma poder emplear a otras personas.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de telas, hilos, agujas y demás artículos necesarios para el taller de costura. Está agradecida por la oportunidad que la Fundación le da, ya que de obtener el crédito le será de mucha ayuda en sus proyectos.
texts.en:
Fifteen women from the city of Caaguazú joined together with the dream of earning more income, and by doing so, being able to ease household expenses that come up on a daily basis. They describe themselves as hardworking, enterprising women that are fighters and above all, responsible. They hope to grow not just financially, but also on a personal level. They are currently in their second loan cycle of Fundación Paraguaya's program for entrepreneurial women. 

Roselia, is a seamstress. She has made a living at this work for a good amount of time and as such she has been able to accumulate a good amount of customers. She says that people from the neighborhood and neighboring areas come to her with work. One of her projects is to have a large workshop where she can receive large orders and this way be able to employ other people. 

She is requesting a loan to buy fabric, thread, needles, and the rest of the items necessary for the sewing workshop. She is thankful for the opportunity the Fundación has given her.

loans.use: compra de telas, hilos, agujas para utilizarlos en el taller

loans.name: Miguel

texts.es:
Miguel, vive con su esposa y dos hijas de 17 y 15 años de edad, ambas estudian y dependen de él, Miguel se dedica a la sastrería y administra una tienda, aprendió la sastrería por un amigo desde hace 17 años, inicia sus labores desde las 7:00am hasta las 5:00pm, de lunes a sábado.
Él está solicitando un préstamo para la compra de tela, hilo, botones, broches, ciper, para la sastrería, pues son materiales que forman parte de la materia prima en su taller, esta compra le ayudara para atender mejor a los clientes.
El objetivo de Miguel es tener un taller capaz para atender la demanda de los clientes y apoyar a su familia, sobre todo a sus hijas para superarse.
texts.en:
Miguel lives with his wife and two daughters aged 17 and 15 years old.  Both of his daughters are in school and dependent on him.  Michael is a tailor and runs a store.  He learned this business through a friend 17 years ago.  He works from 7.00am to 5.00pm, from Monday to Saturday.

Miguel is requesting a loan to buy fabric, thread, buttons, fasteners and zippers for his tailoring business as these are the raw materials that he uses in his workshop.  This purchase will help him to better serve his customers.

Miguel's goal is to have a workshop which is able to meet customer demand and allows him to support his family, above all his daughters, so that they can do well in life.

loans.use: to buy fabric, thread, buttons, fasteners and zippers

loans.name: Margaret Ayiela

texts.en:
Margaret is 48 years old, married woman, and has five children.  She operates a retail shop located in a shopping center where she sells sugar, bread, flour, soda, cakes, and other items. She has been involved in this business for five years. 

Margaret is requesting a loan for 30,000 KES to purchase maize to sell in her store. She describes her biggest business challenges to be inflation and low purchasing power. Her business goal is to expand her business into wholesale within five years. In the future, she wants to buy a plot n to put up rental houses.

loans.use: to purchase maize.

loans.name: Jepkorir

texts.en:
Jepkorir is 41 years old and supports a family of five people.  She has applied for a loan of Kshs 25,000 to buy more cereals to increase her business stock.  She has been in this business for a period of ten years.  

Jepkorir earns an income of Kshs 10,000 per month.   She plans to pay school fees with the anticipated profit that she gets from her business.  This is her first loan from KADET LTD and she hopes to repay it well.

Her hopes and dreams for the future is to educate her children to higher levels and ensure that her business is expanded.

loans.use: buy cereal grains

loans.name: Sheralyn

texts.en:
Sheralyn is 30 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 2 children.

Sheralyn buys and sells fruits, such as mangoes and durian, with the help of her husband (pictured) as the motorcycle driver. She has been running this business for 5 years.

She is requesting a loan in the amount of 25,000 PHP to buy more fruit to deliver and sell. Sheralyn has been a member of HSPFI since 2009. In the future, Sheralyn hopes to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase additional fruit for re-sale purposes

loans.name: Concepcion Group

texts.es:
El grupo Concepción lo conforman tres personas trabajadoras y emprendedoras una de ellas es la señora María de 64 años quien se dedica a la realización de piñatas y decoración de eventos desde hace varios años. Ella tiene cuatro hijos ya mayores de edad. 
Las otras integrantes son Rosalía de 30 años vende ropa usadas y cosméticos, ella acaba de tener su tercer hijo, y Degsy de 24 años se dedica al comercio de ropa nueva y usada.
texts.en:
The group “Concepción” consists of three hardworking and enterprising individuals.  One of them is Sra. Maria, age 64, who has been selling piñatas and party decorations for several years.  She has four grown children.  

The other members are as follows:
•	Rosalía, age 30, sells used clothing and cosmetics.  She just delivered her third child.
•	Degsy, age 24, sells new and used clothing.

loans.use: to buy materials for making piñatas.

loans.name: Carmelita

texts.en:
Carmelita is 54 years old, married, and has six children.  She lives in the Philippines. Carmelita has a retail shop selling canned goods, snacks, and beverages. She has had this business for 10 years. 

Carmelita is requesting a loan for 5,000 PHP, which she will use to buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages. Carmelita is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Carmelita hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase canned goods, snacks, and beverages.

loans.name: Titus

texts.en: Titus is a 39-year-old married man. He has two children, aged 1 year and 5 years. He describes himself as quiet, obedient, and committed to his work. He operates a shop where he sells household items like sugar, salt, and cooking oil, among other products. He has been involved in this business for 23 years. His shop is located in a shopping center at Nakuru, where he serves frequent customers as well as new ones. He describes his biggest business challenge as inadequate funds to add stock. He will use the KES 20,000 loan to purchase additional stocks of household items. Titus's business goal is to be a wholesaler within five years.

loans.use: to buy sugar, milk, tea leaves, and other household items.

loans.name: Janet

texts.en:
Janet is applying for another loan to expand her existing business. She will use this loan of 45,000 Kenya shillings (KES) to purchase more stocks of beans, potatoes, rice, and other cereals for her business. In the future, Janet aspires to continue improving her business.

Since taking her last Kiva loan, Janet has greatly improved her family’s standard of living. She hopes to continue accessing the financial services offered by Yehu and Kiva lenders and thanks you for your support!

loans.use: To purchase more stocks of beans, potatoes, rice, and other cereals for her business.

loans.name: Roselyne

texts.en:
Roselyne, 27, is a married woman with four children all of whom attend school.  She lives in a rental house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past two years, she has operated a fish selling business, selling from the market to her neighbours and passers by.  She faces the major challenge of high transportation costs from home to her place of operation.  She dreams of establishing a wholesale stall selling fish in the future.

With the KES 20,000 she wants to purchase bundles of fish for resale.  She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of fish for resale.

loans.name: Jesus

texts.en:
Jesus is a responsible farmer. He began this occupation when he started accompanying his father on their farm land. He was still 19 at that time. Now he is already 49, married to Maribel and blessed with four children. 

Jesus wants to provide the necessities for his children, especially to his youngest child, currently studying. He is asking for a loan amount of PHP10,000 to buy seeds, fertilizers, and pesticides for his farming business. He hopes to produce better crops out of his loan to protect his family from an unsuitable lifestyle.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizers, and pesticides to improve his farming business.

loans.name: Deggo Group

texts.fr: Ce groupe de solidarité a été créé le 08 mai 2010.IL est composé de 09 membres issues du même village. La responsable du groupe est Aïssatou, elle debout à droite sur la photo. Elle est habillé en blanc. Elle est âgée de 38 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 03 enfants en charge. Elle fait de l'embouche. Elle pratique ce type d'activité depuis plusieurs années. Son prêt va lui permettre d'acheter des moutons à emboucher. Son objectif est de prendre en charge ses enfants et de participer aux dépenses quotidiennes de la famille
texts.en:
This solidarity group was formed on May 8, 2010. It is made up of 9 members from the same village. The person responsible for the group is Aïssatou, standing on the right in the photo. She is dressed in white. She is 38 years old, married and mother to three dependent children.

She fattens sheep. She has been practicing this business for several years. 

Her loan will allow her to buy sheep to fatten. Her goal is to take care of her children and to contribute to her family's daily expenses.

loans.use: to buy sheep.

loans.name: Hieng

texts.en: Hieng is 41 and a citizen from Pursat province, Cambodia. She is married and blessed with four children, three in school and one young child. She grows rice and vegetables as the main source of income. She has been involved in the current business for 15 years, earning about 15,500 KHR per day. Hieng has been with VisionFund (Kiva's partner) for the past three loans. She has completely repaid her past loans which has supported her business on time. For this new loan, she is going to buy necessary materials to renovate her house. She hopes that her house condition will be better than before so she does not need to worry about her kids during the rainy season.

loans.use: To buy necessary materials to renovate her house

loans.name: 15 Tt Vạn Hà Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Vậy operates a food stall/restaurant selling soft drinks. She is requesting a loan to purchase more soft drinks to resell.
Vậy has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. The main hardship that Vậy faces in her business is the lack of capital. 

Vậy is 60 years old and she is married with one child. Vậy is the group leader of the 15 Tt Vạn Hà Group, which consists of 5 members. 
She lives and works in Thieu Hoa district, a rural area in Thanh Hoa province.

In 2010, Vậy joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her  business. Vậy has successfully repaid 4 loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. 

With her business profit, Vậy hopes for her business to do well, for her children to find a good job, and to be able to buy more supplies and equipment for her business.

loans.use: to purchase more soft drinks to resell.

loans.name: Guadalupe

texts.en:
Mrs. G. is widow and has 2 children. Her husband die 2 years ago, but she is a very optimistic person. She starts her own business, selling comforters, blankets, bed sheets, and pressure cookers. She offers her products in her house, because she has to take care of her children. \"Here in New Laredo, (Border City, Mexico-USA) the winter is very intense. She wants to give a very good price to her clients, on her products and wants to grow her business; “This will be without a doubt a good season” She said. She is asking for a loan of $950 to obtain its objective. She wants to repay in a term of 12 months.

Español

La Sra. G. quedó viuda, no obstante ello es una persona muy optimista, se inició así en la venta de cobertores, sábanas y ollas de vapor; sus productos los ofrece en su casa pues debe cuidar de sus hijos. “Aquí en Nuevo Laredo (Ciudad fronteriza México-USA) el invierno es muy intenso, quiero dar buen precio a mis clientes con mis productos y quiero hacer crecer mi negocio; esta será sin duda una buena temporada!!” Solicita la Sra. G. un préstamo por $950.00 para lograr su objetivo, piensa pagarlos En un plazo de 12 meses.

loans.use: buy merchandise for her business

loans.name: Yawa

texts.en:
At only 20 years of age, Ms. Yawa L. is a married mother of two children. She did not have the chance to attend primary school, nor to learn a craft, so she quickly became involved in business. She sells palm oil, gari [granulated cassava flour], coconuts and anything else that will earn her money. She is a hard worker who conducts her business with joy and dedication. In order to improve her sales figures and profits, she is asking for a loan of $400, which will be largely sufficient for reviving her current business.

Translated from French by Leo Duran, Kiva Volunteer.

Agée de 20 ans seulement, Madame L. Yawa est mariée et mère de deux (02) enfants. Elle n’a pas eu la chance de poursuivre ses études primaires, ni d’apprendre un métier et s’est vite engagée dans le commerce. Elle vend de l’huile de palme, du gari, de la noix de coco et tout ce qui peut rapporter de l’argent. Très laborieuse, elle exerce cette activité avec joie et dévouement. Pour améliorer son chiffre d’affaires et ses bénéfices, elle sollicite un financement de $400 qui suffisent largement pour relancer ses activités actuelles.

loans.use: Strengthen sales of palm oil, gari [granulated cassava flour] and coconut

loans.name: Nielzer Laureano

texts.en:
Ten years ago, Mr. Nielzer started out as an assistant in a watch shop. After learning the trade, and with the savings he had been able to accumulate, he started his own small business in the market at Mérida, where he works selling and repairing watches. He is married and has eight children, who are the reason he works arduously day after day to get ahead. He wants to offer his children a better quality of life and he wants them to be able to finish their schooling.

Nielzer wants to continue growing his business, and for this he needs a loan of $375.00, which he will use for the purchase of watches, watch parts, and batteries. These are the items he needs most in order to continue offering the best quality service to his clients. He promises to repay this amount over a period of 5 to 10 months. Nielzer trusts in people who help those who need it most, and he sincerely thanks you for any help you can offer him.

(Translated from the Spanish by Naomi Johnson, Kiva volunteer)

loans.use: To buy merchandise

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
Maria is a 33-year-old married mother of four. Her husband works in the fields, while she makes decorative embroidered blouses, which she later sells to women in her neighborhood or visiting tourists who like her work. With the loan, she hopes to purchase cloth and thread to make her garments.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

MARIA TIENE 33 AÑOS , CASADA, 4 HIJOS , SU ESPOSO ES CAMPESINO , ELLA SE DEDICA A LA ARTESANIA BORDANDO BLUSAS ,LAS QUE POSTERIORMENTE VENDE ENTRE LAS MUJERES DE SU COMUNIDAD O A TURISTAS QUE VISITAN LA ZONA Y QUE GUSTAN MUCHO DE SUS BORDADOS . .PERTENECE AL GRUPO SEMPASUCHIL 2. CON EL PRESTAMO ESPERA COMPRAR MAS TELA E HILO PARA SUS PRENDAS.

loans.use: Purchase cloth and thread

loans.name: Mukaram

texts.en:
K. Mukaram is an active client of MicroInvest.  She is marred and has 5 children.  Her husband is a worker who gets little salary, so Mukaram helps her husband to support their family.  

Her business is located in Gafurov, Khujand, in the big wholesale market.  She has rented a little place for her goods.  She sells men’s shoes.  Her elder son helps her after his lessons.  He studies at 10 forms (her son is in the photo).

Mukaram goes to the wholesale market every week to purchase shoes.  As she has many clients, she sells her goods in a short time.  For the coming season, Mukaram wants to purchase modern and classic shoes and she is requesting a loan of $1200 for this.

loans.use: Purchase modern and classic shoes for the autumn season

loans.name: Srim

texts.en: Mrs. Srim Y., age 44, produces and sells traditional medicinal rice wine, earning around $3 per day. Her husband, age 45, works grinding the husk off rice, earning around $3 per day as well. They have three children, one who is a student and two who work in a garment factory earning about $2 per day. She would like to request a loan of $900 in order to purchase more rice stock to increase her production of wine. She would also like to use part of the loan to rent an adjacent plot of farmland for her family to grow their own crops to eat.

loans.use: To purchase additional rice to make medicinal wine.

loans.name: Nina

texts.en:
Nina is a hard working business owner from Nicolaev, Ukraine. She has a women’s clothing business located at the Sigma Sport retail center in Nicolaev. Nina has much experience in the retail trade, stretching all the way back to Soviet times. Before the collapse of the Soviet Union she was the manager of a clothing store. She has owned her own business for the past seven years. Nina is married. She and her husband have a 22 year old son. Nina’s business has become the main source of income for her family.

Nina has requested a loan of $700 to add to her working capital. Her business is growing. Financial assistance will help her to continue operating successfully and support her family

loans.use: Increase working capital

loans.name: Bui Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs. Bùi Thị Lơ, 45 years of age, has been a member of TYM Fund for 9 years. Before joining the fund, her family was in poverty. Whole family relied on only a half acre rice paddy. Income was about 50USD a month. After joining the fund, she took out loans from the fund to invest in wood handcrafting. Her three grown sons also help the family business. The business, in fact, is booming now and the income is steady at 125USD a month. Mrs. Lơ would like to take out a loan of 575USD to purchase more wood.

Translated from Vietnamese by ngungo, Kiva volunteer.


Chị Bùi Thị Lơ, 45 tuổi, là thành viên năm thứ 9 của Quỹ Tình thương. Trước khi tham gia vào Quỹ kinh tế gia đình chị gặp rất nhiều khó khăn, cả nhà 5 người chỉ trông vào 4 sào ruộng. Thu nhập lúc đó khoảng 50USD/tháng. Sau khi vào Quỹ chị mạnh dạn vay vốn đầu tư vào làm nghề chạm gỗ mỹ nghệ và làm thuê gia công hàng cho một số chủ hàng. 3 con chị Lơ đều đã trưởng thành nên hỗ trợ rất tích cực trong công việc này. Hiện nay ngành nghề đồ gỗ đang phát triển nên chị Lơ rất muốn được vay thêm vốn về để mua gỗ về làm hàng và bán. Chị dự định sẽ xin vay 575USD ở vòng vốn tới. Thu nhập hiện tại của chị là 125USD/tháng.

loans.use: Buy wood

loans.name: Tebuyoleka A(2028)B Group

texts.en: Jennifer is 47 years old and married with six children. She offers tailoring services for a living. With the extra profits, Jennifer intends to buy another sewing machine. Florence runs a beauty salon and wants to buy a hair steamer with the loan. Fatuma wants to use the loan to buy more used clothes for sale. Edith has a retail shop business and intends to add to her stock with the loan while Hanifa offers dry cleaning services.

loans.use: To expand the tailoring business by buying more cloth.

loans.name: Maritza Antonia

texts.es:
Mrs. Maritza, together with her husband, decided to start a family business, with which they could cover all the household expenses and get their children ahead, as well as improving the family's quality of life. In the Villa Reconciliación, where the family lives, the started a small general store where they small amounts of basic goods. With years and with wise administration, the business grew, expanding the lines of products that they offer to their customers. Today it has a broad selection of many goods, among which are a variety of foodstuffs of many styles and brands - all this with the goal of bringing the people products that satisfy each of their tastes and demands. The business is the only source of income of this family, and it has allowed them to get their three children ahead and improve the structure of the house. At this time, this woman needs to supply the store with food that families consume every day, since the demand for these goods is very high.

Translated from Spanish by Shannon Skoglund, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Maritza junto a su esposo decide iniciar un negocio familiar, con el cual puedan subsanar todos los gastos del hogar y sacar adelante a sus hijos así como el de mejorar el nivel de vida en el que se encontraban esta familia. En el barrio Villa Reconciliación, donde habita esta familia inician su negocio con una pulpería, la cual ofrecían en pequeñas cantidades productos de consumo básico, es con los años y la buena administración que el negocio logro crecer, expandiendo sus líneas de productos que ofrecían a sus clientes. Hoy en día es una Miscelánea amplia, la cual ofertan una variedad de productos alimenticios, de todas las marcas y presentaciones, todo esto con el objetivo de brindarles a la población un producto que satisfaga los gustos y exigencias de cada uno de los clientes. El negocio es la única fuente de ingreso de esta familia, el cual le ha permitido sacar adelante a sus 3 hijos y mejorar la infraestructura de la casa. La señora requiere en estos momentos de abastecer el negocio de alimentos que diariamente consumen las familias, ya que la demanda de clientes en cuanto a los productos que ofrece es alta.

loans.use: Purchase stock for their general store

loans.name: Orn

texts.en: Mrs. Orn E., born in 1954 and a single mother with four children, sells water lilies in a local village, Tropeng Sva in Kandal Province. Two of her children are garment factory workers, while the others are too young to attend school or work. In order to improve her living conditions, she is requesting a loan of $400 to buy a cow to raise for breeding.  She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy  a cow.

loans.name: Mwajuma's Jiliwaze Group

texts.en:
Mwajuma is a married woman with 2 children, ages 15 and 8 years old. Mwajuma owns a small food vendor store, which she started in 2007. Every day, she works from 6am to 10pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $48 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more food items for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup members Lazia, Tabia, Sophia, and Zaituni, who have businesses dealing in vegetables sales, banana sales, and food vending.

loans.use: To buy more food items for her business.

loans.name: Gulbahor

texts.en:
Gulbahor K. is 38-year-old lady. Gulbahor and her husband, who is an entrepreneur, have a large family. They have four children of school age. Gulbahor is working hard to earn an honest livelihood. For 5 years already Gulbahor has been running her own business. She started baking the national bread which is called “lepeshka.” She gets up early and bakes the lepeshka so that people have the fresh bread on their tables for breakfast.

Initially Gulbahor only baked the lepeshka but never sold them by herself. Gradually the business expanded, and the children grew up. Today it is the family business and her husband and elder daughter are helping her. Now Gulbahor has a trading place in the central market of the city. The family business is stable. Gulbahor has a client base that allows her to improve the income of the family.

Today Gulbahor requests 300 USD in order to purchase the flour for baking extra lepeshka to expand the business. Gulbahor would like to confirm that she is ready to pay the loan in 9 months and thanks everyone for trusting and supporting her.

loans.use: Purchase flour for baking lepeshka

loans.name: Osvaldo

texts.es:
Osvaldo is 25 years old, single, and lives with his parents and three siblings. He is a shopkeeper who sells toys and provides decorations for children’s birthday parties, weddings, quinceañeras, and school graduations among others. He also provides rentals of chairs, tables, silverware, etc. He has been in business for three years.

The loan requested is for the purchase of an inflatable “bouncy house.” Osvaldo has a great demand for this product, and now that he has an established clientele he must have all of the elements required for a children’s party. In order to meets the needs of his customers he must offer complete service so that his customers will continue to be satisfied.

In the future, Osvaldo would like to expand his store in order to be able to better display his products.

Translated from Spanish by Kristy Placido, a Kiva volunteer.

El Sr. Osvaldo tiene 25 años de edad y es soltero, vive con sus padres y 3 hermanos.

El cliente es comerciante, vende juguetes, y realiza decoraciones para cumpleaños infantiles, bodas, quince años, colaciones de colegios, entre otros. También tiene alquiler de sillas, mesas, cubiertos, etc., ya lleva en el oficio 3 años de antigüedad.

El préstamo que solicita es para la compra de un globo loco (bouncy hause), ya que el Sr. Osvaldo tiene mucha demanda de ese producto, ya tiene una clientela formada necesita tener todos los componente que se necesita para una fiesta infantil, para satisfacer la demanda y ofrecer un servicio completo para que sus clientes queden satisfechos.

El Sr. Manifestó que en el futuro desea ampliar mas su local para poder exhibir mejor sus productos.

loans.use: For the purchase of an inflatable "bouncy house."

loans.name: Maria Victora

texts.es:
Maria Victoria is a widow and has two adult sons who work and help their mother.

Maria has a store in her home. She started selling vegetables on the sidewalk in front of her home and because she did well she also started selling fruits. Her clients then started asking for noodles, sugar and other products. This is when she decided to open a small business and appealed to Fundacion for working capital.

All of the loans that Fundacion Paraguaya previously granted her were used to expand her business and to purchase merchandise. She wants to invest her next loan in the purchase of large quantities of merchandise since the demand from her clients has increased thanks to the good prices and the good quality of the merchandise that she offers.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy M., Kiva Volunteer.

La Sra Maria Victoria es viuda y tiene dos hijos varones que ya son mayores de edad y que trabajan y ayudan a su madre.

María posee una despensa en su casa. Ella empezó vendiendo verduras en la vereda de su casa, como le iba muy bien después ya empezó a comercializar frutas, luego sus clientes en aquel entonces también le pedían fideo, azúcar y otros productos de primera necesidad. Fue así que decidió abrir un pequeño negocio, entonces recurrió a la Fundación para poder capitalizarse.

Todos los créditos que la Fundación Paraguaya le otorgó anteriormente fueron para la ampliación de su negocio y para compra de mercaderías. El próximo crédito lo quiere invertir en la compra de mercaderías en grandes cantidades pues la demanda de sus clientes de sus productos ha aumentado gracias a los buenos precios que ella ofrece y la buena calidad de los mismos.

loans.use: Purchase of potatoes, tapioca, tomatoes, pumpkins, noodles, carbonated drinks, milk, juices, eggs, canned goods and meat.

loans.name: Vahdeta

texts.en:
Vahdeta was born in 1965.  She is from the village Šerići, where she lives with her husband and two sons. Her husband works in a furniture factory in the town of Živinice and earns about 400 KM monthly. 

Vahdeta is in charge of the agriculture and cattle breeding for the family. She sells milk and milk products and can earn about 200 KM monthly. She will use this loan in the amount of 600 KM to buy hay for their cow for the winter. Vahdeta wants to save the money that she earns selling milk and use it to buy another cow in the future.

loans.use: To buy hay for cow.

loans.name: Razia

texts.en:
Razia Baji is the wife of M. H. and lives in Lahore, Pakistan. Lahore is famous for its historical places and for its Punjabi food. She owes a two-room brick house and has been living in it for the last 3 years. She is the mother of six children: two daughters and four sons. All of her children are enrolled in a local school in her neighborhood.

Razia Baji's husband is a tailor by profession. He stitches babies' dresses (pants, shirts) particularly. He has been in this profession for the last 9 years. Razia Baji is a housewife and prefers to do household work and take care of her family. She successfully repaid her first loan from Asasah (a microfinance institute of Pakistan). Now she is applying for a loan to buy a sewing machine for her husband.

loans.use: To buy a sewing machine

loans.name: Horn

texts.en: Horn L., 36, is married and lives with five of her children in Kampong Cham province, Cambodia. She is a farmer who works growing yams to earn a living and is able to make about US$3 each day, while her husband is employed as a worker and makes US$5 per day as well. Horn L. would like to take out a loan of US$500 to hire a worker to cut the grass and then she can grow more yams.

loans.use: To grow yams.

loans.name: Charles

texts.en:
Charles O. is 45 years of age and is married with 6 children. He is a hardworking man who operates a wholesale shop in Bugiri district. Before venturing into the wholesale business, Charles was obtaining his income from selling various food crops from his farm within the same locality. It is therefore the farming income that enabled him to set up his present business.

Charles is using the loan to add a variety of products like cooking oil, cosmetics, toiletries, sugar, rice, wheat flour, and some snacks to his store. Besides expanding his business, he hopes to spend some of the profits in educating his children and providing for the family’s basic needs. He enjoys farming and looks forward to opening a farm produce outlet in the area.

loans.use: To add a variety of products like cooking oil, cosmetics, toiletries, sugar, rice, wheat flour, and some snacks to his store

loans.name: Tajudeen

texts.en: Tajudeen B. sells drinks and pure water. She purchases her drinks and pure water from distributors to sell to her customers. She has been in this business for a long time. She is 45 years old and married with six children. She needs the loan amount of 40,000 NGN to purchase more drinks and pure water to sell. She says, "thank you to all that made this loan possible."

loans.use: To purchase more drinks and pure water to sell.

loans.name: Tatyana Juddyt

texts.es:
La señorita Tatyana Juddyt M. T. tiene 22 años, vive en Buenos Aires, distrito de Víctor Larco Herrera, provincia de Trujillo, departamento de La Libertad, Perú.
Ella estudio Enfermería Técnica, carrera que aun no puede ejercer por no conseguir trabajo, no tiene hijos.
Tatyana se dedica a la venta de productos de belleza, inicio su negocio vendiendo algunos productos, con las ganancias que obtuvo ha logrado formar un capital de trabajo que le permite adquirir mas productos para  la venta a sus clientes, su negocio lo desarrolla en su domicilio.
Con el primer crédito de 300 soles que recibió de su banco comunal “Las Palmeras”, lo invirtió en la compra de productos de belleza para la venta.
Con el crédito de 300 soles, que será cancelado en 4 meses, lo invertirá en la  compra productos de belleza.
Tatyana  tiene el gran sueño de estudiar Enfermería en la universidad y viajar a España.
texts.en:
Tatyana Juddyt M. T. is 22 years old and lives in Buenos Aires, located in the Trujillo province of La Libertad, Perú. She studied nursing, but was not able to practice because she was unable to find a job. She does not have children. Tatyana dedicates herself to selling beauty products, having started her business selling just a few items. With her earnings, she managed to save some working capital which allowed her to buy more products to offer her clients. She runs her business out of her house. With the first loan of 300.00 Peruvian soles that she received from her cooperative bank “Las Palmeras”, she invested in the purchase of beauty products to offer for sale. With this loan of 300.00 Peruvian soles, to be repaid in four months, she will invest in the purchase of beauty products. Tatyana has the grand dreams of studying nursing at the university and traveling to Spain.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase beauty products.

loans.name: Jubail's Group

texts.en:
S. Jubail is a member of the Twesige loan group in Kayunga. He has been with his lending group for twelve years.  He stated with a loan of 50,000 shillings and has upgraded to a 2,500,000 shilling loan. He is grateful for the loans since they have improved his business and helped him out of poverty. He is married and has ten children, three of whom attend school.  He also cares for three orphaned relatives. 

Jubail has a taxi transportation business.  In addition, he buys cows from Mbalala in western Uganda and sells them to butchers in and around Kayunga and Mukono. He has been able to buy himself a plot of land for family farming.  He also owns three cows that give him milk both for sale and home consumption. Jubail is requesting a loan to buy more cows to sell and pay for their transportation costs.

loans.use: to buy more cows to sell

loans.name: Purna Laxmi

texts.en:
Mrs. Purna Laxmi K. is a grocery shopkeeper in the village of Thecho. She opened her grocery store more than five years ago. She sells different types of grocery goods such as rice, maize, snacks and soon. She opened her grocery store so that she could be independent and she also wanted to help her husband upgrade the living standard of her family. She has one son and two daughters. Her son is studying in grade 9. Her older daughter is studying in grade 12 and younger daughter in grade 11.

With the first loan from Kiva ,Mrs. Purna Devi Mali was able to buy various grocery items such as rice, maize and different kinds of snacks. She has been able to raise her income after investing the loan into her business. Now, she has cleared her loan and is requesting a second loan for Rs 30000.00 to further invest in her shop.

loans.use: To buy additional grocery goods for her shop

loans.name: Boimahmad

texts.en:
This is K. Boimahmad, who is married and has four children. He is 42 years old and lives in Dushanbe, Tajikistan, where he runs a retail shop with which he supports his family. In his shop, Boimahmad sells spare parts for many different types of foreign cars. He has worked in this business for more than five years. He hopes to increase his income and send his older son to university. To do this, he needs a loan for $1,900 to buy more spare parts and enlarge his shop to better meet the needs of his customers. The loan will be repaid within 10 months. Boimahmad is happy to be able to apply for this loan and would like to thank everyone for this trust. Hr promises to be precise in making loan payments. 

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road; Alexander the Great's rule; and with its famous great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC.  And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions. 

But, Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable.  These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia.  While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty. 

IMON's History
Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients present a viable business plan. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To buy spare parts and enlarge his shop

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buy seafood (Shrimp, scallops, fish, squid and snails)

loans.name: María Gladis

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Chinandega la señora María V. se dedica a laborar arduamente en su pulpería donde a diario comercializa sus productos a sus clientes que le visitan.

Atraviesa la necesidad de suplir de productos a lo inmediato y por esto es que espera ser beneficiada con un crédito en Ceprodel para la compra de dichos productos y de esta manera continuar con el desarrollo de su negocio.
texts.en:
In the city of Chinandega Mrs. Maria V. owns a local store. She works there every day, selling products to her clients. Maria needs to supply products immediately and because of this she hopes to acquire a loan with Ceprodel. She'll use the money to buy products and develop her business.

Translated from Spanish by Sarah Bishop, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy products

loans.name: Ruth Nakagiri's Group

texts.en:
Ruth is the leader of a four-member group. She is a 33-year-old mother of five children between the ages of 8 and 16. All her children go to school. She owns a four-room house where she is staying with seven people. Ruth takes care of additional family members. There is electricity but no piped water at her home. The family gets three meals a day. She resides and works in a semi-urban area on the outskirts of Kampala.

Ruth sells charcoal in Lugala. She sells to an average of 25 people a day and sells to all categories of people. She works seven days a week. Ruth buys charcoal from delivery trucks from Kasubi and pays for transport costs to and from Kasubi. Her major monthly expenses include rent for the business premises, electricity and medication. She has been in this business for the last five years. Her main challenges are thieves and seasonality. Ruth has been with MCDT for over five years and is on her tenth loan, working all this time with the same group mates. She wants to use this loan to buy more sacks of charcoal.

loans.use: To buy more charcoal and firewood

loans.name: Fe

texts.en:
"When I got married, I experienced emotion because of the many challenges. But my husband is encouraging me to always be strong. Now, we both till the land of 1-hectare. We are renting farmland from a friend. We get a share of every harvest. The more harvest we have, the more our share increases," says Fe A., 48-year old mother of two children. 

She would like to ask for a loan of PHP 7,000 from CEVI. She will use the loan to purchase fertilizers, herbicides and molluscide. The loan will also help in the education of her children.

CEVI has been providing financial services to rural communities. CEVI gives not just loans but training and insurance coverage as well.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers, herbicides and molluscide for farming.

loans.name: Safar

texts.ru: Абдуллоев Сафар проживает в районе Курган-Тюбе. Возраст 60 лет. Женат, имеет 6 детей. Сафар более 10 лет занимается животноводством. Его дети также помогают отцу. Клиент просит кредит, чтобы закупить крупно рогатого скота для откармливания и продажи.
texts.en:
Safar A. lives in the Qurgan-Tube district. He is 60 years old, married and has 6 children. Safar has been involved in animal husbandry for over 10 years. His children help him with the business. Our client is requesting this loan in order to buy cattle to feed and resell.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of cattle

loans.name: Anvar

texts.ru: Давлатов Анвар проживает в районе Руми. Возраст 31 год. Женат, имеет 4 детей. Анвар более 8 лет занимается животноводством. Он откармливает и продает мелко рогатый скот на рынке. В этом ему также помогает его семья. Клиент просит кредит, дял закупа мелко рогатого скота и корма.
texts.en:
Anvar D. lives in the Rumy district. He is 31 years old, married and has 4 children. Anvar has been involved in animal husbandry for over 8 years. He feeds and sells small livestock at the market. His family helps him with this business. Our client is requesting a loan in order to buy small livestock and feed.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of small livestock and feed

loans.name: Odgerel

texts.en:
Odgerel N. is 40 years old and lives with her husband and three children in the Baganuur district of Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. Her oldest daughter is 20 years old and a student in a local university. Her two younger daughters go to a local high school.

Odgerel has a small grocery. She sells various products, including dairy products and soft drinks. She has been in the business for more than 14 years and currently rents a small stall in the Herlen shopping center for her business. In the future, she hopes to buy a stall at the shopping center instead of paying high rent. She says that next year her two daughters will be university students, which means that she needs more money to cover their tuition and living expenses. She also says that she is working even harder to make extra income to meet the family's increasing expenses.

With part of the loan, she plans to purchase more products for her business and the rest of the loan will be used to buy a car engine for her family's minibus.

loans.use: To purchase a car engine and food products

loans.name: Batima's Group

texts.en:
Here is Batima, the leader of this loan group. She is 47 years old and a widow with four children. To make a living she has to raise cattle. Because it is a very difficult activity for a woman, she gets help from her relatives. At the beginning, she did not have any idea how to keep and look after cattle. However, being a smart woman and having caring relatives, she quickly learned the necessary aspects and developed good skills. Now she has three sheep and wants to increase their number. 

Her plan is to achieve the desired population step by step. First, she hopes to obtain a loan and buy one calf. After feeding and resale, she is going to buy two calves for fattening and resale again and so on. Constant concern about her children’s future and awareness that there is nobody except her to take care of them, strengthens her determination and makes her steadfast. One of her future plans is to build a new house for her children. 

Batima has three partners, Aina, Chynarkul and Zeinep. Aina, age 43, is married. Her husband works as a farmer. They keep twenty sheep at home and Aina has to look after them in addition to doing her duties. Aina wants to buy ten more sheep and thus increase their population. She hopes to do that by obtaining a loan.

Chynarkul, 52, is a widow. All three of her children are adults. To keep herself busy, she decided to undertake cattle breeding. Currently she has three calves and hopes to get a loan to buy two more. 

Zeinep is the youngest partner. She is just twenty-one years old. She is married and has six-month old daughter. Being a housewife, Zeinep’s needs a refridgerator, becaue it is summer and everything spoils very quickly. She hopes that, after getting a loan, she will finally be able to buy a new refridgerator.    

======================================
--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance, a young and ambitious socially-focused MFI in Kyrgyzstan.

Mol Bulak Finance is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development on the basis of 3-Ps concept - People (building human capital and taking care of its customers and the society as well), Profit (to be profitable to grow further) and the Planet (taking care of the environment). It is also the only MFI in Kyrgyzstan who delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about Mol Bulak and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and micro-finance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan - at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from the Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and Mol Bulak staff.

loans.use: To buy a calf for resale

loans.name: Roxana

texts.es:
La socia Roxana, es natural de la provincia de Chumbivilcas, zona bellísima y de granjeros y ganaderos, ella se mudó a la provincia de Urubamba por que vio más oportunidades de trabajo.

La socia tiene 30 años de edad y es conviviente ella tienen 2 hijos y aún son pequeños, los cuales le demandan mucho cuidado y esfuerzo, ella alterna sus actividades del hogar con el comercio minorista, ella tienen un pequeño stand en el mercado central modelo de Urubamba y vende juguetes, ella solicita el préstamo para poder comprar mayor mercadería de la ciudad de Lima y traer a su stand y seguir con su pequeño negocio, ella sueña con expandir su negocio y verlo pronto como una galería.

La socia agradece el apoyo brindado y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de su deuda en el plazo establecido.

loans.use: Comprar juguetes al por mayor.

loans.name: Tumaini

texts.en:
Mambo from Tanzania! This is 27 year old Tumaini M. from Mbozi. She is married with one  child, of 9.. Additionally, she is responsible for supporting 2 dependants because they are orphans. Tumaini has been running a shop since 2007. She owns a small duka or neighborhood shop in the city where she sells common household and grocery items.
She works at the business for 9-12 hours per day, 7 days per week. Tumaini currently earns about 100USD from her business. She is requesting a loan in order to purchase shop items in bulk for her business. In the future, she plans to improve quality and range of product. Tumaini thanks you for your support!

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of microleasing is that is allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future

loans.use: To purchase shop items in bulk

loans.name: Helen

texts.en: Helen is married with 4 children and she is 50 years old. She sells provisions like sugar, tomatoes paste, bathing soap, toothpaste, etc. She hopes for the loan amount of  N150,000 to purchase more provisions to sell. She says thanks to all kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more provisions to sell

loans.name: Paulina

texts.en:
Paulina B. is from the town of Lopez Jaena. She is 40 years old. Paulina is married and has 5 school-aged children. To make a living, Paulina owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector running a general store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling a variety of different products in the local community. Paulina has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2007, Paulina joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Paulina has successfully repaid a previous loan of 15,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Paulina is requesting a new loan of 20000 PHP which will be used to purchase a transport vehicle to improve the business. This loan will be the 4th loan taken out by Paulina from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of the borrower's family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase a transport vehicle to improve the business

loans.name: Francisco Javier

texts.es: El señor Francisco Javier O. G. tiene la edad de 50 años, habita en el barrio Pablo Calero junto a su esposa, la cual trabaja como comerciante, para apoyarle con  los gastos del hogar, ellos tienen cinco hijos, ya todos casados , tiene a uno de sus nietos a su cargo el cual le apoya con los trabajos agrícolas , desde hace treinta años don Francisco se dedica a la agricultura , ya que con sus propios esfuerzos logro comprar un terreno el cual lo explota con cultivos , agradece a Afodenic por décimo crédito el cual comparara abono para una mejor cosecha lo que ha lograra mejorar sus condiciones de vida así como este financiamiento a bajos interés y facilidad de pagos . A la vez esta contento por la asistencia técnica ya que le sirve de mucha ayuda para los cultivos.
texts.en:
Sr. Francisco Javier O. G. is 50 years old and lives in the Pablo Calero neighborhood with his wife, who works as a merchant. They support one another with the household expenses. Don Francisco has 5 children who are all married. One of his grandsons helps him with the farmwork.

For the past 30 years, Don Francisco has been engaged in agriculture. Through his hard work, he was able to buy his own land for the purpose of growing crops. He thanks AFODENIC for providing him with his tenth loan, which he will use to purchase fertilizers so that he can produce a better crop. The income he generates at harvest time has enabled him to improve his living conditions. The low interest rates and easy payments have also been a great benefit. Don Francisco is happy to receive the technical assistance that proved to be very helpful in growing his crops.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fertilizers to apply to his crops

loans.name: Yaxenia Magali

texts.en:
Yaxenia Magali G. C. lives with her husband and 4 year old son in the Paraiso district of Guayaquil.  While her husband works as a guard for a local bank, Ms. G. sells rice to neighbors out of her home.  Every 22 days, Mr. G. drives approximately 2.5 hours to Marabi in order to buy 15 sacks of rice for his wife to sell.  They are able to buy each sack of rice for 21 dollars and sell the rice in smaller increments for a total of 40 dollars per sack. 

Ms. G. is requesting a loan in order to buy more sacks of rice. This will allow her family to buy a greater quantity of sacks at a lower rate per sack.  In the future, she hopes that profits from rice sales will allow her to fix the rooms of her house.  Ms.G. is thankful for any support you may be able to provide her business so that her family may prosper.

loans.use: To buy rice in bulk for resale

loans.name: Juan Ramon

texts.es:
El Señor Juan Ramos B. tiene a su cargo tres hijos, esta casado, ha trabajado créditos con Ceprodel durante seis años, en ese lapso ha logrado mejorar las condiciones de su vivienda con los 7 financiamiento que ha trabajado con Ceprodel, el es un excelente cliente y puntual en sus pagos.

El crédito solicitado es para invertir en la compra de materiales para la remodelación del techo de la vivienda y el pago de la mano de obra de la construcción.
texts.en:
Sr. Juan Ramos B. is married and has three children. He has worked with CEPRODEL for 6 years and, during this time, he has been able to improve his living conditions with the 7 previous loans he has received. He is an excellent client who has been punctual with his payments.

The loan he is requesting now will be used to purchase materials and pay for labor required to refurbish the roof of his house.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Pay for materials & labor needed to refurbish the roof of his house

loans.name: Merceditha

texts.en:
Merceditha S. lives in the village of Nabuswang, Brgy Canmoros, Binalbagan, Negros Occidental. She is 65 years old but is still strong enough to manage her business. Her husband, Orlando, oversees their rice farm but cannot do it full-time because he previously suffered a stroke. The couple has seven adult children who also help them with their household needs. Merceditha wants her business to continue so they can have a comfortable way of living and save for their future.
To help her husband provide in preparation for their children's college education, Merceditha began a general store business. She started with a small store adjacent to her house and earned a small income, which was a big help in sustaining her family's needs, especially her children's. As time went on, she wanted to earn more by expanding their general store.
When Merceditha decided to join NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2002, she knew that the loan she got for her general store would help her tremendously in increasing her income. She was able to buy new products to sell and set up a coffee shop within her store. As her loans continued, she purchased and managed fishponds that helped her with her other needs. The successive loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon brought comfort to Merceditha's family for the help they were to her businesses, and she now earns 14,000 PHP a month.
Her previous loan of 23,000 PHP was paid in full and on time within her loan term. Now, Merceditha is borrowing 26,000 PHP as additional working capital for her general store and fishponds.

About NWTF
In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon – a title of esteem that is bestowed on a member of the community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

loans.use: As additional working capital for general store and fishpond

loans.name: Surenhorol

texts.en:
E. operates a business making wood products in his town. The business is very family oriented, as his wife sells the products while he makes them. He started this business in 2009 after managing a hair salon with his mother for 6 years. He is continuing with the hair salon as well as his furniture making business.

E. is 27 years old and lives with his wife and 7-year-old son in Bayanhongor province, Mongolia. He and his family live in a ger (a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent). His wife helps with the family business by selling secondhand goods and the wood products out of a shipping container in their town.

Their business has been successful and they have grown a stable operation. Using his savings, E. has been able to support his family. E. attributes his success to the quality of his products, which are much desired by his customers. He is planning to have his own factory in the future. He is requesting a 3,000,000 tugrug loan to purchase more wood and paint for the business.

loans.use: To purchase more wood and paint

loans.name: Luci Magdalena

texts.es:
Luci vive en la Colonia Las Torres en la ciudad de Tegucigalpa, tiene seis años de vivir en ese lugar, es una mujer muy joven tiene veinte años de edad, su negocio es la Elaboracion y venta de tortillas, tiene 3 años de vender tortillas, gracias a su actividad ha logrado graduarse del colegio, vive con su mama, es soltera, necesita el credito para poder comprar la materia prima al por mayor y asi poder obtener precios bajos en harina de maiz, leña, cal.
Luci vende a sus vecinos todos los dias de la semana desde las 6:00 Am. 
hasta las 5:00 Pm. Sus clientes son todos sus vecinos. 
Su sueño es seguir estudiando en la universidad.
texts.en:
Luci lives in the Las Torres Colonia in the city of Tegucigalpa. She has lived there for six years. She is a very young woman; she is 20. Her business is making and selling tortillas. She has been selling tortillas for three years. Thanks to this activity, she was able to graduate from school. She is single, and she lives with her mother. She needs the loan to be able to buy raw materials wholesale. That way she will be able to get corn flour, firewood, and quicklime at lower prices. Luci sells to her neighbors every day of the week from 6:00 a.m. until 5:00 p.m. Her customers are all her neighbors. Her dream is to continue her education in the university.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy firewood, corn flour, quicklime, and matches

loans.name: Teodora

texts.en:
Teodora B. is from the village of D'ban, Calamba, Misamis Occidental. She is 40 years old, is married, and has two school-aged children. Teodora owns and operates a specialized retail store, selling daily-use products such as coffee, cocoa, shampoo, soap and toothpaste in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month. In 2010, Teodora joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 20,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and used as working capital. This loan will be her first from GDMPC. Teodora plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family's income. About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and to use as working capital

loans.name: Maria Magdalena

texts.es:
María Méndez de 36 años, vive en una zona periurbana en Paraíso de Guayaquil, su casa es de cemento pero solo cuenta con luz como servicio básico. Es madre soltera con dos hijas. 

María empezó vendiendo legumbres y arroz en su casas. Cuando obtuvo el capital suficiente para tener su tienda construyo en la parte delantera de su casa la tienda.

Ahora ella vende bebidas, arroz, enlatados, carnes y ha implementado el servicio de cabinas telefónicas. Trabaja en conjunto con su hija desde muy temprano en la mañana.

Con el préstamo quiere comprar bebidas, arroz, azúcar para su negocio. En el futuro quiere tener un Cyber.
texts.en:
María Méndez is 36 years old and lives in the periurban district of Paraíso in Guayaquil. Her house is made of cement and receives electricity as its only basic service. She is a single mother with two daughters.

María began selling vegetables and rice from her home. When she saved up sufficient capital, she opened a store in a space that she built in front of her house. She now sells drinks, rice, canned goods, and meats. Her store is also equipped with phone booths. María and her daughter work together from the very early hours of the morning.

With this loan, María will purchase beverages, rice, and sugar for her business. In the future, she wants to open an Internet café.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase drinks, rice, and sugar

loans.name: Sira

texts.fr: Sira D. est une femme de 57 ans, elle est mariée et mère d'un enfant en charge. Elle est membre du Banc Villageois de SAREYEROYEL depuis 6 ans et demi et a eu à bénéficier de 13 prêts qu'elle a toujours bien gérés et remboursés régulièrement. Elle fait du petit commerce de sucre, d'huile végétal, d'huile de palme etc. Les bénéfices de son activité lui permettent d'améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille et de participer aux différentes charge.
texts.en:
Sira D. is a 57 year old woman. She is married and the mother of one child in her care. She has been a member of the Banc Villageois of Sareyeroyel for six and a half years and has benefited from 13 loans which she has always managed well and repaid regularly. She is in the business of selling sugar, vegetable oil, palm oil, etc. The profits from her work allow her to improve her family’s quality of life and contribute to meeting various responsibilities.

Translated from French by Shannon Arnold, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to build up investment capital

loans.name: Marcelina Guadalupe

texts.es:
Marcelina tiene 62 años de edad, es viuda y tiene cinco hijos de los cuales solo el último vive con ella. Vive en el sector Manco Capac del distrito de Paiján, en la provincia de Ascope de la región La Libertad, ubicada a dos horas y media de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital de la región Lambayeque.

Desde hace mas de 25 años se dedica a la venta de pescado fresco en el mercado de la ciudad de Casagrande (ubicada a 20 minutos de Paiján). Ella nos comenta que antes vendía en una parada (mercadillo) situada en los exteriores del lugar, hace veinte años tuvo la oportunidad de empezar a vender su producto en un puesto ubicado en el interior del mercado y eso aumentó sus ventas.

Actualmente ella se vale de la ayuda del último de sus hijos para sacar adelante a su negocio. El va todos los dias muy temprano al terminal pesquero de la ciudad de Trujillo y compra el pescado que venderán durante el dia. Marcelina ofrece su mercadería hasta el mediodia y luego se dirige a su vivienda. Esta actividad le ha ayudado a salir adelante y trabajar por el progreso de sus hijos ya que enviudó hace 20 años y tuvo que sacarlos adelante sola.

Debido al incremento del precio del pescado en la zona norte del país ella se ha visto en la necesidad de solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles que piensa utilizar en la compra de mas pescado para mantener su negocio.

Marcelina es una mujer bastante responsable y entregada a su trabajo. Ella ya ha trabajado anteriormente con Nuestra Institución y ha demostrado ser una cliente puntual y responsable al momento de asumir sus pagos
texts.en:
Marcelina is a 62 year old widow. She has five children, but only the last one lives with her. She lives in the Manco Capac section of the Paiján district in the Ascope province of the La Libertad region. It is located two and a half hours from the city of Chiclayo, which is the capital of the Lambayeque region. For over 25 years she has been selling fresh fish in the market in the city of Casagrande (located 20 minutes from Paiján). She tells us that she used to sell outside of a street market. Twenty years ago she had to opportunity to start selling her product at a stall located inside of the market. This increased her sales. Her youngest child currently helps her get ahead in her business. Very early everyday he goes to the fishing terminal in the city of Trujillo and buys the fish they will sell during the day. Marcelina sells her merchandise until midday, and then she heads home. This activity has helped her get ahead and to work for her children’s progress. She was widowed 20 years ago, and she had to get them ahead by herself. Due to the increase in the price of fish in the area north of the country, she has seen the need to ask Edpyme Alternativa for a loan for 1,000 PEN. She will use it to buy more fish to maintain her business. Marcelina is a very responsible woman who is devoted to her work. She has worked with our institution previously, and she has demonstrated herself to be punctual and responsible with her payments.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy fish to expand her business

loans.name: Iyabo

texts.en:
