Iyabo is a hardworking woman and she is determined to pull her business and family out of poverty. She lives in Ogbomoso, Oyo State, Nigeria. She is 40 years old and married with three children. She is happy because her children are excelling in school.

Iyabo sells foodstuffs like yam, yam flour and cooking oil and she has been in this business for a long time. She loves this business because of the one-on-one interaction that she has with her customers.

Iyabo is a Lift Above Poverty Organization (LAPO) client. She is requesting a loan of 80,000 to purchase more foodstuffs to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders for their support.

LAPO is committed to improving lives in Nigeria and elsewhere in Africa.

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs to sell

loans.name: Yunuskhuja

texts.en:
Yunuskhuja is 46 years old. He is a farmer. Since his marriage, he has demonstrated that in spite of his youth he can support his family with hard work and dedication. Because of this, he is always in the fields, growing potatoes, onions and carrots. Yunuskhuja leaves early in the morning to water the fields, then fertilizes and fumigates the crops. This work is satisfying, and it enables Yunuskhuja to purchase goods for his home. However, the most trying feature of this work is dealing with the changes in climate, which can damage the crops. Because of this, farmers like Yunuskhuja must buy products that help protect the crops from shifts in the weather. Yunuskhuja is motivated by his desire to offer his family a better quality of life. He would like to invest in the purchase of supplies to protect his crops, so as to have a better harvest and sell his crops outside of his hometown.  
 

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase seeds, fertilizer, fuels and lubricants

loans.name: Castulo

texts.es: Castulo, de 45 años, es un joven muy  responsable, vive en casa de sus padres, en compañía de su madre que es anciana. Su principal  sustento es la venta de ropa y lo realiza de manera ambulante, pero su perseverancia y dedicación le han dado fuerzas para aguantar largas horas de caminata. La mercadería que posee es muy solicitada por sus amistades y amigos de su barrio, puesto que saben de la calidad de prendas que tiene, además de las facilidades de pago que les da. Es así que ha logrado tener 15 años haciendo esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es negarse en dar crédito a sus clientes, debido a que se demoran en pagar. Su mayor anhelo es aumentar su negocio con la venta de zapatos, de esa manera diversifica su negocio. Este es su décimo crédito con MFP y considera que le será muy beneficioso para el desarrollo de su negocio. Es su grupo comunal, es el encargado de poner el orden dentro de su grupo. Con el crédito que solicita, invertirá en el incremento de más prendas de vestir, para no perder a sus asiduos compradores.
texts.en:
Castulo, who is 45, is a responsible person who lives in his parents' house accompanying his mother who is elderly. His principal job is selling clothing and he does this on foot. However, his perseverance and dedication has given him the energy to spend long hours on foot. The merchandise that he possesses is popular with this friends and acquaintances from the neighborhood since they know of the quality of clothing he has in addition to the payment facilities that he gives them. It is in this way that he has achieved 15 years doing this activity and he considers the most difficult thing to be denying credit to his customers, since they are slow to pay. His greatest goal to expand his business by selling shoes and, this way, diversify his business. This is his tenth loan with MFP and he considers it to be beneficial for the development of his business. In his community bank, he is in charge of placing orders for the group. With the loan that he is soliciting, he will invest in an more clothing so he doesn't lose his frequent buyers.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: He will purchase more clothing.

loans.name: Tamella

texts.en: Tamella Q. is a 44-year-old woman who sells cattle for meat production and makes milk products for her family. Usually Tamella sells cattle to the local butchers and restaurants. She has seven years of experience in this field. Tamella is married and has four children. She applied for a loan of 1000 AZN so she can purchase three calves.

loans.use: To buy three calves

loans.name: Mrs. Mom Kin Village Bank Group

texts.en: Fourteen people make up the village bank loan group, and they live in Krapeu Ha village in Kandal province. Mrs. Mom K. has been selected as the group leader by the other members. Each member will use a small piece of the loan for a different purpose to improve their business. Mrs. Mom K. was born in 1968. She is a Khmer cake maker at her home. Her husband, Mr. Vuthy Touch, is employed in a telecom business. Although this couple works hard, they earn less income. So to improve her family's lifestyle, Mrs. Mom K. is asking for a loan to start a new business to buy more groceries for resale. She is a mother of four children: one is a teacher, two are employed in a telecom business, and one attends the local public school.

loans.use: To buy more groceries to resale to start a new business

loans.name: Lotu

texts.en: Lotu K. is 46 and married with four children. Her business venture is planting and harvesting cocoa for sale. Lotu has three years of experience in this business. Lotu needs a loan of 1,500 Samoan talas to purchase harvesting equipment, such as wheelbarrows, shovels, rakes, baskets and knives. She plans to use the earnings from her business (estimated to be 600 talas or $250 per week) to improve/expand the business. In 2007, Lotu joined SPBD, a Kiva partner. This is her fifth loan with SPBD. SPBD's loans are Lotu's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks. About SPBD In 2000, Greg Casagrande founded SPBD and since then, it has expanded from the main island of Upolu in Samoa to Savaii, as well as Tonga. SPBD's philosophy of lending is based upon the Grameen Bank lending method. Please join SPBD's lending team on Kiva to receive on-the-spot updates on SPBD: http://www.kiva.org/community/viewTeam?team_id=8375

loans.use: To purchase harvesting equipment such as wheelbarrows, shovels, rakes, baskets and knives

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary A. is currently in the business of selling charcoal and local brew at home and is requesting a loan to stock more bags of charcoal to sell.

Mary is 40 years old and is married to a soldier. She has three children and her children go to school.

With the extra profits from her loan, Mary hopes to be able to pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: To stock more bags of charcoal to sell

loans.name: Heidi Tania

texts.es: La señora Heidi Tania tiene 21 años es soltera y no tiene hijos. Ella se dedica a la venta de mercadería en general, los cuales distribuye de manera ambulante, pese a que también en su casa oferta sus productos. Actualmente, algo que le afecta al igual que a la mayoría de personas en el país ha sido las enfermedades. Ella dio inicio a este negocio desde hace 2 años en sociedad con una hermana, con el tiempo ella fue teniendo su propio capital hasta llegar a trabajar de manera individual como lo hace ahora. Ella empezó vendiendo muy poco, debido a que las personas no la conocían, sin embargo fue haciéndose de clientes y pudo establecer un buen negocio. Este crédito solicitado será invertido en compra de materia prima y ofrecer nuevos productos a los clientes. Su sueño actualmente es realizar unas mejoras a la vivienda, además que desea poner el negocio en un solo lugar es decir poner una tienda.
texts.en:
Heidi Tania is 21, single and has no children. She sells general merchandise, which she sells door-to-door, and she also sells her products from her home. Currently, something that has affected her and the majority of people in the country has been illnesses. She started this business two years ago in partnership with a sister, and with time she gained her own capital and has now been able to work individually. She started selling very little, since people didn't know her, but she has been gaining customers and has been able to establish a good business. The requested loan will be invested in the purchase of basic materials and to offer new products to her customers. Her dream now is to make improvements to her home, since she wants to have the business in one single location; to set up a store.

Translated from Spanish by Christine Cooper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: working capital

loans.name: Jimena Adriana

texts.es:
Nuestra socia Jimena pertenece al Banco Comunal “GRANITO DE MOSTAZA de la Asociación Arariwa y tiene 21 años.  Jimena nació en la ciudad del Cusco y vive en la misma ciudad junto con sus  padres.   
 
Jimena es profesora de educación inicial y enseña a niños de 3 a 4 años en el colegio San José de la Salle de la ciudad del Cusco. Ya son 3 años que se dedica a la enseñanza y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo. La socia requiere el préstamo para gasto personal desea comprar una computadora portátil. 

La socia se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
This member Jimena belongs to the communal bank 'Granito de Mostaza', part of the Arariwa Association. Jimena is 21 years old and was born and lives in Cusco city together with her parents. Jimena is an primary education teacher and teaches children between 3 and 4 years old in San José de la Salle college in Cusco. She has been a teacher for 3 years and is doing very well thanks to the hard work she puts into her work. Jimena needs a loan for personal costs as she wants to buy a laptop. Jimena is thankful for the opportunity granted to her and promises to make the repayments according to the time period stipulated.

Translated from Spanish by Jane McCrory, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase a laptop computer for personal use

loans.name: Oyungerel

texts.en:
Oyungerel D. is 45 years old and lives as a single mother with her three children in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent, in Uvurhangai province of Mongolia. The family have been living at their current home address since 1998. Her oldest daughter lives and works in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia, while her middle daughter attends a university and her youngest daughter stays at home. 

She graduated from the technology institute in 1983 and then she worked as a seamstress until 1995. She started her wooden products trading business in 2000 after selling three billiard tables made by her brother-in-law. She usually produces  wooden items such as chairs and bowls and sells them at a local market. She operates this wooden products making business in her town with help of her brother-in-law.

 In the future, to further support her family, she hopes to grow her business by increasing the quantity and quality of products she produces. She is a diligent and hardworking person and says "I try my best to raise my children very well, but it is little bit difficult since I am a single mother with three children." She also wishes to buy a car which would contribute greatly to her business operations. 

Oyungerel is requesting a 750,000 MNT loan to purchase new tools and equipment in order to expand her wood products production.

loans.use: To purchase new tools and equipment

loans.name: Patricia Felicita

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Familiar se reúne cada 15 días en una localidad llamada Colorado a pocos minutos de Montecristi, en este sitio la mayoría de los habitantes tiene diferentes negocios como la fabricación de botones de tagua, artesanía y comercio en general.

La señora Patricia tiene 46 años de edad y esta casada hace 23 años, tiene tres hijos dos mayores y el último que está aún en el colegio, dos de sus hijos viven con ella.

Ella se dedica a la venta de ropa de todo tipo, aunque reconoce que lo que mas vende es interiores y ropa de damas, trabaja los tres últimos días de la semana, en los cuales entrega los pedidos y realiza los cobros que son semanales y en ciertos casos quincenales, ella vende en Montecristi y también en Manta, compra en Guayaquil Y en Huaquillas ciudades que visita una o dos veces por mes de acuerdo a la demanda que tenga de sus productos.

Este crédito lo va a invertir en comprar en Huaquillas ropa interior y jean de mujeres ya que tiene muchos encargos. Esta en el Banco Comunal hace cuatro ciclos y le gusta por las reuniones informativas y educativas.

Su meta es construir otro piso en su casa ya que es muy pequeña la que tiene.
texts.en:
The Family Communal Bank meets every two weeks in Colorado, a few minutes from Montecristi. Most of the residents here run various businesses such as the manufacture of ivory palm buttons, other crafts, and general trading. Patricia is 46 years old and has been married for 23 years. She has three children, two adults and one who is still in school. Two of their children live with her. Patricia sells all kinds of clothing, although what she sells most are undergarments and women's clothing. She works the last three days of the week, during which she delivers orders and collects weekly, or in some cases biweekly, payments. She makes sales in Montecristi and also in Manta. She makes purchases in Guayaquil and in Huaquillas, where she visits once or twice a month according to the demand for her products. Patricia will invest this loan in the purchase of undergarments and women's jeans in Huaquillas, given that she has many orders for them. She has been a member of the Communal Bank for four cycles and enjoys the informative, educational meetings. Patricia's goal is to build another story on her house, because it is very small.

Translated from Spanish by Rachel McRoberts, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy undergarments and women's jeans.

loans.name: Jorge

texts.es: Jorge de 32 años, vive con su esposa y sus 3 hijos en una casa alquilada, ubicada en el pueblo de Llanco. Trabaja sembrando arveja, papa y flores, en un terreno alquilado; ya son 5 años que se dedica a la agricultura y está muy contento con su trabajo, ya que viaja constantemente a la capital para vender las verduras que siembra durante el año; en estos meses sembrará flores y papa ya que es la temporada donde tiene mayor demanda, “se invierte poco y se gana mucho”, afirma. Jorge esta juntando dinero para poder comprar su propio terreno y tener mayores ganancias, de esa manera podrá adquirir una pequeña casa para su familia. Es el quinto crédito con MFP, y está feliz de pertenecer a su banco comunal donde puede compartir experiencias. Con el crédito que solicita, comprará semillas y abono para su próxima siembra.
texts.en: Jorge is 32 years old, and he lives with his wife and three children in a rented house in the town of Llanco. He grows peas, potatoes, and flowers on a piece of rented land. He has been working in agriculture for five years, and he likes his job because he gets to travel constantly to the capital to sell the produce that he grows throughout the year. In the coming months he will plant flowers and potato because this is the season that they are in demand. "If you invest a little you make a lot," he says. Jorge is saving money to purchase his own land and thus earn more profit. With more profits he could buy a small house for his family. This is his fifth loan with MFP, and he is happy to belong to a community bank because he con share his experiences. He will use the loan money to buy seeds and fertilizer for his next planting.

loans.use: Purchase of pea seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Melinda

texts.en:
Melinda P. is a married woman who lives in Lower Calasa, Brgy. Caradio-an, Himamaylan, Negros Occidental. She earns her living by operating three business ventures:  Sugarcane plantation, rice field and fish selling businesses.  Her husband Simeon P., who is 34 years old, works as a Laborer to earn his living and also helps in his wife's business activities.  They have four children who are 7 to 20 years old. 

Melinda joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2005 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past 10 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Melinda has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 10,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 7,000, thus uplifting the family's standard of living.  This time, for her 11th cycle loan, she is borrowing PHP 13,000 which she intends to use as additional capital in her fish vending and to purchase fertilizer for her farm so that she could continue to save up for future house repairs and her children's education. 

Melinda P. is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path towards the achievement of her dreams. 

About NWTF:  
In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.  Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: Fund the Operations of a sugarcane plantation

loans.name: Baatarbek

texts.en:
Baatarbek S. is a 29-year-old, business-minded, hardworking young man who lives with his wife and an infant in Khovd province, western Mongolia. His wife stays home taking care of their child. 

Baatarbek started his transportation business in 2008 and since then, he has gained a lot of experience. He transports livestock. In another word, he purchases goats and other livestock from Khovd province, then he transports them to Ulaanbaatar city. He sells livestock in Ulaanbaatar in wholesale. As his business expanded, he purchased a plot of land where he built a nice house so that the family's living conditions have been improved. Baatarbek is requesting a 3,000,000 Mongolian tugriks loan to purchase goats to resell.

loans.use: To purchase goats to resell

loans.name: Akua

texts.en: Akua D. is married to a driver and together they live with their seven dependants. Akua sells utensils and secondhand clothes at Abura. She has been in this trade for 15 years. She assists her husband in educating her dependants. Akua will use the loan to purchase more of her goods to sell. With the new profits from her expanded business, Akua plans to build a shop.

loans.use: To purchase more goods to sell.

loans.name: Adjoa

texts.en: Adjoa S. is divorced and lives with her five dependents. Adjoa is a hairdresser in Elmina. She has been in this trade for eight years and uses her income to see to the well-being of her family. She is requesting this loan in order to purchase more hair products to use in the salon. With the new profits from her expanded business, Adjoa plans to put up a shop.

loans.use: to purchase more hair products

loans.name: Norah

texts.en:
N. Norah lives in the Kyebando neighborhood in the city of Kampala, Uganda.  She is single and has three children, all of whom are in school. Norah has a business of selling fried chips. She has been in this business for seven years, and she works seven days a week. Norah sells her products at the market at retail prices.   

Norah has requested a loan of 500,000 UGX from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more bags of Irish potatoes and cooking oil. The main business challenges for Norah include seasonality and the ever-increasing price of Irish potatoes.  Her goals and aspirations for her business are to own a fully stocked restaurant and educate her children up to the university level.   

She lives in a home that she rents where she has access to electricity and piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include school fees and food.

loans.use: To buy more bags of Irish potatoes and cooking oil

loans.name: Raul

texts.es: El Sr. Raúl, vive en la casa de su madre el Sr. Es eléctrico tiene un taller eléctrico en la misma casa donde vive, el mantiene a su Mama, trabaja todos los días es muy conocido en la zona por el buen trabajo que realiza, el préstamo invertirá para la compra de repuestos herramientas para su taller, joven  soltero independiente con muchas ganas de salir adelante trabajador, con ganas de superación esta agradecido con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en: Raul is a single independent young man, eager to get ahead in his life. He lives with his mother, is electrician and runs a workshop in his house. He takes care of his mother, works every day of the week and is well known in the area for the good service he provides. He will invest the loan in the purchase of replacement tools. He is grateful to the institution for the support.

loans.use: Purchase of replacement tools

loans.name: Joicy

texts.en:
Joicy T. is from the town of Plaridel. She is 31 years old, married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Joicy owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector planting and harvesting rice for sale. Joicy has been engaged in her business for over nine years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP per month from these activities.
In 2008, Joicy joined Kiva partner, PMPC, to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 15,000 PHP from PMPC. This loan was used to to pay for services to increase crop yield. Joicy is requesting a new loan of 20,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This loan will be her fifth from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's general living conditions.

About PMPC
Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers, such as manure

loans.name: Marisa

texts.es: Doña Marisa tiene 62 años, vive con su esposo y sus 2 hijos en su casa propia. Hace más de15 años se dedica a la venta D. comida en un puesto D. ventas D. un mercado local D. su barrio, veD. todos los días menos los fines D. semana. Ella sola realiza este trabajo que muchas veces requiere D. mucho esfuerzo físico que sin embargo disfruta día a día  porque le agrada cocinar además D. que tiene una buena sazón  por lo que ha logrado  tener clientela fija. Se siente muy satisfecha con el trabajo que realiza, por ello desea seguir continuando con esta actividad. Es su tercer crédito con MFP, esta muy contenta D.  saber que tiene un apoyo financiero ya que siempre ha demostrado  ser responsable en sus pagos, además  le agrada ser parte D. su banco comunal porque  todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y muy solidarias, agradece  a aquellas personas que serán gestoras del préstamo que solicita y le será  muy útil en el progreso D. su negocio. Con el crédito que solicita, lo invertirá en la compra D. los ingredientes no perecibles al por mayor y así tener mayor abastecimiento en la preparación D. sus comidas.
texts.en:
Marisa is 62 years old, and lives with her husband and two children in their own home.  For more than 15 years, she has sold food at a food stall in her local market.  She sells every day except the weekends.  She only does this work, which many times requires a lot of physical effort, because she likes to cook things with good flavor and because she has many loyal customers.  She feels very satisfied with the work she does, so she wants to continue working.  

This is her third loan with MFP, and she is very happy to know that she has financial support since she has shown she is responsible with her payments.  She is also happy to be a part of her community bank because all of the members are responsible and supportive people.  She is thankful to everyone who will make this loan possible since it will be very useful in the development of her business.  

With the loan she is requesting, she will purchase non-perishable ingredients in bulk in order to have a greater supply for the preparation of her food.

loans.use: Purchase non-perishable products in bulk

loans.name: Gonzalo De Jesús

texts.es:
En el municipio de Granada, Departamento de Granada, labora el señor Gonzalo de Jesús M. E., el cual tiene 25 años de laborar como Operador de Pozo en una empresa ubicada en la misma zona. Es acompañado dependen tres personas, su esposa y dos hijos quienes en estos momentos iniciaran en el Colegio.

Actualmente tiene la necesidad de realizar mejoramiento de vivienda en su casa de habitación y por tal razón visita las oficinas de CEPRODEL para realizar dicho mejoramiento y también cancelar unas deudas que tiene para estar libre.

Este señor considera que estando libre de sus deudas y con el resto del dinero para la mejora de vivienda le estaría dando un hogar digno a su familia para que crezcan saludablemente.
texts.en:
Mr. Gonzalo de Jesús M. E. has worked as a Well Operator for 25 years for a firm located in the town of Granada, Granada department.  He has three people with him:  his wife and two children who are about to start school.

He needs to do some home improvements and for this reason visits CEPRODEL’s offices to accomplish said improvements and also to pay off some debts he has in order to be free of them.

He considers that if he’s free from debt and being able to use the rest of the money to improve the home, he’d be providing his family with a worthy home in which to grow healthfully.

loans.use: For home improvements and to pay off a debt.

loans.name: Arcenia

texts.en:
Arcenia is a married woman who lives in Manapla, Negros Occidental. She earns her living by operating a general store. Her husband Ernesto, who is 52 years old, works as an Inkarkado/supervisor to earn his living and helps in his wife's business activities. They have eight children who are 12 to 29 years old. Two of the children have their own families, three of them work to help her and two are currently going to school. Arcenia joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2008 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past six loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Arcenia has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 10,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 6,000, uplifting the family's standard of living. This time, for her seventh loan, she is borrowing PHP 15,000 to purchase more stock to sell so that she can continue to save up for the future for her family and for educational needs. Arcenia is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams. 

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed upon a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by joining the NWTF Kiva lending team at http://www.kiva.org

loans.use: To purchase more stock to sell

loans.name: Halimatu

texts.en:
Halimatu Y. sells cosmetics and soap at Akaa Krom near Abura in Cape Coast, a business she has operated for 12 years. She was educated through the senior high school level. She and her husband have five dependants. Halimatu uses her income to assist her husband, who works as a driver, in the payment of the family's school fees and utility bills. 

Halimatu will use this loan to purchase more boxes of soap to expand her business. With the new profits from her expanded business, Halimatu plans to reinvest back into her business.

loans.use: To purchase more boxes of soap to expand her business

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This Kiva borrower is a 32-year-old Lebanese divorced man. He is the father of one school-age child. He has owned a car repair shop since 2008, and has 10 years of experience working in the same occupation. He is the only income source for his family. He works hard to offer good living conditions to his child and to be able to pay his education fees. 

Today, he is requesting to borrow $1,200 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to purchase supplementary car spare parts. He is hoping to realize his business goals and be able to earn superior income. He is optimistic about his business development and willing to open a bigger store.

loans.use: to purchase supplementary car spare parts

loans.name: Igor

texts.en:
Igor is single. He is the owner of a small farming business in Novomoskovsk. Igor sells vegetable seeds in the central marketplace of his hometown. He changes his merchandise according to the seasonal market. Igor has several vending stalls at different locations of the market. He has been running this business for over 10 years. Currently, his income amounts to 8,000 Grivnyas a month.  

Igor is planning to use the loan of 15,000 Grivnyas to purchase a variety of seeds, fertilizers and farming chemicals to meet seasonal demand. He has inherited this business from his parents, who started it a long time ago. Presently, Igor is supporting his elderly parents, making money and meeting the needs of his family.

loans.use: to purchase additional types of seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Loa

texts.en: Loa L., age 41, is married and resides in Siem Reap province, Cambodia, an area known for Angkorean Temples.  L. is a housewife while her husband is a motorbike repairman, earning an income of about 6 USD per day.  Each month, the family has to spend 60 USD on food and 37 USD on other necessary expenses. L. is requesting a loan of 500 USD to purchase a tuk-tuk for her husband to provide transportation services for tourists. This will be her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner.

loans.use: to buy tuk tuk to provide transportation services for tourists.

loans.name: Hector

texts.en:
Hector N. is from the village of Yumbing, Mambajao, Camiguin Province. He is 50 years old. Hector is married and has four adult-aged children. To make a living, he owns and operates a specialized retail store, selling seafood products, including fish like milk fish, sardines and mackerel. He uses his motorcycle in delivering and selling in the local community. Hector has been engaged in his business for over nine years and earns approximately $175 a month for these activities.

In 2010, Hector joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. He has successfully repaid a previous loan of 9,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. 

Hector is requesting a new loan of 4,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional fish to sell, like sardines and milk fish. This will be his 4th loan from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated to expand his business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional fish to sell.

loans.name: Liduvinda Elizabeth

texts.es:
Liduvinda de 31 años, es casada pero todavía no tiene hijos, tiene casa propia donde vive con su esposo, la cual no cuenta con los servicios básicos, en la zona rural del distrito de Olmos a una hora del departamento de Lambayeque.  Los pobladores de esta zona se dedican a la agricultura y ganadería.

El esposo de  Lidivuinda  labora manejando su mototaxi (transporte que se utiliza para movilizarse en distancias cortas, con un cupo máximo de 3 personas) desde hace algunos años, está actividad lo realiza en su mismo distrito y a los caseríos cercanos.  Ambas actividades le permite tener más ingresos para cubrir sus gastos diarios. 

El crédito que ha solicitado a Edpyme Alternativa es de 1500 nuevos soles y su destino será para brindarle mantenimiento y cambiar algunos repuestos de sumototaxi,para seguir brindando un servicio de calidad, seguridad y comdidad a sus clientes.  Liduvinda tiene como meta en un futuro poder comprar otra mototaxi para alquilarla y tener mejores ingresos económicos, para poder cubrir su crédito y desea que su negocio crezca cada vez más para tener una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Liduvinda, 31, is married but doesn't have any children yet.  She lives with her husband in their own house, but the house doesn't have basic services.  They live in the rural area of Olmos, an hour from Lambayeque department where the people work in agriculture and cattle raising.

Liduvinda's husband has driven a mototaxi (a means of transportation to move people short distances with a maximum load of 3 passangers) for some years in the same district and in nearby villages.  This allows them to have more income to cover expenses.

She is requesting a loan from Edpyme Alternativa of 1500 new sols for vehicle maintenance and to change some parts in the sumototaxi so that he can continue giving quality service, safety, and comfort to his customers.  Liduvinda's goal for the future is to buy another mototaxi to rent and to have increased earnings to cover the loan.  She also wants her business to grow even more so that they have a better quality of life.

loans.use: to have maintenance and to change out some spare parts on the mototaxi.

loans.name: Anifel

texts.en:
Anifel is 29 years old and married with one child. She works hard to provide for her family. For the past five years, Anifel has run a sari-sari (general) store in the Philippines. She also earns an income from farming vegetables.

Anifel is requesting a 25,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy products such as shampoo, groceries, and other items to sell. She has successfully repaid eight previous loans from NWTF. 

Anifel aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items such as shampoo and groceries to sell

loans.name: Darlyn

texts.en:
Darlyn is 26 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with one child. 

Darlyn is providing motorcycle or habal-habal services and her husband is the driver. She has had this business for three years. She requested a loan for PHP 10,000 to buy tools & pay for the utilities needed for the maintenance of the service.

Darlyn has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Darlyn hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy tools & pay for the utilities

loans.name: Jose

texts.es: José, de 62 años, es un hombre muy amable y sencillo, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposa Sarela, de 57 años y está dispuesto a trabajar muy duro con tal de mejorar su calidad de vida. Para José recorrer con su taxi las calles de la ciudad de Pucallpa constituye su forma de ganarse la vida, él sale todos los días en busca de personas que deseen llegar de manera rápida y segura a su destino. Por lo general siempre ofrece el servicio nunca le falta trabajo, generándose muchas ganancias.  Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es manejar por las calles de Pucallpa, lleva 25 años en esta actividad, los cual le ha servido para conocer cada calle de esta ciudad. Espera en el futuro comprar un taxi nuevo y ponerlo a trabajar en la misma empresa, lo más difícil para José es tener que trabajar de madrugada, ya que lo peligroso de la ciudad hace que las largas noches sean terribles. Es el tercer crédito con MFP, sabe que tiene que pagar todas sus cuotas a tiempo y esta dispuesto a hacerlo, en su banco comunal es muy responsable, ya que no quiere causarle problemas a sus socias. Los mil nuevos soles solicitados, los invertirá en arreglar su taxi, para así poder brindarle un mejor servicio a sus clientes.
texts.en: José is 62 years old. He is a very kind and humble man. He lives in his own home with his wife Sarela, who is 57 years old. He is willing to work very hard in order to improve his life. For José, driving the streets of the city of Pucallpa is the way he makes his living. He goes out everyday looking for people who need a quick and safe way to get to their destination. In general, he always offers his service and never lacks work, generating a lot of income. What he likes the most about his job is driving the streets of Pucallpa. He has been doing this activity for 25 years, with which he has been able to get to know every street in this city. In the future he hopes to buy a new taxi and work it in the same business. The hardest thing for José is having to get up in the early morning, since the danger of the city makes the long nights terrible. This is his third loan with MFP. He knows that he has to make all of his payments on time and he is willing to do this. He is very responsible in his community bank, since he doesn't want to cause his partners any trouble. The thousand nuevos soles he has asked for he will invest in fixing his taxi in order to offer his customers a better service.

loans.use: to do maintenance on his vehicle.

loans.name: Thao

texts.en:
Thao is 36 years old, married and has a daughter. She lives in Ho Chi Minh City.
Thao and her husband earn a living by making clothes. Thao intends to take a loan to buy an overlocking machine, fabric and materials. This will enable her to make a greater range of clothing to better meet her customers' needs. Thao hopes that her business will run smoothly and will help her to improve her living conditions and send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy an overlocking machine, fabrics and materials.

loans.name: Ainagul's Group

texts.en: Ainagul, 57, is the leader of this group. Being born and spending her whole lifetime in the town of Kochkor, she has the spirit of a true Kyrgyz farmer in her. Her husband is a member of a farming committee and helps her in the fattening and selling of cattle. The couple started this business with the purpose of having an additional source of income four years ago. Since then, most of their profit has been put into purchasing more young calves for further fattening and selling. The initial investment for founding the business was 10,000 soms. The period of return was quite fast, because the monthly revenue sums up to 5,000 soms. The purpose of this loan is to purchase additional livestock for further fattening and selling. ====================================== Where Did This Loan Come From? This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young and ambitious socially-focused microfinance institution in Kyrgyzstan. MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135. If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and micro-finance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan - Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from the Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase livestock.

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.es:
Yolanda es oriunda de la ciudad de Bogotá donde los tejidos son tradicionales, fue allí y desde muy niña que aprendió al lado de su hermana a elaborar diferentes productos tejidos en máquina. Allí durante muchos años trabajó con su familia quienes además comercializaban. 

Después de separarse de su esposa, esta emprendedora se trasladó a la ciudad de Medellín donde inició con su propio negocio, es así como espera mejorar su calidad de vida y ofrecerle un mejor futuro a su hija con la que actualmente vive. 

Yolanda necesita de un préstamo para realizarle mantenimiento a su máquina tejedora y comprar insumos, así podrá mejorar su producción, ofrecer mayor variedad de producción e incrementar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
Yolanda is from the city of Bogotá, where woven items are traditional.  It was there that, as a very young girl, she learned, at her sister’s side, to make different woven items by machine.  That is where she worked for many years with her family; they also sold the items.

After separating from her husband this enterprising woman moved to the city of Medellín, where she started her own business.  This is how she hopes to improve her quality of life and to provide her daughter, who she currently lives with, a better future.

Yolanda needs the loan for maintenance on her weaving machine.  She will also buy supplies.  This way she will be able to improve her production, offer a greater variety of items, and increase her income.

loans.use: to repair her weaving machine and to buy supplies.

loans.name: Hanifa

texts.en:
Hanifa   lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with two children and both go to school. She has no additional family members. She sells hardware retail from a rented shop. She been in business for the last seven years. She works seven days a week. 

Hanifa has requested a loan of 500,000 from MCDT SACCO to buy cement, nails, locks, and iron sheets. Her inspirational goal is to expand into a wholesale hardware shop. Her major business challenges include transportation and ever increasing prices of building materials. She lives in a rented house and her family has access to piped water and electricity. Her monthly expenses include rent and food.

loans.use: To buy more bags of cement, nails, locks and iron sheets.

loans.name: Juana Yessenia

texts.es:
EL Banco Comunal Buenas Amiga se reúne cada quince días en el Cantón Montecristi, conocido por su rica cultura pre colonial y por su artesanía que es reconocida a nivel nacional e internacional. Lugar de los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla.

La señora Juana es socia fundadora del Banco comunal, es la fiscal de pagos y le gusta por las facilidades para conseguir los créditos. Tiene 31 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tiene dos hijos de 11 y 2 años de edad, el mayor estudia en  escuela. Su esposo es maestro albañil.

Nuestra amiga para ganar algo de dinero por su cuenta y con esto colaborar con los gastos que genera el hogar se dedica a la venta de ropa de todo tipo, su forma de  venta es puerta a puerta y también vende en su  casa hasta donde llegan sus clientes. Trabaja tres días a la semana fuera de casa y todos los días en la misma, deja a crédito a sus clientes  y cobra cada quince días. Su mercadería  la va a comprar a  Guayaquil cada vez que necesita. Tiene tres años que se dedica a esta actividad y le va muy bien.

Este crédito lo va emplear en comprar más mercadería como: pantalones, blusas, camisetas y ropa de niños. 

Su sueño es darles lo mejor a sus hijos.
texts.en:
The “Buenas Amigas” (Good Friends) Communal Bank meets every two weeks in the Montecristi Canton.  The Montecristi Canton is known for its rich pre-colonial culture and for its handicrafts, which are known both nationally and internationally. It is the home of the famous Panama hat.

Juana is a founding member of the communal bank.  She is the bank’s Payments Overseer, and she likes the bank because of the ease of getting loans.

She is 31 years old and married.  They have two children, ages 11 and 2.  The older child goes to school.  Her husband is a master bricklayer.

In order for our friend to earn some money on her own and help with the household expenses, she sells all types of clothing.  She sells door to door, and she also sells at her house, where her customers come.  She works away from home three days a week, and all of the days are the same.  She gives credit to her customers, and she collects every two weeks.  

She goes to Guayaquil every time she needs to buy merchandise.  She has been in this business for three years, and it is going very well for her.

She will use this loan to buy more merchandise like pants, blouses, t-shirts, and children’s clothes.

Her dream is to give the best to her children.

loans.use: to buy pants, blouses, t-shirts, and children’s clothes.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is a hard-working businessman who is twenty-nine years old. He is married and blessed with one child.  

For the last year, he has been selling clothing to earn a living. He has grown his business through the financial support of Faulu Kenya. 

He is requesting a loan of 15,000 Kenyan shillings to buy shirts and blouses.

loans.use: To buy shirts and blouses.

loans.name: Gregoria

texts.es:
Gregoria D. 54 años D. edad, vive con su familia en su casa propia, la cual cuenta con servicio D. agua y luz, ubicada en el distrito D. Cayaltí que pertenece a la provincia D. Chiclayo.   Esta zona se dedica a la agricultura y ganadería.

Gregoria desD. hace 8 años se dedica a la crianza y venta D. animales D. corral (cerdos y aves D. corral), su corral se encuentra en la parte posterior D. su casa, los cuales son apropiados y amplios, los alimenta con comida balanceada para que sus animales lleguen a tener un crecimiento óptimo para poderlos ofrecer en los diferentes mercados D. la zona y así obtenga buenas ganancias para solventar sus gastos D. su hogar.

Ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa D. 1000 nuevos soles  para la compra D. más animales y alimento balanceado, con las ganancias que obtenga por la venta D. sus animales podrá cubrir su crédito como brindarle una mejor calidad D. vida para su familia.  Gregoria es una mujer que con esfuerzo y dedicación trata D. brindarles lo mejor a su familia.
texts.en:
54-year-old Gregoria lives with her family in her own home which has piped water and electricity.  It is located in Cayaltí district, in Chiclayo province.  The people in this area farm and raise livestock.

For eight years, Gregoria has been raising and selling farmyard animals (pigs and poultry).  Her pens are located behind her home and they are suitable and spacious.  She feeds her animals with nutritionally-balanced animal feed so that they reach an optimal level of growth and she is able to sell them in the different markets in her area.  This makes her good profits with which she covers her household expenses.

Gregoria has requested a loan for 1,000 soles from Edpyme Alternativa to buy more animals and nutritionally-balanced feed for them.  She will use the profits that she makes from selling her animals to repay her loan and proviD. her family with a better quality of life.  Gregoria is a woman who, through her efforts and commitment, tries to proviD. her family with the best.

loans.use: to buy more animals of different species and feed for them

loans.name: Gemma

texts.en:
Gemma wants to see her business grow, and that’s why she is asking for a loan of PHP 7,000 that will make it possible for her to buy products such as coffee, sugar, soft drinks and assorted biscuits to sell. She hopes that her work will provide her with the opportunity to provide her family with better living conditions.

Gemma is engaged in a general store business. She is 46 years old, married and has been blessed with five children. For her, the best way to reach her personal goals is through dedication to her work without forgetting about being happy all the time.

loans.use: to buy products such as coffee, sugar, soft drinks and assorted biscuits to sell.

loans.name: Dolly Benedicta

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Portoviejo, capital de Manabí conocida desde hace muchos años  como la ciudad de los Reales Tamarindos, se reúnen cada quince días  las socias del Banco Comunal Alfa.

En este lugar vive la señora Dolly, tiene 35 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene cuatro  hijos de 15, 12, 8 y 6 años de edad,  los dos mayores estudian en colegio y los menores en escuela. El marido trabaja en un taller mecánico. 

Ella  tiene una tienda de comestibles en su casa en la cual vende todo tipo de productos, como arroz, azúcar, aceites, detergentes, etc. allí trabaja todos los días desde las 6am hasta las 17h00. En las noches ella trabaja con un cuñado en una pizzería, por lo cual recibe un sueldo mensual, mientras esta en este trabajo son  sus hijas y su esposo los que atienden su tienda. Su negocio lo tiene ya hace  cinco años y con los créditos lo ha ido mejorando dia a dia.

Este crédito lo va a emplear en surtir mas su tienda, va a comprar arroz, azúcar, aceite, detergentes, embutidos y otros productos de primera necesidad. Está en el Banco Comunal hace 4 años y le gusta porque con los créditos ha podido aumentar su negocio. 

Su sueño es tener la mejor tienda de su localidad.
texts.en:
In the city of Portoviejo, capital of Manabí, known for many years as the City of the Royal Tamarinds, the members of the Alfa communal bank meet every two weeks.  Dolly, 35, lives here.  She’s in a common law relationship and has four children who are 15, 12, 8 and 6 years of age.  The two oldest go to secondary school and the two youngest are in elementary school.  Her husband works in a repair shop.

She has a home-based grocery store where she sells all sorts of products like rice, sugar, oil, detergent, etc.  She works there every day from 6am until 5pm.  At night she works with a brother-in-law in a pizzeria and earns a monthly salary.  While she’s at this job her husband and daughters tend to the store.  She’s had her business for five years now and the loans have helped her improve it day to day. She will use this loan to increase the store's stock inventory.  She is going to buy rice, sugar, oil, detergent, cured meats and other staple items.  

She’s been in the communal bank four years and likes it because she’s been able to enlarge her business thanks to the loans.  Her dream is to have the best store in her neighborhood.

loans.use: to buy stock merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Hamamaoko Group

texts.en:
Chengetai is 47 years old. She is married and has two children aged 11 and 7 years old and they both go to school. 

She operates a flea market stand and has been in the business for five years. Her flea market stand is located at a Market in town. She has one employee. She travels to South Africa to purchase her goods. 

With the loan she would like to buy clothes, shoes, and towels to restock her market. She faces a challenge of fluctuation in the exchange rates when converting from US$ to Rands. In the next five years, she would like to own her own shop to sell  her goods from. She will also be able to provide for her children's needs and wants to give them a better education with the profits from the business.

loans.use: to purchase clothes, shoes and towels.

loans.name: Temakho B Group

texts.en:
Greetings from Temakho B Group in Western Kenya! Janerose is the facilitator of the Temakho B group. This  group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

Janerose  takes care of eight children at home. She joined One Acre Fund in order to access fertilizer and hybrid seeds and ensure food security for her family. In the recent 2011 season, Janerose had an excellent maize yield, harvesting 14 bags on 1/2 acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Janerose was only able to harvest 7 bags of maize on 1/2 acre of land.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Janerose  and her group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

With income from maize sales, Janerose will educate her children and invest in livestock rearing.

In 2012, the members of Temakho B group will each plant between ½ and 1 acre of maize.

The photograph shows the members of the group.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Celina

texts.es:
Celina nació en la ciudad de Ollantaytambo pero actualmente ella vive en la ciudad de Urubamba, ella tiene 24 años de edad y es soltera. 

Celina desarrolla sus actividades cotidianas y económicas en la ciudad de Urubamba, ella ha estudiado técnico en farmacia en uno de los mejores institutos de la ciudad del Cusco y vio la oportunidad de abrir una botica en la ciudad de Urubamba, ella tiene una pequeña botica donde vende diferentes medicamentos, perfumes, cremas, jarabes, pañales, leche martena, vitaminas y otras cosas. Ya son 11 meses que se dedica al negocio y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo. 

Celina requiere el préstamo para comprar mercadería como por ejemplo medicamentos, pastillas, jarabes y otras cosas más. 

Celina se encuentra agradecido por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma. Celina pertenece al banco comunal “Señor de Choquekillca” de la Asociación Arariwa de la ciudad de Urubamba.
texts.en:
Celina was born in the city of Ollantaytambo but currently lives in the city of Urubamba. She is 24 years old and is single.

She conducts her daily financial activities in the city of Urubamba. She has gone into pharmacy technician studies in one of the best institutes of the city of Cusco and she saw the opportunity to open a pharmacy in the town of Urubamba. 

She has a small pharmacy where she sells different medicines, perfumes, creams, syrups, diapers, baby formula, vitamins and other things. She has been doing this for 11 months and it is going very well thanks to the effort she puts into her work.

Celina is asking for a loan in order to buy merchandise such as medicines, pills, syrups and other items.

Celina is grateful for the opportunity given by this loan and at the same time she promises to make her payment in accordance with the schedule. Celina belongs to the communal bank Señor de Choquekillca of the Asociación Arariwa of the city of Urubamba.

loans.use: to buy merchandise such as medicines, pills, syrups and other items

loans.name: Kwekwe

texts.en:
Kwekwe is a married woman with two children, both of whom attend school. She owns a house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For the past eight years, she has operated a food cafe business, selling at the market to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of high cost of transportation in her business. She dreams of expanding her business in the future.

With the Kshs 30,000, she wants to purchase milk, coffee and snacks for her cafe business. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase milk, coffee and snacks for her cafe business.

loans.name: Arturo

texts.en:
Arturo is from Gango, Ozamiz City. He is 45 years old. Arturo is married and has one school-aged child. 

To make a living, he owns and operates a business selling buko juice (young coconut water). He has been engaged in his business for 4 years and earns 15,000 PHP a month from these activities. 

In 2009, Arturo joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Arturo is requesting a new loan of 35,000 PHP which will be used to purchase the raw ingredients needed to make his product. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of his family.

loans.use: to purchase the raw ingredients needed to make his product

loans.name: Farhodjon

texts.ru: Фарходчон жизнерадостный и трудолюбивый мужчина в возрасте 33 лет. Он женат и имеет одного детей. Фарходчон живёт со своей семьёй в маленькой деревушке. Он с юных лет работает вместе со своим отцом на поле, учился пасти скот. С тех пор он многому научился и сейчас сам занимается таким же делом. Чтобы иметь постоянный доход на пропитание,  Фарходчон занимается своим бизнесом. Он занимается откормом и продажей крупного рогатого скота. От данного дела он получает хороший доход. Жена также помогает  Фарходчону в его деле, она продаёт молоко, полученное от скота. Сейчас  Фарходчон хочет увеличить количество скота для расширения своего бизнеса. Поэтому он обратился в Арванд и хочет получить кредит на покупку скота. Фарходчон очень надеется на положительный результат и заранее благодарит Арванд за поддержку.
texts.en:
Farhodjon is a cheerful and hardworking 33 year old man. He is married and has one child. Farhodjon lives with his family in a small village. From a young age, he has been working with his father in the fields, and he learned to graze cattle. Since then, he has learned a lot, and now he works in the very same business himself. 

In order to have a constant income for sustenance, Farhodjon is engaged in his own business. He fattens up and sells cattle. From this business he receives a good income. Farhodjon's wife also helps him in this business. She sells milk received from the cattle. 

Now Farhodjon wants to increase the number of cattle, in order to expand his business. Thus he has applied to Arvand for a loan to buy cattle. Farhodjon hopes very much for a positive outcome and thanks Arvand in advance for the support.

loans.use: to buy cattle.

loans.name: Nelly

texts.en:
Nelly has been doing mixed farming for many years and has grown the value of her farm tremendously. She was raised in the North Rift area of Kenya, where she now lives with her husband and 3 children. The income she makes from selling her produce complements her husband's teaching salary.
 
Currently, she is trying to gather capital to secure more land to cultivate and produce more food that will give her family a decent diet and better income. She loves to feed people and that is why she finds her business fulfilling. Your loan will help her elevate her livelihood by producing more food for her family and others in the community.

loans.use: to buy a plot of land

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more motorcycles for boda-boda

loans.name: Komi

texts.en:
Komi A. was born into an impoverished family in Tsevie in 1977. After a few years of schooling, he decided to become an apprentice cobbler and learn shoe repair. His apprenticeship completed, he has become one of the best cobblers in his area. His work is of excellent quality, but since he lacks the necessary materials he is not really able to satisfy his clientele. Earning very little from his work, he is having a hard time supporting his family, his wife having neither job skills nor money to open a small retail business.

In order to increase his earnings, he is asking for a loan of $950 which will permit him to restock his shoe business in such materials as leather, soles, buckles, and even to buy some machines to make his work easier. With the increased earnings, he hopes to be able to help his wife start up a small retail business and thus improve living conditions for the whole family.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, KIVA volunteer

Monsieur A. Komi est né à Tsévié en 1977 dans une famille pauvre. Après quelques années d’études, il a décidé d’apprendre un métier. Devenu cordonnier, il fait de très bon travail et se positionne comme l’un des meilleurs cordonniers de la place. Ses produits sont de très bonnes qualités, mais faute de moyens, il n’arrive pas à satisfaire ses clients. Avec son revenu faible, il lui est difficile de faire face aux charges de la famille car son épouse n’a pas de métier, ni de moyens pour faire un quelconque commerce.

Pour renforcer son activité et son revenu, il sollicite un crédit de $ 950 qui va lui permettre de se ravitailler en matériel de travail tels que le cuir, semelle, boucles et même certaines machines pour faciliter le travail. Ainsi avec le revenu il pourra aider son épouse à faire de petit commerce et améliorer les conditions de vie de toute la famille.

loans.use: Purchase of material necessary for his work  (S'approvisionner en matériels de travail)

loans.name: Pedro

texts.en:
Pedro has 14 years experience in the production of insecticides, following work with friends who made their living to support their families with this type of business. For 13 years, Pedro has taken on this business to make a living for himself and his family. His business is in his home, producing insecticides per client request. Pedro works 6 days a week, at which time he produces and delivers his product. The insecticides are used to kill rodents, cockroaches, ants, mosquitoes, and other. His wife helps him with the sales at home as neighbors purchase his product.

Pedro is applying for a loan to buy raw material and to make labels. He indicates that his sales have grown and that his current income does not cover for the increase in client demand.

Pedro is 47 years old and has four children who study. His wife helps in the business and considers that the loan will increase her husband’s income which will benefit their home and help meet his responsibilities.

Translated from Spanish by Martha Martinez, Kiva Volunteer.

Pedro tiene experiencia en elaboración de insecticidas 14 años porque trabajaba con unos amigos que tenían de sustento para sus familia este negocio. Desde hace 13 años Pedro tomo también este negocio como medio de vida para el y su familia. Su negocio esta ubicado en su casa produciendo insecticidas sobre pedidos. Pedro labora 6 días a la semana tiempo en que los produce y los entrega. Sus insecticidas son para matar roedores, cucarachas, hormigas, mosquitos y otros. Su esposa lo ayuda en la venta en casa porque vecinos le compra.

Pedro solicita crédito para compra de materia prima y elaboración de etiquetas. Indica además que sus ventas han aumentado y con capital que tiene no cubre la demanda de sus clientes.

Pedro tiene 47 años 4 hijos todos estudian. Su esposa lo apoya en su negocio y considera que con el préstamo su esposo generara más ingresos para beneficio de su hogar y poder cumplir con sus responsabilidades.

loans.use:
To buy raw material for the production of his product/ 
Comprar materia prima para la elaboracion de su producto

loans.name: Hugo

texts.es:
Mr. S. is a married man and the father of 4 children, two of whom are attending the university. He has over 15 years of experience in radiator repair. He is requesting this loan to invest in the maintenance and repair of his location, with the objective of making it look better to attract more customers. He also told us he will invest part of it in tools and materials which will help with his daily work (pipe, aluminum, glue, etc.)

(Translated from the Spanish by Naomi Johnson, Kiva volunteer)

El Sr. S. es un hombre casado y padre de 4 hijos, dos de los cuales está asistiendo a la universidad, tiene más de quince años de experiencia en la reparación de radiadores y está solicitando el crédito para invertirlo en el mantenimiento y reparación de su local, con el objetivo de darle un amejor presentación y atraer más clientes. Nos comentó también que invertirá una parte en herraminetas y materiales que le faciliten sus labores diarias (soplete, aluminio, pega, etc.)

loans.use: This loan will be invested in the repair and maintenance of his location, and in the purchase of tools and materials which will help him in his daily work.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Expand his Tailoring Business

loans.name: Chheang

texts.en: Mrs. Chheang H., age 36, runs a small stand at her home selling grocery products, earning about $2 per day. Her husband works as a driver for a company earning about $3 per day. They have three children, two who are students and one infant. She would like to request a loan of $600 in order to purchase a greater variety of products to meet her customers’ demands. Increasing her inventory will allow her to diversify her business and increase revenue. She plans to use the resulting additional income to help fund her children’s education and reinvest in her business.

loans.use: To purchase a greater variety of inventory for her grocery store

loans.name: Graciela

texts.es:
Graciela is a skilful artist whose hands produce fine work and beautiful carpets, together with her loyal partner. She has been working at this worthy occupation ever since she was a little girl, when her family passed on to her all of their knowledge about the art of weaving. They also taught her basic criteria for combining colors, which now helps her produce high quality and finely finished goods. She has some export projects and has begun the necessary paperwork for this, as she has accumulated orders from several establishments that want products to sell.

The business’s continual progress fills her with satisfaction. Day by day they innovate their designs and try to apply new weaving techniques to their cloaks and carpets. With that same spirit of innovation they now produce produce shawls and cloaks for babies using alpaca and cotton fibers. Their work is of such excellent quality that it is in high demand and they make goods only by request. All of their efforts are motivated by the desires of their four children, who are committed to the family business and want to study administration, finance and exporting with the goal of making the business more competitive.

Graciela is asking for a loan to invest in the purchase of materials to continue producing carpets and other goods, and with the earnings will be able to satisfy the needs and desires of her children. In addition, she would like to build on to her house to expand the workshop where they weave. Let’s support this artistic couple so they can continue making progress and holding onto their dreams of success.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva Volunteer.

Graciela, es una hábil artista, sus manos producen finos trabajos y produce bellas alfombras en compañía de su fiel compañero; este digno oficio viene desempeñándolo desde muy niña ya que su familia le dejó como herencia todos los conocimientos en el arte del tejido a telar, así mismo la dotó de los criterios básicos para la combinación de colores que ahora le sirven para tener una producción de excelente calidad y finos acabados; es por esta razón que tiene proyectos de exportación y ha iniciado los trámites necesarios y ha acumulado los pedidos de varias instituciones que quieren estos productos a fin de capitalizar su inversión.El constante progreso de su negocio la llena de satisfacción y día a día innovan sus diseños y tratan de aplicar nuevas técnicas de tejido en sus mantos y alfombras, ahora también por esa mística de innovación producen chales y mantas para bebés con fibra de alpaca y algodón; sus trabajos son tan finos que son bien cotizados y ellos atienden sólo pedidos. Todos estos esfuerzos son motivados por los deseos de sus cuatro hijos, quienes comprometidos con la empresa familiar desean estudiar carreras afines a la administración, finanzas y exportación con el objetivo de convertirlo en un negocio más competitivo. Graciela solicita un préstamo para invertirlos en la compra de insumos para seguir elaborando las alfombras y demás artículos, con las ganancias podrá satisfacer las necesidades y deseos de sus hijos y además construirá parte de su casa para ampliar su taller de tejidos a telar.Apoyemos a esta pareja de artistas para que sigan progresando y atesorando en su corazón deseos de superación.

loans.use: Purchase of materials for weaving.

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
Mrs. A. sells vegetables such as: yucca, quiquisque (hybrid potato and yucca plant), hard squash, chayote (prickly pear or christophine), onions, tomatoes, and potatoes. This business is the economic base that supports her family and she started it 10 years ago with all her savings.

At first she was a traveling saleswoman, selling her vegetables in bus terminals and from one side to the other at the market until a year ago when she asked for a loan from CEPRODEL. This loan allowed her to establish a locale that, although it may not have the best conditions, at least keeps her from being a traveling saleswoman.

Consider that this financial help has been the economic pillar that has allowed the development of her business and improved the quality of life of her family. She hopes to improve the conditions of her locale little by little.

Translated from Spanish by Lizella West, Kiva volunteer.

La Sra. A. se dedica a la venta de verduras tales como: yuca, quiquisque, ayote, chayote, cebolla, tomate, papa. Este negocio es la base económica donde se sustenta su familia y en el cual decide invertir hace 10 años todos sus ahorros.

Inicia su negocio ambulante ofreciendo sus verduras en la terminales de buses y de un lado a otro en el mercado hasta que decide hace un año el solicitar financiamiento y es por medio del apoyo de CEPRODEL que ha logrado el establecerse en un un local que aunque no tiene las mejores condiciones por lo menos ya no anda ambulante.

Considera que el apoyo financiero ha sido el pilar económico que la ha permitido el desarrollo de su negocio y a mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia y espera ir mejorando las condiciones de su local poco a poco.

loans.use: To buy merchandise.

loans.name: Francisca

texts.es:
It’s been four years since Francisca began making traditional candies, which are very successful in her locale as there are many tourists who like her product. Since she started, her production has grown which is very gratifying to Francisca given that she can use her earnings toward her children’s education.

Francisca believes now is a key time to attempt to increase her production. For this reason, she is asking for a loan of $925USD to be repaid over a period of six months. With these funds, she will be able to buy nuts and other ingredients necessary for her to make her confections. With your help, Francisca will be able to grow her business so that her children can complete a university degree.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn, Kiva Volunteer.

Hace 4 años que Francisca se dedica a elaborar dulces tradicionales los cuales tienen éxito en su localidad, puesto que muchos turistas que pasan por su localidad les gusta mucho este producto. Desde que comenzó su producción ha ido incrementando y esto es muy grato para Francisca puesto que con el dinero que saca puede pagar los gastos de la educación de sus hijos.

Francisca considera que este momento es el más pertinente para incrementar su producción, es por eso que está solicitando un crédito de US $925 que está dispuesta a pagarlos en un plazo de 6 meses y con este dinero Francisca podrá comprar nueces, piloncillo y todo lo necesario para elaborar estos dulces. Con tu ayuda Francisca podrá crecer para que sus hijos puedan terminar una carrera universitaria.

loans.use: Purchase ingredients for making traditional candies/sweets.

loans.name: Franci

texts.es:
Franci works cultivating banana plantations. This activity helps to support his family. He is dedicated 100% to his cultivation of banana plantations that he acquired with a lot of effort and sacrifice. His lands under cultivation require a lot of care and clearing to favor the development and growth of his fruit trees. Due to this he needs supplements and fertilizer and also tools for the clearing of his lands. With your aid he will be able to compile the amount that he requests to acquire what he needs so much.

Translated from Spanish by B, Kiva Volunteer.

Franci es dedica al cultivo de platanales, esta actividad le ayuda al sostén de su familia. Él está dedicado al 100% a sus cultivos de platanales que adquirió con mucho esfuerzo y sacrificio y cuyos terrenos de cultivo requieren de muchos cuidados y limpieza que propicien un desarrollo y crecimiento de sus frutales y debido a ello necesita de abonos y fertilizantes y también herramientas para la limpieza de sus terrenos.Con vuestra ayuda podrá recopilar la cantidad que solicita para adquirir lo que tanta falta le hace.

loans.use: To buy agricultural supplements, fertilizer and tools.

loans.name: Ourk

texts.en: Mrs. Ourk P. is a subsistence farmer and fish seller in Kompong Por Village, Cambodia. She is 37 years old and the mother of a child enrolled in a local school. Her husband, Ra Chhay, is a fisherman who typically earns about $3.50 a day. Additionally, Mrs. Ourk usually works on a cultivatable field which is next to the village.  In oder to make her land more fertile, Mrs. Ourk requests a loan of $175 to buy fertilizer and fuel for her pump.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and fuel for her pump.

loans.name: Shirjana

texts.en:
Mrs Shirjana L. lives in Dhalko, Kathmandu. She lives in a single family with her husband Mr Manoj L. and one daughter. Her husband is a security officer and her daughter is in primary school.

Mrs L. opened a grocery shop two years ago to uplift the living standard of her family. Their condition is not good, so they can't provide a better education for her daughter. In Nepal the cost of education is very high comparative to the income. To overcome this problem she opens grocery shop.

Due to lack of funds she can’t buy goods in her shop. So she is asking for her first loan of Rs 10000.00 to buy goods like rice, dal, noodles, and other items. She intends to spend the income to provide better education for her daughter and to help her husband upgrade the quality of life of their family.

loans.use: To buy grocery items for her shop

loans.name: Assaad

texts.en:
Assaad is 30 years old and lives and works in Saida, southern Lebanon. Assaad is in the scrap business and also works as a taxi driver to make ends meet.

This is the second time he is applying for a loan from A. Majmoua because he needs to buy materiA. to sustain his scrap business.

loans.use: To buy scrap material

loans.name: Vitalyi

texts.en:
Vitalyi is married with a one-year-old son. He lives in Ivano-Frankivsk. Vitalyi used to work as a cook and a bartender, but he decided to start a new business that could provide him with higher income and a flexible working schedule. This is why Vitalyi became a taxi driver. Today he offers transportation services in Ukraine. It is the only source of income for the family. He uses walkie-talkies to get to different locations on time and it helps him serve more clients in less time. Vitalyi has been in this business for four years. Currently, his daily income is about $40-50.

Vitalyi is requesting a loan of 3000 Grivnas to purchase an engine that would work on gas. He believes this change will help him save money on diesel, as the new type of fuel is a lot cheaper. Vitalyi is hoping to repay the loan in 8 months. We believe his perseverance in work and desire to see her business succeed will guarantee prompt loan repayment and consistent growth of his venture.

loans.use: To install gas system equipment.

loans.name: Santo Tomas Group

texts.es:
Mrs. Eugenia A. actively participated in the creation of the current group. She lives in zone B° Sto. Tomas – Pte Franco, and she contacted her neighbors and friends in order to create the group in the zone. The group is made up of 18 women from the same zone. They participate in businesses by selling clothing, foodstuffs, cosmetics, household items and other basic needs. The women took a loan of 300.000 C/U (Paraguayan currency). They will use this credit to buy clothing, cosmetics, fabrics, and other items in other to sell them.

About Group Loans In a group loan, each member of the group receives an individual loan but is part of a group of individuals bound by a group guarantee. Under this arrangement, each member of the group supports one another and is responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. Learn more

Translated from Spanish by Sandy Juárez, Kiva volunteer.

Para la formación del presente comité participo activamente la señora Eugenia A., ella vive en la zona del B° Sto. Tomas – Pte Franco, la misma contacto con sus vecinas y amigas para formar el comité en la zona. El comité esta constituido por 18 señoras, todas de la misma zona, las señoras tienen actividades como venta de ropas, comestible, cosméticos, despensa y otros.
