Las señoras retiran un crédito de 300.000 C/U. Ellas Utilizan el crédito para la compra de ropas, cosméticos, telas, artículo de primera necesidad y otros para su posterior venta.

loans.use: To buy clothing, material, cosmetics, oil, flour, basic need products and others.

loans.name: Eloy

texts.es:
Eloy Yuira M. owns his home in the Lomas district, a suburban area of La Paz. He is married and has three children. Eloy works as a driver in a city construction company and his wife does embroidery work for a traditional costume shop. They requested a loan for building a bedroom on the second floor of their home. This is the first time they are requesting a loan. The socio-economic analysis Impro has conducted qualifies them for a loan.

Translated from Spanish by Todd M. Anderson

El señor Eloy Y. M. tiene casa propia en la zona de las Lomas, área suburbana de La Paz. Eloy esta casado y tiene tres hijos. Su ocupación es la de chofer en una constructora de la ciudad y su esposa realiza bordados para una tienda de trajes folklóricos. Solicitaron un préstamo para la construcción de una habitación en el segundo nivel de su vivienda. Esta es la primera vez que solicitan préstamo y el análisis socioeconómico realizado los califica favorablemente y pueden acceder a un crédito.

loans.use: Bedroom construction

loans.name: Amina

texts.en:
Amina is 34 years old. She is married with 5 children aged between 18 and 4 years old. She has been a tailoring, soap and firewood seller since 2004. Every day, she works from 6am to 6pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $175 from her sales.

In the past, Amina has taken out one successful loan from BRAC Tanzania to expand her business. Amina is now looking for a loan to add items to her current stock.

loans.use: To add items to her current stock

loans.name: Nordin

texts.en:
Nordin is an old man with lots of experience, though he is uneducated. He works in agriculture and has been involved in this business for more than 30 years, working with his family during this time. He has some land, but he would love to have more. To buy more land, he needs extra money. Therefore, he requested an individual loan of 50000 Afghani to buy new land and start growing.

He is a professional man and, from when he started his business, he always wanted to improve his business. In the town where he lives, when any of the agricultural men face any difficulties, they come and ask Nordin to help with their problems.

He is grateful for this loan process. He wants to say that it is his first loan and it is really great, especially for agriculture workers. He wants to continue his partnership and encourage other workers to use this loan service.

loans.use: To buy new land and start growing

loans.name: Rita

texts.fr: Rita N., 56 ans, mariée, 04 enfants scolarisés en charge est membre du banc villageois de Médina Plateau depuis 7 ans et demi. Elle veut un prêt pour renforcer son commerce de boisson et rendre sa buvette plus rentable. Ses revenus lui permettent d’aider à améliorer l’entretien de sa famille et la scolarisation des enfants. Le prêt qu’elle sollicite sera remboursé au bout de six mois en une seule échéance.
texts.en:
Rita N., age 56, is married and has four children in school to look after. She has been a member of the village loan group Médina Plateau for seven and a half years. She wants a loan to boost her commerce in beverages and to make her beverages stand more profitable. Her income enables her to help take care of her family and the schooling of the children. The loan she is requesting will be repaid all at once at the end of six months.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To supply her drinks stand with beverages

loans.name: Sergei

texts.en:
Sergei is married, has two children and makes a living selling hardware products (such as gas burners and parts for them, plumbing parts and more) at the central market in his town.

Sergei started this business four years ago. He decided to open his company because competition was low and demand was high. One of the main income-producing items in his business is the sale of small spare parts for gas burners and plumbing systems. People can not afford to change their systems completely, so they buy parts to fix problems. Sergei lives in a private house and knows a lot about fixing it. His business helps people improve their gas and plumbing systems and have better living conditions.

Sergei has applied for a loan to increase his inventory and generate more income. His goal is to develop his business and have more clients.

loans.use: to increase his store's inventory

loans.name: Angel

texts.es:
Ángel Q. Yucra vive en casa propia, en la zona  de La Portada, en la periferia de la ciudad de La Paz, con su esposa la señora Asunta Mamani y sus cinco hijos.
El señor Ángel trabaja como albañil, en construcciones particulares, y su esposa es comerciante ambulante.
Al presentarse las épocas de lluvia, su vivienda se encuentra en problemas ya que los techos se encuentran deteriorados y tienen filtraciones que dañan sus muebles.
El crédito será destinado a la refacción de los techos de su vivienda.
Esta es la primera vez que solicita préstamo y el análisis socioeconómico realizado lo califican favorablemente y puede acceder  a un  crédito.
texts.en:
Ángel Q. Yucra lives with his wife, Asunta Mamani, and his five children in his own house in La Portada, in the suburbs of La Paz. Ángel is a mason working in private construction and his wife is a street vendor. Now, in the rainy season, he is having problems with his home as the roof is damaged and the leaks are causing damage to their furniture. He will use the loan to fix the roof of his home. This is Ángel's first loan request and our socio-economic evaluation determined that he qualifies for a loan.

Translated from Spanish by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To make home repairs.

loans.name: Jamshed

texts.en:
Jamshed E. is 30 years old. He is married with four children. Jamshed has been selling clothing for 10 years. He began selling to acquaintances and friends, and after a while he realized that he had a lot of customers. So, he decided to rent a shop and establish himself in “Ganjina” market.

Jamshed is a very enterprising man with a great desire to get ahead. His business has been able to show the fruits of his labor and he hopes to grow as a businessman. Jamshed needs a loan of 600 USD, which he plans to invest in inventory in order to offer better service and variety to his customers. You can be an important part of the growth of this business. Today is your opportunity to help, have no doubt!

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road; the end of Alexander the Great's rule; and with its famous great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets as: Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But, Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Increasing his working capital with the purpose of development of business.

loans.name: Bhagabati

texts.en:
Bhagabati S. lives in Chetrapati, Kathmandu. Chetrapati is one of the busy city of Kathmandu and most of the people in this region are engaged in small business. Mrs. Bhagabati Shresth lives with her mother-in-law, husband, one son and one daughter. Her husband, Mr. Prachandra Bahadhur S., works in a government office. Both her son and daughter are studying as well as working.

Mrs. Bhagabati S. opened her photo studio and watch shop more than five years ago. She has employed two workers for her shop, where she has been selling different brand of watches. She opened her shop to upgrade the living standard of her family. In addition, she wants to be independent and she doesn’t like to ask money from her husband. Now she is requesting for Rs 20,000 loan to buy different varieties and brands of watches.

loans.use: To buy watches

loans.name: Salima

texts.en:
Salima started her business 12 years ago selling fabrics for sewing national dresses. Her husband works as a teacher. As a result his earnings are small and she wanted to give her children a better quality of life. Thanks to her effort the business has gone very well for her. Now she is requesting a loan for $800 which she will repay in 5 months. She will use the loan to buy merchandise, since her sales are increasing and she wants to have inventory in stock for all of her clients. With your contribution Salima will move ahead.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International
Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road; the end of Alexander the Great's rule; and with it’s famous great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets such as: Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC.  And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But, Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics.  The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy.  In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable.  These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia.  While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty. 

IMON's History
Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Increasing working capital to buy merchandise and develop the business.

loans.name: Beatriz

texts.es:
Beatriz la es socia del Bancomunal  Las Surcanitas.
Beatriz es casada tiene 72 años, tres hijos que están casados.
Beatriz  es jubilada recibe una pensión cada mes, pero decidió trabajar empezó en el negocio D. venta D. libros por una amiga que vendía libros, ella prendió como era el negocio y le gusto, compra libros en las editoriales y los ofrece en los colegios todos los días sale D. 11am hasta las 3pm . 
Beatriz necesita un préstamo D. 1000 soles para la compra D. libros- y compra D.  uniformes D. colegio. 
DesD. que está en Finca  su economía ha mejorado, ha aprendido como mejorar sus ventas. 
El sueño D. Beatriz es que  pueda continuar trabajando hasta cuando sus fuerzas le den y siempre quiere estar sana.
texts.en:
Beatriz is a member of the Communal Bank Las Surcanitas.

Beatriz is married and 72 years old. Her three children are all married. Beatriz is retired and receives a pension every month, but she decided to start working. She started in the book-selling business, working for a friend who sold books. She caught on to the business and liked it. She buys books at publishing houses and sells them in schools every day from 11am to 3pm.

Beatriz needs a loan of 1000 soles to buy books and school uniforms. Since she joined Finca, her finances have improved and she has learned how to increase her sales.

Beatriz's dream is to be able to continue working until she no longer has the strength to do so, and to always be healthy.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Chong, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy books and school uniforms for resale

loans.name: Oscar David

texts.es: Don Oscar alquila videos juegos el cual inicio con préstamo para poder comprar todo lo necesarios, este es su segundo ciclo en Afodenic. Tiene 24 años de edad, soltero y aspira a tener su propia casa y también poder cambiar su vehiculo. Con esta solicitud de crédito es para instalar una sala de video completa para tener más servicios para sus clientes ya que la demanda esta buena y no la cubre. Con esto espera ganar mejores ingresos. Da la gracias a la institución por hacer crecer su negocio y sus objetivos.
texts.en:
Don Oscar rents videos games, which he started with a previous loan he used to buy all the necessary items. This is his second cycle with Afodenic. He is 24 years old, single, and hopes to have his own home and also get a new vehicle. With this credit application, Don Oscar plans to install a full video room to offer more services to his customers, as the demand is already there, and he cannot currently meet it. With this new service, he expects to earn better income. Don Oscar gives thanks to the institution for helping him grow his business and his objectives.

Translated from Spanish by Scott Lucas, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase equipment for a video room

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.en:
Liên Nguyễn Thị (129950952) is a 40-year-old female living in the town of Sóc Sơn. She is married and has two school-aged children.  Liên runs a food stall, primarily selling herbs & spices in the local community. She has been engaged in this business for over 10 years and earns approximately 5,000,000 VND a month.

In 1995, Liên joined TYM Fund to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan from TYM Fund. This previous loan was used to invest in expanding the business.

Liên is now requesting a new loan of 20,000,000 VND which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. The loan will be her 12th loan from TYM Fund. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Isidra

texts.en: Isidra B. sells fish. She is 43 years old and has four children. She has been trading fish since she got married to her husband, Mamerto B., who is a fisherman. Aside from their catch, they buy fish from other fisherman and sell it to the village with additional mark-up. She would like to ask for a loan of Php 12,000 from CEVI. She will use the loan to purchase fishing materials and fish to sell. The loan will help her grow her fish business even more. CEVI provides financial services to the poor. It offers not just loans but training and insurance coverage as well.

loans.use: To purchase gear for fishing and fish to sell

loans.name: Nkemdilim

texts.en: Nkemdilim sells phone accessories. She is thirty-seven years old and married with four children. She is requesting a loan of N100,000 to purchase more phone accessories to sell. Nkemdilim says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more phone accessories to sell

loans.name: Edna

texts.en:
“The great business of life is to be, to do without, and to depart,” shares Edna E.. She strongly believes in that quotation, which she believes is simply related to doing the right and great things for her family, friends, acquaintances, and other people around her.

Edna is engaged in a general store business. She hopes to purchase more stock in order to meet the demands of her customers and increase her income. To achieve this, she would like a loan of PHP15,000 for the expansion of her general store business.

Edna is 35 years old and lives in the rural barangay of Palao, Solana, Cagayan. She is married to Orlando Jr., who works as a farmer. They are blessed with two children: Gramsel, who is 14 years old and a high school student, and Gerald, who is 9 years old and an elementary student. Both children are studying in a public school in their village.

loans.use: To expand her general store

loans.name: Kasifa Namakula ‘Sgroup

texts.en:
K. is a leader of five members of a group.  She is a 65-year-old single mother of two children aged 45 and 35 years.  None of her children goes to school because they are all old with five children of their own aged between 17 and 25 years. Only three of their children go to school. She resides in and owns a four-roomed house where she is staying with five people. K. takes care of additional family members. There is electricity and piped water at her home.  The family gets three meals a day. She resides and works in a semi-urban area, which is in the outskirts of Kampala. K. stays in Mulago zone selling second hand clothes in Kalerwe one of Kampala suburbs. She incurs extra transport costs to and from shopping or work. K. also sells chicken and pig's food. She sells to an average of 20 people a day and sells to all categories of people excluding children. She works six days a week. K. sells mainly on retail only. Her major monthly expenses include school fees and rent for her business premises.  She has been in this business for the last five years. K. has been with MCDT for over five years and is servicing her 10th loan, working with the same group mates. She wants to use this loan to buy clothes for resale.  K. is aspiring to see her business grow bigger and to own a permanent business premise.

.

loans.use: To buy more clothes for resale

loans.name: Ama Brigitte

texts.fr:
Cette femme  exerce comme activité génératrice de revenu le commerce des produits cosmétiques, elle fait ce commerce depuis 1998 et s'approvisionne au grand marché de lomé. Elle reçoit beaucoup de commande de ses clients. Son stock ayant connu une baisse, elle sollicite de WAGES un crédit pour acheter divers produits cosmétiques afin de rehausser son stock.
Elle est mariée  et mère de 02 enfants. C’est avec le revenu de son activité qu’elle contribue  aux charges de sa famille
texts.en:
This is a woman who earns an income from commerce in cosmetic products.  She has been in this business since 1998 and gets her supplies at the grand marketplace in Lomé.  She receives many orders from her customers.  Since her inventory experienced a drop, she is requesting a loan from WAGES to buy various cosmetics in order to replenish her stock.  She is married and the mother of two.  With the revenues from her business, she helps cover family expenses. 

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy cosmetic products to sell

loans.name: Juan

texts.es:
El señor Juan R. está muy agradecido por su cooperación en sus dos créditos anteriores que ha tenido. El cual le ayudo mucho ha que su negocio tuviera más ventas y ingresos, y también darles empleo a otras personas. 
Nueva mente está solicitando otro préstamo ya que tiene un problema que su camioneta de traslado de mercancía se le descompuso y necesita una reparación y en este momento no cuenta con el dinero necesario para pagarle a la persona que le repara la camioneta. 
El planea pagar el crédito con los ingresos que genera de su negocio.
texts.en:
Juan is very grateful for the two loans he has had previously. They greatly helped him to make his business have more sales and income, and also to provide employment for other persons.

He is soliciting a loan once again because he has a problem with his merchandise delivery van. It is out of order and needs repairs. At present, he lacks the money to pay the person who will repair the van.

He plans to repay the loan from the income his business generates.

Translated from Spanish by Harold Sims, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: REPAIRING HIS MERCHANDISE DELIVERY VAN

loans.name: Rita

texts.en: Rita is a 26-year-old divorced woman living with her parents. She has been working as a hairdresser since 2001, servicing neighboring villages. Today, Rita is wanting to borrow $1,200 to buy tools and a vapor machine to satisfy the demands of her clients.

loans.use: To buy tools and a vapor machine

loans.name: Davron

texts.ru: Даврон Джонбиров проживает в районе Вахдат. Возраст 26 лет. Женат, имеет 2 детей. Даврон по специальности "экономист". Но он более 3 лет занимается торговлей. Он имеет собственную грузовую машину, на которой занимается перевозкой муки на Памир, для продажи. Кредит просит для закупа муки и ремонта автомашины.
texts.en:
Davron D. lives in the Vahdat region. He is 26 years old. He is married and has two children. Davron's profession is economist. But he has been in the retail business for more than three years. He has own truck which he uses to transport flour to Pamir for resale. He is asking for a loan to buy flour and to repair the vehicle.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy flour and repair the vehicle

loans.name: Edwin

texts.en: Edwin has a cassava farm where he plants cassava and plantain. He is 42 years old and married with 3 children. He is requesting for the loan amount of N50, 000 to purchase more cassava stems to plant. He says thanks to all KIVA lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more cassava stems to plant

loans.name: Jose

texts.es: Jose G. N. C. tiene 21 años, vive en union libre, y tiene 1 hija que es su primer prioridad. Su hija tiene 6 meses. El es un agricultor de frijoles en una finca acerca. El tiene campo libre y le gustaría comezar cultivando frijoles. El tuvo un prestamo con FUDECOSUR hace un año para cultivando chili pero no tuvo exito. El piense que frijoles serían un producto mejor con su tipo de tierra. Es su segundo prestamo con FUDECOSUR y prefiere los prestamos FUDECOSURes por que hay menos requistos que los bancos formales. él desea brindar a su hija un futuro mejor y estable y tambien que ella sería una profesional.
texts.en:
Jose G. N. C. is 21 years old, in a common law marriage, and has a 6 month old daughter who is his highest priority. He grows beans on a local farm. Jose has free use of the land and enjoys growing his crops. He took out a loan with FUDECOSUR a year ago in order to grow chili peppers, but the crop was not successful. He believes beans are better suited for this land.

This is Jose’s second loan with FUDECOSUR and he prefers these loans because they have fewer requirements that those of formal banks. He hopes to provide his daughter with a better and more stable future so that she can grow up to become a professional.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fertilizers for his crop of beans

loans.name: Luz María

texts.es:
Luz María tiene 35 años de edad, su esposo la abandonó hace dos años y desde entonces vive junto a su madre y a sus cuatro hijos en el distrito de Cayaltí, ubicado a una hora de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Desde hace seis meses se dedica por las tardes a la venta de papas rellenas, tortitas de choclo y salchipapas (platos típicos de la región) que ella misma prepara y los ofrece en u pequeño establecimiento improvisado cerca de su casa. Su producto goza de mucha acogida debido a su buena sazón y a la higiene con la que los prepara.

Su clientela ha venido aumentando y el poco capital con el que trabaja no es suficiente para cubrir esta demanda, por lo que se ha visto en la necesidad de solicitar por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 400 nuevos soles que piensa invertir en la compra de insumos para elaboración de alimentos.

Luz María es una mujer trabajadora y que ha luchado por sacar adelante a su familia a pesar de las adversidades. Su sueño es instalar una bodega con la cual pueda seguir apoyando a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Luz Maria is 35 years old. Since her husband left 2 years ago she has been living with her 4 children and her mother in the district of Cayalti, located an hour from the city of Chiclayo. For the last 6 months she has worked in the afternoons selling papas rellenas, tortitas de choclo, and salchipapas (regional dishes) that she prepares herself and offers for sale in a small, improvised establishment near her home. Her products have a great reception due to good seasoning and the hygiene with which they are prepared. Her clientele has increased and the little working capital she has is not sufficient to cover the demand. For this reason, she has seen the need to ask for a loan, for the first time, from Edpyme Alternativa of 400 PEN (Peruvian Nuevo Soles). She plans to invest the loan in the production of food. Luz Maria is a hard working woman and has struggled to support her family in spite of her adversities. She dreams of opening a store to better support her children.

Translated from Spanish by Machelle Wilson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of inputs for food processing

loans.name: Fou

texts.en:
Fou S. T. is a 42-year-old woman living in the town of Iva. She is married and has 5 school-aged children. To make a living, Fou owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector, raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from planting & harvesting taro for sale. Fou earns approximately 180 WST a month from these activities.

In 2008, Fou joined SPBD to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Fou has successfully repaid a previous loan of 750 WST from SPBD. This previous loan was used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. Fou is now requesting a new loan of 1500 WST which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This will be the 2nd loan taken out by the borrower from SPBD. Fou plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.

About SPBD:

SPBD's mission is to improve the quality of life of people living in poverty in the poor island nations of the South Pacific. SPBD's philosophy of lending is based on a respect for each individual's innate human ingenuity, drive and self esteem.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Kamu Kamu Group, Mukono

texts.en: K. Steven is a friendly 24-year-old single man with no children. He has a bar business in Kirasa where he has been selling beers, sodas, and wines for 1 year now. Steven is able to make 48,000/= as profits a week and he attributes this to his good customer care and the stock he has. He hopes to expand his business further and also buy a plot of land and build a house before he can think of marrying and having children. He needs a loan to help buy more beers, sodas and wines plus mineral water to sell more during this peak season.

loans.use: Buying more beers, sodas, wines and mineral water for his bar

loans.name: Daribazar

texts.en:
Daribazar operates a clothing business from a rented shipping container in the local market. He began his business in 2007 after running a meat trading business for two years. Eventually he plans to purchase the rented container so that he can have his own work space to sell his clothing and hopefully grow his profits.

Daribazar is 41 years old and lives with his wife and 17-year-old daughter in Bayanhongor province, Mongolia. The family lives together in a ger (a traditional nomadic Mongolian tent). His daughter attends the local secondary school while his wife helps with the family business.

With his hard work and good business sense, Daribazar has been able to improve his family’s quality of life. He is requesting a 2,500,000 tugrug loan in order to purchase a large stock of winter clothes for his retail business.

loans.use: To purchase a large stock of winter clothes

loans.name: Norbertina

texts.es:
Norbertina H. H., mujer de 46 años de edad nacida en Cartagena de Indias; ciudad colonial  y turística del Caribe Latino, de clima soleado y playas con aguas cálidas, ubicada en el extremo Nororiental de Colombia;  ella tiene un hijo de 19 años y vive en el barrio los Calamares, al Sur Occidente de Cartagena,  donde la proliferación del emprendimiento de  negocios, la alegría de sus habitantes y el cumplimiento de sus obligaciones crediticias es el común denominador de sus negociantes, razón por la cual el apoyo de  la Fundación  Mario Santo Domingo es muy notorio en esta zona.
Desde joven La señora Norbertina ha sido muy emprendedora,  sus padres con grandes esfuerzos lograron darle estudios primarios y ella por sus propios medios costeó los niveles educativos secundarios y su carrera como técnica de Oficina; con esta experiencia aprendió valorar la importancia de la educación y ahora dirige todos sus esfuerzos productivos a la educación universitaria de su hijo.
Cuando Norbertina concluyó su carrera técnica, pensó que era más rentable trabajar de manera independiente e inició su microempresa vendiendo mercancías variadas en bajo volumen, pues sus ingresos no le permitían adquirir grandes cantidades. Gradualmente incrementa su  capital de trabajo, ganando un mayor numero de clientes en el mercado y con ello generando ingresos importantes para apoyar el sostenimiento de su hogar.  Como su proyección   era superior sintió que requería un impulso decisivo generador de mayor crecimiento; fue así como acudió a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, donde apoyada con financiamiento para  capital de trabajo, formación empresarial y acompañamiento en el negocio se convierte en usuaria de los servicios de esta entidad desde el año 1994 en el programa de grupos solidarios, recibiendo un primer crédito por valor de $110.000 y desde entonces ha inyectado de manera individual 25 más, a su capital de trabajo. Como en todo emprendedor persistente, comenta que en sus inicios  fue difícil comenzar desde cero, y dedicó mucho tiempo y esfuerzo a conseguir buenos clientes para ofrecer sus mercancías, pues contaba con  un incipiente capital de trabajo y con la difícil y paralela responsabilidad de  su hogar y un hijo,  pues su esposo trabajaba en el oficio de herrería fuera de la ciudad de Cartagena.
En este momento su realidad es otra y ella expresa lo siguiente: “Ha mejorado notablemente mi entorno familiar y mis ingresos; me siento muy agradecida de pertenecer a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con ellos he encontrado la oportunidad de trabajar como independiente, de estudiar una carrera técnica gracias a un auxilio otorgado por la misma; mis asesores siempre han sido muy especiales y he logrado pagar los estudios universitarios de mi hijo.”  
Sueña con lograr sacar adelante los estudios universitarios de su hijo y convertirse en una microempresaria líder en el desarrollo de proyectos para emprendedores que estén iniciando, a fin de devolverle a la sociedad y a la Fundación parte de las muchas bendiciones que ha recibido.
Norbertina desea ampliar su negocio de modo que pueda expandirse a toda la ciudad de Cartagena e incluso otras ciudades de Colombia y adquirir grandes volúmenes de mercancía de importación para convertirse en una mayorista distribuidora y con su microempresa, quiere generar ingresos suficientes para mantener su hogar en las mejores condiciones posibles.
En la actualidad, aplica a un crédito de $1.200.000 para pagar parte del semestre universitario de su hijo, el que actualmente estudia sexto semestre de Contaduría Pública y con él están ligadas grandes expectativas  de mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Norbertina H. H., 46, was born in Cartagena de Indias, a colonial and touristic city in the Latin Caribbean. It has a sunny climate beaches with warm waters, and is located in the extreme northeast of Colombia. Norbertina has a 19-year-old son, and lives in the Los Calamares neighborhood in the southwest of Cartagena. Here, the proliferation of enterprising businesses, the happiness of the residents, and the fulfillment of their credit obligations are the common denominators. For this reason, the support of the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo is well known in the area. From an early age, Norbertina has been very enterprising. Her parents with great effort managed to provide her with a primary education. She then continued on her own with secondary school education and a career as an office technician. This experience taught her the importance of education, and she now directs all her efforts toward providing a university education for her son. When Norbertina concluded her technical career, she thought it might be more profitable to work independently, so started a business selling general merchandise. She began as a low-volume business, as her income did not permit her to buy in large quantities. She gradually built up her working capital and her customer base in the market until she was generating enough income to support her household. Norbertina felt she needed a strong push to generate more growth. At this point, she approached la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo who helped her with working capital and business training. Her first loan, in 1994, was for $110,000 COP, and since then she has added 25 more individual loans to her working capital. Like all persistent entrepreneurs, Norbertina says that it was difficult starting out from zero and she invested much time and effort to finding customers for her products. At the same time, she had the parallel responsibility of her home and son, as her husband works outside the city in the office of an ironworks. Now, her reality has changed. She says, “My family environment and my income have improved notably. I am thankful to Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. With them, I have found the opportunity to work independently and to study a technical career. My advisors have been very special, and I have managed to pay for my son’s university studies.” Norbertina dreams of continuing to advance her son’s education and of becoming a micro-business leader in the development of projects for other entrepreneurs. She would like to give back to society and the Foundation part of the benefits she has received. Norbertina would like to expand her business to all of the city of Cartagena and even other cities in Colombia, becoming a wholesale distributor of imported goods. She wants to generate enough income to maintain her home in the best possible condition. This loan, for $1,200,000 COP will pay part of a semester’s tuition for her son, who is in his sixth semester in the field of public accounting. The hopes of bettering the quality of life for the family are with him.

Translated from Spanish by jeffrey hersk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: University education for her son

loans.name: Karim

texts.ru: Мирзоев Карим проживает в районе А. Джоми. Возраст, 47 лет. Женат, имеет 5 детей. Мирзоев Карим в области животноводства более 16 лет. Он откармливает и продает скот. Мирзоев Карим старается увеличить количество скот, чтобы получить большую прибыль. Кредит берет для закупа скота.
texts.en:
Karim Marzoev is from the region of Abdurahmon Jomi. He's forty-seven, married, and has five children. He has been in the livestock business for more than sixteen years, fattening up and selling cattle. He is trying to improve the quality of his cattle so they'll fetch a higher profit. He plans to use his loan to buy cattle.

Translated from Russian by Jill Heske, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy cattle

loans.name: Teofila

texts.es:
Teófila, de 32 años, es una mujer que siempre ha trabajado muy duro para brindarle a su familia una mejor vida. Vive en la casa de su madre junto a sus 2 hijos; Jason de 9 y Daina de 5, quienes son el motivo de todos sus esfuerzos.

Apoyada por sus padres, cuando tenía 20 años decidió comprar unos terrenos en los cuales pudiera sembrar y ayudar así en la economía de su familia. Actualmente sigue trabajando en esas tierras, pero ahora le ayudan sus queridos hijos, con lo que obtienen lo necesario para brindarles una buena educación y velar por su salud.
Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es la relación tan cercana que tiene con la tierra, además disfruta mucho viendo sus sembríos crecer. Lleva 12 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es tener que cuidar sus campos de las inclemencias del clima, ya que cualquier descuido puede afectar la cosecha. Para más adelante, espera que los costos de las verduras en el mercado suban, ya que de lo contrario su capital de trabajo se verá afectado.

Este es el primer préstamo que tiene con MFP,  está muy emocionada por obtenerlo, ya que lo necesita urgentemente para mejorar su negocio. En su banco comunal es una socia muy querida, pues siempre pone orden en las reuniones. Este es el primer préstamo que tiene con MFP,  está muy emocionada por obtenerlo, ya que lo necesita urgentemente para mejorar su negocio. En su banco comunal es una socia muy querida, pues siempre pone orden en las reuniones.
texts.en:
Teófila, age 32, is a woman who has always worked hard to give her family a better life. She lives in her mother’s house with her two children. Jason is 9, and Daina is 5. They are the reason for all of her efforts. When she was 20, with her parents support, she bought some land where she could plant and help the family economically. She currently continues working this land, but now her dear children help her. With the land they get what they need to give the children a good education and to see to their health. What she likes best about her work is the close relationship she has with the earth. Also, she really enjoys seeing her plants grow. She has been doing this for 12 years. The most difficult part is taking care of the fields and protecting them from bad weather. Any oversight could affect the harvest. In the future she hopes that the prices for vegetables in the market rise. If they do not, her work capital will be affected. This is her first loan with MFP. She is very excited to get it because she urgently needs it to improve her business. She is a well liked member of her communal bank. She always keeps the meetings in order.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy fertilizer

loans.name: Angel Francisco

texts.es: Angel Francisco habita en el sector de Nueva Guinea en la Comarca Flor de Pino en la Colonia Talolinga junto a su familia compuesta por su esposa y 3 hijos menores los que tambien ayudan y colaboran en los quehaceres del hogar y  en las actividades del campo. Don Angel desde muy pequeño, ha tenido como principal actividad economica el manejo de su inventario ganadero apoyado por su papa,  solicita financiamiento de su primer credito para compra de vacas paridas, las que le permitiran obtener mayores fuentes de ingreso que ayudarian a solventar las nesecidades del nucleo familiar, su mayor sueño es pagar su credito en tiempo y forma para que esta institucion le siga brindando servicio de credito cuando lo neceiste, se caracteirza por ser un hombre trabajador con muchas ganas de superarse, en su comunidad lo consideran como una persona responsable y trabajador.
texts.en:
Angel Francisco lives in the New Guinea sector of the Flor de Pino region in the Talolinga neighborhood. His family is comprised of his wife and their three minor children. They help and work together on the household activities and the field work. Since he was very small his primary economic activity has been managing his livestock inventory with his father’s help. He is requesting his first loan to buy dairy cows. These will allow him to get greater income, which will pay for the family’s necessities. His biggest dream is to pay the loan in time in the manner agreed upon so that this institution will continue to offer him loan service when he needs it. He is characterized as a hard-working man with a great desire for self improvement. In his community he is considered to be a responsible and hard-working person.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy dairy cows

loans.name: La Promesse Group

texts.fr:
Amani S.  est présidente du groupe de crédit la Promesse, elle lève la main sur la photo , cliente au 5e  cycle de crédit, agée de 42 ans, mariée. Elle est mère de  10 enfants  parmi lesquels   6   vont à l’école et 3 autres n’étudient  pas par manque des frais  scolaires. Son mari a un petit job, il est  chauffeur auprès d’un particulier. 
Elle a commencé son petit commerce de vente de braises avec son fond propre reçu de son mari, soit une somme équivalant  à 10$. Son business est de vendre les braises  dans un petit marché se trouvant dans la zone urbano - rurale de Ndosho à 12 km du centre ville de Goma.  Notons qu’avant de se lancer dans l’activité de vente de braises, elle avait commencé par  le petit commerce de vente de tomates. 
Avec  le crédit de l’IMF Hekima , elle souhaite accroitre son chiffre d’affaire en achetant 6 sacs de braises et 4 paniers de tomates .
Dans l’avenir, elle planifie d’acheter des  planches  pour renforcer son projet de construction de sa maison et scolariser confortablement ses enfants.  
Elle remercie  l’IMF Hekima, pour les crédits qu’elle reçoit sans aucune garantie matérielle, car grace à ces crédits, elle a déjà acheté 85 planches et 25 toles qu’elle utilisera pour la construction de sa maison. 
Le groupe la Promesse  est composé de 6 membres qui sont  toutes femmes. Il sied d’indiquer que derrière la  photo on retrouve les pierres  du volcan Nyiragongo.
texts.en:
Amani S. is the president of the loan group that calls itself "La Promesse"; she's the one raising her hand in the group photo. She is on her fifth loan, aged 42 and married. She is the mother of 10 children, among whom six are enrolled in school and three others are not because she can't pay school fees. Her husband has a little job working as a driver for an individual. Amani started up her little business selling charcoal with her own funds, received from her husband, in the amount of about 10 USD. Her business consists in selling charcoal in a little market located in the urban/rural zone of Ndosho, 12 km from the center of the town of Goma. It must be noted that before opening this business, Amani had already begun selling tomatoes on a small scale. With the loan from the MFI Hekima, Amani hopes to increase her turnover by buying six sacks of charcoal and 4 baskets of tomatoes. In future, she plans to buy planks to further the construction of her house and to be able to pay school fees easily for her children. She thanks Hekima for the loans that she has received without any tangible collateral, since thanks to those loans she has already bought 85 planks and 25 tin roofing panels which she will be using in building her house. The "Promesse" group is composed of six members who are all women. Behind the group you can see stones from the Nyiragongo volcano.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: 6 sacks of charcoal and 4 baskets of tomatoes

loans.name: Castigo

texts.pt:
Castigo Lorino M. nasceu no Distrito de Manjacaze, Província de Gaza, sul de Moçambique tem 31 anos de idade casado e pai de 3 filhos de 8, 6 e 1 anos de idade, destes 2 vão a escola. Fez somente 5ą classe não continuou devido a falta de condições financeiras, mas pretende continuar a estudar. Vive na casa propria com a sua família e não sustenta mais ninguém.
Saiu de Gaza para Boane com os seus pais a procura de melhores condições de vida. Tem um negocio próprio há mais de 8 anos sem nenhum empregado e consegue um rendimento que varia de 2.500.00mt a 3.000.00mt por mês e aplica nas despesas de casa.
Nunca teve empréstimos em outros bancos, conheceu a Hluvuku através de amigos que também são clientes desta instituição. Este é o seu 2º empréstimo no valor de 10.000.00mt com o qual pretende comprar (fardos de roupa usada diversa) para aumentar a quantidade da sua mercadoria. O emprestimo anterior foi de 6.000.00mt, também foi para a mesma actividade.
Compromete se a pagar devidamente este empréstimo para poder aceder a outros. No futuro gostaria de solicitar mais empréstimos para a conclusão da sua casa.
texts.en:
Castigo Lorino M. was born in the district of Manjacaze, Gaza Province, in southern Mozambique. He is 31 years old, married, and the father of three children 8, 6, and 1 year of age. Two of his children attend school. He lives in his own house with his family, and isn't financially responsible for anyone else. With his parents, he left Gaza for Boane in search of better living conditions. He's had his own business for more than 8 years with no other employees. The business brings in between 2500 and 3000 meticals a month, which she uses for household expenses. She's never received loans from other banks. She learned about Hvuluku from friends who are also Hvuluku clients. This is her second loan, in the amount of 10,000 meticals, which she will use to purchase merchandise (bundles of used clothing) in order to increase the quantity of her stock. Her previous loan was for 6000 meticals, which he needed for the same purpose. He's committed to paying this loan off on time so that he'll be eligible for others in the future. He'd like to request additional loans to finish construction on his house.

Translated from Portuguese by Andrea Rosenberg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase bundles of used clothing

loans.name: Dominic

texts.en:
Dominic is 36 years old and single. He operates a retail shop where he sells household goods and he also does farming to earn extra income.

Dominic is a member of Ushindi Group, in Faulu Kenya, whose group members previously supported him by being his guarantors when he took out a loan of Kes 20,000.  He has requested a new loan of Kes 40,000 to buy buckets, basins and plastic water tanks.

In the future Dominic hopes to buy a lorry (truck) for transporting his goods.

loans.use: To buy buckets, basins and plastic water tanks

loans.name: Juliet

texts.en:
Juliet P. is from the village of Olingan, Dipolog City. She is 38 years old. Juliet is married, has 2 adult-aged, 2 school-aged and 1 infant-aged children. To make a living, Juliet owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising livestock. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from raising pigs for sale. Juliet is just starting this business.

In 2008, Juliet joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Juliet has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000.00 PHP from PMPC. Juliet is requesting a new loan of 5,000.00 PHP which will be used to purchase livestock feed & other supplies. This loan will be the 5th loan taken out by Juliet from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand the borrower's business. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase livestock feed & other supplies

loans.name: Alaskar

texts.en: Alaskar R., age 57, breeds sheep in the small village of Saatli. He has four children. Alaskar breeds sheep because it is very profitable: mutton is a highly popular item among people in Azerbaijan. He has applied for a loan in the amount of 1,000 AZN in order to purchase more lambs, fatten them, and sell them in several months for a higher price. He generally sells his sheep to the local butcher shops and in the livestock bazaar.

loans.use: To buy 20 lambs

loans.name: 12.1.2 Nam Ngan Group

texts.en:
Soan L. T. (5) is a 48-year-old femaL. living in the town of Thanh Hoa. She is the group leader of a 5-member group loan offered by Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. WhiL. each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all responsibL. for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is 12.1.2 Nam Ngan.

Soan is married and has four school-aged children. To make a living, Soan operates a family member's service-based business. WhiL. not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from providing cargo transport services to local community members. Soan has been engaged in this business for over five years and earns approximately 2.000.000 VND a month from these activities.

In 2009, Soan joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 1.626.900 VND from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women which was used to repair a transport vehicL. used in the business. She is now requesting a new loan of 6.000.000 VND which will be used to purchase materials needed to provide cargo transport services. This will be the second loan Soan has taken out from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's general living conditions.

About the other borrowers in the group:

1.  L. T. Quyen (6) is a 23-year-old femaL. who is requesting a 6.000.000 VND loan to support her business in the services sector operating a tailoring business.

2.  N. T. Hoa (7) is a 35-year-old femaL. who is requesting a 6.000.000 VND loan to support her business in the food sector running a food stall.

3.  T. T. Van (8) is a 29-year-old femaL. who is requesting a 6.000.000 VND loan to support her business in the food sector running a food stall.

4.  L. T. Yen (9) is a 51-year-old femaL. who is requesting a 6.000.000 VND loan to support her business in the food sector running a food stall.

About Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women:

The mission of Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women (FPW) is to provide sustainabL. financial services to disadvantaged women in rural areas in the Thanh Hoa province.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese whiL. providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.


Soan L. T. (5) là 48 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy sống ở thành phố Thanh Hoa.  Soan là trưởng nhóm của nhóm vay gồm có 5 các thành viên.  Mặc dù mỗi thành viên trong nhóm nhận được từng khoản vay cá nhân, nhưng tất cả họ đều chịu trách nhiệm hoàn trả lại khoản vay của các thành viên trong nhóm của mình nếu một người nào đó trễ hạn hay không trả được nợ..  Tên chính thức của nhóm vay này là 12.1.2 Nam Ngan (02.12.1.2).


Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ cung cấp các dịch vụ vận chuyển hàng hóa cho người dân trong cộng đồng địa phương.  Soan thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 5 năm.  Từ các hoạt động này, Soan kiếm được khoảng 2.000.000 VND.  Vào 2009, Soan đã tham gia Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải T.ện  sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy.  Soan đã hoàn trả hết khoản vay trước đây là 1.626.900 VND từ Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  Khoản vay trước đây được sử dụng sửa chữa phương tiện vận chuyển được dùng trong công việc kinh doanh.  Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 6.000.000 VND.


Khoản vay sẽ là 2nd khoản vay của người vay từ Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.


Về Những Người vay khác trong Nhóm:


1.  L. T. Quyen (6) là 23 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6.000.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực dịch vụ.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là vận hành công việc kinh doanh may mặc.


2.  N. T. Hoa (7) là 35 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6.000.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực thực phẩm.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là buôn bán quầy thực phẩm.


3.  T. T. Van (8) là 29 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6.000.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực thực phẩm.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là buôn bán quầy thực phẩm.


4.  L. T. Yen (9) là 51 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6.000.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực thực phẩm.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là buôn bán quầy thực phẩm.


Về Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women:

Nhiệm vụ của Quỹ vì Phụ Nữ Nghèo Thanh Hóa (FPW) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính bền vững cho những người phụ nữ kém may mắn ở các vùng nông thôn tỉnh Thanh Hóa.


*Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. .  Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng  Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva.  ."

loans.use: To purchase materials needed to provide cargo transport services

loans.name: Bayram

texts.en: Bayram R. is a 59-year-old man who sells different kinds of food in Agsu city. He is married and has three children. Keeping a big family is not an easy job and Bayram is doing his best to cover all his family's needs. Bayram spends 30% of his monthly income which is about 250 AZN to pay his rent.  He wishes to increase his income using this new loan and to make some savings to build his own shop one day.

loans.use: To increase his income

loans.name: C2327 Abarikumwe Group

texts.en: Viollette is 48 years old and married with three children: the first one is 23, the next one is 19 and the last one is 16. Viollette’s husband does not have an occupation which can make money. For that reason, Viollette needs to work hard so that she meets all the needs of her family. Viollette owns a business selling various products. She is her group representative. Her group is called Abarikumwe in the local language. Viollette and her group are requesting a loan from Kiva lenders via Vision Finance Company so that they can increase their capital for more investments. This loan will be valuable for them because they will be able to purchase more products for their various businesses. With extra money, Viollette in particular expects to save money for the future.

loans.use: To expand the business

loans.name: Benilda Sabina

texts.es:
Benilda cría ganado vacuno en la sierra peruana (San Juan D. Iris) comenzó a los 24 años junto a su esposo quien tenía experiencia en criar estos animales por su familia.
Compraban ganado D. engorD. que significa que no estaban muy bien alimentados y ellos lo hacen engordar con pasto D. la sierra, alimento balanceado para luego venderlo cuando están gorditos en el camal D. la ciudad. Había meses que tenían problemas D. carencia D. pasto en la sierra debido a la falta D. lluvias.
El primer crédito que recibió lo invirtió en comprar tres reces, la leche que producen estos animales las venden a los mercados así mismo aprovechan sobre todo para la elaboración D. quesos. Gastaban mucho antes en movilidad ya que la carne era ofrecida en los mercados D. la capital, actualmente esto ha cambiado se podría decir que son ellos los proveedores, tienen compradores fijos en la capital y éstos compradores los expenden a los mercados. Este negocio D. ganado sirvió para educar a sus hijos quienes son profesionales en la actualidad y ahora éstos apoyan a sus padres, es una alegría para Benilda y su esposo haber logrado ello, además mejoraron su casita. El préstamo que recibirán lo invertirán para comprar Ciclozona, un medicamento muy efectivo que ayuda a desparasitar, evita la infección, resfrío y fiebre en los animales vacunos cuando atraviesan las bajas temperaturas.
texts.en:
Benilda raises cattle in the Peruvian Sierra (San Juan D. Iris). She started when she was 24 along with her husband who had experience from his family in raising cattle. They bought cows to fatten up and that meant that the cows weren’t well-fed: they nourished them with grasses from the Sierra, and balanced food so that they could later sell them when they were fatter in the center of the city. Some months ago they had a problem with grass scarcity in the Sierra because of the lack of rain. The first loan that she received was to buy more dairy cows. The milk that the animals produce is sold in the markets where it is used especially to make cheese. In the past they wasted a lot because of having to transport the cattle to the markets in the capital. Currently this has changed since they are the producers; they have their regular customers in the capital and these buyers sell it in the markets. The cattle business served to educate their children who are today professionals and now they are able to support their parents. It is wonderful for Benilda and her husband to have succeeded and they have also improved their house. This loan will be used to buy Ciclozona, an effective medicine that helps debug the cows and also to avoid infection, colds and fevers when they travel into cooler temperatures.

Translated from Spanish by Miriam Palacio, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy medicine for the cattle

loans.name: Adrian Wilder

texts.es:
Nuestro socio Adrian pertenece al Banco Comunal “GRANITO DE MOSTAZA de la Asociación Arariwa y tiene 43 años.  Adrian  nació en la ciudad de Cusco.  Actualmente, Adrian vive en la misma ciudad junto con su esposa Lizbeth y su hijo Adriano de 6 años.  

Adrian tiene un pequeño taller de mecánica. Ya son varios años que se dedica al taller y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo. Adrian trabaja los 6 días de la semana de lunes a viernes desde las 7 hasta las 6 de la noche. Adrian requiere el préstamo para comprar una grúa. 

El socio se encuentra agradecido por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Adrian is a member of the Communal Bank “Granito de Mostaza” (Mustard Seed), which is part of Asociación Arariwa. He is 43 years old and was born in the city of Cusco. Adrian still lives in Cusco with his wife Lizbeth and his six year old son Adriano.

Adrian has a small auto repair shop. He has worked several years as a mechanic and has done very well as a result of the effort he puts into his work. Adrian works five days a week, Monday through Friday, from 7am to 6pm. He needs a loan to buy a vehicle lift.

Adrian is grateful for the opportunity that has been provided and promises to complete his payments by the established deadlines.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase a vehicle lift

loans.name: Antony

texts.en:
Antony M. is a 40-year-old gentleman who is married to Caroline Wacera. He repairs broken electronics in his shop which is within the Dandora area. His business is in the urban area and his clients are middle-income earners who live within his area of business operation.

Antony learnt about KADET from his friend; he joined a group and is now accessing his first loan. He will use the loan to add more electronics spares to his shop.

Antony hopes to venture into the transport and real estate industries in the future.

loans.use: To add more electronics spares to his stock

loans.name: Beverly

texts.en:
Beverly V., from the village of Palabotan, Dupax del Sur, Nueva Vizcaya, is 23 years old and single. To make a living, Beverly owns and operates a business selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap and cosmetics in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 6000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Beverly joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Having repaid her previous loan of 5,000 PHP from ASKI that was used to purchase materials needed to expand services provided, Beverly is now requesting a new loan, her second, of 7,000 PHP to invest in expanding the business. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her enterprise.

About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 21 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partners to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

location.town: Palabotan, Dupax del Sur, Nueva Vizcaya

loans.name: Rosario

texts.en:
Rosario O. is a 54 year old married woman who supports her family by operating three business ventures:  general store, frozen foods, and e-load. She lives in Sitio. Estaca, Brgy. Lantad, Silay City, Negros Occidental. She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2007 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her various businesses, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of PHP 5,000. Rosario is now borrowing PHP 19,000 so that she can buy more stock to sell in her general store. This will be her 7th loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of 15,000, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey toward economic freedom. Rosario aspires to elevate her family's living conditions and ensure their future well-being by following the Dungganon way. 

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking  the link to the   NWTF Kiva lending team  on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: To purchase more stock to sell.

loans.name: Simon

texts.es:
El señor Simon  vive en casa propia en la zona de Villa de las nieves de la ciudad de La Paz, esta casado tiene dos niños de 10 y 5 años de edad que están en colegio; Simon  trabaja como empleado en una empresa de venta de papeles donde percibe un sueldo mínimo, que apenas le alcanza para la subsistencia de la familia.

El crédito que solicita es para la compra de un equipo de amplificación, con el cual quiere poner un negocio de servicio de música para reuniones y fiestas, y  así mejorar sus ingresos.

Es cliente antiguo de Impro y tiene un historial de pagos  muy bueno, por lo tanto puede acceder a un nuevo crédito.
texts.en:
Simon lives in his own home in the neighborhood of Villa de las Nieves in the city of La Paz. He's married and has two children, 10-and-5-years-old, who are currently in elementary school. Simon works for a paper company and he receives the minimum wage, which barely provides subsistence for his family. 

The loan he's requesting is for the purchase of a sound system, which he wants to use to start a DJ service for meetings and parties, thereby increasing his income.

He's worked with Impro a long time and he has a good payment history, which is why he's able to access a new loan.

loans.use: Purchase of a sound system to start a DJ service

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Joyce O. is a thirty-five year old cereals sales lady in Likoni Mombasa. She is married to Hezekiel, who is a contractor, and supports her income. They are blessed with four children. Joyce has been in the cereals and onion selling business for the last year and has done a great job. 

Joyce has now applied for her second loan in KADET, and she wants to purchase more sacks of cereals and onions for sale and use the anticipated profit to boost her second business, which is food vending. She hopes to have a successful future.

loans.use: To purchase more sacks of cereals and onions.

loans.name: Yaa

texts.en: Yaa B. sells ladies underwear, Fante kenkey, meat and other items at Abura. Yaa is married and takes care of five dependants. Her husband is a farmer. Yaa uses the income she makes from her sales in assisting her husband to take care of her family. Yaa will use the loan to purchase more of her goods to sell. With the new profits from her expanded business, Yaa plans to educate her dependants.

loans.use: Yaa will use the loan to purchase more of her goods to sell.

loans.name: Cruz De Cantera Group

texts.es:
Este grupo adoptó el nombre de cruz de cantera, dado que frente al negocio donde son las reuniones hay una cruz de cantera que tiene aproximadamente 100 años, es un signo distintivo de la región ademas de otros emblemas que distinguen al Municipio de Aculco considerado como un “Pueblo Mágico”, el grupo se ubica en el Estado de México y está conformado por 10 personas.

La sra. Aurelia G.  es la tesorera del grupo, tiene 36 años de edad, estudió la primaria, tiene un hijo, y se dedica ala venta de tortillas desde hace 7 años. Solicita el prestamo para la compra de maiz a menor costo porque en esta temporada de cosecha en la región el precio del maiz disminuye, es una estrategia que ha utilizado y le ha dado buenos resultados. La opinión de sus clientes es de que es un buen producto y que tiene un toque especial por ello consumen el producto, reparte a domicilio a las comunidades aledañas, tambien cuenta con clientes del estado de Queretaro (le consumen cada 8 dias) y clientes del estado de Puebla (le consumen cada 15 dias). Ella inicio vendiendo tortillas en su domicilio, repartiendo su producto en una bicicleta; con su arduo trabajo posteriormente compro un vehiculo que le facilito aun más las entregas (hace 5 años).
Al solicitar el prestamo la señora siente segura de poder salir adelante, además de contar con el apoyo moral de sus compañeras. En un futuro no muy lejano ella piensa adquirir un terreno con base a su trabajo y el apoyo de los presamistas.
texts.en:
This group is called 'Cruz de Cantera' (Stone Cross) because opposite the business where the group meetings take place there is a stone cross which is approximately 100 years old.  It is a symbol of the region along with other symbols which characterize the town of Aculco which is considered a “Pueblo Mágico” (Magic Town).  The group is located in the State of Mexico and has 10 members.

Aurelia G. is the group's treasurer.  She is 36 years old and completed her primary education.  She has one child and has been selling tortillas for 7 years.  She is requesting this loan to buy corn at a lower price because during this harvest season in the region, the price of corn falls.  It is a strategy which she has used in the past and it has had good results.

Her customers believe that Aurelia's product is good and has that special touch.  This is why they consume her product.  Aurelia delivers to people's homes in neighboring communities.  She also has customers in the State of Queretaro (who consume her product every week) and in the State of Puebla (who consume her product every fortnight).  Aurelia started selling tortillas from her home, delivering her product on a bicycle.  Through a lot of hard work she managed to buy a vehicle 5 years ago which has helped her a lot with her deliveries.

At the moment of requesting her loan, Aurelia feels sure that she can get ahead in life with the moral support of her fellow group members.  In the not-so-distant future, she would like to acquire a plot of land through her hard work and the support of her lenders.

loans.use: To buy corn to make tortillas

loans.name: Marie

texts.en:
This is 32-year-old Marie K.. She is married and has one child who is four years old. In 2000, Marie established her clothing business. She began her business because she wanted to support her family. Working six days a week and eight hours a day, she earns about $140 every month. 

She would like a loan in the amount of 3,000,000 SLL in order to add more stock to her business. She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits by approximately 295,000 SLL. In the future, Marie plans to educate her children and open a wholesale shop. She would also like to help  her husband provide for the family and keep up her home. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: purchase additional items for her store

loans.name: Victor

texts.es: Víctor tiene 37 años, vive con su esposa y su hijo en su casa propia. Desde que era un niño aprendió las técnicas agrarias, hoy lo hace de manera independiente, por lo que han transcurrido 7 años dedicándose a la siembra de papa y de otros productos de mayor escala. En muchas ocasiones su esposa y sus hijos le apoyan en esta tarea, asimismo cría animales como: pollos y cuyes que le sirve para el consumo propio familiar, así como en la generase algún ingreso luego de venderlos en la feria de su localidad. Hasta el momento Víctor considera que las ventas de sus cosechas son rentables, y eso lo anima a intensificarse en esa actividad, por lo que espera en el futuro comprar maquinaria y contratar personal. Es el crédito número 4 con MFP, esta muy contenta de saber que tiene un apoyo financiero, además  le agrada ser parte de su banco comunal porque  todos sus integrantes son personas que conoce, responsables y muy solidarias. Agradece a todas las personas que serán gestoras del préstamo que solicita ya que le será  muy útil en el progreso de su actividad económica. Con el crédito que recibirá, comprará insumos para la agricultura como semillas y abono; asimismo contratará peones para que le ayuden en dicha siembra.
texts.en: Victor is 37 years old. He lives with his wife and their son in his own house. Since he was young, he learned farming skills. Today, he farms independently as seven years have passed dedicating himself to sowing potato and other products on a larger scale. On many occassions, his wife and their children help him with this work. Additionally, he raises animals like chicken and guinea pigs that feed his family and also generate some income when sold at the local market. When Victor realized that selling his harvest was profitable, it encouraged him to intensify his work since he hoped in the future to buy machinery and hire workers. This is his loan number four with MFP. He is very happy to know that he has financial support. Additionally, he is happy to be part of his community bank because all the members are people he knows, are responsible and very unified. He is thankful to all the people who will be loaning the money he is requesting since it will be very useful in the progress of his economic activity. With the loan that he will receive, he will buy inputs for farming such as seeds and fertilizer. Additionally, he will hire workers to help him with said planting.

loans.use: Purchase seeds and bags of fertilizer, and also hire laborers.

loans.name: Esperanza Y Progreso 2 Group

texts.en:
Cristina is a mother of four children, she runs a clothings sales business from her home and walking by different communities. This group comes from an extremely poor area in San Pedro de Macoris, Dominican Republic; a city famous for baseball players and sugar cane industries, the main economic activity is a free trading zone, a cement factory, and others. Those living in the Dominican Republic have no access to running potable water, and electricity and healthcare are unreliable at best. Cristina is having her ninth loan with Esperanza International, in hopes to continue improving her life and the lives of her family.  She live with her 4 children and her long term partner.

Cristina will be using this loan to purchase a variety of cloths, for kids, men and women especially; also she will buy shoes and other products like accessories. She has had her business for over six years, using some saving she had, she started her business. She will use the profits invest in building expenses since she started building her house. She is thankful for the loans and she is in wonder of sharing her life that has been improved.  She is reaching her goals and with God, this loan opportunity, and her business all of her dreams come true. Thanks for your support!

loans.use: to buy clothing

loans.name: William

texts.es:
William M. es vecino  de la comunidad llamada trinchera de Pital en Alajuela, conocida internacionalmente por ser  la zona de mayor exportación de piña  en Costa Rica. 
A pesar de que hay grandes Multinacionales exportando la piña costarricense, la producción de piña artesanal también está dando frutos en esta zona.
 Es por eso que William necesita  ¢500 000 (quinientos mil colones) para iniciar su proyecto  de siembra de piña, comprando la pina y los insumos necesarios para tener la mejor cosecha.
El es socio de la Empresa Comunal de Mujeres al Éxito de la Trinchera de Pital, una de las 100 organizaciones socias de EDESA en Costa Rica
texts.en:
William M. is a neighbor of the Trinchera de Pital community en Alajuela.  This is the region known world wide for producing the most pineapple for export in Costa Rica. 
In spite of the big Multinationals exporting Costa Rican pineapple, the production of traditionally-grown pineapple has been successful in this region.  
That is why William is requesting $1025USD (five-hundred thousand colones) to start his pineapple planting project.  He needs to purchase the pineapple and the necessary supplies to ensure the best harvest possible.
William is a member of the "Empresa Comunal de Mujeres al Éxito de la Trinchera de Pital" (Communal Enterprise of the Successful Women of Trinchera de Pital) communal bank, one of the 100 member organizations of EDESA in Costa Rica.

loans.use: To plant pineapples.

loans.name: Emma

texts.en:
Emma is a 37-year-old married woman who supports her family by operating a sari-sari (general) store. She lives in Bago City, Negros Occidental. She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2009 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her sari-sari store, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of PHP 5,000. 

Emma is borrowing PHP 9,000 so that she can purchase more inventory to sell. This will be her fourth loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of PHP 7,000, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey toward economic freedom. Emma aspires to elevate her family's living conditions and ensure their future well-being by following the  Dungganon way. 

About NWTF: 
In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: To purchase inventory

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To be able to buy a new "Basta" in order to sell clothes for men and children in the new "Basta"

loans.name: Abena Kwesi

texts.en: Abena Kwesi A. operates a drinking spot where people pass by to have a drink. She sells bags of water as well. She is married and has three children. Her husband is a driver. She has been through senior high school.  Abena contributes to her husband's income to pay the expenses of the home. This loan will enable her to buy more crates of drinks to sell. The increased income will be invested back into the business for further growth.

loans.use: To buy more crates of drinks to sell.

loans.name: Melanie

texts.en:
Melanie is a married woman with two children. She is 35 years old and has been running a sari-sari store business for five years.

Melanie sells items like soft drinks, coffee, sugar and canned goods to the people in her community. She earns daily from the store. She is requesting a loan of 6,000 PHP to buy more items to sell, such as soft drinks and canned goods.

loans.use: to purchase soft drinks, canned goods and other merchandise to resell

loans.name: Maria Gloria

texts.es:
Maria tiene 47 años de edad. Es madre soltera con 2 hijos. Vive en casa propia, que está ubicada en el caserío Peñarol en el distrito de Tambogrande, un distrito agrícola que se encuentra situado en la región Piura, a más de cuatro horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital de la región Lambayeque. Maria vive en la parte rural de este distrito y no cuentan con los servicios básicos como agua o luz.

Se dedica a la crianza de aves de corral como pavos y gallinas contando con 10 pavos y 18 gallinas. Ella los engorda para luego comercializarlos en el mercado local.
