Lleva más de 3 años realizando esta actividad en la parte posterior de su casa. Desea comprar alimentos balanceado para el engorde de sus pavos y gallinas para que logren un tamaño y peso ideal. De esta manera, ella podrá venderlos a un mejor precio y seguir creciendo en su negocio. Por ello, María ha solicitado su primer préstamo de 500 nuevos soles del Kiva Field Partner, Edpyme Alternativa. Maria es una mujer bastante trabajadora y de muy buen carácter, las personas que le conocen le tienen mucha estima y cariño. Su mayor anhelo es aumentar sus ingresos para poder brindarles una mejor calidad de vida a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Maria is 47 years old. She is a single mother with 2 children. She lives in her own house, which is located in the settlement of Peñarol in the district of Tambogrande, an agricultural district located in the Piura region, more than four hours from the city of Chiclayo, the capital of the Lambayeque region. Maria lives in the rural part of this district and does not have basic services such as water and electricity connections. 

Her work is raising domestic birds such as turkeys and hens. She currently has 10 turkeys and 18 hens. She fattens them up and later sells them in the local market. She has done this work for more than 3 years in the area behind her home. She would like to buy balanced feed to fatten her turkeys and hens, so that they can reach an ideal size and weight. Thus, she will be able to sell them for a better price and continue to expand her business. For this reason, María has applied for her first loan, for 500 Peruvian new soles, from the Kiva field partner Edpyme Alternativa. Maria is a very hard-working woman, with an excellent character; people who know her have much esteem and affection for her. Her greatest desire is to increase her income so that she can provide a better quality of life to her children.

loans.use: to buy balanced feed for her domestic birds

loans.name: Big

texts.en: Big T., 49, is married and resides in Takeo Province, Cambodia, an area known for Pre-angkorean temples. T. sells bananas, earning an income of about USD 3 per day, while her husband, a carpenter, earns USD 5 per day. Each month, the family has to spend USD 45 on food and USD 30 on the other necessary expenses. T. is requesting a loan of USD 1000 to purchase a motorbike for the children to commute to work. This will be her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner.

loans.use: to buy a motorbike for the children to commute to work

loans.name: Banzragch

texts.en: Banzragch is 54-year-old widow and lives with her five children in a house in Zavhan province, Mongolia. Her older three children are all grown up and work in public and private companies. Her younger two daughters go to a college and a secondary school. She manages a vegetable trading business in her town. She has been planting and harvesting vegetables for 31 years and became expert in her field. Now she owns one hectare land where she plants daily-consumed vegetables and large amount of garlic. She is a hard-working woman who says, "Last year all my planted garlic was stolen. So this year I want to have my own storage house in order to preserve all my vegetables." She is requesting a 3,000,000 MNT loan to  build a storage house for her business.

loans.use: To build a store house.

loans.name: Felicita

texts.es: Felicita, de 63 años, es una mujer que a lo largo de su vida siempre ha trabajado muy duro, vive en su casa propia y lo que más desea es tener una vejez tranquila. El trabajo de Felicita es el tejido artesanal, el cual viene realizando desde que tenia 10 años, cuando ayudaba a sus padres a terminar los pedidos que tenían. Ahora ella tiene su propio taller de tejidos, el cual esta ubicado en su casa, en el distrito de Villa el Salvador, en donde atiende con mucha alegría a sus clientes. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es conversar con sus clientes y aconsejarles sobre las prendas que mejor les quedaran. Lleva 15 años en este trabajo y considera que lo más difícil es tener que permanecer todo el día en su puesto de venta, ya que tiene que cuidarlo, aún así sabe que tiene que trabajar muy duro para alcanzar sus metas, para crecer su negocio y poner una tienda de ropa artesanal. Este es el octavo crédito con MFP, espera ser puntual en sus pagos, ya que no desea perjudicar a las demás socias de su banco comunal, en donde es muy querida y respetada. Con el crédito solicitado, comprara más lana para continuar con la elaboración de tejidos pendientes que tiene.
texts.en:
Felicia, 63, is a woman who has worked hard during her life.  She lives in her own house and what she wants most is to have a peaceful old age.  Since she was 10 years old she has done creative knitting.  She started  knitting to help her parents finish their orders.  Now she has her own knitting workshop located in her house in the Villa el Salvador area where she cheerfully takes care of her customers. 

 What she most likes about her work is chatting with the customers and advising them about which articles look the best on them.  She has done this work for the last 15 years and what she finds the most difficult is staying in the workshop all day to sell.  She knows that she has to work very hard to achieve her goals-for her business to grow and to have a specialty clothing shop.  This is her 8th loan with MFP.  She plans to make her payments on time since she doesn't want to jeopardize the position of the other members of the communal bank where she is very respected and liked.  She will use the loan to buy more wool to continue producing the knitwear orders that she has.

loans.use: To buy more wool

loans.name: Sorphoirn

texts.en:
Sorphoirn (pictured here) is 49 years old and her husband, Rotha, is 43 years old. They live on an island in the Mekong River about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh. They have no children.
Sorphoirn is a babysitter, while her husband is a radio and television repairer. Sorphoirn has a motorbike for commuting, but the motorbike is old and breaks down, which is costly to repair. Hence Sorphoirn has decided to sell it and is asking for a loan of $600 to add to money from the sale of the old motorbike to purchase a new one.

loans.use: to purchase a new motorcycle.

loans.name: Rahab

texts.en:
Rahab has practiced farming in Ndunyu Njeru town for the last ten years.  She is 46 years old, married to Joseph and they have ten school-going children.  

She was introduced to KADET by one of our field officers and this will be her 2nd loan.  She paid off her previous loan of  20,000 KES well and in good time.  She plans to use this loan amount to buy potato seeds and fertilizer, and also to pay her casual workers.

In future, Rahab hopes to buy more land and practice large scale farming.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizer, and to pay her casual workers.

loans.name: Rosalpina

texts.es:
Rosa, de 50 años de edad, habita en Pueblo Nuevo, municipio de Estelí, esta casada es madre de 2 hijos, ella es maestra de matemáticas en una escuela primaria y a la ves es comerciante vende ropa y zapato.  Ella inicio su negocio en el año 1992, con la ayuda de su esposa y el salario que recibía como maestra al transcurrir el tiempo fue ampliando y mejorando su inventario de ropa y zapatos ahora lo tiene un poco más surtido.    
Ella solicito el préstamo para la compra de ropa y zapatos para su venta. Ella espera tener abastecido su inventario con nuevo y variados productos para ofertar a sus clientes y mejorar sus ventas. En sus planes futuros esta hacerle mejoras de infraestructura a su negocio y su casa.
texts.en:
Rosa is 50 years old and lives in Pueblo Nuevo, in Estelí.  She is married and has two children.  Rosa is a math teacher in an elementary school and also sells clothes and shoes.  She started her business in 1992 with the help of her husband and the salary she received from her teaching job.  Over time she has expanded her business and improved her stock of clothes and shoes.  Now her business is a little better stocked.

Rosa requested a loan to buy clothes and shoes to sell.  She hopes to stock her business with a variety of new products to offer her customers and thereby improve her sales.  Some of her plans for the future are to make improvements to the infrastructure of her business and her home.

loans.use: to buy clothes and shoes to sell

loans.name: Maria Asunciona

texts.es:
María de 45 años de edad, vive con su esposo e hijos en su casa propia, cuenta con servicio de agua y luz, ubicada en la zona rural de la provincia de Pacasmayo que pertenece al departamento de La Libertad.  Esta zona se caracteriza por ser  agrícola, ganadera y turística.

Desde hace algún tiempo María se dedica a la comercialización de aves de corral (pavos, gallina y gallos), los cría en los corrales que tiene en su casa, los alimenta con comida balanceada y granos naturales, una vez que hayan completado su crecimiento, los vende a sus clientes o en los diferentes mercados de la zona  y con los ingresos podrá cubrir sus necesidades familiares.

Ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 800 nuevos soles para comprar más aves de corral y su respectivo alimento, para seguir ofertándolos a sus clientes y con las ganancias poder pagar el crédito otorgado y mejorar el nivel de vida de su familia.  María con trabajo y empeño a logrado salir adelante poco a poco y poderles brindar a sus hijos otras oportunidades académicas.
texts.en: María is 45 and lives with her husband and children in her own home, in the rural province of Pacasmayo, La Libertad.  This region is known for its agriculture, livestock and tourism.  For some time, María has raised poultry (turkeys, chickens and roosters) in pens behind her home.  She feeds them balanced grains, and once full size she sells them to clients in local markets to provide for her family.  She now seeks a credit from Edpyme Alternativa in the amount of 800 nuevos soles to buy more birds and feed, to satisfy client demand.  She expects profits to allow quick repayment of the loan and also to cover for her family's needs.  María also hopes that her hard work results in better academic opportunities for her children.

loans.use: to buy poultry and feed

loans.name: Elena

texts.en:
Elena is 46 years old and a widow with five children.

Elena works hard to provide for her family. She runs a sari-sari (variety) store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 23,000 loan through NWTF to buy items like shampoo, groceries, etc., to sell in her sari-sari store.

Elena has borrowed and repaid 17 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the sari-sari store for five years and also earns an income from electronic reloading.

Elena aspires to save enough to build a house for her family and to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy items to sell in her sari-sari store.

loans.name: Sergio

texts.es:
El Señor Sergio es casado, se dedica a la reparación de autos y chapería desde hace ya un buen tiempo. Repara los autos de la mayoría de sus vecinos, por lo que se ha hecho de muy buena fama y reputación. Por medio de su buena atención ha logrado crearse una buena cantidad de clientes. Manifiesta que su oficio le genera muy buenos ingresos.
El comenta que gracias a la ayuda de su esposa e hijos logran progresar cada día, uno de sus sueños es poder tener un tinglado donde pueda tener almacenar mas cantidad de vehículos. Todo lo que el realiza es por darle a su esposa e hijos un futuro digno y un mejor estilo de vida.
Solicita el crédito para la compra de repuestos para autos que va a utilizar en su taller de autos. Está muy esperanzado en el crédito, ya que le será de gran ayuda.
texts.en:
Sergio is married and has worked in auto repair and bodywork for quite some time. He repairs the majority of his neighbors’ cars, which is why he has become well known and has a good reputation. As a result of his good service, he has been able to generate a good amount of customers. He says that his work provides him with a good income.

He mentions that thanks to the help of his wife and children, they are able to progress each day. One of his dreams is to be able to have a shed where he can store more vehicles. Everything he does is to provide his wife and children with a decent future and a better quality of life.

He is requesting a loan for the purchase of spare auto parts to use at his auto repair shop. He is very hopeful for the loan, as it will be of great help to him.

loans.use: to buy spare parts to use at his shop.

loans.name: Mujeres Virtuosas Group

texts.es:
El Comité de Mujeres de nombre Mujeres Virtuosas, se conformó en el año 2008, gracias a que la Directora General la Señora Petrona se informó del Programa gracias a la presidenta de otro grupo que era su vecina y la misma la invitó a formar su propio grupo, la misma contacto con la asesora informándose del programa Comité de Mujeres Emprendedoras y de su forma de trabajo. Y luego logró juntar a 16 mujeres quienes se encuentran trabajando muy a gusto ya se el 9no. ciclo, en forma conjunta y solidaria dentro del programa.
La señora Isabel se dedica a la venta de alimentos, gracias al buen sazón que tiene ha logrado formar una clienteal bien definida. Comenta que este trabajo le genera muy buenos ingresos y gracias a esto puede paliar los gastos que día a día surgen en la casa. Una de sus metas es poder abrir un local de venta de comestibles, donde pueda deleitar a las personas con sus platillos.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de carne, pollo, verduras y otros, insumos necesarios para la elaboracion de los alimentos que vende.
texts.en:
This women's committee called "Mujeres Virtuosas" ("Virtuous Women") was formed in 2008, thanks to the Director General, Señora Petrona.  She found out about the Program thanks to the president of another group, who was her neighbor.  This neighbor invited her to form her own group.  She contacted the adviser to learn about the Program "Committee of Entrepreneurial Women", and how it works.  She then succeeded in bringing together 16 women who very much enjoy working.  They are in their ninth lending cycle, and are in the program in full unity and togetherness.

Señora Isabel works selling food; thanks to the good taste of her food, she has been able to gain a solid customer base.  She comments that this work earns her a very good income, and thanks to this, she is able to cover the expenses that arise at home on a daily basis.  One of her goals is to be able to open premises to sell food, where she can delight people with her dishes.

She is requesting the loan for the purchase of meat, chicken, vegetables and other things; necessary ingredients for preparing the food she sells.

loans.use: to buy meat, chicken, vegetables, and other things to make food dishes.

loans.name: Nilda

texts.es: Nilda, de 34 años, es una madre de familia muy alegre y trabajadora; vive en su casa propia junto a su esposo Rene de 35 años y sus 2 queridos hijos Dania y Etno, quienes son el principal motivo de todos su esfuerzo, los educa y cuida en el caserío de Patay. Con el carisma que la caracteriza, menciona que gracias a la agricultura; logró todos sus objetivos. Pues los cultivos de Nilda, son los mejores cuidados del poblado; sus sembríos de papa, alverjas, lechuga y flor de gladiolo, son de muy buena calidad, ya que ella se ha encargado de abonarlos muy bien. En el mercado de Tarma, que es donde vende sus productos, los clientes solicitan mucho sus cosechas, motivo por el cual siempre obtiene un buen precio por ellos. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es la época de la cosecha, ya que siente que los meses de arduo trabajo, son recompensados, lleva 12 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es cuidar sus cultivos de las inclemencias del clima. Por ello planea comprar un puesto en el mercado mayorista, con el cual desea mejorar sus ingresos económicos, pero sin dejar la agricultura, que es lo que más le gusta. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “Santa cruz de Patay” y este es el décimo crédito con MFP, donde ha sido muy puntual en el pago de sus cuotas, ya que siente que tiene un compromiso con la institución. Nilda de recibir su apoyo; invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de una bolsa de semilla de alverja que sembrará dentro de poco.
texts.en:
Nilda, age 34, is a very happy and hard-working mother, She lives in her own home with her husband Rene, age 35, and their two beloved children Dania and Etno. Their children are the main motivation behind all of their hard work. They care for and educate their children in the hamlet of Patay. With her trademark charisma, Nilda says that she has achieved all of her goals thanks to farming. Nilda's crops are the best in the area; her potato, pea, lettuce and
gladiolus flower are of very good quality, since she is sure to fertilize them very well. She sells her products in the Tarma market, where her customers frequently request her products; so she always gets a good price for them. What she most enjoys about her work is harvest time, since she feels that the months of hard work are rewarded. She has done this work for twelve years, and finds her greatest challenge to be caring for her crops against inclement weather. She plans to buy a stall in the wholesale market in order to improve her income without leaving agriculture, which is her favourite activity. She belongs to the "Santa Cruz de Patay" communal bank, and this is her tenth loan with MFP. She has been very punctual in the payment of her quotas, as she feels that she has a commitment to the institution. Upon receiving your support, Nilda will invest the requested loan in the purchase of a bag of pea seeds which she will soon sow.

loans.use: to buy a bag of pea seeds.

loans.name: Geoffrey

texts.en:
Geoffrey is 28 years old and married with two children. He practices dairy farming to earn a living. He has been in this business for two years.  He also sells chickens to supplement his income.  

Geoffrey has been able to grow his business with his previous loans from Faulu Kenya. He hopes to grow his business and open other outlets in five years.  He has requested a loan of 30,000 Kenyan shillings to renovate the cowshed.

loans.use: To renovate the cowshed.

loans.name: Las Reynas Group

texts.es:
La Sra. Lucy de 35 años de edad, madre soltera, empeñosa alentadora y luchadora es madre  de 4 hijos menores  de edad  en etapa escolar .Lucy es una de las socias que conforman nueva   alcancía comunal Las Reynas.
La  socia se dedica actualmente  a su tienda de abarrotes  en general, ubicado en su misa casa, Solcita el préstamo para poder incrementar mas mercadería para así generara más ingresos .Desearía  para el futuro tener una tienda mas para así mejorar la calidad de vida de sus menores hijos .Lucy  en la foto viste una casaca color rojo, se encuentra ubicada a lado izquierdo de la  socia que viste una casaca color marrón  y buzo rosado 
.
texts.en:
Lucy, 35, is a single mother of four minor, school age children.  She’s enterprising, encouraging and tenacious.  Lucy’s one of the members of a new communal bank called “Las Reynas.”  She’s currently dedicated to her grocery store that’s located in her home.  She is asking for the loan to be able to increase her merchandise and generate higher income.  She’d like in the future to have another store to improve the quality of life of her minor children that way.  In the photo, Lucy is wearing a red jacket and she’s located to the left of the member wearing a brown jacket and pink sweatshirt.

.

loans.use: to buy more merchandise.

loans.name: Hajraan's Group

texts.en:
Hajraan is 28 years old, married, and has three sons. She operates a grocery store where she sells daily-use items such as spices, sugar, rice, lentils, soaps, etc. She provides very good customer service and makes good sales.
 
Her husband has a bike rental business. He has some motorbikes which he rents to his customers. He charges the customers by the hour. 

Hajraan has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for the further expansion of her grocery store business. With the loan, she will buy groceries in bulk that will allow her to fulfill client orders on time and increase her profits. She is confident that an investment will help her increase her household income.

loans.use: To buy groceries for grocery store business

loans.name: Choijilsuren

texts.en: Choijilsuren is 36 years old and lives with his wife and children in the Uvurhangai province of Mongolia. His wife helps with his business while the elder two children are school students and the younger one goes to kindergarten. Choijilsuren makes frames for gers (Mongolian yurts) for a living, and his wife paints them. He is well-known for his quality products. Now that winter is approaching, demand is high, and he needs more raw materials. He is a hardworking and diligent man who says, "Now that my business is going well, I need to meet my demand." He is requesting 1,400,000 MNT to buy timber.

loans.use: to buy timber.

loans.name: Grace Group

texts.en: Eurita is a 50 year-old widow from Harare.   She has four children, all attending school.  Eurita runs a peanut butter manufacturing business. The business has been in operation for 6 years. She says the main challenges faced are shortage of groundnuts, as production is seasonal. She has requested a loan of $400 to buy groundnuts. Eurita says the extra income generated as a result of this loan will allow her to improve the family's welfare. In the future, she plans to buy machinery to reduce manual work.

loans.use: To buy groundnuts

loans.name: Vahid

texts.en:
Vahid is 57 years old.  He breeds and raises cattle and has been in business for the last 10 years. 

He is married and has three children. 

Vahid buys small calves, raise and fatten them and sells them for a profit every 5 to 6 months.  He usually sells them for meat purposes in the livestock bazaar. 

His monthly income is 250 AZN.  His wife helps him run the business. 

Now Vahid has applied for a 1500 AZN loan to purchase four calves.  This will be his fifth loan and he has a good credit history.

loans.use: to purchase four calves.

loans.name: Abiba

texts.fr:
Abiba est une femme  âgé(e) de 39 ans. Elle est mariée å un militaire. Elle a 03 enfants tous scolarisés. L’ainé a 08ans et le dernier 03ans.
Abiba travaille comme revendeuse depuis 2008. Elle vend dans une boutique à domicile après achat à Lomé.
Abiba a requis son premier crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter plus de marchandises. Elle veut agrandir l’activité. 
Dans les prochaines années, Abiba voudrait diversifier sa marchandise. Elle dit qu’avec les profits, Elle prévoit assurer les besoins élémentaires de la famille.
texts.en:
Abiba is a 39-year-old woman. She is married to a military man. She has three children who are all in school. The eldest is eight and the youngest three years old.

Abiba has been working as a vendor since 2008. She sells from a store in her home after purchasing her products in Lomé.

Abiba requested her first loan from WAGES in order to buy more merchandise. She wants to expand her business.

In the coming years, Abiba would like to diversify her merchandise. She says that with the profits, she plans to take care of her family's basic needs.

loans.use: to buy basic groceries

loans.name: Akech

texts.en:
Akech is a 28-year-old married woman with two children. One of her children is in school. For the past year, she has had a business selling food items in Bor, South Sudan. 

Akech requested this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase sugar and soda. She will use the extra income she generates as a result of this loan to build a house in the future.

loans.use: to purchase sugar and soda for sale.

loans.name: Omar

texts.en: Omar is a 28-year-old Lebanese married man living with his wife and two children who are still attending school. He really cares for their future and is ready to do the best he can to see them graduate and attain higher educational degrees.  For that reason, he started to work in a local airport in 2007. In parallel, he works as a policeman in one of the local municipalities. Today, he’s asking for a loan of $1500 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to pay his children's educational fees. In that way, they will be able to continue their education properly. In the future, he plans to focus on one industry as to make more profits and better support his family.

loans.use: to pay his children's educational fees

loans.name: Meri

texts.en: Meri lives in Sisian with her husband and three children. For three years, she has kept cattle and cultivated land. Now Meri would like to expand her farm and develop agriculture. With the requested loan, she plans to purchase livestock and forage. Expansion of the farm will allow Meri to get more income. Meri wants to see her children well educated and sustained in the future, so this loan will allow her to implement these goals.

loans.use: to pay for livestock and forage.

loans.name: Kimsok's Group

texts.en:
Kimsok is 40 years old, married and has no child. She is a villager near the mountainous area of the Ratanak Mondul district and has been growing maize as her primary business for more than five years. 
Kimsok has been with Kiva partner VisionFund since 2009 and she has been able to feed her family regularly. She successfully paid back her loan with VisionFund. She is now applying for a loan with her group members, who have also been with VisionFund from two to seven years. As the group leader, Kimsok will use this loan to buy fertilizer for her maize farm. She hopes to grow more healthy maize to increase her household’s income and improve her lifestyle.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for her maize farm.

loans.name: Peter

texts.en: Peter operates a farming business. He describes himself as an honest man with a future goal to succeed in business and purchase a lorry to transport food crops to the market. He is applying for a loan of KES 25,000 that will be used to purchase a water tank. Challenges he faces include inadequate water storage facilities for his farm for irrigation. This will be his 3rd successive loan application with SMEP DTM, with his previous loan being KES 30,000.

loans.use: To purchase a a water tank.

loans.name: Edward

texts.en: Edward is a 41-year-old male. He is a teacher at Kibanda Secondary School and has been in this service for 14 years. He joined this profession because of the passion he had for it and also to earn a living. However, low and delayed salary payments make it difficult for him to meet his daily needs. Since his dream is  farming, Edward is requesting a loan for farming.

loans.use: to farm

loans.name: Noemi

texts.es:
Noemi es una joven emprendedora, tiene 23 años de edad y vive en Santiago junto a su esposo.
Es una persona con muchas ganas de salir adelante, desde casi 1 año trabaja como obrera en una construcción que se está realizando en la zona donde reside, le va muy bien porque es muy trabajadora, respetuosa, siempre dedicada a su labor.
Noemi está agradecida con los prestamistas Kiva porque con el apoyo que le han brindado ella podrá comprarse una moto lineal para transportarse de un lugar a otro sin inconvenientes y pueda trabajar de manera más eficiente, con esto ella ahorrará tiempo que podrá dedicarlo a otras labores y con mucho esfuerzo y dedicación más adelante logrará cumplir su más grande sueño: "Tener su casa propia"
texts.en:
Noemi is an entrepreneurial young woman. She is 23 years old and lives in Santiago with her husband. She is a person who is eager to get ahead. For almost one year, she has been working as a laborer on a construction site that is in the area where she resides. It is going very well for her because she is very hard-working, respectful and always dedicated to her work. 

Noemi is thankful to the Kiva lenders because, with the support that they have offered her, she can buy a motorcycle in order to transport herself from one place to another without issues, and she can work in a more efficient manner. This will allow her to save time and dedicate it to other work, and with a lot of effort and dedication, she will eventually be able to achieve her biggest dream of having her own house.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle in order to move from one place to another

loans.name: Hudson

texts.en:
Hudson was born in 1962. He grew up in a humble family based in the North Rift region of Kenya. As a young boy, he demonstrated his ability to take initiative and showed a lot of promise. He went to school and managed to finish his secondary education. 

Today he lives with his wife, who is also a farmer, in  Mautuma, a small village in Lugari division of Kenya. He practises mixed farming on his one acre piece of land that he acquired five years ago. He sells milk and vegetables produced from the farm for a living. 

Hudson is seeking a loan of KES 100,000 to purchase a water pump generator and animal feed. He has experienced challenges with weather and water supply in the past and he hopes to resolve these. Water shortages in the past have led to wilting of his crops, poor nutrition of his animals, and low milk production levels. He has not considered drilling a borehole because even though water can pumped from deep boreholes, it is usually unsuitable for animals and irrigation because of minerals in the water as well as high drilling and operational costs. 

With your loan, he will be able to use a petrol generator to pump shallow ground water into tanks. The water will be useful for irrigation, animal consumption and domestic uses. 

Lend $25 to Hudson and impact his family in untold ways through changing the way he does business.

loans.use: to purchase a generator and animal feed

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To increase stock.

loans.name: Catherine

texts.en:
Catherine E. was born in Aného on September 20, 1963. She is married, has a child, and is also responsible for another person. She is a charcoal merchant, and her husband is a part-time mason. They both provide for the needs of the family. Although illiterate, she is energetic, and she has the ability to manager a loan and to repay it in a regular manner.

And so she is requesting a loan of $800 to build an inventory of charcoal from areas that produce it. Through buying wholesale, she can then make a better profit. She also needs to lease a store to stock the charcoal. The loan will be repaid in 12 months.

Translated from French by Daniel Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

Née le 20 septembre 1963 à Aného, Madame E. Catherine est mariée et mère d’un enfant. Elle a à sa charge une personne. Commerçante de charbon et son mari un maçon à temps partielle, ils subviennent tous deux aux besoins de la famille. Analphabète mais dynamique, elle à la capacité de gérer un crédit et de le rembourser normalement.

Ainsi donc, elle sollicite un crédit de $800 pour pouvoir s’approvisionner en gros en charbon de bois depuis les zones de production afin de réaliser un meilleur bénéfice. Elle a aussi besoin de louer un magasin pour stocker les charbons. Ce crédit sera remboursé en 12 mois.

loans.use: To do commerce in charcoal

loans.name: Jaime

texts.en:
Jaime has 8 years of experience selling and repairing shoes, a trade he learned little by little while working for someone else. His initiative to rent a site where he could put his own business was wise, since it has gone very well for him. He works every day of the week from 7 a.m. until 12 p.m., when he closes to business to return home to eat. He opens again from 2 p.m. until 7 p.m. He makes shoes on order for his clients, and repairs shoes and suitcases.

Jaime would like the loan so that he can buy a glass display case in which to display his products. He will also buy raw materials with which to continue producing shoes.

Jaime is single and 40 years old. He lives with a married brother and his mother.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Corcoran, Kiva volunteer.

Jaime tiene una experiencia de 8 años en el negocio de ventas y reparacion de calzado. Actividad que aprendió trabajando para otra persona de donde poco a poco fue adquiriendo el conocimiento. Su iniciativa de alquilar un local para poner su negocio fue decisiva ya que le ha ido muy bien. Trabaja todos los días de la semana en horario de 7 a.m. hasta las 12 p.m. Luego el cierra su negocio para ir a comer. Lo vuelve abrir desde las 2 p.m. hasta las 7 p.m. Su trabajo consiste en elaborar zapatos los que después los entrega ha clientes fijos. Además en su taller realiza trabajos de costura de zapatos y maletas.

Jaime desea el crédito para poder comprar una vitrina donde poder exhibir sus productos y también comprar materia prima para seguir elaborando zapatos. /p>

Jaime es soltero. Tiene 40 años. Vive con un hermano que es casado y su madre.

loans.use: Buy a glass display case

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Expand his bicycle repair shop

loans.name: Beauty

texts.en:
Beauty Almuaenmwosa is 44 years old and married with 7 children. She lives in Benin City, Edo State, Nigeria. She has been with LAPO for 6 years as a leader of her union.

She has been in business since 1995. Beauty believes that once she has additional stock, her customers will be able to purchase more goods from her and thus help her store thrive. She is therefore requesting a $450 loan to help increase her stock.

loans.use: To buy more provisions and kerosene for sale

loans.name: Gayatri

texts.en:
Mrs. Gayatri D., 35 years old, resident of Kulashwor, Nepal, lives in a single (i.e., not extended) family with her husband Shyam D. and two sons whose ages are 3 and 1 respectively. Her older son is in pre-primary school.

Mr. and Mrs. D. opened a grocery shop a few years ago. They both work in their own shop, but due to the lack of business capital they can't expand their business. So in order to expand their business, Mrs. D. is requesting a loan of US$ 175. With this amount she will buy noodles, biscuits, rice, etc. for her shop. She is ready to pay back the loan on a monthly basis.

loans.use: To buy grocery goods to stock her shop

loans.name: Noemí

texts.es:
Mrs. Noemi C. C. D. A. and her husband, Hermenegildo, maintain their strength and drive despite the difficult times after the painful loss of their baby. They continue to progress so that they can proviD. for the well-being of their remaining five children who are all of school age. These exempliary parents dedicate themselves to the raising and selling alpacas. Each Sunday in the small town of Ocuviri Noemi sells a diverse selection of clothing in the street fair. The diversity of her wares helps her to earn good revenues. The added revenue helps to satisfy the necessities of her home.

Noemi’s great wish is to further increase the variety and stock of her products so that she can proviD. for the betterment and studies of her children. This is the invaluable inheritance that these humble parents wish to leave to their children. With our help they will be able to.

Translated from Spanish by Casey Unrein, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Noemí y su esposo, Hermenegildo, a pesar D. los momentos muy difíciles que vienen pasando por la penosa pérdida D. su pequeño, aún conservan el ímpetu y ánimo D. progresar para otorgarles bienestar a los cinco pequeños que aún tiene en casa y en etapa escolar. Estos ejemplares padres se dedican a la crianza y comercialización D. alpacas, y los domingos días D. feria del pueblito D. Ocuviri, Noemí venD. en forma ambulatoria diversas prendas D. vestir, negocio que por la diversidad D. su mercadería le viene otorgando satisfacción ya que le permite obtener buenos ingresos económicos para la satisfacción D. las necesidades y deseos D. su hogar.El anhelo D. Noemí es acrecentar la variedad y el stock D. su mercadería con el objetivo D. complacer los deseos D. superación y estudios D. sus queridos hijos, ya que ésta se convertirá en la valiosísima herencia que estos humildes padres pretenden dejar a sus hijos. Con vuestro apoyo lo podrán lograr.

loans.use: Purchase of a larger selection of clothing.

loans.name: Mirna Arely

texts.es:
Mirna’s family group is composed of two children and her life companion. At present they are paying off their house. They live the La Libertad. For the moment she has a tortilla shop in her house. This business allows her to care for her children and to generate a source of extra income extra for the family, since they are paying for their house. Her husband’s income does not cover all the family expenses. The sale of tortillas gives Mirna the opportunity to sell to these same clients sandals, footwear and clothes. When people come to her house to buy tortillas, she can show them the various articles that she sells. She will use the loan to buy corn for the production of tortillas, footwear and clothes for women. Already these are the products that her clients request most.

Translated from Spanish by B, Kiva Volunteer.

Su grupo familiar esta compuesto por dos hijos y su compañero de vida, su vivienda actualmente la están cancelando, viven el La Libertad, por el momento tiene una venta de tortillas en su casa, este negocio le permite el estar al cuidado de sus hijos y generar una fuente de ingreso extra para la familia ya que como están pagando su vivienda lo que gana su esposo no alcanza para poder cubrir todos estos gastos familiares, la venta de tortillas le a abierto la oportunidad de poder vender a sus mismos clientes sandalias y ropa a si como calzado, al llegar a comprar a su casa las tortillas ella puede mostrar los artículos varios que vende , su inversión la hará en maíz que es su materia prima para la elaboración de tortillas a si como calzado y ropa para mujer ,ya que son los productos que mas le solicitan.

loans.use: to buy corn for the production of tortillas, women's clothes and footwear, shoes for children and the other products that she sells in her tortilla shop

loans.name: Julia De Los Ángeles

texts.es:
Julia is a hard working woman and since 1970 has dedicated herself to selling a variety of vegetables in the central market of Chinandega. She characterized herself as happy and humble. She started her business with savings of C$ 1500 (approximately $80 US) which she had accumulated over a long period of time.

She is the mother of 2 children (a daughter and a son) that she would like to offer an education as they are minors. Her biggest dream is to prepare her children to have professions so they don't have to suffer like she did since childhood working hard labor. To realize this dream, Julia has for the past 3 years obtained loans through Ceprodel which have helped her acquire more vegetables thus increasing her profits as well as improving her way of life and that of her family.

Translated from Spanish by Lizella West, Kiva volunteer.

Julia es una dama muy trabajadora que desde el año 1970 se dedica a la venta de verduras de todo tipo en el mercado central en Chinandega. Se caracteriza por ser una dama muy alegre y humilde. Su negocio lo comenzó con un capital propio de C$ 1500 (Mil quinientos córdobas netos) obtenidos por medio de sus ahorros propios de largo tiempo.

Actualmente es madre de dos hijos (un niño y una niña) los cuales tiene el deber de brindarles educación ya que son menores de edad. Su mayor anhelo es que sus hijos se preparen para poder ser profesionales y no sufrir como ella considera que sufrió desde muy joven con trabajos muy pesados. Para ver logrado este sueño, la señora Julia desde hace tres años, ha obtenido prestamos en Ceprodel que le han beneficiado grandemente en la adquisición de las verduras impactándole con altos beneficios ya que ha logrado mejorar sus condiciones de vida y las de su familia.

loans.use: To buy more vegetables.

loans.name: Alejandra's Group

texts.en:
Alejandra and Marlene are members of the community bank “Sumacc Huayta”. Alejandra has been a member for one year, while Marlene joined three years ago. They joined the community bank because there are fewer requirements and they did not need collateral. Through the bank they have learned responsibility and the importance of saving.

Alejandra is married and has ten children. She sells vegetables from a cart on one of the main streets of the city of Ayacucho, which she doing all of her life. She is planning to start selling some meat products as well.

Marlene is 27 years old, lives with her partner, and has one seven year old daughter. Marlene travels to markets around the region where she buys and sells things such as rice and sugar. She has been working in this business for four years. Marlene’s husband is currently sick, and Marlene is taking care of him.

Alejandra and Marlene need loans of 400 soles (3 soles = $1), which they will use to buy grains and vegetables.

One of the most important aspects of the community bank is that each associate has an interest earning savings account. Alejandra and Marlene are currently using their savings to pay for their children’s school fees, buy a home, and pay for medical care.

loans.use: To buy grains and vegetables.

loans.name: Francisca

texts.en: Francisca R. is 54 years old; married and has 6 children. She sells foodstuff. She lives in Benin City, Edo State, Nigeria. She has be a LAPO member for 2 years. She is requesting for a loan of $525 to  buy more foodstuff for sale. She thank you.

loans.use: To buy foodstuff for sale

loans.name: Lucy's Taifa Group

texts.en:
Lucy is a married woman with 3 children, with ages ranging from 14 to 20. Lucy is a clothes seller, and she started her business in 2006. Every day, she works from 8am to 6pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $60 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more clothes for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup members Mwanaisha, Lambeta, Zaituni, and Swaumu, who have businesses in clothing sales.

loans.use: To buy more clothes for her business.

loans.name: Ndang

texts.en: Born in 1963, Ndang B. E. is married to Ndang Joseph and is the mother of five children. She says her agony started when her elder brother and her father, both who had a lot of material and financial help, died. Wishing to be rid of poverty, she decided to become a GHAPE member. With her first loan, she started building skills in growing and selling vegetables. She is proud of having her own small business. She also succeeded in repaying the loan and making a small profit.  She requests a loan to continue selling vegetables at the local food market where buyers come from all over the province. She has set as an objective for this loan to acquire more experience in marketing techniques and to use her profits to buy a plot of land and build her own home.

loans.use: To buy seeds and manure

loans.name: Pabla

texts.es:
Hello, I am Pabla R., and I have run a small grocery store for 5 years. I am 51 years old, and a single mother of two children. 
My business is doing well, but I cannot keep up with my customers' demands for more merchandise.

I am requesting your support with a loan to buy more merchandise including dairy products, cold meats, beef and poultry. The profit on these products is larger and that will help my business prosper.

 Translated by Maria B., Kiva volunteer 


hola mi nombre es Pabla R. me dedico a la venta de productos de consumo popular, tengo 51 años de edad, soy madre soltera de 2 hijos, tengo 5 años de tener mi negocio en el cual me va muy bien, pero las exigencias de mis clientes son muchas y no me doy abasto para comprar todo lo que necesitan, por eso estoy solicitando un credito para poder comprar mas mercaderia como ser lacteos, embutidos, carnes y a este tipo de productos se les saca mas ganancias que a los demas, por tal razon pido apoyo para poder salir adelante con mi negocio,

loans.use: wholesale purchase of groceries: pasta, lard, oil, salt, rice, beans, sugar, coffee, eggs, corn and wheat flour, tortillas, butter, bread, soap, air fresheners, hair gel, hair rollers, sodas, toilet paper, lights, cereals, feminine napkins

loans.name: Maria Evelyn

texts.es:
Mrs Maria Evelin is 21 years old, married and has a 5 year old son, Nelson, after whom she named her food kiosk.

Maria Evelin lives in the “21 March” quarter, in the city of Villa Elisa. She cooks and sells food like sandwiches and empanadas (turnovers). She also sells drinks, candies and other basic commodity products as rice, sugar, bread and herbs.

Her main clients are her neighbors who buy daily at the kiosk. She started the business one year ago because she wanted to contribute to the family’s income and because she had some spare time. She started with a small amount of capital, only selling drinks. As the business grew, Maria Evelina and her partner invested more money and started selling more products.

Today, they request a loan because they want to keep investing in their food kiosk as the sales continue to grow.

Translated from Spanish by Jimena Almendares Leistner, Kiva Volunteer.

La Sra. Maria Evelin tiene 21 años, actualmente esta casada y es madre de un hijo de 5 años llamado Nelson, de ahi el nombre al negocio,

Vive en el asentamiento 21 de marzo de la ciudad de Villa Elisa. La Sra. se dedica a la elaboracion y venta de comida rapida como empanadas, sanwiches y otros. Y tambien venta de bebidas en gral, golosinas, articulos de 1ra. Necesidad como panificados, yerba, arroz, azucar, etc.

Sus principales clientes son los vecinos de dicho asentamiento quienes a diario se surten de su negocio. Nos comento que un año atrás despues de juntarse con su actual pareja y ya que contaban con un pequeño capital (Gs. 300.000) decidieron invertir en venta de bebidas para ayudar a la economia familiar y de paso tener una actividad que la distraiga ya que su marido salía a trabajar y tenia mucho tiempo libre.

En vista a que los ingresos de la venta de bebidas ayudaron y de buena manera a su bienestar, decidieron invertir mas dinero y surtieron con mas mercaderías el negocio.

A ese nivel iba creciendo el comercio hasta que hoy necesitaron una inyeccion de capital superior para seguir invirtiendo en el kiosko. He de ahi la razon por el cual acudio a nuestra institucion.

loans.use: To buy more supplies for their food kiosk

loans.name: Virginia Fátima

texts.es:
Mrs. Virginia Fátima M. D. is originally from Bluefields. She is 30 years old and married to Mr. Juan López, who works in the city's harbor which provides a minimal salary that does no cover basic costs. They have 3 young children who are in primary school. Mrs. M. has sold used clothing for the past 5 years, and has regular customers from the community of Kukra Hill, who prefer her business because she offers a variety of clothing (children's clothes, bed linens, men's and women's clothing for all ages). Mrs. M. has more demand for package of women's clothing varieties, and at the moment does not have enough capital to purchase them. For this reason she needs a loan to buy 1 package of women's clothing variety at $275.00/package. With this investment, she will increase her earnings and be able to satisfy the demand of her clients.

Translated from Spanish to English by Laura Jung, Kiva Volunteer

La Sra. Virginia Fátima M. D. es originaria de la ciudad de Bluefields, tiene 30 años de edad, esta casada con el Sr. Juan López quien trabaja como esquivador en la portuaria de esta ciudad el cual devenga un salario mínimo que no cubre todos los pagos de los gastos básicos, ambos tienen 3 hijos menores de edad quienes cursan estudios primarios. La Sra. M. vende ropa usada hace 5 años, esta microempresaria viaja a la comunidad de Kukara Hill teniendo como clientes los habitantes de esta comunidad que la prefieren por ofrecer una variedad de ropa (ropa para niños, sabanas, ropa para hombres y mujeres de todas las edades). La Sra. Marin tiene mas demanda de paca de ropa mixta para mujeres y por el momento no cuenta con el capital suficiente para comprar mas pacas de ropa mixta para mujeres y por esta razón quiere comprar 1 paca de ropa mixta para mujeres a $ 275.00 dólares la paca, con esta inversión aumentara sus ganancias y podrá satisfacer la demanda de sus clientes.

loans.use: To purchase: 1 variety pack of women's clothing

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
Victoria A. is married and has 2 children. She has received schooling through the Junior High level. Starting this year, Victoria has been in the business of selling "gari" (a popular food made from cassava) at Duakro near Elmina. With the income she generates from this business, Victoria is able to pay for her children's school fees and other utility bills.

Victoria is now seeking a loan in order to purchase more cassava to, in turn, make even more gari for her customers. With the expected increase in profits from such an expanded business, Victoria plans to save money to build a house for her children.

loans.use: To improve and expand her gari-making business by purchasing additional cassava (the raw material needed to produce gari)

loans.name: Tuon

texts.en: Mrs. Tuon A. lives in Boeng Village in Kandal Province. She is a tailor. Her husband, Mr. Siv Ean, is a farmer. Although Mrs. Tuon A. and her husband have different businesses, they still live in poor conditions. In order to improve their standard of living, Mrs. Tuon A. decided to ask for a loan to buy two cows for breeding. She hopes to increase her income after she sells her cows. Mrs. Tuon A. is 50 years old and the mother of four children one of whom is employed in a garment factory while the remaining three are attending the local school. Her husband is shown on the left in the photo.

loans.use: To buy two cows

loans.name: Aminata

texts.fr: Aminata S., 29 ans, mariée, 02 enfants  en charge est membre du banc villageois de Sinthiang Houlata depuis 2 ans et demi. Elle veut renforcer son commerce de tissu teinté, de wax, chaussures dames, mèches et greffage. Ses revenus lui permettent de participer aux dépenses familiales.  Elle sollicite un prêt qui sera remboursé au bout de six mois en une seule échéance.
texts.en:
Aminata S., age 29, is married, has two children in her care, and has been a member of the village loan group Sinthiang Houlata for two years. She wants to bolster her commerce in dyed cloth, Wax pagnes (colorful West African cloth), women's shoes, and hair extensions (mèches and greffage). Her income allows her to help cover family expenses. She is requesting a loan that will be repaid all at once at the end of six months.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Commerce in cloth, shoes, and hair extensions

loans.name: Safiyeh

texts.en:
Safiyeh is a 45 year old woman who lives in Saida, southern Lebanon, with her husband and their five children. Safiyeh has owned a grocery and sweets store for four years. She requested a loan of 1200 US dollars from Al Majmoua in order to purchase merchandise and candies for her shop. This is her second cycle and she has always paid on time.

Safiyeh said that her previous loan has influenced her life in a good way. She is special in her work because she is the only big shop in her area, and she also opens early in the morning till midnight every day. She makes 400 US dollars per month. Her clients are her friends and neighbors. She started her business because of the difficult living conditions in the camp, as well as the lack of money. In the future, she plans to expand her business by opening a bigger shop.

loans.use: Safiyeh needs the loan to purchase merchandise and candies for her shop.

loans.name: Pouchh

texts.en:
Mrs. Pouchh M. lives in Kaung Kang Tie Bey Village in Kampong Cham Province. She and her husband, Mr. Him Vin, are farmers who own a plot of land where they cultivate vegetables. They now face a problem because they do not have enough money to grow cassava on their field. Thus, Mrs. Pouchh M. decided to ask for a loan for this purpose. She hopes to increase their income and improve their living conditions with this loan.

She is 27 years old and the mother of two children, one of whom is attending the local school while the younger one is too young to work or study. Her husband is also in the picture.

loans.use: to buy cassava to grow in their field

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en:
Nancy T. is a single parent and has 2 children. She has received schooling through senior high. Nancy sells groceries and plastic products at Nyankumasi near Cape Coast, which she has done since 1999. Her husband is a petty trader.

Nancy uses her income to pay for the children's school fees, rent, utility bills and other financial expenses. Nancy will use the loan to purchase more groceries and plastic products to meet the increase in demand by her customers. With the new profits from her expanded business, Nancy plans to invest in her children's education.

loans.use: purchase more groceries and plastic products for re-sale

loans.name: Lucia

texts.en:
Lucia M. sells biscuits wholesale at a shop and is requesting a loan to help her expand her business.  Lucia is 40 years old and married; her husband is a policeman. She has four children who go to school. 


BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, and human rights and legal services. These programs are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs, measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which targets returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 female members.

loans.use: To expand her biscuit business

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en:
Mohammad is a 33-year-old man who lives in Tyre, Southern Lebanon with his wife and their five children. Mohammad has been working as a house painter for thirteen years. He has requested a loan of $1000 US dollars from Al Majmoua to purchase paint and tools for his work. This is the first time that Mohammad has requested a loan.

Mohammad is special because of his good and fast work. His clients can be anybody. When he first started his business, he didn’t face any difficulties. He chose his business because of his experiences. In the future, Mohammad plans to expand his business.

loans.use: Mohammad will use the loan to purchase paint and tools for his work.

loans.name: Reyna

texts.es:
Reyna socia del Banco Comunal Urubamba, Reyna es de la comunidad de Huascahura que se ubica a 20 minutos de la ciudad de Ayacucho.
Reyna es casada, tiene 34 años y 6 hijos, Reyna junto a su esposo viajan a las diferentes ferias de la región en donde compran animales, luego los vende en la feria de la ciudad de Ayacucho, en algunas oportunidades los beneficia y vende la carne de casa en casa.
Reyna necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de carneros.
Los sueños de Reyna son mejorar su negocio, brindar una buena educación a sus hijos y mejorar su casa.
texts.en:
Reyna is a member of the Banco Comunal Urubamba, and is from the community of Huascahura which is located 20 minutes from the city Ayacucho. Reyna is married, 34 years old, and has 6 children. Reyna, together with her husband, travels to different town markets in the region where they buy animals, and later they sell them in the market in Ayacucho. In some cases they benefit from selling meat house to house.

Reyna needs a loan of 1000 PEN which she will invest in the purchase of sheep. Reyna’s dream is to improve her business, provide a good education to her children, and to improve her house.

Translated from Spanish by William Gray, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For the purchase of sheep

loans.name: Petrona Del Carmen

texts.es: Petrona del Carmen H. C. vive en San Martin junto a su s dos hijas. Petrona se dedica a su negocio, donde vende diversos productos como; papel higiénico, detergentes, aceite, entre otros. Petrona tiene ya siete años en el negocio, donde poco a poco ha ido creciendo y ganando clientela; pero el sueño de Petrona es vender al por mayor, porque de esa manera obtendría un margen más grande de ganancias, del que ve hasta este momento vendiendo al detalle, es por ello que Petrona solicita un crédito para comprar mayor cantidad de mercadería y ofertarla al por mayor.
texts.en:
Petrona del Carmen H. C. lives in San Martin with her two daughters. Petrona has her own business selling various products such as toilet paper, detergent, and oil, among others. She has had seven years of experience, growing and gaining customers little by little. Her dream is to sell wholesale goods, since she would earn a larger margin. So far she has been selling individual goods; this is why Petrona would like a loan to buy a larger quantity of merchandise to sell wholesale.

Translated from Spanish by Shanti Singh, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy larger quantities of inventory

loans.name: Felina

texts.es:
La señora Felina S. R. tiene 35 años, vive en el distrito de Casa Grande, provincia de Ascope, departamento de La Libertad; Perú.
Ella estudió Secundaria Completa.
Felina se dedica a la venta de abarrotes y gas, cuando inició tenia una pequeña bodega, luego complemento su negocio con la venta de gas y la venta de productos de belleza, esto ofrecido solo al interior de su distrito, su negocio lo desarrolla en su casa. 
Con el primer crédito de 300 soles que recibió de su Banco Comunal Romanas Luchadoras II, lo invirtió en la compra de insumos para su bodega y productos de belleza.
Con el crédito de 1000 soles, lo invertirá en la compra y distribución de gas.
Felina tiene como sueño poner una distribuidora de gas y ampliar su bodega.
texts.en:
Mrs. Felina S. R., 35, lives in the Casa Grande district, Ascope province, La Libertad department, Perú. She completed high school. Felina sells groceries and gas. She started with a small grocery store. Then she added gas sales and the sale of beauty products, which are only sold in the interior of her district. She set up her business in her home. With her first loan for 300 PEN that she received from her community bank, the Romanas Luchadoras II, she bought supplies for her store and beauty products. She will use this loan for 1,000 PEN for the purchase and distribution of gas. She will also expand her store.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase and distribution of gas

loans.name: Felicia

texts.en: Felicia B. sells Bread and Flour at Abura. Felicia has received education through senior high school. Felicia has been selling Bread and Flour since 1999. She is responsible for paying housekeeping expenses and other financial responsibilities.  Her loan will be used for reinvestment, savings and the purchase of more bread and flour for resale. She intends to expand her business and also to increase her capital and profits. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to reinvest to expand her business.

loans.use: Business capital, including the purchase of bread and flour

loans.name: Stella

texts.en: Stella makes a living selling items for babies, such as clothes, diapers and nappies. She is 32 years old, married and has four children. Stella has applied for this loan to buy more items to sell to her customers, and extends her thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To buy more baby items to sell

loans.name: Sat

texts.en: Sat S. is 51 years old and is a handicraft maker who makes cradles for sale. She can generate a daily profit of $3 in order to make her family’s living conditions more stable. Her husband is a local trader who orders various produce and sells it in mobile retail around the country. This couple now has five children; one of whom is married and lives independently and the others are still single and studying. Sat S. is looking for a loan for her husband to use as capital to invest in his business activities.

loans.use: To use as capital to invest in his business activities.

loans.name: Villa Dolores Group

texts.es: Margarita M., tiene el negocio de venta de arroz, es una integrante del grupo “Villa Dolores”  tiene 19  años casada con un hijo, aprendió del negocio que actualmente maneja  hace 8 años, ayudando a sus hermanos, pero hace 2 años se ha independizado, compra su mercadería de diferentes lugares como es de Santa C., Caranavi y Perú, carga toda su mercadería en una movilidad y va ofreciendo su producto zona por zona en la ciudad de El Alto, es decir, ambulando y ahora necesita el préstamo para comprar mercadería y espera estar mucho tiempo en el grupo hasta obtener un crédito alto. Al igual que  Margarita sus demás compañeras tienen diferentes negocios como la venta  de jugos,  ropa, calzados, cerámica, carne, arroz y requieren el préstamo para la compra de mercadería.
texts.en:
Margarita Madani sells rice. She is a member of the Villa Dolores group. She has been married for 19 years, and she has a son. She learned the business that she currently has eight years ago. She learned by helping her siblings. Two years ago she started on her own. She buys her merchandise from different places like Santa C., Caranavi, and Perú. She loads all of her merchandise in a vehicle. She sells her product by traveling from zone to zone in the city of El Alto. She now needs a loan to buy merchandise. She hopes to be in the group for a long time and even get a larger loan. Just like Margarita, the other members have different businesses like selling juice, clothes, footwear, ceramics, meat, and rice. They need a loan to buy merchandise.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy merchandise (rice, quinoa, clothes, ceramics, and meat)

loans.name: Womenegee Group

texts.en: Lorpu, an illiterate Liberian married mother  with six children, has been involved in the sale of food for the past eight years. Within the Zorzor, Yeala Road area, Lorpu faces challenges of finance, with months sometimes passing without any income. Her goal is to have a restaurant of her own and to adequately educate her children and provide them with good medical care.

loans.use: To purchase bags of rice, gallons of oil, bags of onions, etc.

loans.name: El Progreso De La Amistad (The Progress Of Friendship) Group

texts.es:
La alcancía comunal “El Progreso D. la Amistad” formada hace 5 años e integrada por 15 socios quienes habitan en la zona  D. Horacio zevallos, distrito D. Ate, departamento D. Lima, y se dedican a diversas  actividades como: producción, comercio y  servicio.
Prisciliana S.,  Actualmente asume el cargo D. presidenta, natural D. Huancavelica, tiene  54 años D. edad, casada, con 6 hijos, desD. hace 23  años se dedica a la venta D. tejidos manuales como  chompas, chalinas, ponchos, etc. En el futuro anhela exportar sus tejidos y patentar su marca.
Luís C.  Actualmente asume el cargo D. tesorero, natural D. Lima, casado,  tiene  50 años D. edad con 3 hijos, cuenta con un  taller D. imprenta  desD. hace 8 años, su reciente préstamo lo utilizara en el mantenimiento  y implementación D. su local.
Ana V.  Actualmente asume el cargo D. secretaria, natural D. cañete tiene 38 años D. edad, con un hijo, separada hace 5 años, cuenta con un pequeño taller D. confección D. jeans, y su reciente préstamo lo utilizara en la compra D. telas jeans para su producción. Ana anhela  exportar y patentar su marca D. jeans.
texts.en:
The communal bank "El Progreso D. la Amistad" (The Progress of Friendship) was formed 5 years ago and set up by 15 partners who live in the Horacio Zevallos area, district of Ate, department of Lima, and work in diverse activities such as production, traD. and services.

Currently, Prisciliana S. occupies the position of president. She comes from Huancavelica, is 54 years old, married and has 6 children. For 23 years, she has worked selling hand-maD. fabrics such as sweaters, cravats, ponchos etc. In the future, she would like to export her fabrics and patent her brand.

Luís C. is currently the treasurer. He comes from Lima, is 50 years old and married with 3 children. Luís has had a printing workshop for 8 years and will use the loan to maintain and develop his premises.

Ana V. currently occupies the role of secretary. She comes from Cañete, is 38 years old, has a son and has been separated for 5 years. She has a small workshop making jeans and will use the loan to buy jean fabric for her production. Ana would like to export and patent her brand of jeans.

Translated from Spanish by Stephen Bayley, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For the investment in merchandise for their businesses

loans.name: Azykbubu's Group

texts.en:
Azykbubu is the leader of this group. She enjoys her life being a farmer’s wife and has raised three children. Now she is 56 years old, and her eldest son and daughter are both married and live on their own. Only her twenty-year-old daughter, a college student, lives with them. Apart from farming and growing various things in the field, among all the pleasures of life in a rural area there is one that rewards her financially: selling milk. Azykbubu’s daily milk sales constitute around ten liters, which earns her about $55 a month.

No matter how “imperceptible” the gift looks, Azykbubu still remembers with delight and gratitude the day when her parents–in-law gave her one cow and three sheep as a present. Since that day she and her husband have been breeding cows. The profits from this venture have allowed them to buy tractors, provide for their children’s education and increase their herd.

Now, Azykbubu needs a loan to buy another cow. This would help her increase the size of her herd and the amount of milk she could sell. Azykbubu’s main goals are to give her daughter an education, marry her off and increase the population of her herd.

Azykbubu has three partners: Satybek, Kaldykul and Burulcha.

Satybek, 52, is married. He has a twenty–year-old daughter. To make a living he is engaged in cattle breeding. His wife works as a charwoman at the school. Satybek needs a loan to buy a calf for breeding.

Kaldykul, 52, has three children. Her husband is a shepherd, whereas she farms and sells milk. She grows barley, wheat and potatoes. Kaldykul’s married son lives with his parents. Her daughter-in-law often helps her care for the cows. Kaldykul hopes to get a loan and buy two calves.

Burulcha, 49, is divorced and has one daughter. Even though she has had a hard time providing for her daughter, Burulcha has enough steadfastness and dignity to continue struggling to live. She sells milk and grows potatoes. Burulcha needs a loan to buy ten sheep for breeding.

About Mol Bulak Finance:

This loan is being presented by Mol Bulak Finance, a young and ambitious, socially-focused MFI in Kyrgyzstan. Mol Bulak Finance is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development on the basis of its “3-Ps” concept: People (building human capital and taking care of its customers and the society as well), Profit (to be profitable to grow larger) and the Planet (taking care of the environment). It is also the only MFI in Kyrgyzstan who delivers its services to customers 365 days a year.

To learn more about Mol Bulak and view a video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and micro-finance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team—Supporters of Kyrgyzstan—at: http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan Members will get special updates and news from the Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and Mol Bulak staff.

loans.use: To buy a cow to increase her milk sales

loans.name: Awate

texts.en:
Awate R. is currently in the business of selling charcoal and is requesting a loan to purchase more bags of charcoal to sell.  Awate is 36 years old and is Married with a husband that is a nurse. She has 4 children and her children go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build a shop.

 BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education , and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: purchase more bags of charcoal to sell

loans.name: Rosalinda

texts.es: La señora Rosalinda, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Alfonso Ugarte”, Distrito de Tarapoto, Provincia San Martín, Departamento de San Martín. Es Soltera, tiene 55 años y no tiene hijos.Rosalinda, se dedica a la venta de ropas, lleva varios años dedicándose a este tipo de actividad, se encuentra ubicada en su misma casa, donde de poco a poco fue generando sus propios ingresos y ahorrando su dinero, queriendo implementar y aumentar mas su mercadería. Nos cuenta que le va muy en sus ventas, ya que diariamente sale a ofrecer sus mercaderías, a sus amigas y conocidos.Con este préstamo de S/. 3,000.00, comprará telas mas mercadería de ropas como: pantalones, snikers, shores, blusas, polos.Rosalinda, hoy en día se siente una mujer muy realizada. Agradece al Movimiento Manuela Ramos por ayudarla a iniciar su negocio y también a muchas mujeres que  quieren crecer empresarialmente.

loans.use: Comprara mercaderia de ropas.

loans.name: La Union Group

texts.es: Las socias de LA UNIÓN son del mismo barrio todas, cada una de ellas tienen sus propios negocios con el que día a día trabajan, como ser venta de comida, venta de pan, tienda de abarrotes, venta de refrescos empanadas,  promotoras de cosméticos, venta de sabanas y edredones, venta de ropa. En cuanto a la competencia  en sus negocios indican que existe pero pese a eso ellas saben salir adelante. El crédito lo utilizaran para hacer crecer sus negocios tener más capital, tener a futuro un negocio consolidado. Los antecedentes crediticios de este Banco Comunal La es muy bueno ya que todas se llevan bien son bien activas tienen muchas ganas de ser el mejor grupo y trabajar. Algunas socias tienen créditos en otras entidades financieras. En las reuniones realizan refrigerios para compartir con el resto de las socias, esto lo vienen realizando desde la primera reunión.
texts.en:
The members of La Unión are all from the same neighborhood. They all have their own businesses, which they work day to day. They have businesses like selling food, selling bread, having grocery stores, selling refreshments and “empanadas” (stuffed pastry), selling cosmetics, selling sheets and quilts, and selling clothes. In spite of the competition that exists, they know how to get ahead. They will use the loan to make their businesses grow, to have more capital, and to have a solid business in the future. The previous loans with this communal bank have been very good. All of the members get along well, are very active, and have a great desire to be the best group and to work. Some of the members have loans with other financial entities. They make refreshments to share with the other members at their meetings. They have been doing this since their first meeting.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating capital

loans.name: Franco

texts.es:
Franco es un padre de familia de 32 años de edad que vive junto a su esposa y sus dos hijas de 6 y 10 años de edad en el distrito de Zaña, ubicado a 50 minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Desde hace 3 años tiene una bodega que funciona en su casa, cerca a la estación de autos que brindan servicio de transporte Zaña – Chiclayo y viceversa; en este establecimiento ofrece bebidas gaseosas y golosinas a los chóferes y pasajeros que frecuentan la zona. Este negocio es la única fuente de ingresos familiares con la que cuentan.

El incremento de la temperatura debido a la proximidad del verano ha hecho que Franco piense en ampliar su negocio con la compra de más bebidas por lo que está solicitando por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles.

El es un padre responsable y muy trabajador. Su más grande anhelo es seguir trabajando arduamente para ofrecerle a sus hijas una excelente educación.
texts.en:
Franco is a 32 year-old father who lives with his wife and their two daughters, ages 6 and 10, in the district of Zaña, located 50 minutes outside the city of Chiclayo. For three years, Franco has operated a convenience store in his home, located close to the station that offers transport Zaña - Chiclayo and vice versa. In his establishment Franco sells sodas and candies to the drivers and passengers that frequent the area. The store is the family's only source of income. The rise in temperature due to the approaching summer season gave Franco the idea to expand his business by buying more drinks, and for this reason he is asking for the first time for a loan of 1000 nuevos soles from Edpyme Alternativa. Franco is a responsible and hard-working father. His greatist wish is to keep working hard to give his two daughters an excellent education.

Translated from Spanish by Kevin Credo, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of soda drinks to expand convenience store business.

loans.name: Piladel

texts.en:
Piladel G. is a 51-year-old married woman who lives in the village of Shopping, Brgy. Fabrica, Sagay City, Negros Occidental. She is engaged in food vending as a source of daily income and raises pigs on the side as a supplement. Her husband Welfredo works as a carpenter. They are blessed with two children who are 15 and 20 years old and still going to school. The younger is in high school and the older attends college. It is Piladel's dream for her children to finish their studies and have a stable income from gainful employment or a stable livelihood, so that they will have a more comfortable life ahead of them.

She thought of going into business to augment her husband's income because she knew that her husband's work could be seasonal at times. And if they relied on only one source of income, she would not be able to fulfill her dreams for her children and their family. At first, she only raised pigs in her backyard, but the return on her investment took 3-4 months to pay off, so she decided to engage in food vending so that she would have a daily income. As her business continued to flourish, she soon needed additional capital to sustain her business operations.

This is why she joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2002. Her loans contributed a lot to increasing their income capacity by allowing them to raise more pigs and increase the variety of food that she sold. Now her minimum monthly income has increased to PHP 2,000 from her food vending operations. And her income from selling the pigs helps to pay for her children's education and provides additional income for their business.

Piladel's previous loan of PHP 19,500 was used as additional working capital for her business. It was fully paid within her loan term without delay. Now she is borrowing her 15th loan in the same amount, PHP 19,500 to be used as additional capital for her pig fattening and food vending businesses. Some of the income will be set aside for her children’s education and to pay for their family expenses. The rest will be plowed back as capital for their business operations.

About NWTF:
In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress out of earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

loans.use: Additional capital for her pig-fattening and food vending businesses

loans.name: Redeemer Group

texts.en: Emma is 56 years old. She is married and has given birth to four children, all of whom are in school. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in Axim. Axim is along the coastal area in the western region of Ghana. The fishing business is the major occupation of the people. She runs a provision store by the roadside. Emma is the leader of a trust bank group called Redeemer. The members of the group are mainly into fishing business and other commercial activities. The group requests for a loan to procure goods in bulk to expand their businesses.  It is their desire to give their children the best of education they can afford. Emma, the group leader, is in the middle of the photograph.

loans.use: To buy stock

loans.name: Gulchahon

texts.ru: Гулчахон Хасанова проживает в районе Турсунзаде. Возраст 27 лет. Замужем, имеет 3 детей. Муж находится в России на заработках. Сама Гулчахон более 8 лет занимается пашивом одежды. Еще она более 5 лет занимается земледелием, выращивает пшеницу. Кредит просит для посева урожая.
texts.en:
Gulchahon H. lives in the Tursun-zoda region. She's twenty-seven years old, married and has three children. Her husband works in Russia. Gulchahon has tailored clothes for more than eight years. She has also grown wheat for five years. She's asking for a loan in order to sow a crop.

Translated from Russian by Alex Kostrubsky, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To sow a crop

loans.name: Norma

texts.es:
Norma, es una mujer muy puntual, vive en el distrito de Manantay, región Ucayali, tiene 24 años, es madre de un hijo, menor de edad, ella se dedica a la venta de comida, decoración con globos, además  confecciona zapatos y tejidos, todas las actividades las realiza en su casa, cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo, quien es soldador de profesión. Norma forma parte del Banco Comunal “”Las  Mujeres Sabias” desde hace un año, el primer crédito que recibió fue de 300 soles, que fue invertido en su negocio de venta de comida.
Ahora ella necesita un crédito de 1200 soles, que será invertido una parte en la venta de comida y la otra parte en la compra y posterior venta de repuestos de motocarro, negocio en el cual está incursionando. La meta de Norma es seguir trabajando para dar una buena educación a su hijo.
texts.en:
Norma is a very punctual women who lives in the district of Manantay in the Ucayali region. She is 24 years old and the mother of one young son. She sells meals, makes balloon decorations and in addition makes shoes and weavings. All of these activities she does from home. She has the support of her husband who is a welder. Norma has been part of the "Las Mujeres Sabias" Communal Bank for the past year. The first loan she received, for 300 soles, was used for her food business. Now she needs a loan for 1,200 soles, part of which will be used for the food business and the other part to buy and later sell replacement parts for motorcycle taxis, which is a business she is starting to enter. Norma´s goal is to keep working so she can give a good education to her son.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy ingredients to prepare meals and buy replacement parts for motorcycle taxis.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
