Jane is a 32 year old married woman with one child who attends school. She has been operating Jane Salon for three years.  She offers hair and beauty services and employs three people. She also sells groceries for additional income.

With the loan, she hopes to purchase cosmetics for 5,000 KES and a blow dryer for 10,000 KES.  She is grateful to Faulu Kenya for teaching her to keep a record of her business. Jane describes herself as hardworking and determined.

loans.use: To purchase cosmetics and a blow dryer.

loans.name: Benita Lorena

texts.es:
La  señora Benita Lorena Ríos S. es comerciante desde hace veinte años su negocio está ubicado frente al boulevard del bisne tiene cinco años de trabajar con créditos, ha demostrado ser una señora emprendedora con deseos de superación.   

    La señora Ríos S. es soltera tiene tres hijos todos a su cargo y estudian.
texts.en:
Benita Lorena Ríos S. has been a merchant for the last 20 years. Her business is located in front of El Bisne boulevard. She has managed loans for five years and has demonstrated being an enterprising woman that has a wish to succeed. Mrs. Ríos S. is single and has three children, who are students, under her care.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy raw materials: fruit, rice, beans.  Ingredients for meals: cooking oil, sugar.

loans.name: Ascencio

texts.es:
El Sr. Ascencio, es cliente nuevo recomendado por su Señora Madre, quien fue cliente antigua y buena  de nuestra Institución, el Señor Ascencio vive solo, ya que hace tiempo se separo de su esposa, la separacion fue un golpe para el pero supo salir adelante por sus dos hijos a quienes mantiene y que continuan estudiando, la actividad que tiene es de transporte urbano, en esta actividad trabaja  ya quince años, los recorridos que realiza son de la zona sur a cualquier punto de la ciudad, teniendo un ingreso semanal de dos mil bolivianos como promedio, por el momento el está con gastos en arreglo de su vivienda por lo que se ve conveniente darle una tasa preferencial. Con el dinero del credito reparara su movilidad.

El Sr. Ascencio esta agradecido con Emprender y Kiva por la confianza brindada en la otorgacion del credito.
texts.en:
Ascencio is a new client who was recommended by his mother. She has been a long time client and a good client with our institution. Ascencio lives alone because he has been separated from his wife for some time. The separation was a blow for him, but he knew how to get ahead for his two children who he supports and who continue in school. His business is urban transportation. He has worked doing this for 15 years. The routes that he drives are from the southern area to anywhere in the city. He has an average weekly income of 2,000 BOB. At this time he has repair expenses for his house, and it is a good time to get a preferential rate. He will use the money from the loan to repair his vehicle. Ascencio is very grateful to Emprender and Kiva for the trust placed in him by granting the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Maintenance on his vehicle

loans.name: Fatim

texts.fr: Madame Fatim S. habite dans la localité  de  Ouakam. Elle est âgée de 42 ans et est membre de la caisse depuis 5 ans. Elle a déjà bénéficié  de 3 prêts  antérieurs. Elle s’active depuis 10 ans dans le commerce et la vente de vaisselle. Sa maman l’a beaucoup encourage à opter pour cette activité qu’elle aime beaucoup. Et ce qui l’y intéresse  le plus c’est la rapidité de la vente et le caractère non périssable  de ses produits. Elle sollicite un crédit de 500 000 frs pour renforcer ses marchandises. Ses crédits  lui ont permis d’acquérir  des matériels  pour la maison.
texts.en:
Fatim S. lives in the city of Ouakam. She is 42 years of age and has been a member of the microfinance group for five years. She already obtained three previous loans. She has been selling dishes and kitchen stuff for ten years. Her mother encouraged her towards this business that she likes a lot. She is really interested in the fact that the selling of this products is quite quick and that they are non-perishable. She is requesting a loan of 500 000 frs to stock more supplies. Thanks to the previous loans she could buy materials for her house.

Translated from French by MONICA URBAN, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Stocking

loans.name: Esther

texts.en: Esther makes a living as a seamstress, selling clothes and tailoring materials that her customers use to make various designs on their clothes. She has been in this business for eight years, and has applied for a loan of NGN 100,000 to buy supplies in bulk at a reduced rate. This will also allow her to improve her family's life by producing more items to sell, since buying in bulk means she won't need to travel to her suppliers as often. Esther is 40 years old, married and has four children. She offers her sincerest thanks to all Kiva lenders for their wonderful assistance.

loans.use: To buy more items to sell.

loans.name: Irine Akoth

texts.en:
Irine Akoth M. started her fruit and vegetable vending business in 2004 and operates it in Kibuye Market in Kisumu. She buys her stock in Kibuye market on a daily basis.

Irine is married and has four children. She lives with her family in Manyatta, Kisumu. Before she started her business she used to be a housewife, depending on her husband for anything she needed. But that, to her, is long-gone history.

After joining K-MET to learn ways to develop her business, Irine became interested and applied for a Kiva loan of Ksh 10,000 to increase her stock. She is optimistic that she will be able to get lenders to loan her the money.

Irine wishes to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: To increase her stock

loans.name: Ruth Meri

texts.en:
Ruth Meri is a 24-year-old single woman with no children. She is a member of the María Auxiliadora community bank, which is comprised of eleven members all hailing from the San Sebastian neighborhood of Cusco. Ruth Meri says that she has been trained to work in the tourism industry, but because of the low tourist season she is now selling fruit in the Feria de Productos market in Cusco. She sells fruit that comes from the Puerto Maldonado region of Peru, and she buys the products wholesale. She says that she took over her mother’s business selling fruit when the tourism industry started going bad. Ruth Meri earns between 300 and 500 soles ($100-166 USD) each weekend in this business.

Ruth Meri will use the Kiva loan to buy more fruit to sell so that she can increase her profits from this business. She is appreciative of and thankful for the loan, and promises to pay the monthly payments on time.

loans.use: Fruit

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase cement and steel reinforcements to sell

loans.name: Alex

texts.en: Alex M. is from the town of Sto. Niño. He is 47 years old. Alex is married and has four school-aged children. To make a living, Alex raises crops. The main source of income for his business comes from planting and harvesting rice for sale. Alex has been engaged in his business for more than eight years. Alex joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Alex has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI, a Kiva partner. Alex is requesting a new loan of 15,000 Philippine pesos, which will be used to purchase fertilizers, seeds and other farm inputs. This will be the eighth loan taken out by Alex from CEVI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees of his children. About CEVI: Community Economic Ventures, Inc (CEVI) has increased its portfolio significantly over the recent years. Based in Bohol, they have numerous branches throughout the Philippines. In 2009, CEVI was awarded a CGAP silver award for transparency in social performance monitoring. CEVI not only provides credit for its clients but also offers savings, insurance, and training programs through regular cluster group meetings. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers, seeds and other farm inputs

loans.name: Carlos

texts.es: Carlos tiene 53 años, es un hombre muy responsable y trabajador, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposa y sus 6 hijos. El oficio que tiene es de albañil, siendo especialista en hacer pisos, columnas, techos, alzar ladrillos y revestir las paredes de cemento. Cuando aún era joven trabajó de ayudante, ganando así la experiencia de este oficio, siendo actualmente su principal fuente de ingresos, permitiéndole sustentar a su familia. Su eficacia y empeño en el trabajo le ha permitido ganar a sus clientes, quienes muy satisfechos, han recomendado el oficio de Carlos con sus amistades. Disfruta de su trabajo; de esa manera han transcurrido 35  años en esta labor y su mayor impotencia es dejar pasar oportunidades de trabajo, por la falta de material de trabajo. En adelante piensa adquirir maquinarias especiales para instalar mayólicas y de ese modo sus rentas aumenten. Este es su décimo crédito con MFP, y se compromete en pagar como hasta hoy lo hace, sus  cuotas. Con sus compañeras de grupo, no tiene dificultades, por lo que son personas muy responsables. Con éste crédito que recibirá, piensa comprar materiales y de ese modo pueda trabajar con tranquilidad y rapidez.
texts.en:
Carlos is 53 years old. He is a responsible and hardworking man. He lives in his own home with his wife and 6 children. His profession is that of a bricklayer, and he is a specialist in making floors, columns, roofs, taking up bricks and coating walls in cement. When he was still young, he worked as an assistant, gaining experience in the profession and presently it is his main source of income, allowing him to support his family. His efficiency and effort at work has allowed him to gain customers who are very satisfied, and they have recommended Carlos to their friends. He enjoys his work; he has spent 35 years doing it and his biggest problem is letting jobs go due to a lack of materials. In the future, he plans on adquiring machinery to install mayolica tiles and in this way increase his profits. This is his tenth loan with MFP, and he is committed to making his payments as he has done thus far. He has no problems with the other members of the group, because they are very responsible people. With this loan that he will receive, he plans on buying materials and in this way be able to work calmly and quickly.

Translated from Spanish by Ellen Donohue, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy tools to facilitate his work as a bricklayer.

loans.name: Ninoska Del Rosario

texts.es: La señora Ninoska, desde hace 10 años, ella tiene 23 años de edad, es casada y tiene 1 hijo de siete años de edad. La señora se dedica a la venta de ropa nueva, negocio que tiene ya 4 años de desempeñarse a esta actividad. este negocio empezó primeramente como una necesidad de obtener mejores ingresos ya que el salario de su compañero de vida no llenaba la necesidad familiar, por lo que decidió ayudarle a su esposo dedicándose a la venta de ropa. Luego ella noto que el negocio era rentable, por lo que ha continuado siempre con el mismo. El crédito será invertido en la compra de ropa nueva. Algo que ha afectado últimamente es la oferta de mercadería de otras personas ya que el mercado cada vez se hace más pequeño. Sin embargo ella tiene como desafío continuar con el negocio. Su sueño es comprar un tramo en el mercado.
texts.en:
Sra. Ninoska is 23 years old, married, and has a seven year old child. She has been selling new clothing for the past four years. Ninoska began her business primarily because she needed more income since her husband’s salary did not meet the needs of their family. At that point, she decided to help her husband by selling clothing. Later she noticed that this business was profitable so she continued doing the same things.

This loan will be used to buy new clothing. Something that has affected her lately is an increase in the supply of merchandise from other merchants while the market for these products is getting smaller. Despite that challenge, she continues with her business. Her dream is to acquire a vending space at the market.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase new clothing

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: resupply merchandise

loans.name: Jorge

texts.es:
El señor Jorge Benítez López tiene 46 años de edad, es de la ciudad de Encarnación vive en su propia casa del barrio San Pedro Curupayty desde hace ya varios años.

El señor Jorge trabaja como chofer en la Dirección de Obras Publicas y Servicios dependiente de la Municipalidad de Encarnación desde hace varios años. 
El tiene dos hijos y es una persona muy trabajadora que siempre ha luchado por mantener a su familia y dar una buena educación a los suyos. 

El está solicitando este crédito para el pago de aranceles y derecho de exámenes de uno de sus hijos que actualmente están cursando la Universidad y está entrando en época de exámenes. 

El señor agradece la posibilidad de obtener este crédito ya que mediante el podrá apoyar en la educación universitaria del hijo quien aspira a ser un buen profesional en el futuro.
texts.en:
Jorge Benítez López is 46 years old, and he is from the city of Encaración. He has lived in his own house in the San Pedro Curupayty neighborhood for several years. Jorge is a driver for the “Dirección de Obras Publicas y Servicios” (Public Works and Services Administration). He has been employed by the Encarnación municipality for several years. He has two children. He is a very hard-working person who has always strived to support his family and to give his loved ones a good education. He is requesting this loan to pay the fees and exam charges for one of his children. This child is currently attending the University and entering the time for exams. He is grateful for the possibility of this loan. This is the way he will be able to support the university education of his child, who aspires to be a good professional in the future.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To pay for his child's educational expenses

loans.name: Kan

texts.en:
Mrs. Kan C., 22, is a local tailor. She sews and repairs clothes for nearby villagers. She also buys small pieces of cloth from a factory and turns them into sets of furniture to sell. Kan C. is married to Mr. Piset, 20, who assists her with the tailoring business. This couple doesn’t have any children yet (they hope to have a child next year). 

Kan C. currently needs to hire a taxi to pick up cloth she buys from the factory to bring it to her house. She wants to have a vehicle to meet her traveling needs. As she doesn’t have money to buy one, Kan C. decided to seek a loan from Kiva’s field partner, HKL, to be used to purchase a motor with trailer attached, so she can use this vehicle to transport cloth without hiring taxis.

loans.use: To purchase a motor with trailer attached

loans.name: Melinda

texts.es: Melinda, de 33 años, convive con Edberto, de 43 años; ambos tienen 7 hijos, a los que tiene que alimentar y educar, juntos viven en su casa propia ubicada en la localidad de La Unión Leticia.Como mujer luchadora y emprendedora, se dedica a diversas actividades durante el día, ella se levanta muy temprano para preparar los ricos panes que vende diariamente a su comunidad. Muy ágil ella inmediatamente prepara el desayuno de sus hijos para mandarlos a la escuela; hace ya 5 años que se dedica a ello, sus panes son ricos y muy solicitados. Pero la actividad que le trae más ganancias, es la venta de Leña. Melinda compra un lote de 100 árboles los cuales corta con ayuda de peones; posteriormente los vende al por mayor a los comerciantes que visitan su casa los fines de semana; le gusta mucho la venta de leña, “No se requiere mucho trabajo y tiene mayor rentabilidad”, afirma.  Más adelante quiere poner un pequeño taller, donde pueda hacer escaños, escritorios, muebles y demás productos. Este es el noveno crédito con MFP y como siempre está segura que su banco comunal le apoyara para seguir creciendo. Con el crédito que solicita, lo invertirá en la compra de un lote de 200 árboles con ello podrá abastecer la demanda que genera la compra de leña en su zona.
texts.en: Melinda, 33, lives with Edberto, 43; the two of them have seven children whom they must feed and school. They live together in their own home located in the locality of La Unión Leticia. As a determined and enterprising woman she carries on a range of activities during the day. She gets up very early to prepare the delicious pastries she sells daily to her community. With alacrity she immediately prepares breakfast for her children to send them off to school. She has had her business for five years. Her pastries are delicious and highly popular. But the activity which brings her the most earnings is the sale of Firewood. Melinda buys a lot of 100 trees which she cuts up with the help of laborers after which she sells them wholesale to the merchants who come to her home on weekends. She enjoys the sale of firewood very much. "It doesn't take much work and is more profitable" she states. In the future she would like to set up a small workshop where she could make benches, desks, furniture and other products. This is her ninth loan with MFP and as always she is sure her community bank will support her continued growth. With this loan she plans to invest in the purchase of a lot of 200 trees with which she will be able to supply the demand for firewood in her area.

loans.use: To purchase 200 trees

loans.name: Francois Xavier

texts.en: Francois Xavier is 29 years old. He is single. He sells food and other items for home use in his boutique. He has spent five years in this business. With the loan, he will buy more food and lotions. His business is very common for the people around him simply because it is where they buy necessary items for home use daily. With the profit, he will increase the quantity of what he sells.

loans.use: To buy more food and lotions to sell.

loans.name: Gladys

texts.en: Gladys is 29 years old and a member of Faulu Kenya under Maono group.  She sells electronics and plastic containers such as disposed basins and pegs.  She has engaged in the business for five years.  She hopes to succeed in the business so as to help her community.  She is glad to be a member of Faulu Kenya because she has gained knowledge on business management.  She has requested for 20, 000 Kes to buy radios, bulbs, plastics and spanners.

loans.use: To buy radios, bulbs, plastics and spanners.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy red (palm) oil to resell

loans.name: Jahir Wladimir

texts.es:
Jahir Wladimir Z. S. tiene 19 años. Es soltero con los padres, vive  en el cantón de Ventanas en la Provincia de Los Ríos. No  Tiene  hijos. 

Los miembros de la V.R.C. El LA UNION se encuentra ubicada en el recinto Aguas Frías, perteneciente al cantón Ventanas, esta ventanilla se dedica a labores agrícolas de ciclo corto siembra de maíz, arroz y fréjol, esta actividad llevan mucho tiempo haciéndolo.

Jahir se dedica a la agricultura especialmente a la siembra de maíz, arroz y fréjol desde hace 3 años. Compra sus productos en Ventanas y los vende en la feria de Ventanas y en el mismo recinto.

Solicita el crédito para la comprar de insumos agrícolas y fertilizantes para los cultivos. Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentan desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades y la variedad del clima. Su sueño es ser un profesional.
Le gusta hacer deporte.
texts.en:
Jahir Wladimir Z. S., 19, is single and lives with his parents in Ventanas canton, in Los Ríos province.  He doesn’t have children.

The members of the La Union communal bank, located in Aguas Frías, Ventanas canton, are short cycle farmers, corn, rice and broad bean.  They have been in this occupation for a long time.

Jahir has been a farmer, especially of corn, rice and broad beans, for three years.  He buys his products in Ventanas and sells them in the Ventanas market.

He is asking for funds to buy farming supplies and fertilizers for his crops.  Support from the loan will help him economically to meet his needs.  They face challenges like infestations, illnesses and climatic variations.  His dream is to become a professional.

He enjoys playing sports.

loans.use: To buy farming supplies and fertilizers.

loans.name: Benito Rene

texts.es:
el sr. Benito F. tiene 42 años de edad, vive en colonia Smith 2 de la ciudad de Tegucigalpa, Benito presta los servicios de transportar personas, tiene un taxi y su punto de trabajo es en el centro comercial Plaza MIraF., actualmente esta pagando el vehículo a una Cooperativa.
durante el dia lleva personas que necesitan de su servicio y tambien tiene contratos permanentes por las mañanas y por las tardes para ir a dejar a personas a sus trabajos y luego a sus casas despues de la jornada de trabajo.
el credito lo utilizara para la compra de llantas y amortiguadores.
las ganancias las necesita para salir adelante con su familia.
texts.en:
Benito F. is 42 years old.  He lives in Smith 2 neighborhood, in the city of Tegucigalpa.  Benito provides transport services.  He has a taxi and he works at the Plaza MiraF. Shopping Mall.  He is currently paying a cooperative for his vehicle.

During the day Benito carries passengers who need his service and he also has permanent contracts in the mornings and afternoons, taking people to work and then taking them home again at the end of the day.

Benito will use his loan to buy tires and shock absorbers.  He needs the profits he makes from his job to get himself and his family ahead in life.

loans.use: To buy tires and shock absorbers

loans.name: Vestine

texts.en:
Vestine is 32 years old, married and has three children between eight and twelve years old. Currently, all three of her children attend school. 

Vestine sells soaps, rice, and sugar, which she has been doing for five years. She works with her husband. Vestine will use the loan to buy more home products to sell.  

With the new profits from her expanded business, Vestine plans to buy her own building for business purposes instead of renting. She would like to have a loan amount of five million in the future.

loans.use: To buy more soaps, rice, and sugar to sell

loans.name: Deya

texts.en:
Deya is a 28-year-old man from Gaza city in the Gaza Strip. Deya is married and a father of two daughters and two sons. Deya is a fisherman. He fishes in the Mediterranean Sea and sells the fresh fish in Gaza city.

Deya took a loan from FATEN to purchase a new boat and replace the old fishing kit he uses. Deya enjoys his work and wants to improve it, though it is not as rewarding as it used to be due to many complications in Gaza city.

Deya appears in the picture here next to his fishing kit.

loans.use: To purchase a fishing kit and fishing boat

loans.name: Maruja

texts.es:
Maruja es socia del Banco Comunal Brisas, tiene 40 años, es conviviente y tiene 6 hijos. Es feriante, se dedica a la comercialización de cereales, que los compra de los mayoristas del Mercado Nery García Zarate y viaja los viernes quincenalmente al departamento de Ica donde lo vende entre los trabajadores de las haciendas y regresa los domingos.
Maruja solicita un préstamo para invertir en compra de mercardería. A ella le gusta las reuniones de su Banco Comunal porque les enseñan y practican los valores, le dan créditos puede ahorrar y su ahorro gana intereses, le gusta las charlas que reciben para mejorar las relación con los hijos, familia, matrimonio, para trabajar, para valorarse. Maruja está ahorrando para construir sus casa.
texts.en:
Maruja is a member of the "Brisas" [Breezes] Communal Bank. She is 40 years old and has a live-in partner and 6 children. She is a market vendor who sells cereal grains. She buys the grains from wholesalers at the Nery García Zarate Market and travels every other Friday to the Department of Ica, where she sells her goods to the workers on the estates, and then returns on Sundays. 

Maruja is requesting a loan to invest in buying merchandise. She enjoys the meetings of her communal bank, because the group learns and practices values. She can take out loans and save money, and her savings earn interest. She likes the talks given to the group about improving parent-child, family and marital relationships, and about work and self-esteem. Maruja is currently saving up to build a house.

loans.use: Buying goods on a wholesale basis

loans.name: Batool's Group

texts.en:
Batool belongs to Okara, a small city in Pakistan known for its agricultural industry. She lives there in the small colony named Tariq with her family in a two-room brick house for past many years. 

She is 56 years old and is married to A. R.. They have three sons, one of whom does embroidery work to financially contribute to the family. 
Batool's husband has a business of selling vegetables. His shop is located in the market and he is well known in the area for selling fresh quality vegetables. Batool is a homemaker and a very good administrator. She manages her household expenses very well and manages her household work by staying at home. 

She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah to improve her elder son’s business of embroidery. With the loan, he will purchase embroidery material such as beads, colored thread and clothes in bulk that will help him in completing orders on time and will allow him to produce better quality embroidered clothes. 

He is operating this business for past eight years and Batool is very hopeful that her son’s business will be expanded further after buying embroidery material in bulk with the loan. Batool is a regular loan user of Asasah and this is her fifth loan application. In the previous loan years, she has maintained a good credit behavior and never missed any meeting.

loans.use: Buy embroidered material for embroidery business

loans.name: Pedro

texts.en:
Pedro C. is from the village of Agay-ayan, Gingoog City. He is 59 years old. Pedro is separated from his spouse and has one school-aged child. To make a living, Pedro owns a business  operating a specialized store. The main source of income for the business comes primarily from buying and selling seafood products, including sardines & milkfish, in the local community. Pedro has been engaged in his business for over 7 years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Pedro joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Pedro has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional inventory & working capital. Pedro is requesting a new loan of 10000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional fish, like mackerel & sardines, to sell . This loan will be the 3rd loan taken out by Pedro from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand his business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional fish, like mackerel & sardines, to sell

loans.name: Adjoa

texts.en:
Adjoa A. makes her living by selling corn, a trade she has been in for four years, in Kokowada, Elmina. 
She is married to a farmer and they have five dependents. Her income pays for their children’s school fees and also contributes to some household expenses. It is important for her to grow her income and she plans to do so by expanding her business. A loan will allow her to purchase more corn and grow her sales. She intends to reinvest the profits back into her business for further growth.

loans.use: A loan will allow her to purchase more corn and grow her sales.

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita I. is from the village of Tinabalan, Gingoog City. She is 56 years old. Teresita is married and has five school-aged children. To make a living, she makes and sells snacks and other delicacies like rice, cassava and cheese cakes in the local community. Teresita has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately $285 a month for these activities.

In 2009, Teresita joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 15,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional ingredients and as working capital. 

Teresita is requesting a new loan of 20,000 PHP which will be used to purchase raw ingredients like flour, eggs and milk. This will be her 6th loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients like flour, eggs and milk

loans.name: Virginia Gabriela

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Charapoto se reúne cada quince días el Banco Comunal Virgen De Lourdes. Esta localidad se la conoce por su cultura tradicional y además por estar a pocos minutos de dos de las  mejores playas de la provincia como son San Jacinto y San Clemente.

La señora Virginia es socia fundadora del Banco Comunal Virgen de Lourdes y está muy a gusto en el ya que aquí ha encontrado mucha ayuda para ella y su negocio. Se desempeña como fiscal de pagos del Banco. Ella tiene 30 años de edad mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual ha tenido tres hijos de 11, 10 y 6 años, todos ellos están en escuela. Su marido es ebanista. Ella estudia en la Universidad Técnica De Manabí Ing. Comercial.

Ella además de ser una gran ama de casa también tiene un restaurante en su casa, trabaja los viernes, sabados y domingos desde las 7h00 hasta las 19h00, prepara muchos platos para complacer a sus clientes y los domingos prepara salchichas y caldo de manguera ya que este es un plato típico muy solicitado por sus clientes.

Este crédito es para comprar víveres para la preparación de la comida y unas sillas y mesas para dar a sus clientes una mejor atención.
 
Su sueño es terminar sus estudios en Ing. Comercial.
texts.en:
The “Virgen de Lourdes” communal bank meets every two weeks in the city of Charapoto.  This area is known for its traditional culture and for being two minutes away from the best beaches in the San Jacinto and San Clemente Provinces.

Virginia is the founder of the communal bank, is very comfortable, and has already found much help for her business.  She is a bank officer.  She is 30 years old, is in a live in relationship, and has three children, ages 11, 10, and 6, all in school.  Her husband is a cabinetmaker.  She also studies at the Manabí Ing. Business Technical University.

Aside from being a great housekeeper, she also runs a restaurant out of her home, where she works on Fridays, Saturdays, and Sundays from 7:00 am to 7:00 pm.  She prepares many dishes to please her customers.  On Sundays she prepares sausages and soup, which is a typical dish that her customers ask for.

She will use the money from this loan to buy ingredients and some tables and chairs to be able to better serve her customers.  She also wants to complete her studies at Manabí Ing. Business University.

loans.use: to buy ingredients and tables and chairs

loans.name: Nub

texts.en:
Nub S., 35, is married and resides in Takeo province, Cambodia, an area known for Pre-angkorean temples. She sells silk products, earning an income of about $1.30 per day. Her husband is employed at a foreigner’s house, earning an income of $6.30 per day. Each month, the family has to spend $75 on food and $30 on the other necessary expenses. 

She is requesting a loan of $1,200 to purchase a new motorbike and more raw silk to produce silk products. This will be her second loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner.

loans.use: to buy more raw silk and a motorbike

loans.name: Marlyn

texts.en:
Marlyn Y. is from the village of Liong, Guinsiliban, Camiguin Province. She is 31 years old. Marlyn is married and has three very young children. To make a living, Marlyn owns & operates a specialized retail store. The main source of income for the business comes from buying and selling seafood products  including fish like mackerel, sardines & milk fish in the local community. Marlyn has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 8000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2011, Marlyn joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Marlyn is requesting a loan of 4000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional fish like sardines & milk fish. This will be the 1st loan taken out by Marlyn from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional fish like sardines & milk fish.

loans.name: Salamatu

texts.en:
This is 26 year-old Salamatu, a married mother of four children aged 3, 6, 9 and 12 years. In 2007, Salamatu established her lubricant business as a means of sustaining herself and family. Working 6 days a week and 10 hours a day, she earns about Le 800,000 every month from this business.

Salamatu is requesting a loan in the amount of Le 3,500,000 in order to buy more lubricants by the drum for her business. She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits by approximately Le 150,000. In the future, Salamatu plans to support her children and construct a dwelling for her family. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to pay for lubricants by the drum.

loans.name: Nasibahon's Group

texts.en:
Nasibahon is the leader of this group.  She is 35 and married to a builder. Together with her husband, she brings up two daughters and a son. The son studies at school and the daughters are preschool age (under seven). Seventeen years ago, with an initial investment of 4000 soms, Nasibahon started cultivating and selling agricultural products. The monthly profit from this activity is 2,300 soms. This profit made it possible to repair the house and build a summer kitchen. With money received from the loan, Nasibahon wants to purchase mineral fertilizers for growing cotton. In the future, she wants to purchase a piece of land to increase the profits gained from cultivating agricultural products.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase mineral fertilizers

loans.name: Ermelinda

texts.es:
La Sra. Ermelinda es propietaria de Casa Rodas, una tienda de prendas de vestir elegante, como trajes para damas y caballeros, vestidos de novias y quinceañeras, ropitas para bautismos entre otros, es casada, y tiene 3 hijos todos mayores de edad e independientes.
La Sra. es una mujer emprendedora y luchadora, lucha por ir adelante y gracias a todo su esfuerzo hoy dia se siente orgullosa de sus hijos quienes son todos profecionales, ellos on su mayor orgullo.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de prendas de variados tipos,para ofrecer a sus clientes una mayor variedad, para la temporada de invierno.
texts.en:
Mrs. Ermelinda is the owner of Casa Rodas, an elegant clothing shop with suits for men and women, wedding dresses, dresses for quinceañeras, clothing for baptisms among others.  

She is married and has 3 older children who are independent.  She is an enterprising woman, struggling to move forward and thanks to her efforts today she is proud of her children who are all professionals.  They are her greatest pride.  

She is requesting a loan to buy clothing of various types and offer a wider variety to her customers for the winter season.

loans.use: to purchase winter clothing to increase her stock of goods

loans.name: José Antonio

texts.es: Este cliente es trabajador activo de un centro turístico ubicado en las costas de masachapa, desempeñándose como cocinero  tiene  dos años de trabajar para esta institución es casado  actualmente tiene dos hijo en edad escolar. Este es el segundo crédito con CEPRODEL para ampliación y mejora de vivienda los materiales a comprar es arena, piedras canteras, cemento, piedrín y pago de mano de obra.
texts.en: This client is an active worker in a holiday resort on the shores of Masachapa, where he works as a chef.   He has been working for this establishment for two years, and is currently married with two school-age children. This is his second loan through CEPRODEL for expansion and improvement of his home. The materials he needs to buy are sand, quarried stone, cement, gravel, and to pay for labor.

loans.use: to buy construction materials such as sand, cement, quarried stone, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al Banco Comunal “AMAUTA”; El banco pertenece al distrito de Huanchac, Provincia de Cusco, departamento de Cusco.

La socia; la socia tiene  67 años; la socia es soltera y tiene 2 hijos;  La socia se dedica a la atención de su tienda de abarrotes, la socia compra y vende todo tipo de productos de primera necesidad; como arroz, fideos, harinas, aceites, gaseosas, entre otros; la socia también la socia también es dueña de un lava autos y engrase de vehículos. La socia requiere  el crédito para comprar arroz, azúcar, harinas, aceite y todo lo referente a la implementación de la tienda de abarrotes; La socia solicita el crédito para invertir en la compra de productos de primera necesidad. 

La socia se muestra muy satisfecha y agradecida por el apoyo que se le brindara mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus deudas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the “Amauta” communal bank located in Huanchac District, Cusco Province and Department.

She is 67 years old, single and has two children.  She runs a grocery store.  She buys and sells all sorts of basic need items like: rice, noodles, flour, oil and soft drinks, among others.  She also owns a car wash and lubrication service.  She needs the loan to buy rice, sugar, flour, oil and everything related to stocking her grocery store.  She is asking for the loan to buy basic need items.

She is very satisfied and grateful for the support provided and commits to repay her debts in a timely fashion.

loans.use: to buy stock items for her store.

loans.name: Buena

texts.en:
Buena is 57 years old and married. She has six children.

Buena works hard to provide for her family. She runs a sari-sari (variety) store in the Philippines. She has been running the sari-sari store for eight years and also earns an income from farming rice.

Buena has requested a PHP 19,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stock to sell in her sari-sari store.

Buena has borrowed and repaid 13 loans from NWTF before this loan.
 
Buena aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase additional stock to sell.

loans.name: Rosa Leticia

texts.es:
La Señora Rosa es socia del banco comunal Nuevo Porvenir, vive por la parroquia de Cumbe, este lugar es de clima frió, su gente es muy carismática, amable, mantienen su cultura y tradiciones, se dedican al comercio, cría de animales y agricultura.
 
La Señora Rosa tiene 54 años, es viuda en su unión conyugal ha concebido 4 hijos de 25, 24, 23, 20 años de edad, dos de sus hijos estudian en la universidad, una es casada e  independiente, otro trabaja y le ayuda económicamente. La casa en la que vive es de su propiedad.
 
Doña Rosa labora en un restaurante que es de su propiedad, esta actividad la realiza hace 25 años, trabaja de domingo a domingo desde las 6 de la mañana hasta las 9 de la noche. También se dedica a la cría de cerdos, cuyes y gallinas.
 
En el banco comunal es socia fundadora encontrándose más de 15 años en el mismo, el dinero de su crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de  ollas, vajillas, cubiertos y otros productos para su negocio de comida.

Su meta es seguir creciendo en el negocio.
texts.en:
Rosa is a member of the Nuevo Porvenir [New Future] community bank. She lives in the parish of Cumbe. It has a cold climate and charismatic, friendly people who maintain their culture and traditions. They work as merchants and in farming and raising animals.
 
Rosa is 54 years old. She is a widow and a mother of 4 children, aged 25, 24, 23, and 20. Two of her children go to college, one is married and on her own, and another works and helps her financially. She owns the house she lives in.   
 
Rosa works in a restaurant that she owns. She has done this for 25 years. She works every day from 6 in the morning until 9 at night. She also raises pigs, guinea pigs and chickens.  
 
She is a founding member of her community bank and has belonged to it for more than 15 years. She will invest the money from the loan in buying pots, dishes, cutlery and other products for her food business.   

Her goal is to keep growing the business.

loans.use: to buy pots, dishes, cutlery, etc.

loans.name: Nancy

texts.es: Nancy de 40 años, vive en el municipio de Malambo, área metropolitana de Barranquilla y tiene 3 hijos; allí funciona su miscelánea, la cual inició hace 11 años cuando residía  en otro barrio al sur de la ciudad de Barranquilla; al mudarse a la población de Malambo, emprendió hace dos años su negocio, aprovechando que su hermana tenía un local bien acreditado en el sector y justamente fue ella, quien le recomendó vincularse a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, pues su creciente clientela le insistía en nuevos productos y su capital de trabajo se tornaba insuficiente, para responderle oportunamente. Con sus créditos surtió siempre la miscelánea  y diversificó su oferta con artículos para el hogar, como hasta la presente tiene. De sus desafíos siempre ha logrado salir adelante con el apoyo de sus hijos que son incondicionales. En su miscelánea vende a crédito y de contado, a clientes ubicados en el sector donde habita, que es muy comercial. Su credikiva es el tercer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo  Domingo, con el cual comprará artículos de papelería, para el hogar, y también accesorios para las confecciones. Esta inversión está planeada como exitosa, porque está realizándola en un momento en el cual tradicionalmente repuntas sus ventas, por motivo de la celebración del día del amor y de la amistad, que impacta en los meses de agosto y de Septiembre el volumen de estas. Nancy tiene sueños de crecimiento empresarial y por eso se esmera en lograr metas de venta  en su miscelánea , donde presenta indicadores financieros de acuerdo con el tipo de actividad y su rentabilidad sobre las ventas no es inferior a un 35% .
texts.en:
Nancy is 40 years old and lives with her three children in the municipality of Malambo, a metropolitan area of Barranquilla. She runs a general store which she began 11 years ago when she lived in another suburb in the south of Barranquilla. Two years after she set up her business, Nancy moved to Malambo, taking advantage of the fact that her sister ran a well-known store in the area. It was actually her sister who recommended that Nancy join the Mario Santo Domingo foundation, as her growing client base wanted new products and her working capital wasn't enough to meet her customer's demands.  With the loans she obtained Nancy was able to keep her store continually stocked up with a diverse range of products for the home, which is still the case today. In spite of the challenges she has faced, Nancy has always been able to get ahead with the unconditional help of her children. Nancy accepts cash and credit payments from her customers who live locally in her area, which sees a lot of business. 

This Kiva credit will be the third loan that Nancy has taken out with the Mario Santo Domingo foundation. With this loan she will buy stationery items for the home as well as clothing accessories. This investment is destined for success as it has been planned at a time when sales traditionally pick up around the Day of Love and Friendship, which is celebrated during the months of August and September.  

Nancy dreams of expanding her business, which is why she has her heart set on achieving sales goals in her general store. Based on workload and projected sales, her future profits can be estimated at no less than 35%.

loans.use: to purchase stationery items for the home as well as clothing accessories

loans.name: Martha

texts.es: Martha, de 47 años vive en concubinato con Alfredo. Con quien tiene 6 hijos, pero solo vive con 2 de ellos en su casa propia, ubicada en la comunidad nativa de Kivinaki (selva central peruana). Sus días se centran en el cuidado de sus cultivos, los cuales realiza con mucho esmero desde hace 26 años. En todo este tiempo logró sacar un buen grano de café, frutos grandes y dulces, como es el caso de los cítricos, asimismo el infaltable achiote, que comenzó a sembrar ahora último. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es estar en contacto con la naturaleza, pues se siente tranquila y relajada. Por ello cuenta que en temporada de recolección de naranja; ella sale a trabajar como peón en diversos terrenos agrícolas, donde le pagan un dinero extra. Además de tener el apoyo de su esposo, que se dedica al trasporte público cubriendo las rutas Kivinaki – Cerro Picaflor, donde obtiene un dinero extra. Sus planes son seguir mejorando sus sembríos para poder obtener cada día mejores ganancias. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “flor de almendra”, y este es el segundo crédito con MFP, donde trabajará con mucho esmero para poder cumplir las metas que se propuso. Además promete ser puntual con el pago de sus cuotas. Martha está pensando limpiar sus plantaciones, por ello de recibir su apoyo invertirá el dinero solicitado en el pago del salario a los peones que le ayudarán en este trabajo.
texts.en: Martha is 47 years old. She is in a common law marriage with Alfredo, with whom she has 6 hijos. Only 2 of them are living in her home, which she owns and is located in the native community of Kivinaki (central Peruvian jungle). Her time revolves around taking care of her crops, which she has worked very hard on for 26 years. The whole time she has been able to obtain good coffee beans, big and sweet. She has done the same with citrus and the inevitable annato seeds, which she recently started planting. What she likes the most about her job is being in contact with nature, because it makes her feel relaxed and calm. When it is time to harvest the oranges, she works as a laborer in different farms, where she earns extra money. She also has her husband's support. He works in public transport, covering the routes between Kivnaki and Cerro Picaflor, where he makes extra money. Her plans are to continue improving her crops in order to earn more every day. She belongs to a communal bank called “Flor de Almendra”. This is her second loan with MFP, where she will work very hard to meet the goals she has set for herself. She also promises to make her payments on time. Martha is planning on clearing her fields, and for that she needs your help. She will invest the money she has asked for in paying the wages of the laborers who will help her with this work.

loans.use: to hire day laborers.

loans.name: Digna Esperanza

texts.es:
Digna, vive con su esposo y sus 3 hijos  de 14,18 y 21, ella se dedica a vender tamales de gallina y de frijoles el cual todos los días sale a vender al mercado junto con sus hijos, de 6 am a 7 pm.
El préstamo lo necesita para comprar materiales para la elaboración de tamales: maíz, frijoles, leña y pollo, y otros ingredientes, le ayudara para tener más clientes y  más ingresos para su familia.
El sueño de digna es que sus hijos estudien, verlos que progresen y que en el futuro consigan un buen empleo, y ayudar con los gastos de la casa.
texts.en:
Digna lives with her husband and three sons aged 14, 18, and 21.  She works selling tamales made with chicken and beans which, together with her sons, she sells from 6 a.m. to 7 p.m. daily in the market.

She needs the loan to buy supplies for making the tamales: corn, beans, firewood, chicken and other ingredients.  This will help her to have more customers and more income for her family.

Digna's dream is for her children to study, and to see them progress to that in the future they can find good employment, and to help with the household expenses.

loans.use: to buy corn, beans, firewood and chicken to make tamales.

loans.name: Bora Bidii Group

texts.en:
Greetings from the Bora Bidii Group in Western Kenya! Robai is the facilitator of Bora Bidii group. This group joined One Acre Fund in 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program. 

Robai takes care of six children at home. She joined One Acre Fund in order to access fertilizer and hybrid seeds and ensure food security for her family. In the recent 2011 season, Robai had an excellent maize yield harvesting 35 bags on two acres of land. Before joining One Ace Fund, Robai was only able to harvest 18 bags of maize on that land. 

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Robai and her group during Kenya's next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund's integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance. 

With income from maize sales, Robai will educate her children and ensure food security for the family. 

In 2012, the members of Bora Bidii group will each plant between ½ and one acre of maize. 

In the picture the field officer is seen standing on the far left.

loans.use: To source farming inputs such as seeds and fertilizer at low prices for the 2012 planting season

loans.name: Cristobal

texts.en:
Due to financial difficulty, Cristobal is engaged in vegetable production in their village to generate income. He is 30 years old and still single. He mentioned that he needs to prepare his future before he gets married, because he knows that having a family is a great responsibility. At this time, he is also helping his parents to finance the education of his younger brothers and sisters. 

He is requesting a loan of PHP 15,000 to buy seeds, fertilizers and pesticides for his vegetable production. He believes that through this loan, he can raise more varieties of vegetables to sell. He hopes that in the future, he will become financially stable.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizers and pesticides for vegetable production

location.town: Brgy. Bitnong, Dupax del Norte, Nueva Vizcaya

loans.name: Rhealyn

texts.en:
Rhealyn is 28 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with two children. 

Rhealyn has a retail shop that sells bananas & coconuts. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan of PHP 4,000 to buy coconuts & bananas to sell.

Rhealyn is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Rhealyn hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy coconuts & bananas to sell

loans.name: Kamo

texts.en: Kamo is 51 years old. He lives with his wife, two sons, a daughter-in-law and mother in Vanadzor city. He has collage education. Kamo has been engaged in the animal-breeding business for several years. He organized his farm in Shahumyan village which is near Vanadzor city. Kamo’s family helps him in the farm. The meat produced in Kamo’s farm is delivered by his son to Vanadzor’s markets and meat shops. Kamo is also working part time in Vanadzor’s water supply center as an operator but the main income comes from animal breeding. The profit helps Kamo to take care of his family's needs. Kamo asks from a Kiva 900.000 Armenian drams loan to buy fodder for his farm animals.

loans.use: To buy fodder for his farm animals

loans.name: Robinah

texts.en:
Robinah is a single mother of 4 children aged 3-17, living in Hioma, Uganda. She is the only income earner in the family hence she has to take care of the family needs alone. She owns a boys quarter (servant's quarters) and she lives in it with her family.

For 17 years she has been dealing in the fresh foods business and she hopes her business will grow in the future and become self-sustainable. Robinah needs a loan to buy fresh foods like tomatoes and vegetables for sale.

loans.use: to buy fresh foods.

loans.name: Eugenia Basilia

texts.es: La señora Eugenia es cliente antigua ya viene trabajando con nuestra institución desde el año 2004, en un grupo solidario hámster que integraban entre tres personas desde hace mas de un año se individualizaron dos de los integrantes, la señora Eugenia vive en la zona de Alto Seguencoma en la casa de sus suegros, su familia esta integrada de sus cuatro hijos tres en edad escolar y su esposo que se dedica al transporte publico como y la señora Eugenia vende electrodomésticos a crédito por su zona y otras zonas aledañas, en este momento solicita el crédito para la compra de mercadería electrodomésticos al por mayor por época  navideña ya que cada fin de año lo hace para incrementar su capital de trabajo, la Sra. Eugenia es un apersona muy trabajadora, con deseos de superación, su deseo es el de ver a sus hijos profesionales y poder mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Eugenia is an old client that has been working with the communal bank since 2004 in a solidarity group that has three members for more than a year called Hamster named by two of the members. 

Eugenia lives in the are of Alto Seguencoma in her in-laws house. The family has 4 children, three who are school age and her husband works in public transport. 

Eugenia sells household electrical appliances on credit in her neighborhood and surrounding areas. Currently she is asking for a loan to buy appliances at wholesale for the Christmas season as each end of the year she does it in order to increase her working capital. 

Eugenia is a hard working person, eager to get ahead, whose dream is to see her children become professionals and to be able to improve their quality of life.

loans.use: to buy household electrical appliances at wholesale prices for the Christmas season

loans.name: Asma

texts.en:
Asma is a 39-year-old married woman from Madaba, Jordan. She is a mother of eight children.

Asma is doing mosaics from her home. She is requesting a loan of 1,500 JOD to purchase materials needed in making these mosaics.

Asma is looking to improve her project by purchasing equipment needed for her business.

loans.use: to purchase materials needed in making mosaics

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Virginia is a mother of 2, ages 10 and 4, and has been farming for the last 5 years, producing bananas and eggs for the local market. She also runs a retail shop and a salon business besides farming.

Virginia has requested a loan of 50,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to purchase a power saw to venture into timber sales. She says she will use the machine in lumbering with the help of employees at minimal fees. She is focusing on buying a motorcycle too, for taking supplies to the market.

She sees the access to funds as the greatest challenge to smallholder farmers.

loans.use: to buy a power saw

loans.name: Karimatou

texts.fr:
Karimatou est une femme âgée de 55 ans. Elle est mariée å un commissaire. Elle a 2 enfants qui vont tous à l’école. Le premier a 20 ans et le dernier a 18 ans.
Karimatou travaille comme revendeuse depuis 1997. Elle vend de la bonneterie pour tous clients au marché. Elle achète les produits à Lomé. Elle travaille seule. Au moment, n’a pas de difficultés.
Karimatou a requis son 1 crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter de la bonneterie. Elle veut réinvestir dans l’activité.
Dans les prochaines années, Karimatou voudrait agrandir son activité. Elle dit qu’avec les profits, elle prévoit de prendre soin de sa famille.
texts.en:
Karimatou is a fifty-five year old woman.  She is married to a policeman.  She has two children who attend school.  The oldest is 20 and the younger one is 18. 

Karimatou has been working as a vendor since 1997. She sells clothing for everyone at the market.  She buys her products in Lomé.  She works alone.  At the moment, she does not have any difficulties.  Karimatou has received her first loan through WAGES in order to buy clothing.  She wants to reinvest it in her business.

In the years to come, Karimatou would like to grow her business.  She says that with the profits she will be able to take care of her family.

loans.use: to buy clothing.

loans.name: Sum's Group

texts.en:
Sum, 50, is married and has five children. She is a farmer in a village of the Ratanak Mondul district of Cambodia who has been growing maize as her only main income-generating business to support her living. She has been in this business for ten years, and all of her children work at the family’s plantation to help her earn a living. 

Sum's group loan has been with VisionFund for seven years. She successfully paid back her previous loans with VisionFund. The loans have helped her afford sufficient food and make her living better. She now leads a group of three members in the village who are applying for another loan with VisionFund. 

As the leader, she plans to use her $300 portion of the loan to buy fertilizer and to pay a plowing fee for her farmland. Sum hopes to increase her business and earn a larger income.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and pay a fee for plowing her farmland.

loans.name: Rosula Petronila

texts.es:
Rosula es una mujer de 57 años, es soltera, vive en la ciudad de Ica, ella es una persona muy amable, trabajadora y entusiasta, que tiene un gran deseo de superación; con mucho esfuerzo y  gracias al apoyo de su familia Rosula pudo estudiar la carrera técnica de Secretariado, en sus ratos libres le gusta pasear por las calurosas y acogedoras calles de su ciudad y en algunas ocasiones cocina una riquísima Carapulcra con Sopa Seca para compartir con su familia.
Con mucho empeño y dedicación Rosula puso en marcha su pe	queño negocio de venta de abarrotes, todos los días desde tempranas horas inicia su labor, ella puede trabajar un aproximado de 12 horas diarias, donde puede atender a varios clientes, ella se siente a gusto con su negocio y cree que le va bien por la variedad de productos y por el trato amable que brinda a los demás.
Rosula se encuentra muy agradecida con los prestatarios Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar la compra de mercadería para su negocio, tales como leche, azúcar, menestras, arroz, detergentes, golosinas, etc., así también podrá comprar andamios para exhibir sus productos; de esta manera Rosula tendrá su negocio mejor acondicionado y abastecido , así ella espera aumentar sus ventas e incrementar sus ingreso económicos, los cuales le servirán de mucho para que en un futuro no muy lejano pueda ampliar su negocio y ayudar con la educación de sus sobrinos, a quienes ama y son como sus hijos.

loans.use: Para la compra de mercadería para su negocio, tales como leche, azúcar, menestras, arroz, detergentes, golosinas, etc.

loans.name: Grupo Las Marias 2 Group

texts.es: Herlinda es una gran madre de familia, con la visión de superación y con grandes objetivos en la vida, con una actitud de perseverancia, amable y muy disciplinada. Herlinda tiene  una familia muy unida que se integra de tres hijos de las edades entre 5 y 13 años, está linda familia vive en una comunidad de Samayac. Herlinda para obtener sus ingresos se dedica a la compra y venta de abarrotes desde la comunidad de su hogar, lleva tres años dedicándose a este negocio y su esposo trabaja como soldador. Herlinda solicita un préstamo para la compra de más productos de abarrotería tales como; arroz, azúcar, golosinas y gaseosas para  satisfacer mejor las necesidades de sus clientes. Su gran esperanza de vida es contar con mejores condiciones de vida.
texts.en: Herlinda is a great mother to her family, with a vision of overcoming and great life goals, with a very persevering, friendly and disciplined attitude. Herlinda has a very united family that includes her three children between the ages of 5 and 13 years old. This beautiful family lives in the Samayac community. Herlinda has obtained her income making a living purchasing and selling groceries from her home community. She has dedicated three years to this business. Her husband works as a welder. Herlinda requests a loan in order to be able to purchase more grocery store products such as: rice, sugar, candy and soda in order to better satisfy the needs of her customers. Her great hope in life is to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase grocery products such as rice, sugar, candy and soda.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Mary wants to buy Godgets, Hoho, Lettuce, and Cauliflower

loans.name: Michel

texts.en:
Born in 1972 in Aklakou Fondomé in the Lacs Prefecture, Michel G., mechanic, is married and the father of four children. His wife being unemployed, he finds himself alone paying all of the bills. Michel G., experienced and popular, is solicited by a growing clientele.

He is asking for a loan of $1000 to buy an electric air pump so that his business can be more competitive in the area. The realization of this project will help his entire family to flourish.

Translated from French by Alexandra Jaffe, Kiva Volunteer.

Né en 1972 à Aklakou Fonkomé dans la préfecture des Lacs, Monsieur G. Michel, mécanicien de profession, est marié et père de quatre (04) enfants. Sa femme sans activité, l’oblige à se trouver seul devant toutes les charges. Monsieur G. Michel, vulgarisateur très expérimenté, est sollicité par une clientèle de plus en plus grande.

Aussi sollicite- il un crédit de $1000 pour acheter une machine de pompage d’air électrique afin d’être plus compétitif dans la localité. La réalisation de ce projet amènera toute sa famille à un épanouissement total.

loans.use: Purchase of an electric air pump

loans.name: Eba Jeanne

texts.en:
A. Eba Jeanne is a war displaced woman. She is 36 and has 3 children. She was living in the western region of Côte d’Ivoire where her husband was killed by rebels in September, 2003. She joined Anono in the suburb of Abidjan in December, 2003 with her 2 boys and her 4-month-old daughter.

Eba Jeanne heard about “Afrique Emergence & Investissements (AE&I)” from her sister who hosted her and her children on her arrival. She then took a $500 loan from AE&I and started selling stewpans, saucepan and bowls. This revenue-generating activity has helped her overcome her difficult situation and covered living expenses for her and her 3 children. Eka Eba Jeanne wants to expand her business and be able to send her second boy to school in October, 2007.

loans.use: Loan will be used to purchase more goods in bulk and benefit from lower price

loans.name: Delfina

texts.en:
Delfina C. owns a colorful shop in Quisqueya where she sells such commodities as colored candles, bread, chips, sweets, cherries, gum, spices, matches, and chocolate cake by the slice. Delfina's husband ran his own business selling lottery tickets, but after he died, Delfina was left without a source of income. A friend told her about microfinance, and Delfina opened her shop with her first loan from Esperanza. With this loan, Delfina will grow her business, stocking her store and buying a freezer. She has no children, but lives with her younger sister Ana and brother Rafael. Delfina's niece Francia (27) and her two daughters Angela Maria (11) and Carla (6) live with Delfina as well.

Note: Delfina is one of five microentrepreneurs in her Bank of Hope solidarity group, all of whom have gone through Esperanza's business training courses. Each of the five members will receive a share of this $1200 loan for their respective businesses and will be accountable to each other for repaying their share of this loan together. This group-lending method strengthens social needs in the community and helps ensure that members cooperate to help one another repay their loans and invest wisely in their businesses and families.

loans.use: Stock up on household items and food; invest in a freezer

loans.name: Otilia

texts.pt:
Otília Timane is 50 years old, mother of 3. She was born in Xinavane in the district of Manhiça. She was raised by her parents along with her 5 siblings. Otília studied until the 4th grade. Since 1973 she has been supporting her family by working in the machamba (small agricultural field) in Mafuiane. She was introduced to HLUVUKU-ADSEMA by friends. There she requested her first loan to invest in her field. Otília supports her family and sends her children to school with income from the machamba.

With the loan of 15.000.00 MT she plans on buying seeds and fertilizers in order to increase her farming area from 0.5 to 0.75 acres. Otília’s work has a positive impact in her community because it provides employment and income for Otília. It also brings fresh vegetables closer to the residents of her neighborhood.

Translated from Portuguese by Mariana Fraga, Kiva Volunteer.

Localização: Mafuiane - Boane Cliente : Otília Timane Sector de actividade : Agricultura Valor de empréstimo : 15.000,00MT (600.00US$) Aplicação de montante: compra de insumos agricolas Inicio: 30/08/2007 Fim: 31/12/2008

Otília Timane, de 50 anos de idade, natural de xinavane, distrito de manhiça mãe de 3 filho, cresceu sob responsabilidade dos seus pais numa família alargada de 5 irmãos, estudou ate 4 classe. Desde 1973 vem assumindo na integra a gestão de actividade da machamba possui uma machamba de sistema de regadios na localidade de mafuiane e por indicações de amigos soube da existência da HLUVUKU-ADSEMA tendo recorrido a esta para solicitar o primeiro empréstimo para aplicação na sua actividade agricola. A sua actividade esta bem inserida na comunidade providencia emprego a propria, com os rendimentos do seu negocio suporta encargos familiares e uma parte vai a conta poupança, despesas escolares e da saúde dos seus 3 filhos.

Com empréstimo de 15.000,00MT pretende comprar sementes e fertilizantes para aumentar sua area de cultivo de 0,5 para 0,75 ha. A sua actividade tem grande impacto na comunidade porque para alem de providenciar emprego a 1 jovem coloca os produtos frescos mais próximo dos residentes e pessoas vindas dos diversos cantos da cidade.

loans.use: To buy seeds and land preparation

loans.name: Roseline

texts.en: Mrs. Roseline O. produces ice cream and supplies to a retailer. She learned ice cream production for 2 weeks before she started her business in 1997. She is married with four children and lives in Benin City. She has been an LAPO client for 4 years now, and she is soliciting for a loan of $425 to enable her to buy refrigerator and ice cream materials.

loans.use: Roseline would like to buy more freezers & material needed for the production of ice cream.

loans.name: Justo Pastor

texts.es:
Justo Pastor sells clothes, electrical household items, stuffed toy animals, pillows, toys, vases, towels, shoes... practically everything. They even have the drive to sell basic grains.

He has been working this business for 15 years, starting with $54 of his own money. He started with the need to help out his mom, remembering how before, when he was a boy, he would go out with her to sell in the streets door to door. Later, they were able to establish themselves in one of the sidewalks in the central market of Leon, selling watches, cosmetics and small things.

Justo wants to use the money he is requesting to stock his space with more merchandise. He is marries and has two sons and a daughter who is in her first year in college. To make sure nothing is lacking in their home, he has faith that investing more in his business will allow him to have a better profit.

Translated from Spanish by Eliana Colunga, Kiva volunteer.

Doña Justo Pastor vende ropa, electrodomesticos, peluches, almohadas, juguetes, floreros, toallas, zapatos.....practicamente de todo. Hasta tienen animos de vender Granos Básicos

Lleva 15 años trabajando en este negocio, comenzó con 54 dólares de su propio dinero., inicia con la necesidad de tener ayudarle a su mamá, recuerda que antes cuando era niño salia con ella a vender a la calle, de casa en casa...luego lograron establecerse en una de las aceras del mercado Central de Leon vendiendo relojes, cosméticos y cosas pequeñas.

El dinero que esta pidiendo lo quiere utilizar para surtir su tramo con mas mercadería, es casado con 2 hijos y a su niña la tiene en el primer año de la universidad y para que nada falte en su hogar tiene fe que al invertri mas en su negocio le permitira tener mejores ganancias.

loans.use: Working capital, to buy merchandise (Compra de mercaderia, Capital de Trabajo)

loans.name: Lidia

texts.es:
For many years Lidia's husband has worked running a Hot Dog cart. They have 5 children to support and her husband's income wasn't enough to pay the expenses of all of their children because Lidia had all of her children in school. For this reason over 5 years ago Lidia established another cart so that she could help her husband. Little by little in their neighborhood Lidia's cart became well-known and people came at night to buy her products and occasionally on weekends she had a good income.

Currently Lidia does not have enough merchandise to make her products and is thus asking for a loan of $375 which she will repay over 6 months. With this money she will be able to purchase merchandise to sell Hot Dogs. With your help Lidia will be able to succeed and help her 5 children to succeed.

Translated from Spanish by a Kiva volunteer.

Desde hace mucho años que el esposo de Lidia trabaja con un carretón de Hot Dog. Sin embargo tuvieron 5 hijos que mantener y lo que ganaba su esposo no era suficiente para pagar los gastos de todos sus niños, puesto que Lidia tiene a todos los niños estudiando. Fue por eso que hace más de 5 años que puso un carretón, para poder ayudarle a su esposo. Poco a poco se fue dando a conocer Lidia en su colonia llega la gente por las noches a comprarles y hay ocasiones por lo general el fin de semana cuando sacan buenas ganancias.

Sin embargo Actualmente Lidia no cuenta con mercancía suficiente para poder elaborar sus productos es por eso que Lidia está solicitando un crédito de US $375 para pagarlos en un plazo de 6 meses y con este dinero poder comprar mercancía para poder vender Hot dogs. Con tu ayuda Lidia podrá salir adelante y sacar adelante a sus 5 hijos.

loans.use: Purchase of materials to make her products

loans.name: Nancy's Group

texts.en:
Giovanna, Elsa, and Nancy have been part of the community bank Amaquella, which means, “don’t be lazy,” in Quechua, for one year, eight months, and three years, respectively. In their community bank they have learned how to educate their children, the importance of being punctual, the incentives of saving, and how to work together with the other associates.

Giovanna is 33 years old. She is a single mother of one son. Giovanna sells meat from a stand in the Magdalena market. She has had this business for six years.

Elsa is 32 and lives with her partner and one child. She sells cosmetics from a catalog to her family and friends.

Nancy is 33 years old. She is the single mother of two children. Nancy has a restaurant that serves chicken located on a main street of Ayacucho.

Giovanna, Elsa, and Nancy need loans of 600, 600, and 1000 soles (3 soles = $1), which they will invest in buying mutton, pork, perfumes, cosmetics, shampoo, rice, sugar, noodles, oil, milk, salt, and vegetables.

The community bank emphasizes the importance of saving, and each associate has an interest-earning savings account. Giovanna, Elsa, and Nancy plan to use their savings to help their children, to use if there is an emergency, and to expand their businesses. Their dreams are to own their businesses, each own a house, and open other branches, and that their children will study and be good people.

loans.use: For the three women to buy supplies for their businesses

loans.name: Ni Made Suiti

texts.id:
As a wife of a farm worker, Ni Made Suiti does not want to rely solely on their farming income. Now Ni Made Suiti owns a hog farming business guided by the DINARI foundation. With an initial capital of IDR 2,000,000, (Translator's note: 1US$ fluctuates between IDR 9,000-9,500.00), Ni Made Suiti can buy two sows and spend IDR 8,000 each day to feed them. Once every six months, the sows will deliver piglets, eight of them on average, that can be sold for IDR 250,000 each. Hence she earns IDR 1,250,000 for selling eight piglets. The profit is used to cover daily basic needs. The loan from DINARI is used to cover the cost of animal feed. Ni Made Suiti feeds her animals twice a day, once in the morning and once in the afternoon. Her house is built on their own land and is a very humble abode. Ni Made Suiti hopes that by getting the loan from DINARI, her business can grow and her family's living standard can improve along with it.

Translated from Bahasa Indonesia by Arliadi Mahadi, Kiva Volunteer.

Sebagai istri seorang petani, Ni Made Suiti tidak mau hanya mangandalkan penghasilan dari pertanian saja. Terbukti saat ini Ni Made Suiti mempunyai usaha beternak babi yang mendapatkan binaan dari Dinari. Dengan modal awal Rp. 2.000.000,- Ni Made Suiti dapat membeli 2 ekor induk babi, dan setiap hari Ni Made Suiti mengeluarkan biaya pakan Rp.8.000,- untuk babinya. Dari hasil beternak babi ini Ni Made Suiti setiap 6 bulan sekali setiap Induk Babi akan melahirkan rata – rata 8 Ekor yang bisa dijual dengan harga Rp. 250.000.- per ekor. Dengan demikian keuntungan yang bisa diperoleh sebesar Rp.1.250.000.- dari penjualan 8 ekor anak babinya. Keuntungan ini digunakan untuk biaya hidup sehari –hari. Pinjaman dari Dinari dipergunakan untuk biaya pakan ternaknya. Setiap hari Ni made Suiti memberi makan ternaknya 2 kali sehari pada pagi dan sore hari. Rumahnya dibangun ditanah sendiri dan bangunannya cukup sederhana. Ni Made Suiti berharap dengan mendapat pinjaman dari Dinari usahanya lebih meningkat dan kehidupan keluarganya juga lebih meningkat.

loans.use: To purchase two sows for IDR. 2,800,000.-

loans.name: Bridget

texts.en: Bridget N. is 44 years old, married and has 7 children. She lives in Benin City, Edo State, Nigeria. She has be a LAPO member for 6 years. She sells drinks. This  is a business she learnt for 12 month. She is requesting for $700 to enable her  buy more drinks for sale. This said will enable serve her customer better. She thanks you.

loans.use: To buy more drinks for sale

loans.name: Dorice

texts.en: Dorice  K. is from Kyela Mbeya, Tanzania.  She is 31 years old, married, and has three children aged one, five, and eight.  Dorice also cares for three dependents, who live with her because they are disabled .  In 2002, Dorice  established a library business.  She  has already received and successfully repaid a loan from SELFINA, and now requires a new loan of $825 in order to buy more resources for her library.

loans.use: To buy more resources for the library.

loans.name: Abdusoleh

texts.ru:
Abdusoleh Manov lives in the Varzob region. He is 59 years old, married, and has 6 children. He has a bachelors degree and works as a school teacher. Because his salary is quite limited, Abdusoleh and his large family need to be occupied in agriculture. He owns a small piece of land, which he uses to plant potatoes. At this point, he needs to purchase natural fertilizers so he could grow good qulity crops. To obtain the necessary funding he applied for a loan, which he plans to pay off within the next 10 months.

Translated from Russian by Vasilisa Budnikova, Kiva Volunteer.

Манонов Абдусолех житель района Варзоб .Возраст 59 лет, женат,имеет 6 детей. Образование высшее, по специальности учитель.Работает в средней школе учителем.Так как заработная плата очень маленькая ,Абдусолех и его большая семья занимается сельским хозяйством.Он имеет небольшой земельный участок ,который засеивает картофелем. В данный момент он хочет купить минеральные удобрения для получения хорошего урожая.Для этого ему нужны деньги и он решил взять кредит сроком на 10 месяцев

loans.use: To purchase natural fertilizers

loans.name: Tin

texts.en:
Mrs. Tin S. is a farmer in Sya Village in Kampong Speu Province. Aside from this business activity, she is a pig breeder. Her husband, Mr. Uk Ying, is a farmer and he owns a small kiln where he can make a charcoal to sell for a profit. Mrs. Tin S.’s plantation has faced a small problem because she does not have enough cows to plow her rice field. Thus, Mrs. Tin S. decided to ask for a loan to add to her profit in order to buy another cow to work with the old one in the rice field.
