Mrs. Tin S. is 25 and the mother of a child who is too young to work or study. Previously, Mrs. Tin S. obtained a loan to start a pig breeding business. Her husband is on the left in the photo.

loans.use: to buy another cow to work with the old one in the rice field

loans.name: Thi Hong's Group

texts.vi:
Mrs. L. Thi Hong was born in 1966. She wants to borrow 4,876,000 VND to invest in her farm. Currently, her poultry farm has many varieties: 300 ducks, 100 chickens, 100 geese, and other fruit trees such as papaya, and banana trees, etc. Both Hong’s husband and she stay at home and take care of their farm. Their average monthly income is 2,500,000 VND (equivalent to 152 USD). Mrs. Hong always wants to borrow more money to expand her farm structure. In her group, there are four other members: Mrs. L. Thi Mai (born in 1976), Mrs. N. Thi N. (born in 1977), and Mrs. B. Thi Chanh (born in 1982), each of them would like to borrow 4,028,000 VND (equivalent to 245 USD) to expand Mai’s mechanics factory, to invest in N.’s farm, and to invest in breeding animals in Chanh’s case; and Mrs. D. Thi Cai (born in 1975) would like to borrow 2,332,000 VND (equivalent to 142 USD) to sell vegetabL. at the market.

Translated from Vietnamese by Phuong N., Kiva Volunteer.

Lê Thị Hồng, sinh năm 1966 (Ms 23070012 ), mức vay: 4.876.000 vnđ để đầu tư chuồng trại. Hiện nay, gia đình chị nuôi rất nhiều gia cầm gồm có: 300 con vịt, 100 con gà, 100 con ngan và trồng nhiều loại cây ăn quả như đu đủ, chuối, ....Vợ chồng chị đều ở nhà tăng gia sản xuất. Thu nhập bình quân của gia đình chị khoảng 2.500.000 vnđ / tháng. Với mô hình trang trại, gia đình chị luôn mong muốn được vay nhiều tiền để mở rộng chăn nuôi.Trong nhóm vay của chị còn có: Lê Thị Mai, sinh năm 1976 (Ms 23070014 ), mức vay: 4.028.000 vnđ để đầu tư mở rộng xưởng cơ khí. Nguyễn Thị Nguyên, sinh năm 1977 (Ms 23070015 ), mức vay: 4.028.000 vnđ để đầu tư trang trại. Bùi Thị Chanh, sinh năm 1982 (Ms 23070013 ), mức vay: 4.028.000 vnđ để đầu tư chăn nuôi. Đồng Thị Cải, sinh năm 1975 (Ms 23070021 ), mức vay: 2.332.000 vnđ để đầu tư đi chợ buôn bán rau.

loans.use: chăn nuôi

loans.name: Santos Efraín

texts.es:
Professor Santos Efraín, a single 43 year old, states that he used his two previous loans to start putting up a wall, but that strong rains ruined it. With this third loan, he will finish the 5 meters that remain. He also has as a project to change the roof of the kitchen of his house because it is in very bad condition. Señor Núñez said that after the death of his wife he had neglected his home, but that now he is trying to return to normal and to improve his home to give his daughter who is the only one who lives with him a decent home. His daughter is in her first year of university studies. The Professor has 19 years of service in the education sector as a teacher of physical education. And, he hopes that he can start a new life with his daughter and wants to start by upgrading his home.

Translated from Spanish by Joanna Silverman, Kiva Volunteer.

El profesor Santos Efraín soltero de 43 años plantea que con sus dos créditos anteriores comenzó a levantar un muro de contrucción pero que las fuertes lluvias se lo arruinaron, con este 3er crédito lo terminará ya que le hacen falta 5 metros, también tiene como proyecto cambiar el techo de la cocina de su casa porque está en pésimas condiciones. El señor Núñez manifestó que después de la muerte de su esposa él había descuidado su vivienda pero ahora está tratando de volver a la normalidad y mejorar su vivienda para darle a su hija quien es la única que habita con él, una vivienda digna. La joven está cursando estudios universitarios el primer año de su carrera. El profesor tiene 19 años de servicio en el sector educación como profesor de educación física. Y espera poder empezar una nueva vida con su hija, y quiere empezar por el acondicionamiento de su vivienda

loans.use: Improve his Kitchen's Roof

loans.name: Blás

texts.es:
Blas es un joven olero (persona que se dedica a la elaboración de ladrillos) de 28 años de edad, vive en pareja desde hace 8 años con Delia con quien tiene dos hijos de 8 y 6 años respectivamente.

Comienza diciendo que es el segundo de entre cinco hermanos y que le hubiese gustado terminar alguna carrera universitaria, pero que debido a los problemas económicos de sus padres no pudo hacerlo y desde muy temprana edad tuvo que salir a trabajar para conseguir el sustento diario.

A partir de los 14 años comenzó a trabajar en la que hoy es su profesión, acompañando a su padre todos los días en el trabajo. Hoy día ya cuenta con su propia olería y le da empleo a 3 personas.

Aspira comprar con el tiempo un camión en el cual podría transportar sus productos inclusive hasta la capital en donde conseguiría mejor precio.

En esta oportunidad solicita el crédito para la compra de una carreta con bueyes para transportar la materia prima debido a que en la actualidad tiene que alquilar una, lo cual le genera más costos a su producción.
texts.en:
Blas is a young brickmaker (a person dedicated to making bricks), 28 years old, married 8 years to Delia with whom he has two children ages 8 and 6. He begins by saying he is the second of five siblings and that he would have liked to finish a university career but due to economic problems of his parents he could do that and from a young age he had to go out and work in order to be able to eat. Beginning at 14 years old he began to work in what is today his profession, accompanied by his father every day at work. Today he has his own brickworks and he employs 3 people. He aspires to buy a truck with which he will be able to transport his products even to the capital where he can get a better price for his products. With this loan he would like to buy a cart and oxen to transport raw material as today he has to rent one, which results in greater costs to his production.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy and cart and 2 oxen

loans.name: Chorn

texts.en: Mrs. Chorn M. was born in 1986 and lives in Traov Phny Village in Kampong Cham Province. She owns small piece of land where she grows rice. However, she does not have enough money to buy rice seeds. Thus, she decided to ask for a loan for this purpose. Her husband, Mr. Oeurn Sith, helps on plantation. They have one child who is five years old. Her husband is on the right in the photo.

loans.use: To buy rice seeds

loans.name: Martha Alicia

texts.es:
Martha es  una persona muy trabajadora, honesta, responsable cumplida y a la que no le gusta darse por vencida.
Ella inició el negocio por el compromiso que tiene de sacar adelante a sus 4 hijos: Armando de 19 años estudiante universitario; Uriel de 14 años estudiante de secundaria; Luís de 7 años estudiante de primaria y Marlen de 5 años estudiante de pre-primaria, dándoles una buena educación y para apoyar a su esposo con los gastos de la casa ya que con su sueldo a veces no es suficiente.
 Comenzó en Octubre de 2001 vendiendo solamente refrescos y dulces, después empezó a vender botanas y pan de reconocidas marcas, y como le estaba yendo bien acondiciono un local en la parte de enfrente de su casa en donde pudo poner una tiendita mas surtida y desde entonces gracias le ha ido muy bien. Además, hace algunos meses, también empezó  a elaborar y a vender tamales los fines de semana.

Ella necesita un préstamo por 7,000 MXN que pagara en 6  meses para comprar mercancia y resurtir su tienda y tener mejores y más productos que ofrecer a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Martha is an honest, responsible, reliable, hard-working woman who doesn't give up easily. She went into business in order to help raise her four children: Armando (19) is at university; Uriel (14) is attending secondary school; Luis (7) is in primary school; Marlen (5) is in pre-school. Martha's goal is to give them a good education and help her husband with the household expenses since his salary often isn't enough. She started up in October 2001, selling just soft drinks and sweets. Later she started selling sandwiches and brand-name bread. Since she was doing well, she set up a store in the front of her house where she sells a broad range of products. She has been very successful since then. Some months ago, she started making tamales on weekends. She needs a loan of 7,000 MXN, which she will repay in six months, to buy merchandise and re-stock her store, so as to have more and better products to offer her customers.

Translated from Spanish by John Rynne, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy merchandise

loans.name: Akoélé

texts.fr:
Madame A. Akoélé a 51 ans d’âge, elle est une revendeuse de fruits (banane, mangue, orange) au marché d’Agoè assiyéyé et exerce ce commerce depuis 1978. Elle n’a jamais obtenu de crédit chez WAGES et sollicite ce crédit pour se réapprovisionner en stock avec l’achat de  04 paniers de mangues, 06 paniers d’orange et 05 régimes d’ananas.
Madame AGBADOU est divorcée  de son mari ATTIOGBE sossoukpè qui est tailleur, elle a un enfant. Avec le profit tiré de ce commerce elle pourra subvenir aux besoins de sa famille.
texts.en:
Ms. Akoélé A., age 51, is a retailer of fruit (bananas, mangoes, oranges) at the Agoè Assiyéyé marketplace and has been in this business since 1978. She has never been a recipient of a WAGES loan and is requesting this loan to stock up with supplies: 4 baskets of mangoes, 6 baskets of oranges, and 5 bunches of bananas. Ms. A. is divorced from her husband Mr. Sossoukpè ATTIOGBE, a tailor. She has one child. With the profit derived from this business, she will be able to provide for her family.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fruit

loans.name: Leng

texts.en: Leng B. is 29 years old and lives in Kompong Tom Province, Cambodia. She is married and the mother of five children, all of whom are single; some of them are attending school. She currently earns a living by raising pigs in a pigpen behind her house, raising them for their offspring and for slaughter. She also earns income in rice farming. She has been running both her businesses for more than eight years and is currently earning approximately $6 each day. Her husband helps her in her businesses. The children also help her in raising pigs. B. hopes to start new business of selling clothes. She is requesting a loan to help build a medium sized store and begin selling clothes.

loans.use: to build a medium store and begin selling the clothe

loans.name: La Union Hacia La Fuerza Group

texts.en:
Ramona operates a small restaurant inside her home. The menu varies daily dependent upon what is available, but daily a “plato del día”, or plate of the day, is offered generally consisting of rice, beans and a meat option, or sancocho, a typical Dominican stew. Aided by Esperanza International, Ramona is able to purchase ingredients in greater bulk and produce a larger quantity of food for her customers and in turn, earn a greater profit than she was able to before her first loan.

Ramona is not alone in her quest to earn a profit through entrepreneurial activities. Ramona is a member of the ten person microfinance bank, “La Union Hacia La Fuerza”. This group’s past two loans have been successfully repaid, and the group, including Ramona, hopes to utilize a third loan for further business expansion.

Ramona, mother of four children (ages 9, 11, 12, and 14), desires to see growth in her business so that she may continually provide for her children. Her husband, a street vegetable vender, desires the same and together, success is aspired for.

On behalf of Esperanza and this group of business entrepreneurs, we would like to thank you for your support!

loans.use: Purchase raw materials for restaurant

loans.name: Kamil

texts.en: Kamil is a 38-year-old married man with two children; he lives in Zahleh in the Bekaa valley. He inherited a gas station from his father three years ago. Kamil wants to borrow $1,000 in order to increase his gasoline inventory, especially since the demand for it  is very high in winter.

loans.use: increase gasoline inventory

loans.name: Moammad Ali

texts.en: Mohammad Ali is twenty years old and lives in Tarik Al Jadida in Beirut. In 2006, he opened a clothing shop with the help of his parents. Today, Mohammad Ali wants to increase his inventory, especially since he has the opportunity to buy a supply of clothing for a very good price.  He is requesting a loan of $1,200.

loans.use: Buy more clothing for his store

loans.name: Sally

texts.en: Sally E. is a 39-year-old mother of two. Her husband Miguel is a carpenter. She helps her husband in raising their kids by doing laundry for her neighbors. She joined ASHI (Ahon sa Hirap, Inc.) to get capital for her new venture. She applied for this loan to buy two piglets for fattening and to invest in their small farm managed by her husband. She wants to expand her pigpen to a piggery later on. She dreams of saving enough money to send her children to school. Her membership in ASHI has impacted her life, as she is gaining self-confidence and learning more from her peers in the center she is a member of.

loans.use: To buy two pigs for fattening and to invest in her farm

loans.name: Jehova Suple - Groups 1, 2

texts.en:
Marcia P. and Octavia D. L. C. are two representatives of the ten entrepreneurs applying for this Kiva loan. Both Marcia and Octavia have small cafeterias. They sell mostly juices, sandwiches, and fried pastries filled with either meat or cheese. These make great snacks and are cheap, easy-to-take-on-the-go breakfast options as well. This loan will be used to purchase more juices and pastries in order to serve larger clienteles in the morning when both of them have the largest crowds. Marcia and Octavia want to own the houses they live in so they don't have to pay rent in the future and can take more advantage of what their businesses are generating.

All of the group members live in San Pedro D. Macoris, in southeast Dominican Republic. They have successfully repaid five previous loans to Esperanza International, and are working towards consolidating their businesses. These hardworking women have shown great determination in taking their micro businesses to the next level. Please help us to continue supporting them with this Kiva loan. Thank you!

loans.use: To purchase flour, meat and cheese for fried pastries

loans.name: Zonia

texts.es: Zonia tiene 48 años, vive con sus tres hijos y su esposo, quien trabaja como chofer. Desde hace 8 años se dedica a la venta de bebidas en un espacio que acondicionó en su casa, adicionalmente, por las noches, vende platillos de comidas al paso. Con ambos negocios, y el trabajo de su esposo, están logrando solventar la educación de sus hijos y las necesidades básicas de su hogar. A Zolia le gusta su trabajo porque la entretiene y se siente útil ante la sociedad, además obtiene ganancias diarias, gracias a que se encuentra ubicada en un lugar estratégico para las ventas, pues transitan muchas personas. Para el futuro, a Zolia le gustaría tener un minimarket. Este es su 9no préstamo con MFP, y el dinero que solicita lo usará para invertir en sus dos negocios, incrementará la cantidad de cajas de bebidas que ofrece, y comprará víveres e ingredientes para los platillos que prepara por las noches.
texts.en:
Zonia is 48 years old, and lives with her three children and husband, who works as a driver. For 8 years she has worked selling beverages out of a space in her home. Additionally, at night she sells plates of food. With both businesses, and her husband's work, they are able to resolve the educational needs of their children and meet the basic needs of their home. Zonia likes her work because it entertains her and she feels useful in society. Moreover, she obtains earnings daily, thanks to the strategic location where she sells, where many people pass through. In the future, Zolia would like to have a minimarket. This is her 9th loan with MFP, and the money she requests will be used to invest in her two businesses, to increase the amount of drinks offered, and to buy ingredients for dishes she prepares at night.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Hopkins, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase beverages and ingredients for preparing dishes.

loans.name: Emily

texts.en:
Thirty-five years old and married, Emily C. is from Clarin, Misamis Occidental, Philippines where she operates a sari sari store. She joined PAGLAUM’s microfinance program last July in order to help her husband, and within the period of her membership she has demonstrated excellent performance in terms of loan repayments.

Emily is requesting the loan amount of Php 9,000.00 to buy additional stock such as laundry items, seasonings, goodies, toiletries, drinks and other household items. She hopes to enrich their way of life and expand the business.

loans.use: Additional capital for sari-sari store

loans.name: Comfort

texts.en: Comfort N. is 28 years old. She is married and has given birth to two girls who are currently in primary school. She lives with her two daughters and husband in a rented apartment in a commercial town called Dwenase, which is in the Western Region. Dwenase is a suburb of Sefwi-Wiawso, which is the district capital. She is a food vendor. Comfort prepares and sells rice and stew. She sells from a tabletop by the side of the road. She sells in the mornings. Comfort wants a loan to buy bags of rice and other ingredients in bulk. She buys her goods from Kumasi. She has been in business for five years. Comfort aspires to expand her business and provide her children a good education.

loans.use: To buy bags of rice

loans.name: Cheab

texts.en: Cheab P., 35, is married. She lives with her husband and her ten-year-old, only child who studies at a local primary school. She has been involved in a business of selling rice and corn. She usually goes directly to her customers’ places of business to deliver her products. She has requested a loan of US $900 to purchase more corn and rice to expand her inventory. She is very optimistic that she will succeed with this business plan and investment if she is able to receive this loan.

loans.use: buying corn and rice to sell.

loans.name: Doris

texts.en: Doris A. sells processed fish in Denu, which she has done since 2003. She is married and has two children. Her husband is a fisherman. She has received no formal education. Doris uses her income to pay fees and other bills. Doris will use this loan to buy fish to be processed and sold. With the increased profits, Doris plans to expand the business and also to buy a piece of land.

loans.use: To buy fish to be processed and sold

loans.name: Virginia

texts.es:
Virginia se dedica a la fabricación de mantas y macramé; estos productos da a terceras personas para que las puedan comercializar, su esposo es chofer asalariado, esos son sus principales fuentes de ingreso con lo que cubre la manutención de sus seis hijos los cuales todavía se encuentran estudiando, vive en casa propia ubicado en la Zona de Villa Ingavi de la ciudad de El Alto.
 
El préstamo lo destinará para la compra de Maquina de coser domestica y con eso podrá elaborar mas mantas y así poder incrementar sus ingresos económicos.
 
Es primer crédito con Impro, la evaluación realizada califica para la aprobación del préstamo solicitado por Virginia.
texts.en:
Virginia produces blankets and macramé items. She provides her products to third party vendors to sell on her behalf. Her husband is a salaried driver, and both of their incomes cover the living expenses of their six school-aged children. They live in their own home, which is located in the Villa Ingavi district of the city of El Alto.

Virginia will use her loan to buy a domestic sewing machine so that she can produce more blankets and increase her earnings. This is her first loan with IMPRO. Her evaluation indicated she is qualified for an approved loan.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase a sewing machine

loans.name: Delia's Group

texts.es:
El comité del Barrio San Pedro esta compuesto por 17 integrantes, todas las señoras realizan actividades productivas para poder ayudar con los ingresos de la casa. Ellas atienden además a sus hijos y esposos. Son mujeres luchadoras que buscan una mejor oportunidad de estudio y trabajo para sus hijos y futuros nietos.
 El monto que recibe cada señora varía de 300.000 a 800.000, todas las señoras destinan el crédito para las actividades que ya están realizando actualmente. 
Las actividades de cada señora se describen a continuación:
Delia T. Bogado, Venta de ropas ambulante.  800.000 
Juliana Elizabeth Benítez Del Valle, Venta de ropas ambulante. 
Gladys Q. de Valdéz, Modista. 
María Magdalena Benitéz Cuella, venta de ropas ambulante.  
Dora Gladys Martínez Mereles, Venta de ropas ambulante. 
Lelia Crismilda Martínez Mereles, Venta de sábanas, 
María Luisa S. Correa, Venta de dulces, 
Ramona Martha Benitéz Cáceres, Venta de Dulces, 
Blanca Graciela C., Peluquera, 
Eustaquia E. de C., Kiosco 
María Rosa C. E., Modista 
Felipa E. Sena, Empleada doméstica, kiosko
Damilita C. Arguello, Venta de comidas ambulante, 
Elva Z. de M., Kiosco
Cindy Vanessa M. Zeballos, Comerciante Minorista, 
Lucia D. Flores, Venta de comidas ambulante, 
María Cristina Q. de Lezcano, Taller mecánico,

loans.use: Compra de artículos comestibles, ropas, telas, harina, aceite, carnes, panificados, tapa para empanada, harina de maíz, compra de hilos, cosméticos, frutas y otros para surtir kiosco.

loans.name: Sion Plus Group

texts.fr:
Arise K. 30 ans, est président de la Banque Communautaire dénommée « Sion Plus » constituée de 25 membres solidairement unis pour recevoir des prêts chez Kiva à travers l’IMF HOPE RDC dans le but de développer leurs activités. 
Arise a commencé son activité en 1998 avec un capital initial de $50. Il gère sa propre boucherie au marché situé à l’ouest de la ville de Kinshasa. Il est client fidèle de l’IMF HOPE RDC qui a déjà reçu 3 fois les crédits et les a remboursés correctement. Il compte avec le prochain prêt acheter des vivres frais à revendre en vue d’augmenter le bénéfice. Son activité lui procure par jour, un bénéfice de $12. Son ambition est d’ouvrir une chambre froide. Arise est célibataire avec 2 enfants âgés de 8 et 9 ans. Tous deux vont à l’école.
texts.en:
Arise K., aged 30, is the president of the Banque Communautaire “Sion Plus”, which is composed of 25 members united in solidarity to receive loans from Kiva through IMF HOPE RDC with the goal of developing their businesses. Arise started his business in 1998 with $50 in initial capital. He manages his own butcher shop at the market located west of the city of Kinshasa. He is a loyal client of IMF HOPE RDC who has already received three different loans and has repaid them properly. He intends to use the next loan to buy fresh staple goods to resell with the aim of increase his profits. Each day, his business brings in a profit of $12. His ambition is to open a cold storage facility. Arise is unmarried and has two children, who are 8 and 9 years old. Both of them go to school.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fresh staple foods to resell for increasing his income

loans.name: Cleo Ann

texts.en:
Cleo Ann S. is from the village of Upper Langcangan. She is 34 years old. Cleo Ann is married and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Cleo Ann owns & operates a "sari-sari" store business in the retail sector running a general store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling a variety of different products in the local community. Cleo Ann has been engaged in her business for over 6 years and earns approximately 8000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2006, Cleo Ann joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Cleo Ann has successfully repaid a previous loan  from PMPC. Cleo Ann is requesting a new loan of 10000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory & working capital. This loan will be the 10th loan taken out by Cleo Ann from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of the borrower's family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory & working capital

loans.name: Melissa Ivette

texts.es:
La socia Melissa, es natural de la ciudad del Cusco, ella pertenece al grupo Ayni, ella es la fiscalizadora de su grupo y en esta ocasión ella solicita un préstamo individual.
 
Nuestra socia  tiene 26 años de edad, esta separada tiene hijo y ella realiza diferentes actividades, ahora ella compro un par de celulares y los activó para realizar llamadas a otros celulares y teléfonos fijos, desde sus equipos a personas o transeúntes que soliciten este servicio, nuestra socia solicita el préstamo para comprar un par de equipos de celular mas y recarga todos sus equipos, ella cobra 0.50 céntimos de sol por minuto lo que equivale a 0.17 céntimos de dólar.

La socia agradece el préstamo otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de su deuda en el plazo establecido.

loans.use: Comprar equipos de celular y recargar.

loans.name: Zeidy

texts.es: Zeidy M. G. tiene 31 anos, vive en union libre y tiene 3 hijos que son su primer prioridad. Sus hijos tienen 14, 9, 4 años. Zeidy tiene dos hectarías de pasto libre y quisiera empezar criando ganado. Ella quiere comparar una vacca y por esta razón solicitó un préstamo de FUDECOSUR. Es el primer préstamo con FUDECOSUR y piense que pueda crecer su campo con este préstamo. Le gusta los prestamos de FUDECOSUR por que hay menos requisitos. él desea brindar a su familía e hijos un futuro mejor y estable. Tambien ella quiere mas vaccas algun dia.
texts.en:
Zeidy M. G. is 31 years old, is in a common law marriage, and has three children, 14, 9, and 4 years old, who are her first priority. Zeidy has two hectares of unused grazing land and would like to start raising cattle. She wants to buy a cow and asked FUDECOSUR for a loan. This is her first loan from FUDECOSUR and she believes that she can make her fields grow with it. She likes FUDECOSUR's loans because they have fewer requirements. She wishes to offer her family and children a better and more stable future. She would also like to own more cows someday.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a cow.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To stock up food products and resupply her shop

loans.name: Marvie

texts.en:
Marvie L. is from the village of Bayabo East. She is 37 years-old and married with three school-aged children. Marvie owns and operates a service-based business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from providing rice processing to local community members. In 2009, Marvie joined Kiva partner ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Marvie is requesting a first loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase materials needed to provide service. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees of her children.

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fishers and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase materials.

loans.name: Ricardo Rodolfo

texts.es: El joven Ricardo F. tiene 24 años de edad, trabaja como analista de bodega desde hace tres años, han sido mucho días difíciles cuando empezó lo hizo como ayudante de bodega, luego por su empeño laborar lo ascendieron el cual ha estado contento ya que sus ingresos mejoraron, se caso y su esposa le tiene una niña de años, pero vive en la casa de su suegra lo cual  es bastante incomodo ya que no tiene la privacidad deseada. Desde que comenzó a trabajar ha ido recogiendo para hacer su propia casa. Ya que su deseo es lograr poder tener lo propio, con sus ahorros logro comprar el terreno ya, y con este préstamo comenzara  a comprar materiales de construcción para comenzar a  construir su casa poco a poco por que esta muy caro los materiales comprara: piedra, arena, cemento, hierro, zinc y perlines para comenzar la obra. Todo esto lo esta logrando con el apoyo de Afodenic mediante el financiamiento de prestamos a largo plazo. Uno de sus objetivos es seguir escalando de puesto, para un porvenir mejor.
texts.en:
Ricardo F., 24, has worked as an analyst for a convenience store for three years. There were many difficult days when he started as an assistant in the convenience store. Later, he was promoted because of his work effort. He has been happy because his income improved. He got married, and he and his wife have a daughter. But, they live in his mother-in-law’s house. This is pretty uncomfortable because they do not have the privacy they would like. Since he started working, he has been gathering money to make his own house. His wish is to be able to have his own. He was able to buy the land with his savings. With this loan he will start to buy construction materials to start building his house little by little. It is very expensive to buy the materials. He will buy materials like rocks, sand, cement, iron, zinc and beams to start the work. He is doing all of this with the help from Afodenic through long term loans. One of his objectives is to keep advancing in his work in order to have a better future.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy materials like rocks, sand, cement, iron, zinc and beams to start building his house

loans.name: Baigalmaa

texts.en: Baigalmaa is 30 years old and lives with her husband and 1-year-old infant in Arkhangai province, Mongolia. She and her family live together in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent. Baigalmaa operates a retail Russian candy business in her town. She began her business in 2008 with working capital of 500,000 tugrugs (~350 USD). After several years of operation, she has managed to establish herself in the business community. Now her working capital exceeds 2,000,000 tugrugs (~1,400 USD). Baigalmaa delivers Russian candies to local supermarkets and shops, which sell the candies. She also has individual customers who buy her candies on a regular basis. Because of her business success, she has managed to finance her family's daily needs. Baigalmaa is requesting a 1,000,000 tugrug loan in order to purchase candies for her business.

loans.use: To purchase candies

loans.name: Teresa Del Carmen

texts.es:
Teresa del Carmen S.  G. 58 años  empezó vendiendo helados de coco, nancite, de leche, de maní, de mamón etc. con el tiempo logro invertir  en cosméticos, ropa y otros productos los cuales vende por encargo.

S. es un ejemplo de que la perseverancia y el trabajo arduo tienen sus recompensas. Ella desea seguir trabajando y mejorando el negocio.
texts.en:
Teresa del Carmen S. G. is 58 years old and started selling various flavors of ice cream including coconut, “nancite” (a native fruit), milk, peanut, and papaya. Over time, she began investing in cosmetics, clothing, and other products that she sold by request.

Teresa is an example that demonstrates that perseverance and hard work have their rewards. She wants to continue working and improving her business.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase cosmetics & clothing to sell

loans.name: Khadi

texts.fr: Madame Khadi T. née en 1965 s’active dans le commerce depuis 10 ans.  Elle a choisi ce métier pour dit elle subvenir  à ses besoins et à ceux de ses enfants. Après de bonnes années d’expérience, elle sentit la nécessité d’adhérer dans une mutuelle et c’est ainsi  qu’elle est devenue membre à U-IMCEC Thiès  en Août 2009. Cependant elle sollicita pour la première fois un crédit de 100 000 FCFA pour son approvisionnement afin de mieux fructifier son activité. Elle compte acheter avec ce financement du mil et d’autres produits pour la préparation du couscous.  Cette femme mariée et mère de 10 enfants est vendeuse ambulante de couscous  à Thiès.
texts.en:
Mrs. Khadi T., born in 1965, has been selling food for the past ten years. She chose this profession to meet her needs and those of her children. After useful years of experience, she felt the need to join a credit union, which is how she became a member of U-IMCEC Thiès in August 2009. She requested for the first time a loan of 100,000 FCFA, to replenish her supplies so she could grow her business. With the loan she will buy mil and other ingredients for the preparation of couscous. This married woman, mother of ten, is an itinerant couscous vendor in Thiès.

Translated from French by René McConnell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy mil (grain)

loans.name: Antonia Lorena

texts.es:
La señora Antonia Lorena V., es trabajadora de la Alcaldía de Chinandega, se desempeña como operaria de limpieza, ella es casada con cinco hijos de los cuales solo uno tiene a cargo, tiene tres años de trabajar con ceprodel lo cual le ha beneficiado para salir adelante con su familia.

La señora V. utilizara el préstamo para terminar de alistar a sus hijos para las clases y también comprara un zinc para reparar una parte del techo de su casa.
texts.en:
Antonia Lorena V. works for Chinandega's Mayor's office as a cleaning lady. She is married and has five children, of whom only one is still dependent on her. She has collaborated with CEPRODEL for three years and this has been useful to her to get ahead in life with her family. She will use the funds to finish getting her children ready for classes and will also buy some zinc metal sheeting to repair part of her roof.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy zinc metal sheeting and for personal expenses.

loans.name: Humberto

texts.es:
Humberto es socio del Banco Comunal Perla.
Humberto es conviviente, tiene 30 años y 2 hijos, Humberto tiene una tienda en un local alquilado en donde vende repuestos, actividad que realiza todos los días.
Humberto necesita un préstamo de 1200 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de repuestos.
El sueño de Humberto es progresar con su negocio.
texts.en:
Humberto is a member of the Communal Bank “Perla” (Pearl). He is 30 years old, in a common law marriage, and has two children. Humberto has a store in a rented location from which he sells spare parts, an activity he engages in every day.

Humberto needs a loan of 1200 PEN in order to buy more parts. His dream is to keep progressing in his business.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase spare parts

loans.name: Syprosa

texts.en: Syprosa is a diligent and determined 33-year-old lady. She has owned a car repair shop in the market place since 2005. With her business income, she helps her husband with the household expenses; they support each other as a family to provide better living conditions. Syprosa hopes to expand her business and improve her living standards in the future. She has requested a loan of 20,000 KES from Kiva partner, Faulu Kenya, to buy paints and car sprays for her business.

loans.use: To buy paints and sprays for cars

loans.name: Nicholas

texts.en: Nicholas M. is sixty years old, married and has five children. His business is located at Tindiyo, a busy market in Kakamega. He has been selling cows, goats and sheep to the butchers, farmers and schools for the last twenty years. He says that this business is very profitable and the only challenge is animals being stolen. He is taking a loan of KES 40,000 to purchase cows and goats to expand his business. He hopes to buy a pick up to transport the animals to the slaughter house. He also hopes to give his children a quality education and also to build a residential house for his family. He is a generous and social man.

loans.use: To purchase 3 cows and 4 goats.

loans.name: Ibrahima

texts.fr: Monsieur Ibrahima N. est un ouvrier dans une usine de pêche à mbour mais il dispose un taxi clando qui va assurer ses dépenses quotidiennes . Le but du prêt est l'acquisition de piéces détachées pour sa voiture qui est rester en panne depuis un certain moment  et sans cela il lui est difficile de tenir les 3 repas quotidiens comme tout sénégalais
texts.en:
Mr. Ibrahima N. is a worker in a fish factory in Mbour, but he has an unregistered taxi that is going to ensure that his day-to-day expenses are covered.  The goal of the loan is to acquire spare parts for his car, which has been out of commission for a while.  Without it, he would have trouble having three meals a day, as do all Senegalese people.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Repair work

loans.name: Lilia

texts.en:
Lilia M. is from the village of Punta. She is 44 years old and married with two school-age children. Lilia has a store selling cosmetic products. She has been engaged in her business for over 15 years and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month.

In 2008, Lilia joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from PMPC, which was used to to purchase additional inventory and working capital. Lilia is requesting a new loan of 6,000 PHP which will also be used as additional capital for her cosmetic business. This will be the 5th loan taken out by Lilia from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: additional capital for her cosmetic business

loans.name: Keleya Group

texts.fr:
Les femmes du groupe Kéléya, toutes mariées, ont en moyenne 40 ans, 3 enfants et vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies dans le village de Fatiana, préfecture de Dioïla, Région de Koulikoro (deuxième région  administrative de la république du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté et font le commerce de poisson frais, de condiments et des légumes.
Ces femmes du groupe Kéléya sont à leur premier prêt solidaire qui sera utilisé pour acheter des poissons frais, des condiments et des légumes.                   
RABIATA T. du groupe Kéléya compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter, des condiments alimentaires pour la restauration.
Elle s’approvisionne en condiments le plus généralement à Nangola et environnants et effectue sa vente sur place, au marché de Nangola et dans les foires environnantes, au comptant et à crédit, à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes.
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 15 000FCFA qui sera utilisé dans les dépenses  quotidiennes de la famille et le reste sera  réinvesti dans les activités de commerce.
texts.en:
The women of the Kéléya group, all married, are on average 40 years of age and have three children. They all live in traditional extended families in the village of Fatiana, Dioïla prefecture, Koulikoro Region (second administrative region of the Republic of Mali.) They know each other because they are related and they sell fresh fish, condiments, and vegetables. The women of the Kéléya group are on their first solidarity loan which will be used to buy fresh fish, condiments, and vegetables. RABIATOU T., a member of the Kéléya group, intends to use her share of the loan to buy condiments for selling cooked food. She buys the condiments generally in Nangola and surrounding areas and sells right there at the market of Nangola and nearby weekly markets, for cash or credit, to a clientele composed of women and men. She expects to make an average monthly profit of 15,000 F CFA which will be used for day-to-day family expenses, reinvesting any remainder in her business.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of condiments for selling cooked food

loans.name: Domulokhon

texts.en:
O. Domulokhon is 40 years old. He is married and has 3 children. Hia wife is a housekeeper and the business of Domulokhon is the main source of income of his large family. Domulokhon has been providing transportation  services for the last two years. Each day on his lorry he transports construction materials for his clients.

Domulokhon dreams that all of his children will be well-educated; for that he is working hard. As a result the business generates significant income, allowing him supporting his large family. In order to provide better service for his clients and therefore earn more, Domulokhon needs to make major repairs to his lorry. He believes that this will make his business more profitable. For this purpose he requests $1,000 USD. The well-being of this family is in your hands.    


More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing of spare parts for the lorry.

loans.name: Edgar

texts.en:
Edgar P. is from the town of Sto. Niño. He is 39 years old. Edgar is married and has 6 school-aged children. He owns & operates an agricultural business, planting and harvesting rice for sale. He has been engaged in his business for over 14 years.

Edgar joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and his ability to engage in business activities. He has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. Edgar is requesting a new loan of 12,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and other farm inputs. This loan will be the fourth loan taken out by Edgar from CEVI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated to pay the tuition fees of his children. 

About CEVI:

Community Economic Ventures, Inc (CEVI) has increased its portfolio significantly over the recent years.  Based in Bohol, they have numerous branches throughout the Philippines.  In 2009, CEVI was awarded a CGAP silver award for transparency in social performance monitoring.  CEVI not only provides credit for its clients but additionally savings, insurance and training which are provided through regular cluster group meetings.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and other farm inputs

loans.name: Minerva

texts.es: Minerva Vázquez G.  cuenta con un negocio de Abarrotes llamado “Yoely” este ya tiene establecido un año en cual ofrece buena calidad y un bajo precio a comparación de otras tiendas. La señora desea comprar mercancía para surtir su tienda y así incrementar sus ventas. El esposo le ayuda económicamente pues el trabaja como albañil  para poder cubrir los gastos de la familia.
texts.en:
Minerva Vázquez G. has a grocery shop called “Yoely”, which she set up a year ago. She offers good quality and low prices compared to similar stores. She would like to buy more stock for her shop and so increase her sales. Her husband helps with the family's finances by working as a bricklayer.

Translated from Spanish by Rosa Oswald, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy additional stock for her business

loans.name: Alicia

texts.es: Es una mujer de 46 años, casada con nueve hijos quienes le ayudan a realizar las actividades que le generan ingresos, su esposo trabaja en otras actividades y es por eso que el no le puede ayudar en su negocio, pero el esposo de doña Alicia provee todo para el hogar, es por eso que ella puede dedicarse a la siembra y cosecha de tomate, maíz y hongo chino, doña Alicia tiene conocimiento del tratamiento que esto debe llevar ya que ha recibido capacitaciones al respecto. Ella sueña con que sus hijos sean profesionales y que cuando sean ya mayores se independicen. Ella necesita mas capital para invertir en la siembra.
texts.en:
She is a 46-year old married woman with nine children who help her to complete the work to generate income. Her husband works in another business and as a result, he cannot help her with her business. However, Alicia’s husband provides everything for the home. This is why she is able to work planting and harvesting tomatoes, corn, and Chinese mushrooms. Alicia has knowledge of the care that they should receive since she has received training on the topic. She dreams that children will become professionals and that they will become independent when they are older. She needs more capital to invest in planting.

Translated from Spanish by Kathleen O'Connell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To invest in her business

loans.name: Agua Clara Group

texts.es: El grupo solidario Agua Clara se encuentra conformado por Leyla María Velásquez V., Ivania del Carmen
texts.en: The solidarity group "Agua Clara" ["Clear Water"] is made up of Leyla María Velásquez V., Ivania del Carmen

loans.use: Buying supplies

loans.name: Jemima

texts.en:
Jemima is a married woman with five children who all attend school. She owns a house with no electricity but it does have piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food.

She has been operating her tailoring business for the last five years, selling at retail prices to her neighbors and passersby. She sells secondhand clothes as her other source of income. She faces the major challenge of seasonality in her business.

Jemima decided to work with Yehu so as to get financial assistance to boost her business. With the 30,000 KES loan she wants to purchase fabric, materials and Khangas (traditional African cotton cloth). Her major goal of working with Yehu is to operate as a wholesaler in the future.

loans.use: To purchase fabric, materials and Khangas.

loans.name: Razel

texts.en:
Razel T. is from the village of Cabgan, Tambulig Zamboanga Del Sur. She is 30 years old and single with one school-aged child. To make a living, Razel owns a retail store selling daily use products such as eggs, sardines, noodles, shampoo, soap and toothpaste. Razel has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month.

In 2008, Razel joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7000 PHP from GDMPC to purchase new items to expand her product offering. Razel is requesting a new loan of 8000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be the third loan taken out by Razel from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk, and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

loans.name: William Piter

texts.es:
William Piter M. es un joven de 33 años muy alegre, que tiene un tenderete donde vende camisetas pantalonetas, sabanas jeans, toallas y chancletas. Conciente de su responsabilidad con su familia, especialmente de su hijo de tres años, diariamente se levanta a trabajar con mucha dedicación. Aunque su actividad comenzó como un hobby, hoy es el ingreso más importante que tiene y es su empleo preferido, porque con él  ha logrado su crecimiento personal, el fortalecimiento de su autonomía y una forma de ganarse la vida.
Este es su segundo crédito con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con él planea comprar ropa para el fin de año, calzado y sabanas y toallas, pues es una época de mucho repunte en las ventas y le ayudará a   aumentar su capital de trabajo y reinvertir en su negocio. William es un gran promotor de esta organización porque considera al crédito como una oportunidad de trabaja con un dinero que no contaba, y esto es lo que ha logrado con la Fundación,  con la que quiere seguir trabajando para lograr su sueño de ver crecer su negocio, como le está ocurriendo, porque  nota que cada día tiene mayor posicionamiento en su punto de ventas.
Su plan ahora es extenderse en otras poblaciones pero va a hacerlo gradualmente, para asumir el  riesgo pero de manera controlada, porque sabe que hay temporadas mejores que otras y debe estudiar con mucho cuidado, cual es el óptimo momento para iniciar su próxima aventura de tener puntos de ventas en otros municipios.
texts.en:
William Piter M. is a young, cheerful, 33-year-old young man who has a stand where he sells t-shirts, pants, sheets, jeans, towels and flip-flops.  Conscious of his responsibility toward his family, especially his three year old son, he rises daily to work with much dedication.  Although this economic activity started off as a hobby, today it’s his most important source of income and his favorite occupation because through it he has attained personal growth, strengthened his autonomy and way of earning his livelihood.

This is his second loan with Fundación Mario Santo Domingo.  He plans to use it to buy clothes for the end of year, footwear, sheets and towels because this is a season when sales peak and it will help him increase stock and reinvest in his business.  

William is a great promoter of this organization because he considers credit to be an opportunity to work with funds he would otherwise not have access to and this he has accomplished with the Foundation that he wants to continue to work with in order to see his dream of having his business grow come to pass as it is currently doing because he notices that every day he is better positioned in his sales points.

His plan is to expand into other towns but he will do so gradually so that he can assume the risk in a controlled way because he knows that some seasons are better than others and he has to study the situation carefully to see when the optimal moment to start his new adventure and start sales points in other towns.

loans.use: To buy clothing for end of year, footwear, sheets and towels.

loans.name: Marco Antonio

texts.es: Marco Antonio tiene 34 años, tiene 1 hijo menor de edad, vive en la comarca San Francisco De Asís. Se gana la vida trabajando en una pulpería y vende cosméticos desde hace más de 10 años de experiencia. Esta actividad le permite sacar adelante a su familia por lo que siempre trata de dar lo mejor de sí para salir adelante. El desea realizar algunas mejoras en su vivienda. Pues cada día se esfuerza más para realizarlo. Este crédito es para la compra de materia prima ya que su negocio ha crecido y tiene una mayor demanda.Esta acción le permitirá otorgarle una mejor calidad de vida a su familia. Su mayor anhelo es seguir trabajando para hacerles progresar y salir adelante.
texts.en:
Marco Antonio, 34, has a minor son.  He lives in San Francisco de Asís.  He earns his living working in a grocery store and has also sold cosmetics for over 10 years.  This activity makes it possible for him to support his family so he always does his best in order to get ahead.  He wants to do some home improvements and every day he tries harder to accomplish them.

This loan will be used to buy stock items for his store because the business has grown and he has more demand.  This action will allow him to provide a better quality of life for his family.

His greatest wish is to continue working towards their progress and success.

loans.use: To buy stock items for his store.

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.es: La Señora Lourdes es una de las socias antiguas de nuestra Institución, ya que primero trabajo en Banco de Emprendimiento ocupando el cargo de Tesorera y ha demostrado ser puntual y responsable con el pago de sus cuotas, también demostrando solidaridad con sus compañeras. Pero actualmente ella solicito un crédito individual para poder surtir  su tienda de barrio ya que es la única de su zona, con el dinero del crédito comprara, variedad de galletas y dulces, refrescos, abarrotes, etc. La señora Lourdes  es casada y tiene 4 hijos de los cuales 3 están en la Universidad y un pequeño de 4 añitos, por tal motivo la Sra. Tiene que trabajar duro por los gastos que implica el estudio de sus hijos mayores, uno de los deseos de la Sra. Lourdes es el de ver a sus hijos profesionales, esta muy agradecida con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
Lourdes is one of the veteran members of our Institution as she first worked for the Village Bank in the position of Treasurer and has shown herself to be punctual and responsible with her payments, as well as supportive of her fellow members. But currently she is requesting a loan as an individual in order to be able to supply her neighborhood shop as it is the only one in her area. 

With the money from the loan she will buy a variety of cookies, crackers and sweets, drinks, groceries, etc. Lourdes is married and has four children of whom three are studying at the University and one little four-year-old. She must work hard on account of the expenses incurred by her three older children's education. One of Lourdes's wishes is to see her children working as professionals. She is very grateful to the institution for its support.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise
